text: Not impressed.  I had heard so many good things about this spot, so when an aquantience was having a "thing" there I took time and money out of my personal accounts to join the party. What a waist. I was very disappointed. The dinning room had way to dark "mood" lighting (we could barely read the menu and everyone knows dimness vails flaws), the waitress was annoyed, snarky, the crab cakes were super fishy. I had to spit them out in the bathroom to avoid food poisoning. The mashed potatoes served with the over priced surf & turf had to be instant! Although I can't be positive about the mashed potatoes, the texture and flavor definitely tasted like it. There is no outdoor smoking area, you can't take your drinks outside (laws and all). The dinning area was claustrophobic and they wouldn't split the check (understandable, but still annoying). Overall, not the best experience. My suggestion, if you're someone who prefers quality over quantity (cheap happy hour), this is not the spot for you. Save your money. Go somewhere with more integrity. Somewhere that doesn't insult the intelligence of its patrons. Really? Instant mashed potatoes with surf & turf. Tacky.

The food and craft cocktails are worth a visit.  However, I don't recommend this place for parties or if you have a large group of people.  We tried to hold a birthday party at H & R last night and were told beforehand by the owner that it would be no problem.  Unfortunately there were plenty of problems including really bad service and the staff not being alerted that we were coming.  Our waitress seemed far more interested in hiding in the back than taking our drink orders.  Everyone left hungry, thirsty and frustrated.  I will go back but never to do anything but sit at the bar with no more than one or two other people.
This place is must try if you like Vegas, Steak and amazing cocktails. Try the Pimms Cup or a Blinker, great drinks.

Food and ambience were great. The hostess with the glasses is a complete and utter dingbat. She had no clue how to be a hostess. She tells us that it will be about a 20 minute wait to be seated...it took over 1 hour. More than half of the tables were empty so we asked her when our table would be ready. Said someone was cleaning the table so we were about to be seated. We see her seating several other walk-ins right away. We waited about another 20 minutes and were beyond frustrated. She then told us she was waiting for us to come back to the hostess stand so we could be seated? WHAT? She is horrendous

The food is excelent and service a five star thanks
Will be back for more with all my family they deserved good food too

Best Happy Hour Ever!!!

Located not too far from the strip (like 5 to 10 minutes away) great place for locals and tourist. Lots of parking!

My friends and I have been here lots of times because it's one of our favorite restaurants. Also, it is a great place to bring your family because they have lots of seating and kid friendly. They also have a private area if you want to throw a party. Great place to go on dates because the lighting is dim and great music! So far everyone that I have recommended this place to has never been disappointed. The service is excellent, they will never leave your glass empty. 

Happy hour is from 5PM- to 8PM and 12AM to 3AM(for you late night eaters), which is half off food menu which are the items with a star next to it! 

Must try Items:
Chicken Wings, Ribeye, Flatbread, Calamari, pretty much everything on the menu because yes it is that delicious!

BEST STEAKS in LAS VEGAS. PERIOD

Forget shelling out $80 - $100 for a rib eye at a fancy steak house on the strip, for you steak lovers out there, this is the place to be.

The place can get a little bit hectic at times, and service is a hit or miss but it's their happy hour that makes up for it all. Trust me, every other time I'm in that place, you won't see their servers for a while because their running around like chickens with their heads cut off. I ain't gonna lie, it makes me mad in the beginning waiting for our food and drinks but once you take a bite of their steaks you just zone the hell out and forget everything bad that just happened.

Yeah it's that good, I work in the hospitality industry too and service is one of the things I look for while dining out at other places. 

Happy Hour is 5pm - 8pm and 12am - 3am everyday with the exception of Sundays (closed)

50% off all steaks, and a few apps.

Weapon of Choice: 14 oz NY strip, medium rare, with a side of peruvian chimichurri and creamed corn. This ain't your graveyard casino $3.99 steak and eggs NY strip, I honestly don't know how they get the NY strip so damn tender. It eats like a Rib Eye but with less the fat. 

All in all, for about $21 for a steak, side, and topper, you cannot go wrong with that.

I will be in here frequently, say hi if you ever run into me =]

Completely stupid this place doesn't have more than one person answering the phone to take reservations. When "Michelle" did answer, she put me on hold for 10 minutes and never came back. Then I called 4 more times and it went to voicemail. Not going to leave info for reservations on a large party if they can't tell me on the spot if they can accommodate us. I need to make plans ahead of time.

My boyfriend and I just ate here while we were staying on the Las Vegas strip. When we drove up...the outside of this place looked SKETCHY! Like a strip mall. Once inside, it is a very cute place. Like a dark, brooding speak easy. 

We ordered drinks, our waiter was very nice . He did warn me the Mint Julep I ordered was a very strong drink....and wow! It was too strong for me, he was very nice and offered to get me something else. 

We ordered the Kobe sliders...so juicy and flavorful! Also the carpaccio, perfection. Great meat and wonderful flavors. As well as the sweet potatoe tater tots with marshmallow crust...great idea, but fell a little short for me there wasn't enough salty contrast in the dish. We also ordered the farmers flat bread...ok, not wonderful. 

I did really like the good food we had here though. Be warned, if you like semi-sweet cocktails like me...there isn't a whole lot on the menu that doesn't involve bitters, gin, rum, or whiskey.
Love this place. I'm there or picking up something to go at least twice a week. The meatballs are fantastic.  My drink of choice is the Diablo.
Went for dinner and drinks here and LOVED it. Really scrumptious food and perfect drinks. My Husband and I will be back.

Herbs and Rye has become one of our favorite late night go to's for dinner and drinks. We are there at least every couple weeks. They have happy hour from  5pm to 8pm and midnight to 3am where steaks and some cocktails are half off. Their food is fantastic, the steaks are always cooked the way you like them and the sides are all delicious. My favorite is the Truffle mac and cheese and the sprouts and swine (Brussels sprouts and bacon) 

The atmosphere is amazing, it has kind of an old speak easy feel to it, with dim lighting and lots of reds and black. This is not a quiet place but  If you like a little more privacy sit in the main dining area. If you are up for a good time sit at the bar, it gets loud, wild and crazy but is a real blast. Isaiah and Matt are the 2 best bartenders and they are always willing to recommend a good drink. One of our friends always requests bottled water and Matt has it on the counter for him by the time we sit down. Isaiah is fantastic and crafting cocktails based on peoples tastes and I have yet to have a poor cocktail from him. 

Parking can be a bit tough, there are very few spaces and the parking lot gets really busy during happy hour but even if you have to trek a ways it is well worth it.

Loved everything about this place! Loved the dim lighting and ambiance. We went for our anniversary dinner and made reservations they seated us right away. We had the calamari as an appetizer and a few drinks which were all very good. My husband orders prime rib with the truffle mac and cheese and I had the New York steak with the mac and cheese they were both very good and the steaks were at the perfect temperature. This was our second time there and we will definitely be going back. Mark Vega was our server and he was so attentive to every detail he made us feel right at home and so did everybody else who helped us. Can't wait to go back

This will be on my list of places I need to eat at every time I'm in Vegas.  Upon arriving we had some issues, we actually didn't get in until an hour after our reservation time.  Having a hangry group of 11, we started to get a bit fussy.  They sent shots on the house outside where we were waiting as well as some bread baskets which made us much happier and made the trips inside one by one to complain go away.  Once seated, we had a wonderful waitress [really wish I got her name!].  I don't believe we're the easiest group to deal with honestly and she kept a smile on her face the entire time!  Appetizers we got some shrimp cocktail which was delicious, also an order of wings that came out cold but we were so hungry we didn't seem to care.  Everyone at the table got steak and had good things to say about it other than a few complaints about the way their meats were cooked.  I personally am not much of a steak person but I tried my fiance's and it was delicious!  I got the chicken breast on angel hair pasta and it was fantastic!  Their extensive cocktail list was pretty awesome too!  I tried a few from the table and they were all yummy.  I'll definitely be back.

The food was good enough, but very expensive. Service was not great, they forgot more than one order. When I asked for horse radish, I finally had to go to the kitchen and get it, and they charged $4 for it. They added 28% for their tip.
They did have Brussels sprouts with ham and marshmallows, so that was good.

Herbs and Rye has the destinction of being a wonderful purveyor of great crafted classic and modern cocktails.  Our waiter was very knowledgable and the service was good.  We went during happy hour and split a couple of half price entrees which made the evening rather inexpensive.   If you don't go during happy hour the food prices can really add up.  The food was good, we had a steak and the gnocci both of which were quite tasty.  The vibe of the place is laid back and comfortable.  If you're a cocktail drinker, then this place is right up there with the Artisan and the Downtown Cocktail room.

Herbs is my fave! Come here! Often!!!  Bar is super fun and Emily and Mark are seriously the best ever!  They are the shining stars that make spending money here a pleasure, and make me excited to come back!!!   The guy w the glasses who is previously from bazaar is super cool too. These guys have hospitality in their genes!! Always a great time and I literally live for the clams and cheeeeesy broccoli they are so good!!! Great hospitality with amazing food, what more could you want in a neighborhood bar/restaurant?!! 

Only downside is the bigger guy with the long beard. He literally looks like he would be in excruciating pain if he had to smile and kindly acknowledge a guest at his bar. It makes you feel really uncomfortable when he turns around every five minutes to talk quietly to another bartender with his head down. Dear Mr Mean Bartender Guy, I hope 2016 is better for you and you can find some happiness because it's a small part of a job as a bartender to talk to, engage with, I don't know, not snarl at your guests who are spending money at your bar.  

Thanks for all the great times herbs babies!! New cool hipster host dude is pretty cool too. :)

Happy hour steaks! The steaks are a bit pricey but I feel you get what you pay for. I'm giving this place 4 stars only because every time I go I feel I have to ask for the bread basket multiple times, after awhile it just gets annoying and when it's finally brought out you just don't want it, same goes for when asking for steak sauce or chimichurri. Overall great place for happy hour steak.

Italian? This is more a steakhouse than anything else. Its also definitely $$$ vs the $$ that it shows on Yelp (maybe even 4$). 

++ happy hour (4pm to 6pm, and midnight to 3am) makes it well worth it. steaks are half off.

++ quality: truffle mac & cheese was rich & fantastic. flat iron steak was juicy and flavorful. 

+ cost: split a Caeser salad, and the two of us were out the door for $55 total.. stuffed and fully satisfied.

service was very friendly, albeit it a bit slow. but I didn't mind, we were seated in a table by the bar and it has a nice atmosphere.

Great food and beautiful place but service is sooooooooooooooooo slow...I had to ask for order to be taken after 30 min of waiting....paying  with credit card took another 40 min...like I been here for 3 hours...

I hardly ever write reviews, but I decided that after happily coming here several times this place definitely deserves the 5 stars! Every time I go we usually try and sit with Deborah because she's absolutely fantastic. She manages to always remember us even remembering the signature cocktail I order which is the weekend at the Waldorf ( great citrus drink to cool off this heat!) On top of the service the food is always impeccable. I also work at a steakhouse on the strip so this little hole in the wall definitely holds up with any fine dining restaurant with an added casual local feel. From the outside it may not seem like much especially considering the surrounding area, but the inside is a whole other world!
So I would like to share my personal experience of this establishment. I came here with a party of 8 on a Thursday night at 6:30 for their HH.

If you want a spot at the bar, come early. It's really the best seat in the house. You get to watch the bartenders do what they do best. Their cocktail list ranges through the eras of the history of the cocktail, so there is definitely something different and fun for everyone. I also love that they use fresh ingredients with an abundance of fruit adorning the bar. 

We came in for a quick, quality, craft cocktail and weren't disappointed. We tried the Aviation and Boulevardier. Both very well done. 

It's been a while since I've been in for food, but last I was here we had half-off steak that was excellent. Come for the full experience or just a drink. It'll be worth your while.

The steak here is the best.....soooooo delicios. 
And it's  very romantic inside. It's a good place to have a romantic and cozy date. Love it!

What an amazing happy hour!!!!! I can't express enough how delicious the wings, filet sliders and spicy mussels were!!!! Everything was great as it always is, I would of given 5stars but I told the bartender twice we needed the check and still had to wait while he talked to some people. I can always say it's always a good time

It pains me to give the delicious food here such a low rating, but there are two reasons for it.

1. The prices. Without the Happy Hour, the prices here are ridiculous. You can go to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse for these prices and get a far superior cut of meat for the same prices, if not less.

2. The service. Oye. We were a party of 7. Normally, I'm very forgiving of mistakes in a big party. Things are just bound to go wrong when you have that many people to serve. That wasn't the problem here. The problem was that we were in the restaurant for almost 2 hours and saw our waiter 4 times. Maybe 5. He came and took our orders, then he disappeared. 35 minutes later, we haven't received any of our food, and we haven't seen our waiter in 35 minutes. Several of us wanted to order another round of drinks and were stuck trying to waive someone down. No one ever came. Finally, he came with our food and we quickly ordered drinks while we had him. He disappeared again until he came around with our check.

The worst part is, the restaurant wasn't even crowded when we were there. I counted 7 or 8 other tables that were seated, that was about it. When you've got a big party and you know you're getting a mandatory tip, that shouldn't be grounds to just ignore the group and collect your cash at the end of the night. If there had been a manager going around asking how patrons were doing, we might have been able to point out our problem to him. But there wasn't. Guess bad service starts at the top and works its way down.

To be fair, the food itself was delicious, which is why I'm still not giving it 1 star. Everyone was happy with how everything came out and all the meat was cooked perfectly. The flavors here are fabulous.  It's a great spot for some yummy food, but I'd suggest never going in large parties or during regularly priced hours.

This place is just incredible. Hand crafted old school cocktails are to die for. I hope you have patience because service is always a bit bit slow but I realize these cocktails take time. So I don't mind. And it's worth it. The food is always outstanding. I'd recommend going for happy hour, Everything is half off, thus making a rather expensive meal very affordable! Even the steaks are half off! The bartenders, servers and even porters are all top notch and professional! Very much appreciated! This spot is a real Vegas Gem!
Great Service Great food Great Drinks. Always a great time. Everything is delicious and the hospitality is beyond words.

Our expectations might have been too high due to so many 5 star reviews, promising online menu, glorious pictures that yelpers posted....But it was just average for us.  Their drinks were good but we didn't feel they were unique or exceptional.  We ordered Vieux, Jack Rose and Ward Eight which were all recommendations from our server.  The food (ordered Ribeye, NY strip, mac & cheese, and garlic mash) was average, but I didn't hold it against them too much because it was happy hour pricing.  Overall, value-wise, it's very affordable.

Also interesting note, if you call before they open (5pm I think) you're going to be told that their number is not in service.  Now where I'm from, you get that message when your number is disconnected or you're no longer in business.  I thought this place has gone out of business until I called right at 5pm just for the hell of it, and the hostess picked up.  LOL.

I went here with my wife and sat at the bar.  Great romantic atmosphere.  This place has all of the prohibition Era drinks and the bartender was fabulous. A lot of local people here and ...not the strip.  The happy hour prices are a great value.  I had the meatball appetizer with a Boulevardier and that was a perfect combination of food and drink. The  ribeye with garlic mash and the Brussel sprouts for dinner.    Great food/service/people/ambiance.

I have been here several times now and it never disappoints! The 120 oz steak at happy hour for six people is a great deal and fun experience. Truffle Mac, swine and sprouts, and mushrooms are all legit!  Don't forget a hand crafted cocktail! The brown derby and lions tail are solid.

Great late night spot for dining as well as handcrafted cocktails. During our most recent visit we were well taken care of by Mike who gave us great service. Food was tasty & drinks were on point! Calamari is a definite favorite there as well as the caprese salad. They also carried one of our favorite wines by the bottle, Meiomi! Shoutout to Mike who sent us out an Anniversary dessert on the house! Overall we had a great time & will definitely be back in the near future.

After my first visit to Herbs & Rye, I was going to write 2 reviews just to give the place 10 stars. After my second trip, I have to give it 3 stars, and here's why. 

On my first visit, my friend and I decided to indulge in the happy hour special and we ordered the flat iron steaks. He ordered his with $3.50 extra house rub, I ordered mine plain. We also paid for two alacarte sides that we decided to split. When the steaks were placed in front of us, we weren't sure which had the rub and which didn't. We later found out that neither had the rub, but those were some damn good steaks. So good that we considered ordering second steaks. The flat iron was juicy, flavorful, and tender. I wanted to slap someone they were so good. We went around bragging about how wonderful the steaks were, and they were. At the time we thought, since we were charged for it, that both of our steaks got the house rub. 

Fast forward to the next trip where we brought some friends along, we decided almost recreate our first trip. We got 3 Kansas City cuts 2 with the rub and one with blue cheese. Lets just say this is when we discovered that we paid for a rub that we didn't get and we also paid for sides that should've come with the meal. I had to verify, since the first server charged us separately for the sides whether or not a side was included with a steak order. That rub that we didn't receive the first go round was definitely not the be's knees.  A couple sitting in the both next us thought the same thing. Finally, my friend who got the blue cheese topping on his steak really wanted more steak than blue cheese. Blue cheese is pungent enough that the entire 12oz piece of steak did not need to be covered in it. I took a bite of his steak and tasted no steak at all, just blue cheese. 

My advice, get the flat iron with no extra anything.

We didn't realize that reservations were recommended when we decided to visit, we went just on word of mouth, but the manager was friendly and got us a table fairly quickly. This is definitely a great place to go for an expensive date. The food was incredible! I'm from Nebraska and we know our steaks and this place has amazing steak! The staff was friendly and efficient. I really loved the "old Vegas days" type decor and I loved how it felt like we were dining in a speakeasy. It looks like a hole in the wall but it definitely is not! Don't let the location throw you off

This is my second time here and it is definately a hidden neighborhood gem.  It's off the strip, so you'll need to drive or catch a cab there.  But let me tell you, it is worth it.  Jalepeno creamed corn was good, but would be more spectacular if they used fresh cut corn.  Bf had ice in the spicy mussels which had great flavors in the sauce, but unfortunately one mussel still had ice on it!  Get the flat iron at HH price $13, you will not be dissapointed.  It is juicy and delicious.  It's definately a bargain.  Bf got the pork and fig....omg, SOOO amazing.  Not HH deal, but worth every penny.  We had 3 rounds of cocktails each, all were unique and kept us smiling the entire night!  Will come back again next time I'm in Vegas.

We attended after reviewing the yelp reviews,   Have always been steered right.  We had the happy hour steaks all cooked as ordered,,,,   Very yummy we're also the sides.    Brussels sprouts are typically not my first choice, have shanged my mind...    Will definitely be back,,,,

Yelp had this place categorized incorrectly as Italian and tapas. It's definitely not either. ITS AN EXPENSIVE STEAK HOUSE. Had the 18$ calamari and it wasn't even close to worth 18$. I was seated by the bar and it was VERY loud. They moved me no problem though. The waiter was great. The beef tartar was great but my friend @Annemarie H. Got the squirt stinkies almost immediately.  Oh yeah and the toilet had mold in it.

Prior to heading out for New Years Eve a group of us booked a table at Herbs and Rye for pre-celebration food and drinks.  Sadly we had a very poor experience which seems at odds with the general high standards of review for this establishment.

Initially thinks seemed ok, the server took our drinks order and placed the bread plates...then things began to go downhill. 

Firstly the drinks took an age to arrive. When they did the two Pilsners (Firestone) had a strange soapy taste to them. Eventually we managed to grab the waitress who after initially seating was very disinterested with our table. She took the drinks and came back with fresh ones, however, again the same soapy taste. I asked if the pipes had been cleaned recently at which point out of the shadows jumped the manager. He quickly said the pipes had been cleaned to their usual standards and maybe we weren't used to the taste of Pilsner...well I and my buddy are very used to the taste and I can tell you this wasn't right! I asked the manager if he himself had tasted it and he sheepishly replied that he had not and that he would go and taste it...he never came back to the table.  

It took about an hour for the food to finally arrive. The bread course never arrived.  A table next to us that arrived after us was also served dinner before us and got their bread. We would have loved to have had the opportunity to point the problem out but the waitress was nowhere to be seen. 

When the food arrived the steaks were tepid and the truffle fries cold. The entire meal had obviously been sat waiting to be served for some time. Again it took an age to be checked on and in the end we grabbed a porter and told him about the fries. He apologised and returned in about 5-10min with fresh hot fries. Once he had taken the fries back to the kitchen the waitress appeared and asked how the meal was, as we began to tell her the issues she completely ignored what we were saying and said she was glad everything was ok and she walked away. We were astounded!  

At the end of the meal the manager came round and asked if everything had been ok. We gave him a précis akin to this review. He didn't understand the term 'tepid' which for a restaurant manager was pretty epic, and his solution to the problem was he would love to have us back and gave one member of the party his card.  He did offer a round of champagne or desserts if we so wished but as we had earlier explained we really needed to get going to Fremont. 

The meal took 2 hours in the end and we only had an entree. When the check came the soapy beers had been removed and that was it. We asked for the fries to be comped also and the waitress disappeared for another 10mins. By this time we were exasperated and could not believe the poor service. We understand that NYE is a tricky time but the restaurant was far from being overly busy and looked to be on a standard service footing in terms of numbers in there.  The food we had was tasty, just not hot enough and let down with the addition of poor service. Disappointing Herbs and Rye, disappointing...treat your locals well if you want return custom and good word of mouth reviews.

I have always heard about Herbs and Rye. From co workers and locals alike, so I ventured out for a first..

We arrived about midnight. As we entered it was dim and very relaxing. We were greeted by Joshua, a very welcoming young man, eager to give us a great experience. We started out with the Beef Carpaccio (w/ aoli, balsamic, caper berries, and wild rocket arugula). It had to be one of the best carpaccios I've had in a while. The dish presented tasted very fresh, and had a great presentation. The carpaccio was smooth and delicate. Not too "beefy". the other key factors was the aoli and balsamic, making this dish enjoyable as well as flavorful. The capers helped balance out the arugula. All in all it got our appetite ready for the main course, and most certainly our taste buds were amused.  My date and I had a "Martinez" cocktail to start. It complimented it well as it made us feel like we were in the 'Good Ol' Days' of Vegas once again. Our server recommended this for us, and we were glad he did so.

For our entree my date had the Kansas City steak (bone in) cooked medium. I had the ribeye (medium rare). For sides we both had garlic whipped mashed potatoes, the 'infamous' truffle mac n' cheese, and the garlicky spinach. When our entrees were delivered, once again presentation was extraordinary. Our steaks were cooked to perfection and the sides were mouthwatering. The garlic whipped mashed potatoes weren't as "plain" as you ordinary mashed potato dish. They had a subtle character to them. The truffle mac n' cheese was everything we had heard about and then some. Made the entire meal even more enjoyable. Then there was our garlicky spinach. it was nothing like we expected. The spinach was vibrant, full of life. Not mushy and 'can like'.  Would definitely recommend for tourists and locals. Will be here again soon.
Great local spot! Food and drinks are on point, love the mixologists they really know their stuff, and service is always exceptional!!!

Came here for my birthday with a friend. Parking is a pain, it is REALLY dark and the service was ok. Lots of reviews mention it's in a bad part of town. I would say an older part of town but not bad. Price wise, a little high for the area but this is Vegas.

Service was an little lacking. She was helpful but super busy and didn't check back enough for my standards. I hate having an empty drink glass!! And I also hate when water is poured all over the table while refilling glasses and not cleaned up!!

Food was amazing!! We had the bone-in strip and a filet, the broccoli with cheddar, mashed potatoes, and truffle mac and cheese. All delicious. Tried three cocktails, all delicious. Make sure you ask about flavors if you're not familiar with the the ingredients. Some are very strange!!

Cocktail menu gives everyone something to like and the idea of categorizing the cocktails by dates is amazing. The steaks were perfectly cooked and the sides were all great. Also, it was happy hour and steaks were 1/2 off!

Happy hour is amazing...but honestly at full price dinner and drinks here are still a bargain anybody that disagrees is a negative yelper and refuses to be happy to pay for quality, the passion behind the bar menu and behind the bar itself is rare to see with such little spotlight or reward....they have one goal and that to impress and make you happy mission accomplished...the first bartender we had was probly my favorite he had moved here from California...and his on the spot mixology based on flavor and spirit preference was rare nowadays...I haven't seen him since not sure if he is still there or have just missed his shifts
This is one of the more popular local gems for Vegas locals. They have an AMAZING happy hour discount, and their food and classic and specialty cocktails are always on point. love love love.

I went for the first time a couple nights ago and it was late night happy hour, so we waited about 45 minutes to be seated so that I didn't like. Once we were seated the food and drinks were awesome. I ordered the filet mignon and it was perfectly cooked with jalapeño cream corn. All around great experience I will go back. The only thing I didn't like was the location, but you can't win everything.

We went here for after dinner cocktails. 
If you are ever in Vegas and want to get away from the strip I would have to say go here. Something low key. It's a prohibition gangster style bar and steakhouse. 

The cocktails are $10 each which is not bad for Vegas prices.  They also have a beer that they make. I believe it's an IPA. That was hoppily delightful. 

Although I did not eat there the food looked and smelled great. Although that was closer to Vegas prices but I think still a little cheaper. 

You won't find cran and vodka here. Not even a manhattan. Think rye, absinthe, and bourbon based drinks. The bartenders are very friendly and can recommend something if you are unsure about the ingredients (a few drinks have egg white for "froth and a creamy texture")

I have been to Vegas several times and I will definitely be coming back here on my next trip. 

Also happy hour (or hours) are 5p-8p and midnight-3a.

The late night happy hour with half off steaks is awesome. our server (young latin girl) was super friendly and very nice. porterhouse was cooked perfectly. No British beers was a disappointment but it forced me to try something that was pretty good - Seef.

Super fun place for drinks.  If this review was based on cocktails alone it would be a higher rating.  That being said,  the food is good but not amazing.  It is a little steep for the food you actually get. 

The ambience on the other hand is lovely. Very dark and intimate, giving it a very 20's speak easy feel.  The bartenders strike the perfect balance of being interactive but not nosy. The servers we have had are also lovely. After several rounds of drinks and shared plates we were sent a digestif  which was nice. 

Definitely a place we will return to if we are hosting friends,  but not a contender to be a regular stop.

This is a great restaurant. The food and cocktails are excellent. The staff was very friendly from start to finish. Everything they suggested to drink and eat, I loved. It is open pretty late and it's great to stop by after a night out on the strip. If your every in the area I suggest stopping in and having a drink/food, because you won't be  disappointed.

Came here after seeing owner win Bartender of the Year. Awesome cocktails and great staff! Cocktails we're surprisingly reasonably priced along with our bottles of wine. We enjoyed the 1/2 off Happy Hour after midnight and ordered steaks. The steaks were good, but would have liked to see a more tender cut and some aging on them (for the price). Overall a pleasant experience!

Atmosphere takes you back to the roaring 20s. Bartenders, or, mixologists are legit.  Pages & pages of cocktail drinks in leather bound menu, so fancy.  Use Phone Light if you're blind like me as they have dim lighting.  I like to sit at the bar, order an appetizer & have the bartender surprise me, has not disappointed.  Tonight it's a blend.  Put this one in the Vegas hidden gem album.  Don't tell the tourists, I like it as my local bar.   & good ole blue eyes starts to sing in the background, perfecto!!

Half-price steaks during happy-hour ... that should be "'nuff said".
However, the ambience is cool, it's away from the Strip and easy to get to with plenty of parking. 
Despite the fact there was a big party going on their private room, service was really great.
The steaks were good as well as the sides (big enough to share), the fresh made donut dessert melts in your mouth.
Wine list has a nice selection, creative cocktails, good food, great service, altogether a great experience.
Carpaccio is some of the best in town. That and the sweet potato tots alone make this place worth the visit.

If you are looking for craft cocktails this is the place to go. The bartenders are really cool and are open to make recommendations if your not sure what your looking for. The food is great just a bit expensive but they have happy hour

11.13.2012 Herbs and Rye (Las Vegas, NV)

Herbs and Rye is located on the corner or South Valley View and Sahara. Every time drove past this restaurant the parking lot was always full (around dinner time). That is always a good thing! When we walked up to the building a little after 6pm, the black exterior and windowless building had a speakeasy feel to it. Opening the doors, it definitely reminded me of an older, classy, speakeasy type of restaurant. There are two dinning areas. We were lead into the area which also holds the bar. The bar is 3/4 the length of the building. Opposite the bar are booths. Chandeliers hang from the ceiling, dimly lighting the restaurant. While you wait for your dinner to be served they provide you with fresh baked bread and butter. We were lucky enough on out first visit to make happy hour. Which not only meant discounts on liquor it also meant 50% off our steaks. They identify which items can be discounted because of happy hour with a star next to the item. We ordered steaks and they each came with one side dish. In addition we ordered an additional side dish... we needed to try it all! The side dishes are served family style. Our meal was excellent as well as the service. Throughout our meal I noticed that the bar was continuously becoming busier. We left a little before 8pm and the place was still quit busy. I feel like I was the last to know about this lovely whole in the wall restaurant. They are always the best! There is not doubt that we will be going back.

 
Impressed!

Very good....got truffle mac and cheese and also the Caprese salad.  my friend got the sliders and the asparagus.  omnomnomnom

The drinks here are SPECTACULAR.  I tried a few but the one that stands out is some strawberry, rum, curacao and lime twist. It has over 2 oz of alcohol and is only $11.  Next time we are coming during happy hour so we can get steaks (50% off during HH).  This might be our new spot! :)

This place is really GOOD! Couple of my friends told me about it! So I decided to give a try, 5 min drive from Strip, not a lot of tourists.
Great atmosphere, excellent customer service, amazing food and superior cocktails! Now is my favorite place to go when I'm in Vegas!

Awesome handmade cocktails.  Our servers - Christian and Ronnie - were really awesome to speak with and were extremely knowledgeable.  They recommended some great drinks based on the type of alcohol I enjoy, and the balance of flavor I was looking for.  The appetizers were phenomenal (we had the meatballs and muscles) and then enjoyed the salmon and new strip for our entrees.  We then topped it all off with their doughnut dessert with caramel and cream cheese dipping sauces - so freaking good.  Aside from the great food, the ambiance and excellent service from Christian and Ronnie really made the experience.  It has an old-school lounge feel and apparently has an awesome late night happy hour starting at midnight.  Definitely take the chance to check this place out if you're looking for some great drinks and food outside of the strip.

AMAZING! ....Period! 

The true highlight of Herbs & Rye is that it is the complete antithesis of what you would find on the strip.**

**Great tasting food, innovative cocktails and prompt, un-intrusive service without the stiff upper lip atmosphere. 

I was comfortable the entire time! Such an amazing experience!

This place is undoubtedly for raw unfussy foodies!
Expensive. Happy hour is only on steaks... I thought it was going to be on drinks so that was disappointing. Food is really rich but tasty. Good if you want to take someone on a pricey dinner date.

Good food, good drinks, good service in a very relaxed and comfortable atmosphere.  What a great place!  Go for late night happy hour and sit at the bar.  We rolled in at 1am and scored 1/2 price steaks that were seasoned and cooked to perfection.  Bar keep made me a whiskey cocktail that was equally delicious.  Loved the HUGE selection of whiskeys!

My boyfriend and I came in Tuesday night for dinner. It was our second time trying this place out. Everything was so delicious, happy hour was great. Service was friendly and efficient. This is a hidden gem and an awesome place for date night dinner. We will definitely be back and recommend it to all of our friends.

My fiance and I were recommended Herbs and Rye by our Uber driver. We both love cocktails and have enjoyed visiting many cocktail bars around the country when we travel together. We were greeted by the friendly and no nonsense mixologists, Emily and Mark. We both felt welcomed when they shook our hands and asked our names when we sat down at the bar. The menu was set up by cocktail eras which we found helpful and fun to read. Overall the experience was fantastic. Both mixologists did their work exceptionally well and we loved our drinks. My Lions Tail was spiced appropriately and refreshing at the same time. A great atmosphere ensures all patrons will enjoy their food and drinks here. Go here!

Its been a while since I have been, and this place is awesome.  Before 8pm is happy hour (1/2 all steaks and other items on menu as indicated and well drinks.)  Parking lot is always F U L L and had to park around the corner until after 8.  Food is awesome.  Service is great.  Recommend highly.  We were a larger party, and things are a little tight in the bar area, but that was part of the charm.  Great cocktail list.
"Hidden gem" comes to mind with this place.  Craft cocktails and upscale bar food.  Supposedly there is a secret speakeasy but I haven't been able to weasel my way into it just yet.

I have somewhat mixed feelings about this place. The service is excellent, and the first time you visit it seems like a special place: it's moody and atmospheric.

I go back there only for two dishes: the pork and figs (with gorgonzola) and the jalapeno creamed corn. Both are excellent.

The other dishes I've had have been fairly ordinary: the chicken wings were a big disappointment, while the steaks and fries aren't very exciting.

Service is on the slow side, which is fine for me, but may frustrate others. One of my family members didn't enjoy our visit there due to the dark lighting: it really is dark (so dark that the waiters carry torches to help with the menu), so don't go if you're not comfortable in such environments.

Great classic cocktails done by great BARTENDERS not mixologists.  The food is phenomenal as well.  My lady cannot get enough of the carpaccio that is covered in arugula.  The flat breads are very good as well and the butcher portion of the menu...whoa.  Definitely a local gem and worth checking out. We go several times a month.

I LOVE this place, suggest it to all my friends and come here at LEAST once a month.. I always have mark as my bartender and he is AMAZING!!  I just recently met JOJO and he comes off kinda rude.  He keeps slamming the bar with his hand, telling people to finish their drinks and asking guys if they need straws in their drinks... It just seems like he wants attention... And giving the fact that this bar has class and sticks to classic feel/drinks... He tends to give off a not so classy feel
The cocktails here are amazing, next visit had the food... WOW! The service is awesome drinks where great and the happy hour prices are amazing!!
Food and service were great. They ruined the experience at the end when they grossly overcharged our group of eleven. Blamed it on a new POS system. Yikes!! Pay attention at the end.

OVERCHARGED AND IGNORED!

My girlfriend and I went here for a late dinner about 2 weeks ago.  Nondescript exterior, pretty cool red lounge-y interior.  But, friends, the buck basically stops there.  

Immediately we were greeted by a rank bathroom sewage smell that creeped out of ladies restroom.  That odor persisted throughout our entire meal.

For drinks, we ordered the house brew: really boring beverage; at least it was well priced.  We were starving and ended making a pretty eclectic food order: calamari, mediterranean flatbread, chop salad, pork and figs.  Everything was okay; super rich, a wee salty, but pretty good.

Here's the point of my story: our bill came to $82, we left $16 for the tip and went on our way, glad to be smelling fresh air.  When the bill finally posted, we had been charged $36 for the tip!  I called 5 times, friendly each time, trying to get this rectified.  Each time I was promised a call back.  Not once did anyone call.  I even spoke to the GM/Owner, Nick, who told me he'd take care of it right away and to call back if I didn't see a credit in 24 hours.  The last time I called I was put on hold for a full 4 minutes and hung up.  I called right back; the line was inexplicably busy for the next 20 minutes.  I had to resolve the overcharge directly through the claims department at my bank.

Had they shown any real intention to fix their error and followed through with even a single call I expect we'd go back: ordering better beer and lighter fare, yes, and turning around at the door if it still stank.  Okay.  BUT! to be disregarded entirely despite making my best and patient effort repeatedly leaves me with a foul taste, odor AND impression.  Not Going Back.

This was me and my husband first time eating hear. We both have been hearing so many great things and it was time to check it out. WE both really enjoyed the atmosphere and the wonderful attentive staff, great job Mike! The Bistecca Flatbread was a light and tasty appetizer, especially with the spinach on top. Our main course was the Ribeye, truffle mac'n'cheese and asparagus....oh my god! Let me just say that was the BEST steak I ever ate. Oh and to actually have their steaks on the happy hour menu was the icing on the cake. 

The reason for the 4 and not 5 stars was because we waited 1 hour for our main course. When we arrive we were the 2nd couple in the dining area we were seated at. However, by the time we order it was full, but most of all them seated after us was already eating. I understand the business, but that was a little too long and seeing others eating wasn't helping my hunger pains lol! 

BUT I will NOT hold that against them. WE will return and also tell others about them! =)

Not sure about the bad reviews.  The service and food were both outstanding.  Mark the bar tender was very friendly and fun just to watch.  Even just ordering drinks and watching them make the over 30 or so old fashion cocktails is reason enough to go check it out.  Also the steak was amazing and during happy hour its half off steaks and drinks!

Was not impressed with this place. Parking is terrible (in an alley) and despite only having to wait 20 minutes for a table, it took over an hour from the time of ordering to get our food. When it finally did come, it was wrong (added a spicy rub that wasn't asked for). I didn't send it back because I didn't want to wait another hour for my steak. When I was finally able to catch up with the waiter, he said he had put my order in correctly and I must have gotten someone else's steak. Upon getting the bill, (which also took way longer than it should have) nothing "adjusted" to acknowledge the mistake and poor service. Food was decent, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.

I really want to like this place. I do. However, I find that Herbs & Rye continually disappoints me. Service is consistently poor. The quality of the drinks make up for it, but the final straw for me was double-charging my bar tab and then acting tactless brute in resolving the situation. I respect Nectaly for opening the bar in a neighborhood that is found my heart, but I'll be drinking a few miles away.

Back again... as long as they're in business, I'll try to get over here a few times a year. This time it was dinner in the large dining room (3 total rooms in here, this being the largest). Loud, celebratory environment with dim lights and still NO TELEVISIONS (thankfully!). My friend and I ordered a couple of New York Strips from the charming Allie (we further named her, 'bacon bringer') -- she suggested some toppings for the steaks because she is a "stuff on top or stuff" type of person. The steaks and the toppings did not disappoint, but the meatballs appetizer was the big winner -- spicy, savory, and hearty. The cocktails are always top shelf here, so I won't bother to write about them. But be sure to get a seat at the bar on your first visit here to watch the magic happen... and if you're lucky like I've been, the bartenders will recommend some recipe books for you.

Amazing reverse happy hour ( some entrees are half-priced from 5-8). 

Excellent cocktails every time--from different time periods!
Definitely one of my favorite spots great steaks and there tomato soup is delicious! Service is always pretty slow tho. That would be my only complaint

Service is not good, for all the great drinks bartenders make, bar service takes it all down.


It might be that they're busy , having too many tables, bar being busy, but taking 30 minutes for 3 drinks is unacceptable, 45 minutes for wings is worse.

Overall, great drinks, ok food but teeeeeerrible service...

My wife and I stopped in Herbs and Rye for a drink or two before heading to dinner somewhere else and were very impressed. It was like stepping back in time to an old time Chicago mob bar when we walked in and sat at the bar. Emily, the friendly bartender who served us, was very knowledgable and easy to get along with while making suggestions for other drinks as we enjoyed the drinks we had ordered. I had a pisco sour to remind me of time I spent in Peru and my wife had the Mary Pickford both of which were outstanding. We will certainly be back here again not only for drinks buy for dinner as well. 2 thumbs up here.
One of the few times I have seen every steak at the table cooked exactly to order. The service was great and the happy hour well worth while.

Emily created cocktails that thrilled the entire group. I usually ask for a whiskey cocktail with Cynar that's not bitter to test the ability of the bartender and she ROCKED it! Then she made me a. Bourbon cocktail with a Mexican Fernet that was outstanding! The rib-eyes from the in-house butcher shop were delicious and my friend raved about his lobster tail. The only downside was the limited wine list (I love a good red with a great steak) and our server was inattentive - but the manager bought our last round and saved the day!

If you're looking for good atmosphere and great food late at night I recommend Herbs & Rye. I've only been here once before and completely forgot about their happy hour specials. 

I went in last night with my Dad who is in town from New York and we received excellent service from our server Mike. 

Mike took time to explain the happy hour specials and give us his recommendations off the menu. He was one of the best servers i've had in Las Vegas and as someone in the service industry that is a huge compliment from me. 

We ordered the beef carpaccio & the steamed clams to start and they were both delicious! Normally when you order clams you get a little bit of grit somewhere in the dish, but there wasn't any at all in this. It is served with a big chunk of bread to dip in the delicious white wine sauce that the clams come in. 

We both ordered a steak (which are half off during happy hour and come with one free side), asparagus & truffled mac n cheese. It was all excellent. 

We weren't sure if we wanted dessert but Mike said the Chocolate Chip Cookie Skillet was his favorite and really good so we went for it and let's just say we found room quickly to finish it! 

I will definitely be coming back more frequently and sitting in Mike's section. 

10 out of 10 recommend!

Don't judge a book by its cover. This is a great and reasonably priced dinner. We were in Vegas on vacation and tired of the prices on the strip. This is a must try. Some recommendations are the Mussels, Caprese salad and almost all steaks are half price during happy hour.
If you like a late night snack.  This is the spot to go.  They have some late night specials.  The steaks are awesome.. And it's nice to bring a date for drinks to end your evening.

This is the best bar in Vegas hands down. You can get anything your mind could come up with improved by these bartenders. After a couple drinks I just allowed them to make me something cool. I was never let down. Amazing place.

This place was recommended by a local bartender who said the restaurant has great Ambiance and wonderful food. He was right. The bad news is the parking is very small. The service is not so great. We waited an hour and 10 minutes for bread. An hour and 30 minutes 
for our food. We were seated at 8:05 and don't be fooled the manager said that he could not give us the happy hour prices as the computers and menus change over automatically. After reading some of the other reviews I know now that that is not true. The service was nothing special and you have to pay automatic gratuity. Overall the food  is spectacular but it wasn't worth the hassle.
Truffle mac n chz is a must have! Great specialty cocktails and great happy hour 5-8 12am-3am

As my girlfriend and I pulled up to Herbs and Rye I was very skeptical of the place because it is in just a dark dingy looking building but as we walked in my view changed. It is a very interesting restaurant. We got a table in the bar area, the wall paper had velet decor on it,  we thought it was a nice touch. The drinks were great, the menu is quite extensive. We started out with a ceasar salad, the dressing has a bit of a kick to dressing, it was a delisious surprise. My girlfriend had the surf and turf and I had the filet and ordered a side jalapeño cream corn. Everything was great! I would recommend getting the surf and turf though,  you get more food for your money and it comes with two sides, and the steak has a delisious red wine sauce. Service was great!

First let me start by saying the place is clean and the staff is welcoming. Several reviews mention poor waitstaff, but I found our server to be very good. The food is delicious from the steaks to the sides to the desserts. However, what I didn't expect was to pay more than 30% gratuity. The gratuity, it appears, is based on the full menu price of the items AND taxes. As a server, the government has never calculated my tips on taxes, so to pay gratuity on taxes seems a bit ridiculous. When I researched yelp to see if anyone else had commented on this, I noticed several did. Then I noticed, one guy, received a response from the owner; which was incredibly rude. I've never seen a response like that and I can't imagine someone being in business with that attitude. Want to see for yourself? Go to Herbs and Rye and in the search box place the word gratuity, then search for Bob C. Amazing! I'm secretly hoping the owner responds to my review, so I won't feel bad not returning. I considered it until I read her response. WOW!

No Vegas bullshit. Just craft cocktails.

If you want a break from Vegas or just a well made, signature shaken crafted cocktail... go here.

As a bartender, I appreciate the knowledge and skill of a well crafted cocktail and trust me you'll receive it here. Take a look at their chronologically itemized cocktails (I love this touch) on the menu, pick an era, and order. You won't be disappointed. 

P.S. Take a gander at their top shelf liquor ... ie: rip van winkle... impressive

I think this would be a great restaurant/bar if it didn't have so many staff problems. 4 bartenders behind the bar couldn't take care of 15 people sitting at the bar because they were too busy trying to get laid.

 Food is great here but it's strip prices basically, which is a huge problem in my opinion for a place that is trying to gather a locals following. 

Drink menu is brilliant, but it's a shame I haven't seen this place get their act together yet. Yes the reviews are glowing in 2010, but I'm 2012 it's a different story. I've given this place about 4 chances now.
Love the atmosphere of this place. Drinks are tasty and meatballs are a must try!

Sprouts and ham was delicious.  Spicy clams was excellent.  A must order!  Rib eye was flavorful.  If you add blue cheese to any steak... Order it on the side.  The flavor is too overwhelming with the steak.  Clams linguini lacked flavor.  Order after midnight for the 1/2 off steaks.  Pricey place...

Mixed Review for Service and Food. Parking is horrid, parked 2 blocks away, not located in the best area. Huge waiting line out front, lucky we had reservations. My husband and I went for a nice evening out during their Happy Hour from 5-8 PM, when steaks are half price. Reservation requested "quiet table." Seated in the corner, so far, so good, 2 minutes later they seat a group of 10 guys on a boys night out/business dinner right next to us. I asked to be moved but they had nothing that was any better. The place is very loud and you can barely hear yourself think. Server was cordial, but busboy delivered warm bread to every other table around us, including the one next to us before us and by the time we got our bread, the meal was already delivered. We both ordered the ribeye and mine was to have sauteed mushrooms and onions topper. My husband's steak was average and mine was so marbled that there was a glaze of fat on my plate that shined in the dim lighting. Mushroom and onion topper was primarily onions. Apparently, they do not believe in seasoning the steak as it was bland. The server did not offer to send it back for another one, just brought me the salt and pepper shaker, no fresh cracked available. Only saving grace was the Truffle Mac and Cheese which was delicious, but I have no idea why "truffle" was in the name as I could not detect anything truffle related. Cocktail was good. Bar was packed with younger crowd. Place only has 1 bathroom for both sexes and had a very long line. Price was good but I had the impression from the server that they were doing us a favor by allowing us to purchase a $54.00 steak for $27. Dinner out was still $100 and I left there unimpressed.

We went to Herbs and Rye for a nice night out. The first thing that caught my eye was the dark and mysterious decor! Then we sat down at the bar and started talking to the bar tender. He was so friendly and helpful with any questions we had about the menu. We also talked with the owner who was very nice and friendly as well! The food was pretty darn good but my favorite part of the night were the drinks. They have a list of specialty drinks and every one we tried was phenomenal. If you go, I highly recommend the Buck's Fiz  (not sure if I spelled it right) but its awesome!

Great food, good drinks and really cool environment. Reason for the 1 star was the horrible horrible wait staff. Everything he could have done wrong as a waiter he did & paved the way with apologies.. Don't say sorry, just be better at your job. Otherwise, I enjoyed the king Kong and a variety of cocktails. I may go back, but never on a Thursday at midnight again

The food is good but overpriced. They have a happy hour but do very little in offering discount prices. The $60 rib eye becomes $30 which is exactly what it should cost anyway. I certainly don't see the draw here, when there are so many great places to eat in the valley, like Echo and Rig, which has better food and atmosphere. Then they added in a 24% tip to the check using the before happy hour prices.  It's hard to walk away without feeling like you have been fleeced. I won't be back.

Followed my favorite Vegas bartender Isaiah from the Vangaurd to this spot. I like him because he makes you feel like family every time he sees you. The bar has great atmosphere and good drinks. If you need a swanky place to chill and grab a good drink go here.

This WAS my favorite steakhouse until last night. We had a reservation for a party of 9 at 7:30. They told us we would be seated in a few minutes once this table cleared. Well instead of coming and getting us to be seated they grabbed the other big party that arrived 20 minutes after us and seated them. They stated because they were busy they just grabbed the nearest group. Unprofessional!  We ended up waiting almost 2 hours to be seated. They said they would take care of us and I guess that meant sending out extra appetizers. When our bill came and they split it each group had over a 30% gratuity added. Thank God for the company I was with otherwise this would have been one of the worst nights out ever. They have forever lost us!  Good luck to whoever makes reservations and expects a great experience!  Also I would like to note I would not give this place any stars but it makes you.

I really liked the ambiance at this place, it has a slight gothic feel with dim lighting and velvet curtains. The music wasn't too loud so it was easy to have good conversation with our whole group.  The classic cocktails were interesting, but a bit pricey for a "locals" bar.

 The Carpaccio was good and had a decent portion size. The gnocchi was awesome, perfectly cooked with a hearty and flavorful sauce. The Flatbread was very flavorful and was a decent size. I wouldn't order the calamari again, as it was a bit too chewy and there wasn't much flavor. 

Over-all, this place has a low-key vibe and is a chill place to lounge, eat, and drink. Don't expect a high energy party bar or dancing.

I have passed by this place multiple times because my friend used to work at a restaurant close by. I have also wanted to try it, epecially since they do have HH! However, I'm not a steak fan nor do I spend tons of money eating out.  

I had the perfect opportunity to go the other day for my friend's birthday. I got there exactly at 6 which was the reservation time. The waitress was very friendly as she asked us if we wanted any cocktails or appetizers (I get it, it's her job to upsell and ask.) However, we were still waiting on the rest of our late party.  

Finally everyone arrived. My friend ordered the beef carpaccio which had balsamic vinegarette, and tasted sour. It had arugula on top. I loved the veggies, but not the sour taste of the dressing. We ordered our food at approximately 6:30, and did not receive it until past 7:11. I get it. We were a large party (we had 12 people). My friend asked for extra bread. The waitress said she would put it in right away. We did not get it until my other friend asked 40 minutes later. Now, I'm not a steak fan, so I can't give too much opinion on my steak. When our food arrived, she gave me brussel sprouts instead of the truffle mac and cheese that I had ordered. The waitress did fix that mistake and bring me mac and cheese. Someone in our party did not receive his steak. There were issues with that which you can read in other reviews.  Half of the steak was medium rare and the other half was medium. I had ordered medium. My steak was COLD! As though it had been sitting there for a while. Maybe it was because I ordered mine medium and everyone else ordered theirs medium rare, so they cooked mine first and let it sit? I don't know.  The mac and cheese was nice and hot, but it just made my steak seem super cold. 

They cleared our table  and gave each person a small plate and said it was for dessert since it was a birthday. Our waitress brought out the check and gave it to the birthday boy. Uh... we asked for separate checks.  10 min later she came back and said we can't do separate checks.  So we would have to calculate the price with tax and gratuity and tell them how much to put on each card. What a HUGE inconvenience.  

The manager came up to us and was told us that he would take care of us to get us out. UH... YEA that's what we were trying to do... You guys had your strict regulation of not splitting checks. You think I wanted to sit there and ponder over how much I owed. I felt that was super rude of him because I felt like he was wanted to get us out of there and just get rid of us.  The dessert finally came out, and it was beignets that I read in other reviews that they received complimentary. They didn't even give us enough for everyone in the party, and why did they even need to give us plates?  Plus it took FOREVERRRR!  Like, it was free, so I shouldn't really complain, but it came right as the manager came over to say that he was going to "take care of us." 

Something weird, when eating the appetizer, I didn't use my silverware, so when the waitress brought out the steak knives and forks, she took my napkin and silverware. Was she going to reuse? I didn't think much of it at the time, but I didn't have a napkin. Why the heck would you take mine?!? 

I'm not a fan of steak to ever come here again after the horrible service I had. The food was okay, but again steak is not my thing. I spent $18. I could have made my own steak and mac and cheese for way less and not experienced that.
Kind of disappointed. A lot of my friends told me to try this place and that it's worth it for the happy hours. Well... The food is good but it's too expensive !

Easily my new favorite cocktail spot. I was so stoked to see so many gin cocktails on the menu, with ingredients that enhance the herbaceous flavor of the spirit (I had the ford cocktail: gin, dry vermouth and orange bitters). SO DELISH. Can't wait to go back to delve further into their extensive list of creations!

This place is fantastic. The food is always amazing, the steak is so delicious. we first ordered the caprese salad, which was amazing but the size was too small for us, so we also ordered the spicy steamed mussels. The mussles were amazing!! it was a huge pot, I would even recommened ordering it as your entree if you wanted seafood. I ordered steak of course! The flavor of the meat is so wonderful, they only put a few salt, pepper, and baselmic butter on it when cooking. My personal favorite is the new york strip. It was a perfectly cooked medium steak. the side I picked was the mac and cheese with truffle oil. THIS WAS AMAZING! I would love to have a recipe for this!  The only reason i dont give them 5 stars is all based on the cocktails. I know they are supposed to be known for their cocktails but i personally wasnt a fan. I tried three different kinds and they all seemed to be way to sour for my taste. my face actually hurt from the puckering of my cheeks. I switched to beers lol. I will be back for more though!

Service is SUPER SUPER slow. I mean we orderd our dirty martinis the second we sat down and didn't get them till right when dinner was served (30 min later) I understand they are handmade craft drinks but 30 min, really? Our server was wonderful ( a brunette girl) the busser boys all had attitudes, I feel like the employees don't work as a team. Bartender was awesome to (bearded guy with glasses) the people in the place were super trashy and loud. I had a lady next to me talking about sex and penis the whole dinner, it was repulsive. The salads sucks and the steaks were really good. Over all when you walk in the place it looks cool because it's really dark but I guarantee when the lights come on it looks like a shit hole. I was dying to get up after dinner, was not relaxing at all, super loud and the service was snail slow. Will not be going back here EVER. The food was not worth the experience.
Excellent experience. Food was great.. We order crab cake  sliders  the farmer flatbread  spinach papparadelle  all very good! Can't wait to go back!
Old school Vegas!!  Great happy hour pricing!!  Fun place to go with friends!!

This is by far my favorite place to eat in Vegas, I love the food, the atmosphere, the staff and the drinks. This is one place you can't go wrong. I feel like I've had everything off the menu from the Mac and cheese to the steak. Some of my favorites are the Mediterranean flat bread, seared salmon, mashed potatoes, flat iron steak, truffle fries, basically everything is amazing! The blinker is my go to drink-it's has blantons whiskey, grapefruit and raspberry flavor, shaken and served up! So good!

Currently in my top 5 places to drink in the world!  First rate cocktail menu, second to none.  Excellent bar staff that knows what they're doing.  As I recall...and its not always easy to remember the details after nights like this...I enjoyed 3 classic drinks from their menu:  all gin based, all historical.  I talked with the bartender about what I liked about each and what else I'm drawn to in cocktails, and then asked him to take that info and create me something new.  It was the perfect drink...and unfortunately I have no recollection of what it was!  Job well done!  We also enjoyed some nibbles...a very nice flatbread...but thats all I remember.  Also, one bartender was hot enough to warrant sneaking a photo...so there's that.
Love this place.... Great energy, tasty food, love goes into every cocktail and it's worth the wait. The staff is always on point and happy to give amazing service.

Definitely a local gem and an all time fav of me and my SO. If planning to go during happy hour (seriously the best happy hour in Vegas and the best deal if planning to dine here, IMO), be sure to make a reservation! This place gets busy and parking can be a bit hard to come by when its busy, so try to car pool or take a cab. 

The outside makes it look a bit shady, but I love the dark, moody decor and lighting inside. Such a big part of a great dining experience to me. All the servers we've had have always been super nice and extremely helpful with any questions and offering up suggestions. 

We always get a few different cocktails (even though they aren't included in the happy hour specials). We like our drinks on the sweeter side, so some of our favorites are the Zombie, Harvey Wallbanger, Painkiller, and Mark Pickford. On occasion, when we're feeling adventurous, we'll go for the Bartender's Choice. 

For food, the Wedge Salad is always our favorite way to start. It never disappoints. And my SO always goes for the NY strip and I get the filet, topped with onions and mushrooms. For sides, the garlic mash is always solid and the sweet potato tots are good too. The steaks have always been cooked perfectly to our liking and are tender and flavorful. They offer lots of add-on options for the steaks as well.

The only negative is that it is a bit pricey when not dining during happy hour. I spent significantly more dining here when it wasn't happy hour, than I did dining at Vinter Grill, which is a more upscale restaurant.

Delicious food, great drink selection. Restaurant was nice, a little too dark but seemed to lighten up at one point. Filet mignon topped with Castello Bleu cheese was off the charts, and at 50% off it can't be beat. Had Ward Eight and Brown Derby, both very tasty. Will return without question. Other selections were spicy mussels, and wedge salad. Both delicious.

So my wife and I went with two other couples to herbs and Rye tonight. We went specifically for the happy hour. The service was bad but the food was decent. All was bearable until when the check came. We were charged tax and "automatic" gratuity based on the full price of what we ordered! Not the happy hour price! Based on what the bill should have been, we paid 30% gratuity for crappy service! This place has figured out how to advertise one thing then charging you more then the normal price! We know we weren't the only ones noticing this. Everyone had their phones out adding up their bills. The manager went to four other tables besides our trying to explain how the happy hour price isn't a deal. This is our last time at Herbs and Rye. We will spend our hard earned money at an honest place.

um, best happy hour ever! half off of selected steaks, etc. amazing selection. And don't get me started on their classic cocktail menu, which by the way is chronologically organized according to eras of cocktails. The atmosphere is awesome too, beautiful, dark and sultry!

Herbs and Rye is a fitting name for this modernized Speak-Easy cum Steakhouse cum Spaghetti Shop.

I LOVE this place and, though they may not be as "proprietary" as Downtown Cocktail Lounge or as "niche" as Frankie's Tiki, Herbs and Rye defeats others because, not only do they have Food and Classic Cocktails, they do both exceptionally.

A close friend and I have been frequenting them since last year and, each time we go, we're satisfied with the experience.

First, because it's not the thing you expect from a cocktail room, let's talk food.

My favorite thing on the menu is the Bistecca Flatbread.  I like the steaks (And, at either Happy Hour they are a steal at half-price!) and several of the pasta and Italian dishes, but the Flatbreads are the gold here.  The Bistecca is a well-balanced combo of crisp, fired, cracker-like flatbread topped with a perfect balance of cheese and steak, all topped with a mound of peppery, salty Arugula.  This is great accompaniment to any cocktail.

Also, I found the Pasta Carbonara (They don't call it this, but peas, bacon/ham and cream on pasta is Carbonara.) to be excellent - I've ordered it twice.  I will say it is incredibly rich, so be prepared for it.  Also, don't let it sit too long because it loses its pop if it cools too much.

Now, the coctails are definitely "where it's at" at Herbs and Rye.

After my first evening finding this place - desperate for a real cocktail, not beer, wine, or Frat Party Specials - my friend and I sampled about 10 of the cocktails between us.  With the exception of ones we just didn't like from preference, all were great!  Here's my deal, if you can make me a Blood & Sand that is coherent, I'm pretty satisfied.  If the Sazerac tastes good, I'm home.  Both met my test.  For something easily approachable, try the Aviation.  For something with a punch, the Corpse Reviver #2 will do the trick.

The one thing I would like to see is more consistency in the service.  The staff is all very friendly and helpful and knowledgeable, but the one time I've held a party there, they seemed a bit "run around".  Also, I rarely see more than one bartender, which is not enough for busier hours, especially during a happy hour.

A note about the Happy Hour, it's one of the few in town to offer items from all parts of the menu - with the exception of the Classic Cocktails - and one of the only ones that runs until 8pm, and then picks-up again at Midnight.  You can start and end you evening here easily.

Bottom Line:  If you want good food, atmosphere and OUTSTANDING cocktails, go to Herbs & Rye.

This was my 4th visit to Herbs and Rye. We tend to come here before going to the Smith Center so we are usually on a bit of a time schedule. We arrived at 5 pm and we're promptly seated. Unfortunately, it took us asking and approximately 15 minutes for our drink order to be placed. By 530 we still did not have drinks and had to ask to go ahead and place our food order.  Our food was fantastic as always once we got it. Normally we have had great service but this time it was lacking. I will continue to come here because we love the food and happy hour pricing, however we were disappointed in the service on this visit.

This was a fun experience. The food was pretty awesome. The late night happy hour is a great deal for my carnivore husband. Not so much for his herbivore wife. But still a great time. The server was good, not great. We got told it would be a 25 minute wait, but it was definitely less time than that, however a group that came in after us got seated before us. So they lose a star for that.

The environment is very nice, in an old fashioned kind of way. It was pretty wild for a Tuesday night which I thought was odd.

The three ladies had a whiskey and ginger ale, the bartender was very friendly and I enjoyed his helpfulness. He was quick, friendly, checked up on us while we waited for our table and overall gave great customer service. Later in the evening I ordered an aviation. If you haven't had one before try it, it takes a bit to get used to but it was delicious none the less. Will definitely be back again!

This place never disappoints! Great food, price, and atmosphere! The only downfall is the long wait to be seated. I made reservations at 7 PM, didn't get seated until 7:20 PM - not a big deal but can see how people may get frustrated especially if you're hungry. Definitely will come back again!

Awesome!  Steaks, drinks, ambiance,  service and let's not forget the mixologists G, Eddie and Little Johnnie. Thanks for a memorable night 7/6/17!  My wife and I were visiting Vegas from Miami celebrating our wedding anniversary.   By far the best dinner, drinks and service we had in Vegas.  Our last dinner was at Herbs & Rye.  We didn't want to leave. Lol.  You must sit at the bar and watch these guys tear it up making your favorite cocktail.   Btw, the patrons are also a Blast!.  Props to Leslie Chow (The Hangover) and his female friend,  Shaken but not stirred. Need to see the ice crystals...bro...LMAO! To the blond lady sitting next to my my wife, THANKS!  We'll cherish the memories for a long time.

Two stars means "I've experienced better". And in this case, I have experienced FAR better than this place. Came with a group of about 15. Did not get bread until the food was served. The server came only to take the orders. No explanation or recommendation of ANY kind. The non-Happy-Hour prices are far above than regular prices at other steakhouses. That might be somewhat palatable if there were comparable stellar service to go with. The whole dining experience is not just about the food. It takes into account the experience from the moment you step inside to the moment you step out of the restaurant. This place sorely lacked in making this a positively-memorable experience. It did succeed in leaving us with a bad taste in the mouth (metaphorically speaking). Perhaps they are not too enthusiastic about having large groups come and dine. We knew ahead of time that they would not make separate checks. But trying to figure out everyone's share was like deciphering a code. The bills lists the regular price, the Happy hour price and a total of what we "saved" because of Happy hour.   The 20% automatic gratuity was a real killer. The service did not deserve any kind of gratuity. Upon discussing with one of the employees, his comment was "this is company policy, we just work here". REALLY!!! Perhaps someone should explain to him what "service" in customer service means!! He stated the gratuity policy is in the menu. I guess it must be in some fine print because it did not catch my eye when I was looking over the menu for ordering. 

BOTTOM LINE: T-Bone at Redrock, Fleming's, Del Friscos, Echo and Rig, Alder and Birch have far better service and food for less than H&R's regular prices. I am not planning on coming there any time soon!
Great cocktails, perfectly cooked steaks and thoughtful service. What else can be expected?

I've been here several times, and my experience has been mixed.  The atmosphere is great, the service dependable, and the drinks are really good.  However, the food is very hit or miss.  I've had times where the steak is delicious and other times where its made me throw up, same thing with the mac and cheese.  

Their drink menu is a big plus, but while they are priced around standard 8-9 dollars per cocktail, they are on the smaller side.  

Wish I could like this, but probably won't be back here for awhile considering I threw up my last few meals at H&R.

I have to say my husband I are total food and drink snobs. Read awesome reviews on this spot but still weren't sure if we were gonna try it because it was a little ways off the strip. However, after deciding to go we have discovered one of THE best spots for unique cocktails on earth! I can not explain how blown away we both were. If you love vintage cocktails, cocktails from the past, or just a truly fine cocktail this place is for you. You will not be disappointed! Staff was super friendly as well!!!

Had my birthday dinner there - great ambience, so many cocktails, it was fun trying to select one - and I loved the explanations and list by time when they were created.

We took advantage of the dinner happy hour - very yummy!

Okay so it's been a long azz time since I wrote a review.  This place made such an impression on me that I just had to get back on here and share.  Damn it's been over a year!

This place has that old school speakeasy vibe that I've been looking for (don't let the outside of this joint fool you)..... 

-dark lighting to set the mysterious and chill vibe right. CHECK

-simple, classic styled furniture and decor as if you walked right back into the past.  CHECK

-leather booth seating.  CHECK

-small, quaint, and not a manufactured corporate chain.  CHECK

-friendly service that knows their menu inside and out.  CHECK

-damn simply,  a classic, cocktail lounge with character!

There's two sides to this joint, the restaurant side and the bar side.  Pick the side based on your purpose for being there.  Duh, I was here to drink....so straight to the bar I went.
