The bar is the perfect place to chat it up with the bartender and ask questions about the drink menu if it's your first time here.  Mike (our bartender for the night) was very friendly and explained the menu very well.  School was in session.  Great service overall.

I cannot speak for the food since I came here purposely to drink and chill.  But from what I saw and smelled everything looked great.  Some random girl next to me ordered the donuts.  They looked so damn good I was gonna chat her up and see if she was willing to share!  She was a cutie, but it was the donuts I really wanted.  Hahaha.

Anyway, back to the real reason for this review....the DRINKS!  I cannot explain well enough how awesome these drinks were.  These drinks are handcrafted, classic drinks representing different eras of American drinking.  

Wait, did I tell you they were handcrafted?  Yes, handcrafted!  Hold up.....let me change that....these weren't just any drinks...these were cocktails.  And the cocktails weren't just poured....these were handcrafted.   Dammit......these were Handcrafted Cocktails!  No pre-made mixers or store bought juices used at all.  Cocktails shaken by hand over one shoulder.  Fresh cut fruits for the juice or zest only.  And a little bit of fire for the Blood and Sand cocktail.  Watch out now!  Very entertaining to watch these bartenders make your drink.

I listed below the eras the different cocktail menu items represented:

Gothic Age of American Drinking (?-1865)

Golden Age of American Drinking (1865-1900)

Old School Age of American Bartending (1900-1919)
.
Prohibition(1920-1933)

Years of Reform (1934-1948)

Dark Age of American Drinking(1949-1989)

The Revival of the American Drinking(1990-Present)

Side Story:
I came here on a recommendation a couple of bartenders (Kevyn and Jonas) from the Social House (yes I was drinking there earlier that day too) made to me when I had asked if they knew of any place in Vegas that was a chill, low key place that was unique.  They had asked in return if I was looking for something on the Strip or off the Strip.  I mentioned that I've done the stereotypical Vegas scene plenty of times already.  They told me specifically to check out Herbs and Rye.  And I'm glad I did!

My buddy and I tried a few drinks that were recommended to us by the bartenders from Social House:  Aviation, Blood and Sand, and Vieux Carre.  

When my buddy asked what was another good cocktail from the menu, Mike our bartender of course replied "everything", and then continued to handcraft a cocktail called Corpse Reviver No. 2 for him.

Man, they were all good!  Next time, I'd probably start with the Vieux Carre for the full, bold taste and end with the Corpse Reviver No. 2 which is more sweet and refreshing.  The Aviation and the Blood and Sand were somewhere in between.    I highly recommend all these cocktails.


SIde Notes:

-We came here for late night happy hour 12AM-3AM and only spent $9 a cocktail.  There's no way on the Strip we would've gotten strong quality handcrafted cocktails like these for $9 each!   Tell me if you do.

-It was Late Friday Night/Early Saturday Morning when we rolled in and they were spinning old school Hip Hop!

-It wasn't packed in here at this time and the clientele seemed more like locals then tourists. 


Okay yeah I get it, people come out to Vegas from all over to party up on the Strip....  dress up all fancy, throw cash around like you're dirt rich, drink expensive drinks, etc.  After awhile isn't always the same?  If you wanna check out something different check out Herbs and Rye.  At the very least start your partying here for the earlier happy hour...then head out to the Strip.  If you're already partying on the Strip, you'd probably wouldn't physically be able to make out here for the late happy hour (yeah I know you party hard).  In case you do, it's the perfect place to unwind and chill for a couple more cocktails before going to bed. 

So what if  I left this place about 3:30AM and feeling really good and ready to continue partying....don't judge me!  

Definitely coming back when I'm in town

My bf told me about this place awhile back ago. We ended up going here for his birthday (last week) and we had an amazing time! The ambiance, food, drinks, and service was amazing!!! He got a steak with a side of truffle mac and cheese and garlic mashed potatoes (with a blood and sand coctktail) and I got the angel hair pasta (with Vieux Carr'e cocktail). EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS. He and I shared everything and we just about died with how delicious, flavorful, and well cooked everything was. The truffle mac and cheese is to die for. If I had to have a last meal, I'd definitely come here..and drink all their alcohol because the cocktails we had were so well made as well. Our server Mike had only been there for 3 weeks, but he was exceptional. Very nice and welcoming and he explained everything to us. He was funny as well. This place is worth the money. We will definitely come back again, happy hour or not. Loved it!

New favorite steakhouse in Vegas. Slightly off the strip, worth the trip! Had the linguine and clams, and can't even believe the Bruschetta flat bread. So delicious, romantic atmosphere, prohibition style (very full) bar, get there early for half priced steak from 5-8 pm! Cooked to perfection with amazing service to top it off! Thanks for a great experience!

Would have given 0/5 stars if I could. 
I work in the hospitality industry and understand the importance of my customer/clients and have previously referred family and friend to Herbs and Rye but ad the WORST customer service experience there recently!  Waitress(and hostess) were rude and self-occupied so much so that having THREE tables(and the the restaurant was virtually empty that night)was too much for the her.  She never asked us for drinks, we ordered steak and she never even asked how we wanted it cooked...perhaps her shallow little mind could read ours?!  It was ridiculous.  We walked out and called the manager/owner who was apologetic and groveling, asking us to give them another chance, took our number promising to call back but never did.  This is a manager/owner out of touch with his customers.  Prior to this experience, we have enjoyed this restaurant numerous times, but will simply take our business elsewhere where customer service is a priority.

This place was so nice! I love that they charge "off the strip" prices for crappy cocktails to encourage customers to try something new! The food was awesome, the service was awesome, the atmosphere was awesome. I could get mad about paying 11 bucks for a drink, but in all honesty it was the best cocktail I've ever had. Very creative. Go during happy hour if you want to save a little bit of money, but still want a steak.

Simply amazing! 

The food, service, ambiance, and cocktail selection is great & be sure to try the truffle mac&cheese!
Such a cool little gem! Great ambiance, great food, great music and loved the happy hour specials!

Ambience = bad lighting, hhahha.. so true. But, don't let the dark place fool your taste palate. We didn't really have any expectation and it exceeded ours. Their happy hour is one of the best in LV. if you want a pretty good and decent steak on the lower price range, this is the place. 

Go for their drinks and steaks and you are all set.  We were glad we made a reservation as they had to turn down some people who didn't have reservation due to fully book restaurant, but maybe because we were there during a holiday weekend.

You walk in and it looks like you're in a murder mystery. Cool, dark, red velvet patterned wallpaper with dark brown and black accents, very dim lighting, and old-school black upholstered booths. 
Service: spot on. Nice, pleasant and to the point. Always accessible. 
Food: 14oz New York Strip with truffle Mac n cheese. My only "beef" withy the steak was a little too much fat and gristle. Otherwise, it was seared just about right and had perfect pepper and salt seasoning. Great taste. 

Probably the most notable part of this dining experience was that the steak was half off. That's right - half off during Happy Hour - 5-8pm. So I enjoyed a nice $36 NY cut for $18. That might've been the best $18 NY cut I've ever had. 

I enjoyed this dining experience. If the NY was a little leaner I would've given 5/5. But 4/5 is good. I'll definitely return to try the other Meat Methods

Absolutely as good as it gets!! 
If you are reading this, do yourself a favor and make a reservation right now online for Herbs & Rye happy hour (Mon-Sat, 5-8pm & 12-2am). You won't regret it!

Food: We ordered the clams appetizer which was on HH - it was amazing! The claims are served in a lemon, butter, garlic sauce with makes them so tasty & THEN... you have to sop up the clam broth with the bread. Oh.Em.Geeee! Then, we each ordered a steak which was also half off on HH. The steaks were excellent, but it was the truffle mac & cheese & the jalapeno creamed corn that really stole the show! 

Service: Top notch! 2 gentleman available to bring drinks, clear plates, help with anything that we needed, but were not intrusive at all. 

I can't wait to go back!!

Normally a great place. We have been several times and lately the service has been fair to poor.  We took a friend there on Thursday night at 9pm. The dinner hour rush was over and there was only 4 tables that had people. So it was slow. We waited 75 mins before we received our food. We had to call the waiter over 3 times to get water to our table and final after 45 mins if waiting I ask if our food was coming. We were told that it was coming right out. I called the waiter again and then he said that the order did not make the kitchen since their ticket machine in the back was not working. However other people that arrived after us did receive their food on time and faster than us.  We final received our meal and the dishes came out separate.  My pork chop was not hot and I just are it as everyone else had received their food and we were ready to leave.  The waiter asked if we needed anything else and said he was sorry about the wait. I was pleased that he apologized but said that he would have to ask the manager if they could discount the meal since we waited so long. When the bill came they took off 2 drink for a table of 3 and did not discount the food????  Thanks for the $8 discount on a $80 ticket. Could do more...especially for locals that brings u business.  

I will have to consider going back again.  Sad because it is a cool place to go that true Vegas
Happy hour (HH) menu is VERY limited! Music is loud and unfitting with the speakeasy vibe. Streak and appetizers were good, cocktails were surprisingly lacking. Service is very slow.

When you pull up to the place, and step into the restaurant, you question if the great reviews were misleading.  However, after you sit down, order a cocktail, and start digging into your meal - BAM!  This place is really good.

We had a big table and ordered a variety of plates including several steaks - we ate family style.  It was nice to be able to try a variety of the dishes.

The cocktails of course were very good.  Lots of interesting choices.  Our waitress was also very good - friendly, cute, and not afraid to offer suggestions.

They have a bar there too that looked like a cool place to hang out, but we didn't end up doing that this time - but we'll make a point if it next time.

One more thing - it's an excellent value.  I'll definitely be back.
Excellent stakes make the price worth it.  Good service with the only negative is limited parking.

We went back for dinner to give the restaurant another chance.  I don't eat beef or pork so I had lobster over garlic mashed potatoes which was delicious and my husband had the double cut pork chop which he said was great.  I had the Thai wings again and they were very good.  The Pina Colada I had was one of the best I have had. They do make great drinks! 

We went on a Wednesday night and it was packed but I did notice people being seated right away.  Our service was very good.

It was a lot better experience this time around and we would go back.  The food is definitely good!

Herbs and rye is one of vegas' best gems. I usually stop by during the week since i know weekends tend to get a little crazy and you might have to wait awhile to get a seat. The parking lot is also quite small so finding a space might take a minute. But it's worth it to have a night at this spot. 

Once your inside you'll notice the dim lighting & the speak easy ambiance. The music isn't loud which sets the tone for conversation to take place. Sitting at the bar is usually my go to since the bartenders are so welcoming and engaging. Mark has been my bartender several times and is one of my favorite reasons to sit in his area. 

I've had at least 5 different cocktails there and was never disappointed. Everything they do is handcrafted and the prices are actually moderately priced. Usually from $10-15 which is actually a really low price point when you consider the mess they serve on the strip. 

It's a great place to have a chill night with good friends and excellent drinks. Overall I give this place 5 stars for service and quality

I can't add more than the positive reviews already say below. Food was fantastic and reasonably priced. Filet was cooked perfectly and didn't need sauces. The New York strip was also excellent. Truffle Mac was very truffly. Broccoli and cheese was amazing. My Pimms Cup was also one of the best cocktails I've ever had. I'll have to think hard to figure out what was better.

I wish I wasn't on such a short trip and an I frequent visitor, but it beats the Strip restaurants hands down in my book.
Simply. Fantastic. The food is great & cocktails are amazing. We have been coming here for over 5 years. It is our go to when friends and family visit.

I hadn't heard of this place and the facade upon arriving looked unimpressive.  But that all changed as we entered the place.  The ambience was uncontrived and interesting.  It was bustling with locals. The staff was all very friendly and accomodating. But most importantly, the food, especially the rib eye steak was excellent.  I recommend the steamed asparagus that came as my siding.  Will try to go back once more, before I leave. Definitely one of the better steaks I've had.
Love their Primm's cocktail. Food was really good. Had their filet and pasta. Both very good. Desserts were really good.  Try their donuts

Great meal the mussles were a perfect start.
My filet was delicious and melted like butter
Bread pudding with fresh apples made me tear up.
Nice old feeling bar worth it especially for happy hour...happy hour food is 50 percent to offer their includes steaks 
Nice haunt for us locals.

What an exceptional experience!  Searching for an off the strip steak house and found this place. Looks can be deceiving from the outside and make you think twice. But once you walk inside you feel you stepped into a 1920s speakeasy. The bar tenders are true mixologist who know how to make all the classics.  Order the steak just like you want it and is delivered perfect.  I tend to order my steak under done so it comes our correct, but not here. Exactly the way you ordered is how it is prepared. Next time in Vegas I'm bringing my customers! Great specials during happy hour from 5 to 8.

first time coming in here for happy hour. i tried their prohibition cocktail blood and sand its a mix of scotch, heering, dry vermouth, lemon and OJ. Its absolutely delicious i had to have another round for $9 its absolutely worth it! We took a few shots of chocolate cake, it's ok for $9 a shot. i dont think it'll be ordering it again. Our bartender Bryan was ok. It was an experience because of the cocktails and the company that i was with. i wish their service was as great as their drinks.

Herbs & Rye is hands down mine & my boyfriends favorite restaurant in all of Vegas.  The steaks are off the charts... oh & the brussel sprouts....yum yum...  But what we love the most is how we are always treated.  Everyone greets us with big smiles, hugs & calls us by name.  We always sit in the bar area because we like the atmosphere in there.  Christian, Ronnie, Emily are the bomb!!!  Thanks for making my birthday awesome.

Wish there were a 4.5, because I almost fee it's unfair not to give them a 5 star.  The food was delicious!  We had sliders (amazing!), Pork and figs (trust me on this one, it's delicious!), but my favorite by far is the Kitchen Sink (sort of like a seafood stew)... just the right level of spice.... it was awesome! I would go back just for that in a heartbeat.  The risotto was ok, but definitely not their best dish. The atmosphere was way too loud and crowded for me and parking is atrocious. However, must say the service was awesome! If you don't mind fighting for a parking spot and crowed loud places, you'll love it here. For me, the great service and delicious food make it totally worth-while!

A famous bartender named Jeff Bell told me to eat here while in town. He's much better looking than me
So I did. 

The ribeye was the best piece of animal I've ever put in my mouth. Jalapeño cream corn was epic. The meatballs made me want to slap my mom for making bad meatballs. 

I loved the food and atmosphere so much but nothing compared to the attentive and professional staff. 

Ronnie our server loves the band Rush. I invited him home to meet my sister. Our bartender Matt was professional and funny and had a beard that would make ZZ Top jealous. Joe was funny and made a great drink but his fake Boston accent was a little off putting, but nothing to get mad about. 

I loved this place so much I decided to move to Las Vegas and move in with the girl who said hi to me in the parking lot. 

Thank you Herbs & Rye for helping me find food and love!

Great happy hour deal especially for the late night 12-3am one because of the chill music and the video-accompanied mixes by the DJ. Got the Kansas bone-in 12oz steak with truffled mac and cheese for $14.50. It was decently cooked (medium rare) but I don't think I would have been happy paying the full price for it.

I had been a "regular" of this restaurant going for happy hours and even dinners. My experience with them this past weekend will ensure I NEVER go back. I had made reservations a month in advance for (8) people at 6:30. The entire party arrived on time and wouldn't be seated until "everyone was there".... We waited in the bar for our table while struggling to get attention for a cocktail due to their very popular happy hour. 

7pm passed, 7:15 passed...still not seated. Almost an hour after our reservation time we were finally seated. We ordered appetizers right away which came out COLD about 45 minutes later. Our meals didn't come until close to 9:15pm, which were equally cold and disappointing. When the bill came (way after 10pm), the restaurant did the right thing by paying for appetizers and rounds of drinks but they also added 20% gratuity, which was not warranted. 

This was a customer dinner with my boss and huge customer. I was embarrassed and reamed by my boss for the evening. There were so many other places to go, and should have chosen: 
Huge disappointment. Won't be back. Lost a great customer and a huge previous advocate.

The food was great & social experience was amazing. Unfortunately, the removal of the National Children's Cancer Society candy machine was disappointing. 
It was nice to have a gumball, chocolate or Skittles to snack on after our meal........owner must be more concerned about profits than customer satisfaction!

I would have given them 3 stars because service was very good and atmosphere was nice. Meatballs were great. Fig and pork dinner was good and pasta was good. Drinks tasted like kool-aid. 

But I dropped it to one star because the seafood dish was so bad. The kitchen sink seafood medley smelled and tasted bad .... And the person who ate it got food poisoning.

Unfortunately not liking the attitude of the bartender (guy with the beard) not just with us but the group next to us. Don't know if that's acceptable behavior here but it was enough for us to pass on the second drink and dinner. Got raving reviews from a friend so we decided to try it. Not coming back and they probably don't care!!!

Definitely an awesome place to get a great steak at a fair price. The Filet Mignon just melts in your mouth. The drinks are awesome as well go see Mark the bartender, he provides great recommendations and is knowledgeable about the drinks.
This place is great! I had an incredible Filet Mignon and a kickass Moscow Mule. Bar staff were all incredibly friendly and personable. Great atmosphere.

Great place for Happy Hour!  They have a huge list of craft cocktails from decades past, and, great old Vegas decor.  The Moscow Mule was a treat, as was a cocktail with absinthe and lemon (don't recall the name).  

We would have easily drank a third round, but, had to practically beg our waiter to come back to even get us our second round.  Plus, both rounds took at least 20 minutes after ordering to receive.

Wasn't too keen on the food, unfortunately.  I really wanted to be wowed, but, all of us agreed that the food was just OK.  

The pasta, pork chops and 2 different steak cuts were well priced and of decent quality, just, nothing any of us would order again.  The truffle mac and cheese was dry and lacking flavor.  And the brussels sprouts tasted like they just threw cheese and bacon on them, but it just didn't "mesh" well.  Too bad, because I read other Yelpers swearing how yummy both are.

Come for a round of drinks and the cool atmosphere!  Then, head out for dinner...

First impression: ambiance was lovely. Cocktails: Jack Rose (recommended by server) was way too strong. Got a Moscow mule instead and it was good. Food: my flat iron steak was overlooked but still very tasty. My boyfriends ribeye was under seasoned. Garlic mashed potatoes were very dry and didn't taste like garlic. Also, onion soup was not that great. Very little cheese, very little flavor. Overall I will give it another chance but we were very disappointed after hearing so many great things.
Love this place. Always good times and laughs! They're soon opening a spot next to my job and I could not been happier. It'll be the perfect place at .0001 miles to grab a cocktail after work!

This restaurant is phenomenal. This is the place that my husband proposed to me. We celebrated our college graduations and any other special occasions. What keeps us coming back is the food, drinks, atmosphere, and service. This is an establishment that prides itself in preparing food and drink the right way, not the fast way. While you sit, you can see the bartenders hand-crushing ice and freshly squeezing orange juice for cocktails. I highly recommend this restaurant!

Not impressed at all. Way over priced even during Happy Hour. Service was basic when empty and non existent when busy (had to beg for the check then it was an imposition to split it). And come on now if you need a flashlight yo read the menu its too dark!!

Come for the cocktails. Probably the best in Vegas.  Don't dine here. The food is below average and the service is incredibly slow. With so many good restaurants in Vegas, come here for the great atmosphere and have a cocktail, then leave and go to one of the great hotels on the strip.

Totally surprised. Recommendation by a colleague.  The steak was flavorful and the sides were the perfect compliment.   The adult beverages were a little slow to the table but the establishment was busy.  

I would surely visit again.

Some very good friends of ours highly recommended H & R. The Happy Hour menu seemed like a really great deal. So after reading all the reviews,  we decided to invite my husbands boss and wife out to celebrate his birthday. We made a reservation for Saturday night at 7:45pm. We arrived a little early, and the very pleasant hostess showed us right to our table. 
Aly, our server was pleasant and efficient. She gave us a quick rundown of the menu offerings and her recommendations. We took a few minutes to peruse our options. Our guests each went for the pork chop options and we decided on a New York strip and hanger steak, all 4 part of the 1/2 price Happy Hour menu. Each entree includes one side, so we collectively ordered 2 truffle mac and cheese and 2 "sprouts and swine" (Brussels sprouts and bacon) . We also ordered the bruschetta flatbread as an appetizer. 
The food came out pretty quick, and every item was delicious and perfectly prepared.  The service was very good considering how busy the place was. I really enjoyed the intimate feeling of the bustling dining room, yet it never felt crowded or intrusive. The dim lighting added to the ambience, and the background music levels were just right. The freshly made donuts for dessert were a fantastic birthday surprise and the perfect ending to a delightful meal. We will definitely be returning sooner than later.

Went here on a Monday night for Happy Hour.They have a prety big bar with dark wood. The palce is dimly lit with a warm coziness to it.  The prices were decent. We had half off everything on the menu.The drinks were cheap during happy hour. We had the calamari, flatbread pizza, gnocchi with Bolognese sauce. They were all tasty. They had other things on the menu but was too full to order any more. I would have to come back here and check out  the food again. Not a bad place.

Charlie was my server for the evening and was such a delight! So informative, friendly, and made such a comfortable experience for my friend and I. Tried some amazing cocktails but my favorite was the blackthorn..yummm! Overall A+ experience and cannot wait to come back.

Showed up Thursday about 11pm. Ordered 1 well drink, two specialty drinks, and a house Cabernet for friend sitting 4 seats away. I got my well drink within 5 mins, Cab was poured, then put in front of friends seat..but on bartenders edge of counter?? (It wasn't till much later that I discovered the bartender started serving him white wine, and never gave him the red he charged me $16 for)! It took the bartender another 20 mins to even start making the specialty drinks?! I paid the $50 tab. Other friends (9 total..including me) showed up, so all moved to a table across from the bar. Then the nightmare really began. I made it very clear that my 2 sons and I were on the same tab. They ordered a couple more specialty drinks and I ordered an appetizer and Linguino n Clams (It was spaghetti noodles!) that was covered in shells, and even less clams, that were smaller than a 4 year olds fingernail. Very very bland. Most orders were placed just after midnight. I got my appetizer and Linguin(o) both about 40 mins later. No one else got their food yet. It took almost an hour before theirs started to trickle out. We kept reminding him of my sons 2 specialty drinks, but the waiter would regularly disappear for 15-25 mins! My sons ordered 2 sides of bacon mac n cheese and the waiter promised the drinks were finally being made, and that he will graciously comp them. 15 mins later the mac n cheese is served by someone else, and still no waiter, no drinks. Finally, one son had to leave as the drinks came. he took a sip and left. I paid what appeared to be a modest tab of 27 dollars. It turns out that was just the cost to the "sides" of mac n cheese! My other food was on someone else's tab! While sorting this out, another friend is given his tab without his credit card! We spend 20 mins looking for it under tables..everywhere (meanwhile waiter disappears again). WE asked the second bartender, and he said that he picked it up and held it thinking it was one of his customers! Our waiter finally reappears with my additional charges..takes friends card again and places it with billfolds in his apron pouch and promises not to lose it. He brings back my OTHER tab. You'll never guess what happens.. You did! He lost my friends card and tab AGAIN! Another 10 mins goes by before he returns with it! I then confront the bartender about $16 Cabernet that never made it to my friend, and he reruns my tab. The jury's out yet if these tabs ever show up correct on my Credit Card!  Herbs and Rye's prices are outrageous considering the dumpy location. Even Happy Hour prices are on the high side. Some of the foods and drinks were actually pretty good, but way over-priced. I've lived in Vegas for 23 years, and this was absolutely the worst customer service I've ever had..EVER!

I had heard nothing but good things about this restaurant so finally on November 30th of last year I took my daughter there for a special birthday dinner.  That's how long I have been trying to connect with management at this restaurant.  The only thing worse than the service we got from our server Ronnie was the treatment I got today from Valerie.  Admittedly, she did call me back soon after the incident but I was out of town for a family death and her call went to voicemail.  Today, after my many calls Valerie finally called me back and she insisted that we had spoken previously since she was familiar with my situation.  Yes, she was probably familiar with it because I had spoken on numerous occasions with Jessica, who was always friendly and professional.  
So yes, once they re-did our over cooked steaks the food was excellent, the service? hmmmm not so much.  
Would I be so brazen to think that maybe this manager Valerie is a family member?  How else could one be so bold to verbally assault  a customer fearing no repercussions.  To the owner: if she's not family you need to be aware that she is doing you a huge disservice 
The one star is for the great food, but staff can take away from what should have been a joyous experience.  How does a business maintain a 5 star rating?  By remembering what it took to obtain those 5 stars and do not ignore the one star customer experience. People will always remember a good experience but a bad experience will be forever etched in their mind and their word.

Update:  now I ask you given the "owners" response.  Who sounds crazy in this equation?  Who wants to eat at a restaurant whose owner responds in this fashion?  Is it any wonder his staff behaves as they do?  Look at his example.  If it wasn't so pathetic, it would be hysterically funny.

I love this place. The drinks are so tasty and the bartenders really know what they're doing. It's a great place to check out great classic cocktails. Its nice and dark and intimate inside so its a great date spot. Not to mention, happy hour is half off steaks and it really doesn't get any better than that.

I do not know if there is even a true word out there to really explain the love I have for this place. I was very fortunate in its unearthing. It is amazing. Everything about it is amazing to me. 

The cocktails are so unique and exquisite. I love their Pimms Cup, Pisco Sour, Diablo, Last Word, oh I could name some more but you should go find out for yourself. The discovery of these classic cocktails is such a marvelous occurrence for your taste-buds. 

The food is wonderful. The BEST and I will keep saying this until some other place tries to beat them out on it, but seriously the BEST Truffle Mac & Cheese I have ever had. It is one of my favorite dishes. I also enjoy their cobb salad and filet. I have had their flatbreads too. So good. 

The bartenders are super talented, especially the owner Nectaly when he gets behind the bar on occasions. Nectaly, Brian, and Michael are the three that really stand out whenever I go. They are friendly, entertaining, and know how to make their drinks. 

I have never been bored just sitting there. The atmosphere is dark and mysterious. It makes me feel relaxed and mysterious myself. The music is usually good. The DJ on Saturday nights can be a hit or miss for me, but they do not ruin my mojo when I am there. 

Writing this is making me miss it. I think I shall have to get some Mac & Cheese after all my Halloween festivities tonight. 

Side note: They close at 2am M-Th, 3am F & S, and completely closed on Sundays. 

Thank you everyone at Herbs & Rye for being awesome.

Impressive in every way.  
The brick walls and dim lights really set a relaxed and old school mood. The bar is true to the mixology style and have a great selection of 'original' drink recipes. 
Non gaming (which is so refreshing) and plays upbeat jazz type music.
Joe and Elrey were fantastic and knowledgeable behind the bar. I loved the attention to detail.
We had the Penne Pasta, Flat iron Steak and mashed potatoes all of which I would recommend. 
Of the many cocktails I tried my 2 favorites were the Jack Rose and the Blood and Sand. 
My first time tasting a shot of Fernet after dinner and the only way to describe it is WOW!
Best drinks, dinner and dining experience I've had in a long time. It's a must try!!

Ambience is nice, pretty dark inside and has an old school feel to it. I was carded immediately to make sure I was over 21.  I came here for happy hour, in which I lrearned that only certain items on the menu are half price. 2 appetizers, the steaks, well drinks $5, and select beers (blue moon or a red amber) $3. Cocktails are regular price. I sat there for a while waiting for the rest of the party to get there, in the meantime I had a beer and water. After we ordered it took forever for our bread to come out, albeit it was very good, but why couldn't the server brought it out earlier? 
I ordered the ribeye and so did the rest of the group, we compared steaks as we all had pretty fatty and grisly steaks and couldn't tell what we were cutting into as it was so dark. For the price they were charging, I expected a better quality meat. However, the steaks were cooked properly. 

Service was fantastic, there was no smoking, and no casino noise. However, I am going to try the filet mignon next $17 for happy hour).

Wow, it's pretty sad when the owner of this restaurant has to make himself look like even more of a jack ass by bashing me after I let everyone know how horribly he treated myself and my 2 friends. He had to comment on my Yelp review to make me out to be the bad guy and say I was "drunk". That is pretty pathetic. I wasn't impressed with the food nor his lousy attitude when I came there this past weekend. I'm glad that people can now see how you are a complete immature jack ass after your response to my complaint. A good business owner would have responded back with an " I'm sorry about your unsatisfactory meal and service, what can we do to make this up to a valued customer?" However you took the low road and made YOURSELF look bad!
Christian the manager is a asshole. Took us 30 minutes to get a drink and the place was not crowded at all. They need to be taught about hospitality
Went for happy hour. Had a great pisco sour and clams were great. Very disappointed with sausage pizza. Tasted like cardboard and had no flavor

Pushy on the drinks, but after midnight you can't find a better place in town for steaks. 

I've had every whiskey drink under the sun there and have never been disappointed. 

The porterhouse is great and the truffle fries are seasoned to perfection.

This was my first time to Vegas and we went here on a whim, off the recommendation of a bartender downtown. We wanted to go somewhere local and off the strip. The food here was amazing, the drinks too. I can't say enough about how awesome this place was and would definitely recommend it anyone visiting Vegas! 

Oh and you can't go wrong with the Pork Chop or Chicken Alfredo...delicious!!!

Worst happy hour ever (editing review for people to understand how this happened). Yes, the menu says groups are charged an auto gratuity (as is standard in the industry) but they INTENTIONALLY HID the auto gratuity (by literally SAYING they wouldn't charge us as a group - see below). Our server was AMAZING and deserves the tip (Deborah) but the anger comes from being INTENTIONALLY MISLEAD and TOLD we were being charged as individuals. 

We had a group of 6 because someone showed up an hour after we had started. LITERALLY we had purchased drinks and our food and we're hanging out when a friend decided to join us. Our server said since we were 5 that we were originally rung up as individuals. However, management changed us to a "group" right before they rung us up and didn't even tell us. It took someone in our party who was actually critiquing her check to see it. If we were going to get the auto gratuity we wouldn't have even asked to split checks in the first place - what a waste and hassle if you're not being charged individually. Again, they rang us up as a "group" when they said they wouldn't!  That's why 1 star. 

Specifically - we had people in the group who paid 22% to 33%. Seriously 33% percent. 

There are too many restaurants in Vegas, with too many deals, to deal with this nonsense. As a local, I will never come here again

A MUST visit if you're a fan of classic cocktails. Went in on a Tuesday night and the bar area was jumping. Bartenders were super friendly, even though they were busy creating magic. Nectaly (the owner) came over to say hi before getting behind the stick. Had a few bites (the Carpaccio really stood out) and a few drinks. Check was quite reasonable (might have been Happy Hour).

I love places like this. Its a really cool prohibition style atmosphere inside. We went for happy hour and got steaks and a side for half off. There is a decent beer selection and the highlight is old fashioned cocktails. I got the Kansas City cut with truffle mac and cheese-it was a great accompaniment. The house red ale is surprisingly crisp and flavorful, and the Brown Derby was a really great shaken drink. My wife got a really good off-menu jalapeno/gin concoction. She loved the Brussels sprouts. The Caesar salad was pretty small for the price, with three leaves of uncut romaine; but the dressing was really good. I'd love to go back there, its definitely worth driving 12 off the strip.

Came for the half-price steaks during happy hour.  I actually liked the food I got quite a lot.  My salad was fresh and plentiful, the asparagus that came with my steak was deliciously seasoned and grilled just right.  The steak was a nice size, cooked a bit more well-done than I ordered (I'd asked for M.R., got Med.), was very tasty nonetheless.

My friend didn't fare as well, as his Filet was definitely over-done, but still flavorful. He, too, enjoyed his salad quite a lot.  I had water with my meal, as their wine is too expensive, and we'd had a couple elsewhere, anyway.

My three-star verdict is based on three things: four-star food, almost-four-star service, and two-star honesty.  The half-price steaks are a big gimmick in the sense that no one in their right mind would pay $42 for the NY Strip I had and be happy about it, and certainly not $59 for the Filet my friend had.  At half-price, they were just about right.  So the take-away is that you should NOT order steak unless it's happy-hour, because you will feel you've been SCREWED.  And by the way, the argument that everybody charges stupid prices for steaks in Vegas doesn't fly, because it's STILL stupid :)

The best cocktails I have had in a while!  We came for happy hour, but didn't realize until seeing the menu that the HH special mostly applies to steaks and not much else on the menu.  No problem, we had some delicious calamari and some sweet potato tots with melted marshmallow and bacon bits.  Oh, yeah.
The Hemmingway Cocktail was perfection and service was friendly.  I will definitely be back.
NY Strip w Herbs and Rye spice rub was very good. Classic cocktails were enjoyable and bartenders and staff were very polite. Good place and would like to come back next time I'm in Vegas.
Best speakeasy in town. Loved it. Went on a recommendation from Family. Well worth he drive. Service was great. Options were plentiful. Food was savory. Must do if you have one place to go in Vegas.

How have I not written a review for Herbs & Rye sooner?! 
I've been here roughly around 35 times in the last few years. Great quality steaks, fun and romantic atmosphere (depending on what you're going for), and an extensive cocktail menu.  Also a huge local spot so it's very likely you'll run into someone, especially if you work in the industry.

Oh, and 50% off the steaks during Happy Hour (5-8 pm and midnight- closing) what's not to love?!


I've tried the majority of their menu and my favorites are: 

Filet mignon (all the steaks are delicious. Pick whichever cut you prefer, high quality meat you'd find on the strip without ridiculous prices) 

*the chimmichuri sauce is soooo good! I also like the house rub but beware- it's very spicy.

Sweet potato tots- You just have to try these. So so good. 

Truffle Mac & Cheese- Yes. Just yes. 

Jalapeño creamed corn- I tend to get this less often, but sooo yummy. 

Truffle fries- Simple truffle fries, but they always hit the spot.

All the sides are a generous portion, and each steak comes with one included in the price. Also, the flatbreads are all great. My favorites are the Bistecca and Bruschetta. 

For drinks, I recommend the Moscow Mule and Weekend at the Waldorf!

All in all, I love this place (that's why I keep coming back). The only thing I would improve is the service can be spotty, sometimes amazing service and sometimes it's very so-so.

So it was a night of culinary adventures last Friday and I finally got time to yelp about it. It started off at Herbs and Rye, which I have driven past umpteenthousand times without even noticing. The inside is very swanky, almost a Rat-Pack feel, as if Sinatra should come out of the other room telling you to scram, you're in his seat. It's the kind of place where the booze is cold and the broads are hot. (Wow, I've been waiting FOREVER to use that line in conversation.)

The food was good. Maybe I was just looking at a bar menu, but the selection seemed to be kind of small. It seemed to be like: Appetizer, Flatbread Pizza, Big Fat Steak, the end. But I ordered the hot wings, which were satisfactorily spicy. I tried some of my friend's sweet potato tater tots, but wasn't sold on them.

But the drinks... oooh lordie. If you have more than two, be prepared to have a designated driver. I ordered a Long Beach Iced Tea, which when made right should have a subtle red/fuschia color to it. Too dark means it's a weak drink; too light means too much alcohol.

The drink came back and looked less like a cocktail and more like a serving of pink lemonade Crystal Light.

Needless to say, I only ordered one.

I'm not knocking the place. If I was invited back by friends, I'd certainly go. But for such a good first impression, it kind of fizzled out.

I really wanted to absolutely love this place but I just didn't love it as much as I wanted to. The decor is gorgeous and the dining room is much smaller than I expected but really nice. Our server was friendly and helpful. I had the linguine and some sweet potato tots. The tots were great and not too sweet. The pasta was a little too spicy and soupy for my taste (the chili flakes were dispersing in the broth). My friend and I shared the cookie for dessert. It was nice and hot and cake with ice cream; delicious. All in all, dinner was nice, liked everything but my entree. Nice place for a date night or private event.

Wow!  My sister told me to try this place and it was amazing. Great service, wonderful food and a plethora of amazing drink options. We had the bone in pork which was cooked to perfection. Our sides were the garlic mashed potatoes and Brussel sprouts. We had to ask how they were cooked so that we could try to recreate the yumminess. I didn't like my first drink and the waiter promptly suggested a new one and brought it to me. Happy hour is the way to go!  5-8 and 12-3. Get there early as we were there on a Tuesday and it filled up by 5:30.

This is my new go to place to eat, grab a drink (or 3), and enjoy the company of a great group of customers and superior wait and bar staff.

Every time I travel to Vegas, I try to work in an evening at Herbs & Rye. The menu is not complicated, yet offers a nice variety of dining choices. Quality of beef is really good. But the most fun, sitting in the bar and working through the menu of drinks. Don't be like me and work through too many of the drinks or...well...end up needing late checkout the next day!. My favorite drink by far is the Vieux Carrè.

Do yourself a favor, get away from the Strip for an evening, and share good food and drink with the locals. Oh, they have two, yep, two happy hours! Now, if that is not persuasive, then what is?

By far one of my favorite steak houses a to go while in Vegas! Open late hours, amazing food, great signature cocktails. Perfect for entertaining and it's a hole in the wall that you wouldn't expect to be so good! Best steak I have had in years! Will be coming back.

We had a great dinner. Food was delicious and service was a joy.

Take advantage of their happy hour (until 8 pm) and you get discounts on beer and cocktails as well as some of the meals on the menu.

I would recommend it to friends any time.

Awesome!  The whole place. It's just a super cool joint. Then the cocktails are amazing!  I mean every where I go I ask for a pisco sour and no one knows how to make it. But this place has it and it tastes great!  Along with many other good cocktails with a history of them which is very interesting.

The food is just as good. Meatball appetizer is very tasty. I had the pasta and it was delicious. Then of course the filet mignon at half price during happy hour. Yes!  It's crazy good price with a great taste!

i came here a couple days ago for dinner.

my party was large, 6 people. although the place was crowded, the hostess accommodated our large party very nicely. we were seated in about 15 minutes, good seats as well. 

the environment of this place is very pub like. the place is very low lit, with nice music and a very laid back ambiance. although it is a bit pricey. 

my party ordered all steaks of different cuts. we came at the time where steaks were 50% off (check the steaks with the two stars by them!). i didn't get a steak, but i tried someone's and it was great! i usually don't like eating a whole steak, which is why i opted out. i got the risotto which had chicken breast and asparagus. the risotto was very good, but different. it had a tangy taste, one that i had not tasted before in that type of dish. but overall it was very nice and i was very happy and full! we ordered desert of the tray of little fresh donuts, excellent as well, it came with glaze and caramel dipping. 

in regards to service it was excellent. our waitress deborah was very accommodating and even took our pic when she saw us struggling to do it on our own. they were very attentive as to what our table wanted, and we rarely had to wait for anything. 

highly recommend this place!

In the modern world, it is difficult to believe a restaurant cannot split checks with parties of six or more. Frankly, that is just laziness and a complete lack of concern for the customer. When addressed to the server, he responded "I'll sleep easy tonight either way."  

The mac and cheese was very good. The steaks were average. As addressed above, the experience was poor due to their seemingly anti-customer attitude. In fact, the bottom of the menu is littered with multiple disclaimers that go against the customer. It gets two stars only because the music and the ambiance are great. If they would just shift their focus to a more customer friendly one, this place would rate four stars easily. 

UPDATE: I lowered it to one star because of the condescending response below. That was exactly the attitude of the server when we politely asked about splitting the check. This place treats its customers like they are an annoyance.
Looking for a local speakeasy style bar with half off steaks during Happy Hour?  Craft cocktails, modern lounge music and excellent service.  Need I say more?

For a long time, we've considered this restaurant our secret.  Happy Hour is the BOMB!

Herbs and Rye serves super tasty drinks and delicious steaks for a low price.  It seems that the people of Vegas are catching on to the best kept secret in town.  The last few times we stopped in the place has been full!  It's great to see a local restaurant doing such a great job!

You have to stop in and see the newly remodeled bar area and have the bartenders serve you a drink. 

This place is a MUST go! :)

Happy Hour is fantastic and makes it affordable to have a superb meal. The bartenders are friendly and it's fun to sit at the bar and watch them craft delicious cocktails. The atmosphere is lively and hip but the best is that it is off the Strip, so no crazy traffic and parking to deal with. This is definitely my new go-to place.

I will not be attending this establishment again. They do not respect Veterans and service was completely disrespectful. I was accused of being drunk because I couldn't hear our server. I'm sorry I'm deaf in my left ear.

I took my family to Herbs & Rye (Las Vegas) in November based on a recommendation from our hotel. Food was good and the service was adequate.  

However I made a mistake on the tip because I didn't realize that a table of five was subject to an automatic gratuity...100% my fault. 

The big issue here is that I made numerous attempts to speak with the restaurant manager who has refused to communicate with me. 

I'm talking about $35 but it still shows a lack of customer service and respect. Think about that the next time you are trying to decide what steak house to visit while you are in Vegas.

Had a great time!
Good food 
Amazing drinks!!!! The Happy Hour is Fab! 
I will definitely be back

My most favorite spot in Vegas. Drinks, food, and service are phenomenal. The place is known for steaks but my father and I do not eat red meat so we go for the other options and the kitchen prepares them with love as well.

I was so excited to try Herbs and Rye.  I am a Las Vegas native and have never been until yesterday.  The atmosphere was wonderful that I felt I was thrown back to a Vintage Vegas era. The steaks were so tender and the steak seasoning was outstanding!  My steak was the wrong temperature, but it was so good that I wasn't going to send it back.  The thing that made this one of the worst dining experiences was the server.  He was unkind and mean at times.  It affected my entire experience. I was afraid to ask for anything that may put him in a worse mood.  He was nice at the end before he dropped the check. Being a server myself, I will learn from him and make sure I never treat a guest unkindly! If I return, I will make sure to never sit in his section.  I should have asked for a different server.  It was my first time there and wished it would have been a great memory!
Half priced steaks during happy hour from 5pm - 8pm.  Great food, good service, and a great selection of bourbon.

One of the best steaks I've had. And going during happy hour doesn't just mean 1/2 price drinks. It also includes several appetizer and dinner options. Service was great. Loved the prohibition vibe of the place. Very cool. And dessert is amazing. Try the donuts.

We really enjoyed this restaurant what a swanky cool place to have dinner.  The waitstaff and food were on point umm the tomato bisque came with a yummy grilled cheese!! What? Lol Happy hour is offered in the main dinning room as well!! Half off meat selections, sides, appetizers and a tons of drink specials this place is a must try!!

this place is the definition of a true hidden gem. service was great, joe is a great server! my boyfriend and I loved his vibe, very playful and witty. we got the ribeye and ny strip and both were pretty great. the ny strip was a bit tough but not enough for me to care too much. the truffle Mac and cheese was a bit too rich for my boyfriend, but still delicious. steak fries paired really well with the steaks. the bruschetta flatbread is a bit odd at first, but it grew on me. 

alcohol: I got the missionary's downfall, which tasted kinda strong at first, then the mint hits you and faded away with the lime. all within 2 seconds lol

ambiance: my eyesight in the dark is horrible so it took me a while to take in my surroundings. this place is very dimly lit. if you wanna take photos of your food, you need flash. the music is very laid back and overall good vibes all around.

would I go back again? definitely. would like to try other things from the menu.

Amazing specialty cocktails and to die for truffle mac and cheese.

The exterior looks really shady and creepy (especially at night), but the inside is a whole different story. It's a more intimate and cozy setting, with a blast from the 1920's Service was great, waiter was really knowledgeable about the beverages. The bartenders are amazing because they're held to such high standards from what I can tell. Would come back here for sure.

A M A Z I N G

I didnt want to go here to begin with, I thought it was gonna be some hole in the wall place I was being taken to save a couple bucks, boy, was I wrong! I have now had nearly everything on the food menu, & we havent even BEGUN discussing drinks! 
For the food, my fav appetizers have to be the littleneck clams, which are bsolutely perfect. I always want to like shellfish, but especially clams and oysters, no matter how many times I order them, I just never do....until I had these. The porton is more than enough for 2 people, and it comes w/ awesome bread. For the entrees...I have never had pork that tasted better than their Pork chops and fig meal. It is incredible, when I tasted that, it was like when you have a child, I just, didnt know I could love something so much. They serve your standard drinks of course but also, a huge array of prohibition era drinks. Seriously, if you go anywhere else in Vegas to eat a steak, you are wasting your money and making a huge mistake. Do yourself a favor and wait til Midnight, when most items on the menu at Herbs & rye are 50% off!

I decided to check out Herbs after reading the reviews.  I was not impressed.  The ambiance was well worn mediocrity somewhere between speakeasy and whorehouse.  I was particularly dissapointed in the bait and switch tactics.  The reviews make it sound like there is a great happy hour with great prices for food and beverages.  First we were presented with a menu that was virtually unreadable.  It was almost like it was done on purpose, small red letters and dim lighting.  We were told by the bartender that only the appetizers marked were half price.  In one corner of the menu the symbols were shown and it turns out only the clams and mussels were discounted. Unfortunatly they were half off an artificial price double what it should have been.  The beverage list was extensive, but again only the standard drinks ie, gin and tonic were discounted at $5 each, and as near as I could tell the exotic cocktails didn't show prices, but since you could barely read the menu, it was hard to tell.  The only discounted entrees were the steaks. At half price they were $25 to $30 which once you get away from the strip is no real bargain. As a local, my suspicions  were confirmed. A real happy hour that runs to 8pm?  Probably not. But, if its old Vegas ambiance you're after this is as good as it gets, it recalls the days of the locals taking advantage of the yokels.  And, if you are a local that likes $3 imported beer subsidiized by the out of towners this is your place.  For the rest of you, if you're happy, we're happy.

I haven't bothered to come back since my last review (ahem, which was almost exactly THREE years ago to date; that's how BAD the experience was) -- but my boyfriend requested to try this place out for his birthday, so how could I refuse? Fine, we'll go...

We made a reservation and I told the hostess it was his birthday, asking if they do anything special. She stated she would make a note for our server under the reservation -- and depending on the server, they'll either send out a round of shots or their donut dessert with a candle! 

Well, the server did wish him happy birthday before we ordered our food... and again as we left. But he didn't receive ANYTHING (which is even more annoying, because two booths down, that guy got a candle lit dessert!). Maybe I just get bad luck when I come to this place, but wow... it took everything in me to not make a scene as we left. 

Strike two, Herbs & Rye.
____________________

EDIT:
- NOT TO MENTION A VERY SARCASTIC, CONDESCENDING & UNAPOLOGETIC BUSINESS OWNER! Thank you SO much for the insincere and unnecessary "apology" comment below, and for reminding me to never bring business to your establishment again. I'll knock off an extra star just for you (who needs a STRIKE THREE?)! =)

I can't say enough good things about this place. The steaks are perfect every time, the Mac n cheese is life changing and the drinks are unique and damn near magical. It's hands down my favorite steakhouse in Vegas, thank god I live here so I can go all the time. 

Update: 

Been here at least 20 times and every time it's perfection. Still my fav!
I had dinner with my husband Rick and our friends Kathy and Ron yesterday and everything was perfect  Our dinner was fantastic

I'm writing this besides the fact this is the best craft cocktail bar in possibly the country but more because Nectaly Mendoza put his literal blood sweat and tears in this business. I love his replies. His amazing staff have given everything they have  to Las Vegas. Anything less than five stars and you're high. Anyone writing a one star review on here is either a) a cheap ass. b) a racist or c) a person who thinks the world revolves around them. I hope Mr. Mendoza has many years and many venues across America with as much cool as Herbs.

It is rediculous that we were told that we would have to wait for a reservation no-show to be seated. The hostess should be able to tell us how long of a wait there is, or that there is no availability... We have been dining at Herbs and Rye for years, and have never experienced such lack luster service.

If you want a good cocktail, look no further. Sit at the bar, talk to the bartender, they'll steer you in the right direction. The people making the drinks are smarter, friendlier, and more talented than the price tag attached to an evening spent here. I had three cocktails and an appetizer, the littleneck clams, and let me tell you, my guy Nick (I think that was his name) had the art down. He picked people up, got neighbors at the bar socializing, and made a good show of making some of the best drinks I've ever had the pleasure of drinking. Do a little googling and notice that the biggest bartenders in Vegas recommend this place for a serious cocktail; then drop in, relax, and let the joy of seriously crafted food, drink, and atmosphere  wash over you.

A happy hour that can't be beat and top notch hand crafted cocktails in the (pardon the pun) old fashioned style.  It's a speakeasy, throwback place, quaint, understated and awesome.  All the food is great and there are so many drink options, it warrants many repeat visits to taste your way around the menu for both food and drink.  They've truly done something special here.

By far, the best steakhouse I've been to in Vegas and in OC! The filet mignon was tender, full of flavor, & simply mouthwatering! My husband and I had the truffle Mac & cheese, garlic mash, whiskey shallot potatoes and the sweet potato tots with marshmallow-- holy moly, the sides are huge and they were all delicious! But our favorite was the sweet potato and marshmallow crust! It's sinful! Do yourself, your taste buds and stomach a favor and stop by! Even better was that we came during happy hour :D

My husband and I went here to celebrate my birthday. We went on a Saturday during happy hour (5-8). During their happy hour they have half off of a lot of their steaks. My husband had a ribeye and I had a filet mignon. Both the steak and the sides were wonderful. We also loved their cocktail list, which was based on eras. Great experience, we will be back!

Pros: Awesome steaks, awesome sides, awesome service, awesome drinks, Happy Hour steak specials!

Cons: Not really a con but you need to make a reservation. Parking can be a challenge.

I have been here a few times and every time has been great. The atmosphere is business casual but you can dress up or down from that without it being an issue. 

Let me get this out of the way, two of the five best steaks I have had in the last five years have come from this place. This is a place any steak fan visiting or living in Las Vegas must come visit. You get very high quality steaks, sides and drinks here. I have tasted a couple of different cuts but I say go with the Ribeye.

The drink menu is really fun, it categorizes drinks by era. You can still get a Budweiser if you want, but seriously, DON'T. The drinks are well described and crafted with the level of care you can expect from any retro speak easy.

The service has also been great every time I have gone. The last two times I went with my fiance we had Mark helping us and he is awesome.

Go here, it is worth it. One last hint, get the donuts for dessert.

Love this place!! They have a full section on the menu with classic cocktails like Manhattans and Negroni's, with little bits of information on each of the cocktail. Their Happy Hour is probably one of the best in town! The steak was awesome and so was the service. Cannot wait to go back.

Happy hour is 5pm-8pm & midnight-3am. 
Steaks are delicious--plus half off during happy hour! Awesome cocktails. Solid bartenders--they know heir stuff!

I've heard of this place a few times and ended up going with a group of 8 on a Monday evening. We were the only ones in the main dining room with maybe 6 people in the bar area. The atmosphere was pretty cool, but ruined by painfully slow service, and servers who had poor fine dining etiquette. We all ordered steak and most ordered a simple side of mac & cheese or mashed potatoes and I really started getting nervous as the time passed... A half an hour later our food came out in 3 separate groups with at least 5 minutes between each one. I ordered a medium rare flat iron steak and my food came out last. As soon as the server set down my plate I immediately cut all the way through the center and.......hockey puck....well done with not a drop of juice.... I was practically insulted... After a quiet "sorry about that", and once everyone was done with their food I received a replacement steak that was delicious and cooked to medium rare, however it did not make up for the fact that I had waited forever just to have everyone in my group ready to leave watching me eat my steak. We received 2 desserts to share between 8 people, I guess this was their way of trying to make up for a horrible night.... 

Due to the reviews I may give this place one more try if I happen to be in the area, but only during happy hour because the prices do not justify the service and experience provided. Most likely I will not be going back and I would not recommend it to anyone else...

Love the ambiance and beautiful bar at Herbs and Rye. Last night it was definetly a miss. Sat at the bar and ordered drinks while we waited for our table. My date ordered a MGD, my drink was made, served and his never arrived. The bartender was drinking shots with the men to our left and women to our right. Another party of four arrived and sat next to us. Bartender came to serve them and he asked for a beer again, never got it. Had to ask a completely different bartender and it finally arrived. A twenty five minute wait for a table turned into an hour (but it was Friday and HH). Got seated at 745 and promptly ordered our meals to score the HH steak price. Had the meatballs as appetizers and they were great!!! Slighlty spicey, but the goat cheese, melts slightly, rounds out the flavor giving it a silky smooth taste in your mouth. Ordered two medium ribeye, tasty steak but the steak hindered on medium rare rare and was more purple inside. Both steaks were undercooked. I informed the waiter and he took one steak back to cook a little longer. A steak is never the same redone and I was disappointed to go to a GREAT steakhouse and have the steak very undercooked. The Brussel sprouts were a miss as well. Extremely charred, one piece of swine and LOADS of cheese ontop. Normally I wouldn't care about the extra cheese, but I wondered if the cheese were hiding the burnt Brussels and lack of swine? Normally the brusses are fantastic!! Cut into fourths, slightly steamed and grilled to carmalize on one side (not all four and black). The swine ontop is cut to resemble thick pieces of panchetta and sprinkled all over. The one piece of swine was black, hard and not even edible. Overall dinner was a hit and miss. After the no beer, wait time, undercooked steak and burnt brussels we did not even stay for the AMAZING donuts (sigh). Being a steakhouse and price of the meal my expectations were that our food would be prepared as requested. Sending a steak back at a steakhouse is never a good thing.

If you love high quality hand-crafted cocktails by talented bartenders this is 'the' spot. The food was great too but the cocktails were another level. Had the rib-eye and bartender suggested bacon and eggs on top... listen to the bartender.

If you are visiting, get off the strip for a dinner/drinks and visit here, you won't be disappointed.

Very nice dim lit interior. My boyfriend and I came during the Happy Hour when steaks are half off. I ordered the 9 oz. Lobster tail and 9 oz. filet meal ($55 and not eligible for happy hour price) with garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus. It was fabulous except that big of a lobster tail can be pretty tough. I enjoyed the steak though, very juicy. My boyfriend ordered the New York Strip which he liked a lot. We also had a side of the truffle mac n cheese which was fantastic. I highly recommend this place especially during the happy hour. Great bang for your buck!
A busy restaurant with excellent cocktails. You'll need a reservation. Attentive service at the ready.
I don't drink so I can't comment about the drinks. But my friend said his cocktail was not up to par for the price. Food was good. Service is excellent

I will begin by saying I am bias. I will continue by saying my dining experience was fruitful, I didn't despise this place nor do I now. But the touted "three-star" Herbs & Rye has received is solely based on what happened after the restaurant. Maybe I'm just as bitter as the beer I received, not a complaint, or maybe I'm just indifferent cause I have had world class bistec in my time, not a complaint. 

I came here on a weekday, I believe it was a Thursday. To get it started, we went during Happy Hour. Happy Hour is from 5-8pm and 12am to some un-Godly hour. It includes the choice steaks, well drinks and beer and some appetizers and such. A fair deal for steaks you usually overpay for in most cases. I came here with a bunch of friends for a nice relaxing, cheaper than usual meal.

I won't complain about much, the service was great and I wasn't misled on any of the items. Usually when you go to a place, the server will try and sway you from the Happy Hour deal for their own benefit. Not here, our waiter pretty much made it seem like we were crazy to choose any of the full priced items. I ordered a Red Amber beer because it was Happy Hour and when I got it, it was a little warm. He did tell me they were changing the keg, but I assumed that it would still be cool. Not in this case, I still drank the darn thing because I have problems, but it wasn't as refreshing as I probably expected. 

Speaking on my behalf, I ordered the "Bone in Kansas City Strip," which I added a spice to the steak (it started with a Ch- kind of deal, I can't recall - but it was olive oil, garlic and thyme I want to say). You also get a free side and I splurged and got the truffle mac n' cheese. Overall  the meal was delicious and I was super full after eating. I wish that you didn't have to pay 3 bucks to put the topping on the steak, but I mean when you're paying half price for $30-40 steak it's worth it. My steak did have bone in, but it was oddly peculiar that there was bone also lining the rim of portions of my steak. A tedious process to cut around, but again, steak is steak and a man likes to work and earn his food. 

Okay, so I left and proceeded to have a horrible night. I spent more time with the toilet then I did with my girlfriend that night, our date night. My stomach did not feel good and I was miserable after. Maybe it's the mess that is my body or maybe it's the food I ate, but I didn't enjoy the feeling. I haven't ever had food poisoning and I don't think I even had it at all, but the feeling after the meal I had wasn't normal. That being said, it may be a little bit till I go back because I may have to get bowel reconstruction (a joke -__- ). I don't blame on it on the place, but I just have to say I didn't feel like that until after the food. So, I applaud the efforts of the Herbs and Rye staff and I will be back. But when my bowel is ready for another round. Otherwise, people should come here for some decently priced food and drinks!

Amazing drinks here and if you hit the happy hour, even more amazing prices on food.  Four of us shared the 60oz. ribeye and it was only $95!!!  And the meatballs...even my Italian grandmother would love them.  Wonderful experience here, would go back ANYTIME!

I can't stay away.  I long for the taste of a hand crafted bucks fizz,  thank you Emily,  I am much happier now. 

Tonight I had the carpaccio, it was perfectly chilled and accompanied by arugula.

This is my favorite bar in Vegas hands down. I go once a week. Their foods amazing as well as the drinks and service is top notch! I love bringing friends and family for their first time and they always want to go back.

Drinks are better than the food...  That being said the food is more than passable and the drinks are fantastic so I definitely recommend this place as a change of pace from the usual over-the-top strip wannabes.  Vegetarian options were available if not especially numerous.

The service was perfectly attentive and the ambiance was nice with a dark speakeasy vibe.  However, as other reviewers have mentioned, the electro lounge music playing does not suit the vibe of the decor.  Put some sweet jazz tunes on and everything would fall into place.

Herbs and rye offers the best cocktails in Las Vegas bar none. The service at the bar was excellent. I really enjoyed their selection of classic cocktails, everything from pre-prohibition, during Prohibition, to modern classics. We also had several food items including the steak tartare the mac and cheese and really enjoyed all of them.  Next time I'm getting the steak. They have a half office in steak before eight pm.

Great experience. Went for a friends birthday celebration. Christian the manager made our night very special. Great food and great drinks. Extremely satisfied and have already recommended numerous friends and coworkers to enjoy their atmosphere as well.

A place like no other in Vegas. Old style mixology and a history lesson on the origion of the drinks. Entertaining and delicious. The atmosphere is old, lounge style midwest. Sort of reminds me of what the cast of "Mad Men" would go to after wheeling and dealing. The Drinks were different, and awesome, the steaks were great and the prices were terrific at half price, during happy hour.
It was very busy, wasn't the quickest service, but the server was friendly and attentive.
Cannot wait until my next visit!

Had the most Amazing birthday there with a party of 18 people , the waiter was amazing and very charming , food was unbelivable !!! the corn was crazy good ! and the home made Donuts were the most incredible thing ever ! asked to be seated together and  we got put in the front of the bar it felt like my very own VIP room ,..... the staff was super helpful and i will be back there again , and would take everyone i know who is a foody to go there ! drinks were unreal ! happy hour , was off the hook with great food choices ! 10 /10 vibe !!!
Love it here... great ambience, great food, fantastic bartender... Go! Just Go... it's awesome!!

My wife and I had heard great things about this hidden gem. Way off the strip and hidden in an old run down strip mall. Go through the red door and you are in another world. Turn back the clock. The rat pack is whispering through the walls. Dark ambiance, cool music, classic cocktails and out of this world menu for steak lovers. Our waiter Mike was so friendly and informative. He guided us through the menus, helped us with our cocktail selections and wine selection. We had New York Strip and Filet Mignon with sides of garlic spinach and mashed potatoes. Mike was constantly on top of our dining experience and we never waited long for any assistance. Wonderful experience and we will be back and let all our friends know about this great local draw.
Mark is the man with the HoneyBush tea.   Great atmosphere.  Steaks like you wouldn't believe.  Happy hour at 12,  holla half off. Great place period.

Why couldn't I have a great experience like everyone else? :(

I came here for a late dinner with 3 friends a few months ago.  Our waitress did not seem thrilled to be working in the least bit.

I ordered the sliders and asked for them plain.  "So do you want the sauce?"  "No thank you."

Our drinks are all empty by the time our food comes out.  It is served by a different server, or a food runner.  Sure enough my sliders come out with sauce on them.  After the person drops off our food he leaves.  Clearly we all need refills.  Since it was so hard to find our waitress I decided to just suck it up and eat my sliders with the sauce on them.  After looking around, we finally see our waitress in a corner eating.  Umm okay, let's let her enjoy her food.. We flag down someone to get refills and a different person again later on to get our check.  Our waitress comes over to pick up our check and return it... What sucky service!!

The food was good, even with the sauce.  I will have to come back again and give this place a second shot.  Only because of the food.  However in restaurants, food and service go hand in hand.  Too often do I hear of places with great food losing customers because of crappy service.  Since I am a server myself, I will give her the benefit of the doubt and give it another go.

I love Herb & Rye. I like the dark decor and last time i was there on a friday night they had a DJ in there as well.  Aviation is my favorite drink there and i don't normally leave the bar without at least three of them ;)

The food is also great there, i like the wings (hot & sweet & crispy, YUM), beef carpaccio, mussels, and the steak actually tastes good here.  Definitely order it during their happy hours, really worth it :)
Not impressed. Over priced for what u get. I ordered a $14 chicken pasta that cost me $25. Bland and nothing special about it. My friends steak came out cooked wrong

Fantastic place! Hope to go again soon. 

Love the 1920's prohibition vibe in there. It's dark, with small output chandeliers, and felt wall paper. I feel like I'm no longer in Vegas and instead I'm in a place that talks about its mob culture. The mob made money off bringing alcohol, then they built Vegas. It was the places that looked like this that made Vegas what it is. 

I had the rib eye which was seasoned so perfectly. Came out a perfect medium rare. I ate the whole thing, came with a side of truffle fries that had just a nice hint of garlic, not too much like most places. 

The calamari was a must. I would recommend it over most Italian places. It was a great presentation too.

The cocktails were so fun. I was trying to hit all the different eras of cocktails but I was starting to feel pretty good by the fourth set, there's a total of seven I believe.

Can't wait to go again, and impress more friends with this place!

Have you ever cried deeply into your food because the first bite alone just made you feel like hot butter rolling down a warm ear of freshly grilled corn? 

A great restaurant guarantees great food, great ambiance and most of all great service; Herbs & Rye does all of the above and does it with an elegance that is rare to find in Sin City outside of the prestigious Las Vegas Strip. So it is no surprise that Herbs & Rye has an daily average wait time of 55 minutes no matter the time of day (dress warmly as the waiting area is a grand lounging area of one wooden chair).
**UPDATE: I WENT BACK 04/2017 AND THEY NOW HAVE A TUFTED BENCH!!**

Regardless, every visit is well worth the three-digit minimum bill, the hunger-game esque hunt for parking, and the inability to fit into any of your clothes the next day. If you are craving a beautiful piece of meat or searching for a new watering hole for your next special occasion, I highly recommend Herbs & Rye aka the only restaurant to make me actively crave brussel sprouts ever. A personal favorite is the filet with an old fashioned and never skimping on the creme brulee.

Plus the 5-8PM happy hour discount will not break the bank.
The best double happy hour in Las Vegas and the classic cocktails are the bomb !
This is my #1 favorite bar/restaurant in Vegas. Happy hour is truly the best. The bartenders really know their liquor history. The truffle Mac &Cheese is a must have along with the donuts.

I love herbs & rye!! Such a cool place to come when u want a different night out!! The beef tar tar and steaks here are amazing!!! Definitely go for the meatballs and Mac and cheese!! Sounds so strange but I mix mine for an incredible side!!! Jalapeño cream corn is also amazing!! Get the donuts for dessert!!! Oh yea and you can't go wrong with the prohibition style drinks at this place!! So excellent!!!

The atmosphere is very relaxed with nice staff. Dimly lit place with nice nostalgic feel to it. Perfect for date or a nice evening out. Excellent music selection! I was quite excited to finally try this place out for happy hour and here is my experience. To start, you cannot make reservations for the late happy hour 12-3am online. Husband stopped in when he was in the area to get that squared away. We arrived and our waiter, Joaquin was very friendly and knowledgeable on all our drinks. Some of the drink suggestions were spot on, one or two were not.  Clover club was very light but a little bitter for my taste. The Vieu Carr'e was the crowning glory. Nice cognac taste with amazing fragrance to it. Very strong too! Excellent customer service; staff was on point with refilling drinks and checking on us. We ordered the spicy mussels and the clams, which are their only two appetizers on happy hour. Delicious! The spicy mussels were a huge hit at the table, with the sauce making it the most delicious plate we ordered. Definitely recommend dipping that bread in the sauce. I ordered the filet mignon with truffle Mack and cheese. Mac and cheese was on point! Great flavor little crunch bits in top made for excellent texture. Thoroughly disappointed in the steak. Asked for the steak medium well and while the inside was so tender and delicious, the outer coating was burnt and extremely salty.
