The saltiness took away from what would have been the most delicious steak of my life. Buddy of mine had the same experience with his NY strip steak, so he didn't even get halfway through his meal. My husbands was excellent, right amount of seasonings really made his cut of beef shine. With a cut of meat this good, why add so many seasonings? It's already delicious! Little salt and pepper and it's good. So, I knocked off a star for that. One drink waiter suggested, Can't remember the name but it looked something like a red martini, was so bitter I nearly vomited my food. The doughnuts were certainly delicious. Would give this place another shot, if simply for the spicy mussels. Oh, and the table also ordered the meatballs with chorizo, tender meatball but very flat flavor. The whiskey potatoes were a delicious side as well.
The donuts alone deserve 5stars! AMAZING! Staff is also very friendly and the atmosphere is great.
One of the top three cocktail bars I've ever visited. Just go, drink, and enjoy.

I came here last night for part 2 of Nelson Q's UYE. It was happy hour and we had GOOD TIMES!!

What I ordered:

3 - Moscow Mule $9 (3rd one from my boy Matt S and 1st one from H&R for Yelpers)
      vodka, lime, ginger beer
1 - Blue Moon $5
1 - Carpaccio $6
      thinly sliced beef, balsamic glaze, cherry pepper aioli, arugula
1 - Harlem (shot from Jieun L)

The Moscow Mule was very tasty. It was served in this cool mug. The Carpaccio was a little too salty. We wanted Jager shots but they didn't have it. The bartender suggested Harlem, which wasn't as good as Jager. 

I will mos def come back for the Ribeye during happy hour!

Despite an earlier review from a fellow Yelper, Debra was an actually very good server, if not one of the best I've ever had. (Gotta take Yelp with a grain of salt) We came in at 11pm sat in the bar booths and missed the happy hour. 

Pro: food is generous in portion, even the flatbreads ($14)- 8 huge slices! I'm used to Blue Martinis flat bread which is a rip-off. The mac and cheese  ($7.5) was delicious and cheesy and flavored really well. Caesar salad was beautiful in presentation, but it took work chopping it up. The 3 Filet Mignon sliders were delicious, flavorful and just well put together. As opposed to the dried out sliders at Sugar Factory. I've sworn off the rip-off that are sliders just because of Sugar Factory.

Cons: The Diablo ($10) took forever to arrive- 10 minutes I'd say. It was only 4 people in the bar and we accounted for 2 of them. Not sure if the bartender forgot or maybe he was juicing the Agave?

 The server forgot to ask how we wanted our sliders prepared, which arrived medium rare. A real filet mignon is fine med-rare, but a ground up burger med-rare is close to raw. 

More specificity on the menu i.e. how many of each item- $11 for a meatball appetizer is unheard of outside of LAVO.  It's 3 meatballs btw.


Overall, Herbs & Rye re-imagines what real food is in Vegas. Not only was I surprised at the complex flavors of the food, but the mood and ambiance of such a quaint unassuming building really makes me want to go back.

First and foremost great staff and knowledgeable staff especially one named Mark he had Charisma he upsold and he knew exactly what I wanted and had a taste for, even though I had no idea of the menu. my first time experience was so fantastic with Mark our server/waiter that we returned again. I dined with a friend named Jack who we must be careful next time and bring him plastic cups when he orders the bee's knees cocktail. Sorry for breaking a glass MOZEL TOV! Thank you MARK you are the best

Made reservations for this past weekend. Upon arriving, no one was at the host stand. After waiting a few minutes, a server came to the host stand to get us seated. Turns out this was going to also be our server. This was my second time here. First was good, did not recall any issues. Unfortunately this visit was not so great. 

Service was not good and it was not that busy. The bar area looked fairly busy but it was just as happy hour was ending. The dining room area was not busy. After being seated and getting some water to start, we waited for the server to come back to get our drink order. By the time drinks came back, we were ready to order. After placing our order (main plus a side). the server came back to inform us they were out of mashed potatoes. Really? Um, ok. So I picked another side. Once we did get our food, the steaks were luke warm. Being hungry and not having a server check on us or both trying to flag down someone else, we just took what we got.

Unlike other restaurants where the server stops by to check on things, we didn't see much of our server after that. I remember one visit to check after we had our food and take a second drink order. Once finished and plates were cleared we wanted to get the check, but where was the server? No where to be seen. Then he shows up to ask about dessert and leave a menu, which we declined and just asked for the check. Soon as we got the check, I put my CC in hoping to have it taken back promptly, but no, the server disappeared again. After the check with my CC was sitting for a bit, someone else offered to take it for us. That other server than came back by to let us know our server was taking care of it. 

In the end, I was disappointed since I know this is a popular place, they have a great drink menu and on my previous visit loved the food. However this recent visit was not worth a higher rating. I most likely won't be coming back anytime soon. There are too many other great restaurants in Las Vegas.

Came here for our 45 wedding anniversary. Steaks are very good, and cooked to perfection. Wife had the pork chop which also was cooked to perfection. 
This place is old school and the service is excellent what you would expect from the 50-60s. 
They specialize in cocktails. The drink menu is actually divided by year the drink was popular back starting in the early 1700s. 
It is said Frank Sinatra came here to eat and drink. I would suppose the rest of the rat pack was here also. 
The ambiance is dark, bring your phone or small flashlight if you have problem reading in low light. 
Don't let the outside fool you. The place has obviously been a go to place for many years.

Right off the top, we were 20 minutes late for our 5:30 reservation and they held our table for 4.  Then we had the pleasure to meet, Mark our server. As with other reviews, he elevates your experience.  He is very knowledgeable and engaging.  We got margarita flat bread and little neck clams for appetizers.  The crust on the flat bread was done to perfection, just the right crunch.  The clams have the best broth to be soaked up by the equally tasty bread.  1st round was The Boulevardier, a very nicely done bourbon based drink, but it was quickly topped by a smooth View Carre, an El Diablo a fine representative for tequila, and a mock tail of club soda, cucumber, a touch of sweet and sour and mint, it was very refreshing.  Our meals were the Linguini & Clams, Pappardelle, New York Strip and Bone in Pork Chop.  Everything was cooked to our expectations.  The stand out was the Pork Chop.  I let Mark setup the entire entree and he delivered.  It was cooked medium with the spice rub and blue cheese crust, and Sprouts and Swine side. There is nothing I can say to describe the taste, just the best pork and brussel sprouts I've ever had.  Bottom line, Herbs & Rye is "THE" place to eat and drink in Vegas.  Oh, and the donuts are a fantastic ending!

I've only gone during happy hour, but I gotta say make a reservation to avoid the wait. It gets packed and why shouldn't it?! 1/2 price on steaks and classy cocktails late at night...what more could you ask for?! Every time I'm in Vegas I always make it a point to close out the night here. Good atmosphere and friendly service. Steaks are cooked to perfection. 

Recommended sides: Garlic mash potatoes, truffle fries, or brussels sprouts

One word!! Service was bad !!! Food bad!!!! WINE  very
Bad for the price!!! 

So this place was highly recommended by a person  due to their happy hr. We normally don't really complain about the WINE but this wine and service was the worst!!! 

Highly not recommended. U better off going to Mastro because they are pretty much the same price but Better everything els !!

The perfect Vegas feel. The food was  spot on, the drinks were intriguing and perfectly balanced (also set back to the 1920s, and they're known for their Moscow mule), and the elegant lighting had me gazing at everyone's beauty. 

Happy hour is as legit as it comes. They do it so right I almost felt like I was getting away with something. 5-8pm with so many of my first picks as options including steak!
They have the option of putting a spicy rub on your steak of choice. I was hoping for mine to have a good kick but it was modest. The flavor was on point, however. 
We came for a birthday (party of 6) and everyone at the table shared family style so we could all taste the different flavors and get a good taste of the place. You just can't go wrong here and I say that after trying half the menu. 
It was busy and the parking isn't thuper. It took way too long to get our drinks and to place our order. We were in good company, however, and nobody came hangry so it actually allowed for more time to enjoy the atmosphere.

Went here for the first time last night and had to go back again tonight. First of all, its nothing nice to look at from the outside, but once you get on the inside you definitely get the speakeasy 20's feel. The ambiance is great!

I ordered the moscow mule and the ramos fiz which were both the best I have ever had, and from what I hear you definitely get a show if you sit at the bar and watch them make their drinks. The drink selection is awesome and I cannot wait to try them all.

My fiance and I shared a caprese salad which tasted great. I really like how sweet and thick the balsamic sauce was. I ordered a filet mignon with a blue cheese crust and the steak was great. We ordered truffle fries and asparagus for our sides and both tasted amazing.

I really cannot wait to go back. It is a great date spot and I could really come here eery night for a post-work drink. I probably wouldnt come to eat unless it was happy hour though because the steaks were expensive, but such a good deal for HH!

I was in Vegas with my colleagues for work and staying on the strip. We always try new restaurants but most of them are within walking distant. This time we decided to venture out and try a spot all the locals rave about. I made a reservation on their website - highly recommend, when we arrived, the wait was two hours without one. Happy hour ends at 7. We arrived at 5:45. Happy hour is half off all of their steaks! What an awesome deal!!! I had a 9 oz filet mignon, it was amazing and comes with your choice of one side. I opted for truffle Mac and cheese - delicious. My friends had the creamed spinach and garlic mashed potatoes. The food was good, I am only giving 4 stars because the blue cheese was cold and wasn't melted like it should be as a blue cheese crust. I asked if they could melt it on the side and they said no and brought be cold blue cheese instead. Also, the horseradish that my friend ordered was brown - didn't look or taste fresh. The libations were really good and super strong! Hence the small glasses they are served in. The vibe overall is super cool - vintage dark, speak easy. I was hesitant at first, the front door is beat up and the entry is short and narrow, but I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. While it doesn't have the glitz and glamour like the big fancy restaurants on the strip, I would say it is worth an Uber drive to venture out and try something new!

Our second visit and certainly not our last!

Made reservations in advance for happy hour (half off of best steaks around) and showed up early on purpouse to sample some great cocktails at the bar while we waited for our table.

Service was fantastic, great selection of some of the best bourbons, whiskeys and scotches.

Steaks were absolute perfection and honestly, other than the excellent craft cocktails, the steaks are THE reason to come here.

Very memorable and best anniversary dinner!

I really enjoyed the food - and the *amazing* cocktails.  What a classic list!  Not trendy, Classic.  Our server in the bar area tables was not the best as far as guest empathy and showing concern, and the drinks took *forever* to arrive, but maybe it was an off night for her when we went.  The bartender was busy talking to the people sitting at the bar and possibly didn't see the drink ticket?  Our server was nice enough, just not super nice, nor super attentive.

Of the things we tried for dinner, the little neck clams were delicious.  My advice is skip the very good steak - get the Pork and Figs instead!!  OUTSTANDING.  That's what will have me coming back soon.

I'm impressed at how well the waiters know the cocktail menu; every item the waiter can describe how it tastes on your palate from start to finish.

I'm also impressed at the hostesses; 12pm on a weekday I called asking for a reservation for 2 and left a voice mail. The girl called me back once the business opened up and was able to accommodate me, even though they were fully booked online.

Steaks are awesome, I would eat here like twice a week if I lived closer.

I took my wife out for our Thursday night date night to Herbs & Rye. The last time we ate in this building it was the Venetian back in the 90's. This restaurant is incredible and we love the happy hour there. We shared a 16oz ribeye cooked to perfection the truffle steak fries with bacon, French onion soup and a ceaser salad, all were excellent.  The bar is very good as well and you can eat at the bar as well as having a table. Great crowd wonderful staff and excellent food and service. We will be back!
Went here for the first time recently. The overall ambiance is neat, but very dark inside. So dark that I couldn't even read the menu. Food was good. Drinks were interesting and good too.

Excellent food and a local atmosphere. Friends brought us to this place and they said we would like. The cocktails were good I had a Brown Derby, my wife and I shared the ribeye that was cooked to perfection. Definitely a hidden jewel in Las Vegas.
Awesome cocktail menu. Good service. OK but overpriced food. But it's definitely a great local spot. The 120 Oz steak challenge sounds fun! Good luck to all who dare to try it.
Amazing!!! Great atmosphere, and after midnight you get a great discount on select steaks!! Drink were well crafted and yummy!!! Would go again!!!

The restaurant obviously has good food - so do many Vegas restaurants - but they have to compete on service.   
I ordered by steak Med-Well, because I order "safe to ensure I get a cooked steak.  I will return for a Med or Med rare steak after I figure out the "cooks or server" preference - my picture is of my "med - well" served steak - and it was still bleeding when I received it ......: but we all know what happens when you return food.

Went during happy hour at 5; they don't even open until 5. These are pretty good quality steaks. I wouldn't pay full price for it, but at half-price, I wouldn't mind making a return trip, though there are still too many steaks in Vegas I haven't tried. I ordered the rib-eye but would probably try the filet mignon next time. All steaks come with one side of your choice, which is pretty awesome for someone that doesn't like when you're limited to potatoes or chef's vegetables. I ordered the truffle mac 'n cheese, but I didn't notice any truffles, was probably just truffle oil. The asparagus that someone else got looked really good, though that side didn't seem as large, about 5-7 spears.

I agree the place is too dark, I too couldn't tell how well cooked my steak was with the lack of lighting.

The online menu (as of 8/27/12) does not do the place justice. Their in house menu is far more extensive, with a good number of half-priced happy hour items.

Also, the outside of the restaurant looks like crap, but the inside is pretty nice.

Just go! You'll be thrilled.  Tucked in a strip mall with a blank, boring exterior, you walk in and the interior transforms you to a whole new place!  The hostesses are always charming and helpful, the bartenders love what they do and the wait staff are top-notch.  I've never been disappointed here.  I've come for cocktails and appetizers and then other times full dinners.  Portions are big (it's a man-friendly place), so you can share, but honestly, the food is so good, you'll devour your meal.  There are two seating sections, one in a room and the other near the bar area, but with cozy booths.  If you are there with a date or some friends you really want to get to know, I'd suggest the room, rather than the bar area, which can be a bit loud.  But, maybe I'm just getting too old.

I only come here during the happy hour because it is totally worth it.  As a broke college student, finding cheap/decent eats is like a diamond in the rough and I'd definitely say herbs & rye is. 

EVERY night from 5pm-8pm and 12am-close? The happy hour is 1/2 off some of the steak items (among other items on the menu) and the steak is good quality and awesome. 

This is one of the places you don't even need to drench your steak in A1 sauce-- because it is just that good. 

I was told that they cut their meat portions in-house, and lemme tell ya- the portions are pretty decent. You can get a 20 oz ribeye for 22 bucks!! The steaks also come with delicious sides and I recommend getting the truffle mac and cheese. It is served fresh and the combination of the two are extremely satisfying. 

The happy hour also includes well drinks, but no cocktails.

Went here for dinner tonight as the boyfriend and I were starving. We were promptly seated and after asking our waiter a few questions about the food, we ordered a couple items. 

I have to say though, I had some sticker shock. $17 for a small/medium-ish plate of plain fettuccine alfredo?! Really?! And Matt said it ended up being $19 because they made a mistake on the bill and he didn't want to contest it -.- 
It was decent, but the cream sauce better have been milked from virgin unicorns because there is no way it was worth that much. I can get a giant plate of the best fettuccine alfredo in town for $14 at Casa Di Amore. This place, even though the ambiance was lovely and the service was spectacular, the food was no Casa Di Amore.

Matt ordered the red, green, and white pizza. This thing was as big as the menu and $10 - not bad. It tasted okay, but I'm not a huge ricotta cheese fan so it lost me there, but overall it was flavorful.

The service was amazing, the surroundings were lovely, but the food was not up to par. It tasted fine, but once the bill rolled around - yikes. I would probably come back during happy hour but that's about it.
Mediocre food, indifferent service. I don't know what the positive reviews are thinking. We are locals but will not be back.

Love this place!  A Vegas industry sanctuary!  
May I come to the party?!  I too love magicians!
I absolutely love this place! Food is amazing and everyone is so nice! Wonderful Customer service I will definitely be returning and will recommend anyone who hasn't tried this place to try it!!!

Went here to have a casual dinner with friends, thinking we would all like to try a new place. 
Made dinner reservations for 6:30 the night before, and we honestly got there about 5 minutes late - tight parking in this area around dinner time/Happy Hour when menu items with 2 stars are half-off (mostly meats). 
It didn't take us long to be seated at a table after checking in, and we had 1 of our group running late. 
The setting is nice, slightly dim for a kinda suave atmosphere. The wait staff is also a good representation of the setting. When I say that, I mean they're really nice and personable, but also know when to give your group space to ease in. Our server Mark (sp.) was not only nice, but he was also knowledgeable about the menu. He told us the background on the meats and his favorite menu items for recommendations. He even threw in a few jokes to jab at our friend for being late, then eating off of us 'cause he had sushi before our get-together. LOL. He managed to get him to order a few drinks.
I also have to give him and the bartender kudos for making a drink that wasn't on the menu, but I thought I'd give a shot at asking for. It was an Old Fashion, sour, with brandy and olives. They even made it "Wisconsin style" for me 'cause it's common in the Midwest, but uncommon in the West. This is honestly the first place (well stocked and equipped bar) that made that drink right for me. XD Anyway...
Food was scrumptious! The Meatballs & Chorizo was yummy with the tomato sauce and Feta cheese. We all ordered the Ribeye with different sides, one was cooked a little too rare for my friend though. For sides, we chose Truffle Mac 'n Cheese, Garlicky Spinach and Brussels Sprouts & Honey Swino. All yummy, but my favorite is the Brussels Sprouts (thinking it's because of the bacon). The sides are in small dishes, so it doesn't come proportionate to the size of the steak unless you'd like to order additional stuff. Ahahaha... Fine by me though 'cause I just had my leftover steak to go and made it for breakfast with eggs and hash browns. For dessert, we had the Bread Pudding with ice cream, and the H&R Doughnuts that comes with 1 caramel and 1 white chocolate sauce. Oh my gah... Don't even ask me which one I liked more 'cause I honestly can't decide. Mark did tell us that the Doughnuts are always a popular item though. 
For about 6 drinks, 3 steaks with 1 side each, and 1 appetizer, I think the bill came to around $200-$245 with the gratuity.

Wow! Absolutely fabulous spot! Got there around 7:30- 8 on a Friday night. Not much parking. Line to get in was out the door. Once inside, there was quite a bit of a wait, but the hostesses were friendly and the decor was pretty neat. Once the bar cleared up, we were able to wait for a table there. We had so much fun at the bar, that we ended up eating there. Bartenders were friendly and even funny at times! Drinks were delicious and the menu was creative. The angel hair pasta was better than I thought it would be, and my husband enjoyed his salmon. We will definitely be returning.

This is a hidden gem of Vegas.
Area is sketchy, but venue is pristine.
Early 1900s music and feel, herbs and rye had the best ambiance with its dark mood setting that's intimate, yet social. 
Ordered pork and fig and fillet mignon with truffle Mac and broccoli and sharp cheddar. 
No regrets at all. 
Dessert offerings were limited to a root beer float, cookie and ice cream, and fresh donuts. I skipped dessert. 

I would go here and recommend it anytime to anyone looking for great value and high quality, without the tourist trap prices of the strip.

Herbs & Rye has become my favorite restaurant in Vegas.

Herbs & Rye has also become my favorite cocktail bar in Vegas.

To put it simply, the steaks are one of the best in town.  They butcher the meat themselves, the season it perfectly, and it's always at the right temperature you order.

The cocktails are a delight as well.  More of a trip through drinking's history than a cocktail menu, you are practically guaranteed to find your new favorite drink from this menu.

The service is top notch as well. I accidentally ordered something spicy, and before I could ask for something to be done, my meal was remade without question.  I also like a place where I am not lacking water at any time.

And then there is the happy hour.  50% off of most steaks on the menu and many drinks as well.  I paid $22 for my filet mignon.  My incredible filet mignon.

If you want a unique cocktail, a wonderful steak, impeccable service and the best price in town for it all, Herbs & Rye should be your destination.
Great food, prices were very good during happy hour, however regular times the prices were above average.

Loved the dark, old school bar area. We made a reservation on Open Table and were running late, staff accommodates us no problem. Our waitress Debra was attentive and very helpful. Ordered half off filet, truffle mac, and sharp cheddar broccoli (my fav). Amber ale is half price between 5-8pm as well. Great meal, great atmosphere.  Owner, Mr. Mendoza, even came out to greet us at our table. Don't be discouraged by the outside, inside is charming and comfortable. Order the donuts!!!!

What a cool and intimate steak house. A friend of mine suggested that we give this steak house a try while we were in vegas and it was a great suggestion. The vibe in this place is very unique and one of a kind. It has the feel of a dark dive bar but the experience of fine dinning. The filet sliders are amazing and the tomato bisque is good. Especially, with the grilled cheese sandwich that it comes with. This place is great for couples and that happy hour is the perfect time to go because all of their steaks are set to half price during this period. Our server mark was very hospital and made great menu recommendations. He even heard that it was one of our friends birthday while we ate and brought out some homemade mini sugar donuts that were to die for. Check this place out if you ever get a chance when passing through Las Vegas.

Two words - Happy, Hour

You just go to this place during happy hour to get 1/2 off steaks and select appetizers. If you miss happy hour don't be upset because the steaks are worth more than full price!

I do recommend calling ahead for a reservation as it can get quite busy.

The story you are about to read is true. This is old town, classic Las Vegas, Nevada. My name is Skacey, I carry twenty years of memories about the town the mob built.

This investigation starts at Kahunaville inside the TI. I ask the bottle slinger behind the bar about classic cocktails. My never ending quest for the perfect Sezarac leads the conversation to Herbs & Rye. According to his story, H&R is the place to find it.

8:23 pm. My partner and I are on east Sahara when we spot what appears to be a classic Vegas dive bar. Industrial plain building leads me to believe the trail may dead end here. Stepping through the door and we are greeted by a remarkably warm and inviting interior. We decide to sit at the bar to get the full experience.

Now I've spent more than my fair share in Vegas bars and eateries. I remember the Vegas of the 80's as the last whimpers of organized crime faded behind corporate greed. Herbs and Rye brings a classic, personal touch to service. Our bartender is a consummate professional with enough personal interaction to make you feel more than welcome. I would trade ten modern servers for one who studies the art of service like this gentleman.

The true test comes when I tentatively ask for a Sezarac, fully expecting to have to explain what it is and what's in it. Without missing a beat, the bartender asks about my preference on Rye Whiskey. I just about giggled with delight (yep, glance back at that profile picture and visualize giggling - quite a shocker, huh?)

The drink is exquisite.

For the food, I tried their Seafood Diablo and found it to also be inspired. Not to short the details on the food, but remember, I giggled through much of my meal.

The Good: Best Classic Cocktails, and Classic Service in Las Vegas
The Bad: Why does it have to be so far from my home town, Orlando, FL?
The Ugly: The outside of the building - really let it go, once you're inside, you'll forget all about it.

You know sometimes when you read the reviews you don't know whether it's true or not. You go on the star rating and hope for the best. Herbs & Rye was a great Steakhouse.

We Come From the Midwest so we know good steak. This was one of the best steaks that I've had in a long long time.

We went during the happy hour special which was, I believe from 6:30 to 8. Steaks for half price and some appetizers for half price period

If you went during regular times, it would be pretty pricey. I believe New York strip was 46 or $48. But during happy hour half price.

Love the feel, love the old-fashioned drinks, and would definitely go back again.

I've been here twice now. The first time, the concierge at the Cosmopolitan recommended it. The second time, I brought a group of 12. Michelle, the reservations agent, was awesome and made sure our party was accommodated. 

Each time, I ordered the filet, which was perfect. I ordered a wedge salad each time, which was also very good. They offer a side with each steak, so I recommend the brussels sprouts. 

The decor is old rat pack style, but is a newer remodel. The waiting area is crowded, so the bar is the place to be while you wait. The bartenders are attentive, and the bar has a locals feel, without feeling like you're an outsider. 

Each time, our waiter was friendly, without being annoying and both were very knowledgeable about steaks and the wine selection. I wished I had ordered a dessert, but didn't have room. Highly recommended 

Oh, p.s., if you had patience to read this far, you are well rewarded...steaks are half price during happy hour!

Parking is horrendous. We had to park in the alley 3 buildings west. Then once inside, we sat down and immediately started to sweat. It was as hot as a sauna inside this place. It was hotter inside than it was outside. Not only was the temperature uncomfortable, but our waiter was rude. However, The food was very good and the beer and wine list are very nice. Once our meal was done, we sat waiting for 30 minutes with no check. Once we finally asked for the check, it took another 30 minutes for our waiter to bring it to the table. I will not be coming back.

Great food, a fantastic cocktail menu, and the lovely Allie. 
Went here for dinner last night and I was really impressed. The place was packed, which shows how popular a place it is. The cocktail menu was long and really interesting. It's broken down by era which is a cool concept I haven't seen. Isiah the bartender made me an excellent sazerac and a variation of a whisky sour that were excellent. The steak I had was incredible as were the sides. Our server Allie was not only nice and lovely but knew a ton about bartending and provided some great drink recommendations. The only thing I would recommend is making reservations, you'll never get walk in seats on a Friday or Saturday. Oh and good luck finding parking. Overall this place was awesome, I'll definitely be back.

Herbs and Rye is more of a cocktail bar that serves steaks rather than a steakhouse that has a bar, and it is the cocktail bar that surely serves a good steak. 
The quailty of Ribeye steak (medium rare) was top notch. It wasn't dry aged therefore it did not have strong flavor but the steak was absolutely amazing 
The plate of wings (sweet thai) that was served as an appetizer was tasty and filling. It had a larger portion than expected but i dont think no one would complain extra 3 or 4 more wings.
There are two reasons i gave this place 4 tars instead of 5, and one of them is because of the side. The truffle mac and cheese was very mushy. It surely tastes great but the texture could be improved.
The second reason that drew me back from giving 5 star was the music. I understand that it was a cocktail bar and needed music to keep the atmosphere upbeat and alive but the music was extremely loud that it was hard to hear my own server. 

Overall, this place is a perfect spot for quailty steaks for an affordable price.

The food was delicious and they had a lot of speciality cocktails to choose from. Nice, dim and romantic atmosphere. Happy hour pricing is awesome, especially for the steaks (which were cooked perfectly to our liking). Our server was nice and knowledgeable about the drinks on the menu. He didn't rush us when our meal was over. We will definitely come back for another date night.

Made a reservation for 4 and got seated on time, but the experience went downhill from there. My party and I came here specifically for their happy hour..50% off steaks! However, about 45 minutes later...we finally received our food. It took more time for the food to arrive than for us to finish. Yes, the steak was pretty good, but I'm not sure if I would be willing to return to wait an eternity. 

Also, I completely understand that the waiter has no control over how fast the food will come out, but it would have been nice if we were offered more bread in between or gave us an update on what's going on. When it came to paying, our server split the checks into two for us (for two couples). We got our receipt back and signed for the credit card, but he never gave my friend that paid in cash his change..um..did he assume that was his tip or something?? Unprofessional. We didn't bother to ask about this as we were already here for way too long. My friend obviously didn't leave a tip cause he just kept the money..

On the bright side..they are on top of refilling your water. Keep in mind I drank a lot of water when I was waiting for 45 minutes. Yep, there was always a full cup of water.

I've been to this place 4 times now. Wasn't ever a disappointment until this visit. I know the service is typically slow but it was ungodly slow on this recent visit. Steaks were mediocre & chewy & dry instead of the normal moist & melts in your mouth. Waiter kept trying to up sell everything even after we told him we were fine. Took forever to get drinks. Sides that we ordered w/ our meals were meh as well. Asparagus had no flavor, jalapeno creamed corn was cold, cheddar broccoli was gross - was like cheese whiz melted on broccoli. Since 2 of us share a steak we opted to add another additional side of sweet potato tator tots - seriously $7 for those things? Not worth it. Mind you we didn't add the (for more $$) marshmallow crap on top (it's gross anyway) but no plain sweet potato tator tots are worth $7. The best sweet potato tator tots I've had in this town were @ BB Kings which is unfortunately closed. I will give a proper shout out for the little neck clams. They were great in the garlic white wine broth. Got extra bread to soak up all the great juice (btw - had to has 2 times to get the bread finally the bus boy was the one that brought it to us) Bill was $249 (before tip) for 5 people @ happy hour time & 2 of us even split a steak. There are no drink specials on their "specialty" cocktails. They are $10 apiece but says that nowhere in the menu & waiter doesn't mention the price. They need to hire more waitstaff to take care of patrons as everything took forever like I said I waited there before & it's never taken as long as it did on this visit. I noticed that other tables were getting frustrated as well. Was overall disappointed  with this visit to Herbs & Rye. I used to tout this place to everyone but I will be rethinking it now.

Tonight it was my birthday. I was looking for a good steakhouse but at a fine dining spot. I yelped and I was originally going somewhere else but they only served people over 21 and I had my daughter with me so we ended up looking for something else and I came around this place "herbs and rye" and I'm glad I ended up here . When you walk in the atmosphere was more for a romantic date or anniversary things like that for me it was my birthday. We never been here before but the waitress we had was super nice and filled us in on happy hour which is at midnight . Anything with two stars is half off which sounded so much better because it is pricey , anyways we ended up ordering one rib eye to share and side dishes like garlic mash and truffle mac and cheese ( so amazing) and jalapeño corn yummmm and hot wings ( super sauces up ) just how I like. They play old school music like hip hop and r&b I loved it

As a girl originally from the Midwest, I can tell ya the steaks did not disappoint. We made a reservation during happy hour which is definitely the way to do it. All in all, great food and and great service. Would recommend.

Went for dinner and drinks and was not disappointed. Got a flatbread which was delicious, wanted to get a second one but didn't want to feel like a fatty. Got a few drinks, the drink menu was walked through with us by the waitress and she was very informative. The staff was very friendly and we had a great time! We will definitely be coming back!

The happy hour at this place is the best in town! Everything is 50% off from 5p-8p! The atmosphere is very dark and kind of like what I would picture a vampire bar to consist of. I had the flat iron steak which was said to be 8oz but it looked much larger than that. The asparagus was cooked just right, not too soft and not too firm. The garlic mash was creamy and flavorful. I had the spicy mussels as an appetizer and they were a great way to start. I don't necessarily like gin but their gin cocktails were tart and sweet at the same time and I enjoyed them.

This was supposed to be a fun ladies night away from the kids and husband's. Turned out to be a bad experience. The service was super slow and the waiter was not friendly at all. He rarely came to our table to see if we needed anything else. Not to mention they only have one co-ed bathroom(disgusting). The way they calculate the gratuity is from the full price menu mind you we were there on happy hour!! The gratuity came out to be $84 if the service would have been great our group wouldn't have cared to tip that much for excellent service. I will never return to this establishment.

Update to my original review. Talked with manager, asked me to email him the details and bank print out to show him the draft was indeed too much. He managed to take my only record of the transaction from my girlfriend during her discussion with him then claimed that he did not take when whe asked for it back. No correspondence from the the email and no answer to phone calls. Dinner ultimately cost $320 for some basic food that way ovet priced with bad service. I'd stay away they seem to be ok with being shady business.

I don't really know how I feel about this place. Our server Mark was great and even remembered our names, I think that's really the only positive.  We ordered the linguine and clams and the truffle Mac and cheese which were mediocre. We came here around midnight on a Friday night for their happy hr from 12am-3am. The bar was packed so we had to get a table which is fine, but it was so ridiculously loud in there that you can't even hear the person next to you. This is primarily because of the rowdy people at the bar. Then there's really no explanation of the happy hr on the menu so we thought this included cocktails...which it doesn't. Also, they don't even have prices for them on the menu....strange. Cocktails weren't great anyway, I didn't even finish mine. Would I recommend this place? No. Maybe I would try this place again just for their steak, but not for drinks or ambiance.

For me the atmosphere was better than the meal.  From the outside, it looks like your standard neighborhood bar, but on the inside, you'll think you stepped into a trendy new hotspot at the Wynn or the Bellagio.  Dim lighting, attractive servers, and groovy music all come together nicely.  I especially like the old movies playing on the flat-screens above the bar.

About the food:  Appetizer was great.  Entree was not so great.  I ordered these marinated meatballs as a starter that had wonderful flavor.  I should have made a meal out of them, but opted for the filet mignon with a mac & cheese side.  Be careful how you order it because medium well somehow got translated into well-done.  So my steak arrived as a flavorless, dried-out piece of beef jerky.  And the mac & cheese was a little too bland for my taste.  To be fair though, my buddy ordered the same steak medium RARE and his looked (and tasted) much better.  I also preferred his mushroom side to my mac & cheese.  Those were the best marinated shrooms I've ever eaten.  So altogether, I'd say the food can be hit or miss.

About the price.  I thought for a "$$" designation, I would be under $30 (Yardhouse pricing), but after an appetizer, entree with a side, and a decent tip (20%), I was into this meal for $75.  I wasn't on a date; I was just grabbing a late-night dinner with a friend. So this was a bit more than I wanted to pay.

Would I go here again? Sure, but maybe during happy hour when the menu is a little cheaper.

It's a Monday. It's 7:30pm. It's off-Strip, on West Sahara. And it's absolutely slammed. The parking lot and the back alley parking, all full. And so are all the tables inside. Pretty durn telling! Alas, once again, I'm going to have to take dinner at the bar.

The last time I dined this space was fifteen years ago, when it was still "The Venetian." Yes there was once another Venetian. It was an old-school Italian-steakhouse joint and it had a lot of history. Many future chefs and restaurant owners started their Vegas ascent by serving time at The Venetian. And of course the famous and the infamous had dined it. Most of the classic MidCentury décor here now - engulfing curved black leather banquettes, red velvet wallpaper, bricked walls, et. al. - all inherited wholesale from The Venetian. And what a joint it was. My last order there was Linguine Ai Frutti Di Mare, and the bowl was just insanely massive. I spotted my tie - and three staff in formal attire rushed to my side with club soda as if I had had a heart attack. Ah, old Vegas. My next trip to Vegas, it was dark.

As the name portends, this venue is, first, a drop-dead-serious craft cocktail lounge. I know because I saw top-level buttons on the POS terminal for French 75, Corpse Reviver #2 and Boulevardier. I know because I saw 12" of glass shelving holding about 50 bottles of bitters. I know because the featured cocktail menu is arranged chronologically. And I know because that menu didn't offer any pricing.

I also know because I watched the bartender prepare (and I was going to ask if they could) my ATF (on the rare occasion I do imbibe): a Ramos Gin Fizz. It's a classic cocktail from the 1920s that has gone almost entirely off-the-radar, even at the most crafty-ish of craft cocktail bars. In fact, I once asked for it at the Wynn (a five-star resort with a full-time mixologist on staff managing the cocktail menu seasonally) and what I heard was "a-wha?" After shuffling and calling about, they admitted they did not have one of the key ingredients on the property. And this drink is a ton of labor; the bartender said they had worked to whittle down the prep time to about 7 minutes, versus the original New Orleans recipe's 20-minute preparation (that including a 12-minute shake, that being why so many bars have nixed it). Yet I've never seen it made so well as I did here, with its egg-white-induced head slowly rising almost an inch above the lip of the glass, while it sat right in front of the attractive young woman who was informed enough to have ordered it.

If you want to learn & taste the history of classic cocktails, grab your plastic and saddle up here.

The crowd here, most interesting, mostly trendy, monied, sharply-attired, 25ish to 40ish. This bar is made for mingling-up movers, shakers and wanna-bes. Bring friends ... or, as I observed, readily make some new ones at the bar.

But I am at the bar to dine, to determine the true value of their steak deal: 5pm to 8pm, midnight to close, half-price. I say show up for the deal if you don't want to nuke your plastic. My 18oz (bone-out) rib-eye plus side, regular price, $60. And there were other cuts, much higher. Of course, even all the affluent that were in there, they were there for half-off, so there's no shame in claiming it for your own. I fronted a Caesar salad for $12.

My service at the bar was on-point and efficient, but not too fawning. Entirely understandable since these bartenders were often - literally - working a pair of Boston shakers at the same time. 

The quality of the steak was nothing short of amazing. Since landing in Vegas, only my Golden Steer beef could venture to lay claim to besting this hunk of rib-eye. Perfectly charcoaled, perfectly juicy, wonderful marbling. Yet tender. Nirvana. And priced well, to boot. If I had skipped the salad, this quality/quantity of rib-eye, at thirty smackers, I would have almost been stealing it.
 
The background music never strayed once from its well-curated & upbeat intent: the very best of 1960s Carolina Shag, 1960s soul and 1960s Motown. And not at subtle decibel either. Its volume certainly evoked an up-tempo mindset at the bar, but it also surely inhibited convo in the banquettes. But the space was plenty noisy anyway, everyone reveling in their imbibing and dining experiences.

Yes, Herbs & Rye, you haven't seen the last of me, by any means. But I expect I am going to like you more somewhere after midnight, when I suspect things are a bit more sedated ... and the half-price-beef deal has kicked back in. 

And when the lower volume and the black banquettes are all mine. And when I can watch your bartender's every nuance, as he crafts the pefect Ramos Gin Fizz ... just for me.

Love this place. I've always thought I really wasn't a steak guy till I had the ribeye here. All of my friends kept raving about this place so I finally broke down and took my wife. It's definitely a must try you've definitely got to come here during happy hour all stakes are half price so I got my beautiful ribeye steak for $30 in Stead of the 60 it shows on the menu. Comes with one side get the truffle macaroni and cheese it will blow your freaking mind. Also so big I could not finish it there sad part is I had to microwave the next day and it was still tender enough to cut with a fork I never thought I would see that my life. drink specials are great never had a Moskal meal before and it was amazing I will definitely be coming back to this place. Would definitely say it's one of the best happy hours for food in town.

Nothing beats Herbs & Rye HH!
Half off steaks is what gets people, definitely what got us! 

Came here for a casual eat & drink date night with the hubs.

Service was awesome, everyone working seemed like they really enjoyed working there and food was on point! I ordered :
18oz Ribeye - medium rare, seasoned perfectly, meaty, fatty, melt in your mouth goodness!
Truffle Mac N Cheese - I LOVE TRUFFLE, this is one of the best mac n cheeses I've had!
Moscow Mule - my go to drink, because I wasn't into their spirits, aka strong ass cocktails!

Not sure why it took so long for a return visit but can't wait to go back soon!

Went a year ago everything was great. Today  Valentine's day I figured what a great place for me and my husband to go...It was nothing like our last experience. Service was terrible, steak was under cooked, bus boy topped off my perrier with tap water. I will never go back or recommend this place to anyone!!!
Great atmosphere, fantastic food. I was recommended to try this place by a friend and wow was she right. The service is amazing. I loved our server, his knowledge and enthusiasm.

Very disappointed  in our visit last night.  The drinks were lesser quality, made by bartenders I didnt recognize from prior visits to Herbs & Rye.  My group had 11 cocktails  and 9 were just slightly off making the drink a little harsh to swallow.  We are cocktail  people and travel to places like tails of the cocktail  in new orleans for cocktails and this was the worst sazerac I've ever had.  My group of 4 agreed that the drinks were  not up to our expectations of a Herbs and Rye cocktail.  
Secondly, the steaks were filled with fat and 1 with way too much gristle. We had amazing steaks in our past visits  to Herbs and Rye and this visits quality was very disappointing for our whole group. I known that ribeyes are marbled with fat but this was excessive.   Don't believe gristle about the size of a tennis ball should be found in the middle of a New York steak.
Third, we all were so disappointed to walk in and hear Michael Jackson,  stevie wonder and other 70's soul
R & B being played.  We are use to the electro swing, jazzy lounge style of music they played all other times we have been there. Herbs & Rye has a great lounge feel / atmosphere. Playing the wrong style of music for its decor didn't make sense and to not hear the great lounge swing style of music was disappointing.
It altered the feel of this great restaurant and bar.

After about $300, we had to sadly leave.  We ended up finishing the night at a different cocktail bar. We were very disappointed and discussed  our sadness over cocktails later that night and over breakfast the next day.  I sure hope management won't ruin this amazing place.  We recommend  it to everyone that will listen and after last night, I'm afraid to recommend it.
Last night was 3/5 @ best
All past visits 5/5.   
WILL BE BACK AGAIN BUT hoping our favorite bar just had a bad night.  The music COMPLETELY changed the vibe of this lounge for the worse!!!!!!!!

Straight up I'm not cool enough for this place. I love a craft cocktail but always cutting sugar so it's lost on me. I'm just drinking my poison on the rocks no chaser. The bar is super sexy and should not be overlooked, so much appeal! 
We came in and had the pork chop and appetizer meatballs. The pork chop was good, fat,  juicy and good quality. The meatballs however were the best restaurant meatballs I've ever had. I'll be returning for those no doubt. I'd like to make it for happy hour for their deal on the steaks but hate to battle a crowd so who knows. They take reservations so utilize that if you're interested in HH, bonus that it's the whole place not just the bar. It's been added into the rotation.

Really good place!
Drinks were good, creative.
The sweet potato tots were so good, as was the pork & figs. Happy hour deal of half off their steaks was amazing, the steak was very good.
Overall, loved the place, only bad thing I can say is it was and hour and a half after we sat down until we got our food, and they weren't very busy. We weren't exactly in a hurry, but the service was slow.

Nice place. A bit noisy. But the music was good. The menu was somewhat confusing. Be sure to look at the sides, those are the tapas. The button mushrooms were delicious. 

I had wanted the pork and figs but they were out. Meaning its popular.

Very good place. Good service, and outstanding food. I do not eat meat, and always get the sides. Jalapeño cream corn, garlicky mashed potatoes and spinach is all I need. Great place to get together with friends. Great happy hour prices, including 1/2 off steaks for you meat eaters. Parking is hard to get sometimes.

Happy hour here is amazing! The steaks are so good and half the price! Can't beat that! Customer service is great! I highly recommend you make reservations before coming the wait for walk ins is hour plus at times. Beside the wait the place is great

Happy hour review

Happy hour is from 5-8PM daily. Their specials include $5 well drinks (one mixer). They also have 1/2 off select appetizers, entrees, and a variety of steaks (those items marked with 2 stars on the menu are the specials). Other than that, there are no other happy hour specials. 

The steaks are of good quality and done properly. They are not the best steaks ever, but worth the discounted price.

There are no prices on the drink menu, but we were told that all of their cocktails range from $10-12. Drinks are interesting and well made. Bartenders are friendly, efficient, and they know their craft expertly.

The happy hour steaks come with one side of choice.

parking - free

I've been hearing people talk about this place for a long time and finally checked it out with my husband. It's rare that a place with such rave reviews lives up to it but it did. We sat at the bar for happy hour and we weren't starved so we shared a shrimp cocktail and the sliders. Shrimp was great, like an old steakhouse classic, but the sliders were incredible. We went at happy hour (which is 5-8 every night) and sat at the bar. The bartender was great and introduced us to Japanese Scotch Whiskey...what??? As well as a number of other drinks. Can't wait to go back!

Herbs and Rye has the best steak happy hour around town! They have happy hour everyday from 5-8p and 12a to closing! They offer a huge selection of steaks and happy hour is 50% off all steaks! The ribeye is the best and most tender steak on their menu! The ribeye is huge and doesn't need any extra flavor. The steaks on happy hour also come with a side, my favorite is the truffle Mac and cheese, absolutely amazing. For an appetizer you must try the beef tar tar... it's like nothing I've ever tasted!!! Unfortunately it's not on happy hour and on the little pricey side.

Went here last week with a group from work. The service was less to to be desired. When we spoke to the manager/co-owner took care a an issue we had but by that time the rest of our party left. We will not be back and I would not recommend going out of your way to go to the bar. There are other bars in the area that are 100x better in food and service.

As usual host can riun the entire evening. Its a nice place with good food but for days like Valentines day or any other holiday the owner should not allowed ignorant and people that can't handle little bit of a pressure to work as hosts. There was a short and rude girl that ignored us numerous times while we were trying to let her know that our table is supposed to be ready because we received a call for it. She was calling for a person but was to ignorant to notice that she was misspealing the name of my husband. Yeah we tried to let her know but no luck... Unpleasant and unpolite as her should find a field with no customer service involved. Next holiday it will deffinatelly be a different place. We know quite a few with welcoming and pleasant hosts. We will keep this place only for the happy hour when there is no other option.

The review below, epic. Well done Steve T. 

Came here for a drink with a friend, great service, great cocktails. Rare to find old school red velvet style wallpaper, it's from a bygone era. Prince in Koreatown is similar in decor. We agreed to return for steak but that didn't happen. Oh dayclubs. I won't be back in Vegas for a while but when I do, it'll be with some friends for that 120oz steak challenge. Mark my words!

I can't believe I've been in vegas 15 yrs and not until recently I discovered this gem. Ambiance is amazing, drinks are delicious and the food mmm mmm mmm. It's steakhouse with an incredible bar. Their drinks are wonderful and the customer service outstanding. The place is cozy, and I love love love the music  selection. They play jazz, the doors, jimmy hendrix, just really really great music.  It's become one of my favorite spots
I'm telling you this place is worth the trip. One of best steaks I've ever had and at happy hour prices you can't beat it.  Had a great waiter who took care of us well.  I highly recommend it.

This is my favorite place to come with family and friends. Anytime I want to impress someone, I always bring them here. I usually start off with a Manhattan or Old Fashion cocktail, then a Tomato Bisque. When I'm there for happy hour I'll go with the Filet topped with a wine glaze and a side of garlic mash or Mac n cheese. All the bartenders are the coolest. Mark is the most engaged in conversation, with me at least. Emily and Adam know how to liven the place up though. Ali is my favorite server.

food.  fantastic.  we always order the rib eyes and clams in both red and white sauce.  good selection for drinks too

service.  pretty good depending on server but most of the time have been pleasant.  once they drop off the stuff lacks the check ins however for additional needs at times 

frustration here is there reservation system.  seems like one person in charge and shes hard to get a hold of and have never returned our calls.  they definitely need a better system here for overall convenience.

Update.  Went on or just around Halloween.  Good times.  And they were open.

Well this is about the third time I've been here and they've "closed early". Thx for making me drive out here to get my drink on then close. Shiftys is awesome...  You guys are amateur...

Great place for just drinks or a good dinner.  Come between 5-8 for happy hour and get half price steaks. The broccoli and cheese side is awesome.  Ronnie the server was great.  My wife's new favorite place for drinks.

I've been coming here for YEARS!!!! Always an amazing time! Food is always ridiculously tasty! & needless to say is my favorite bartender & makes the most amazing drinks... (Brown Derby, is My to go too!) ...anyhow, Last night was my last official night living in Vegas & so of course, I wanted to visit & spend time at my three favorite places, oak & Ivy, Downtown Cocktail Room & end it with some delicious late-night food and drink & Herbs & Rye. Now, again. I've been coming for years!!! & last night I was wrongly, verbally attacked by the black waiter/bar tender, Joe. I was already in my zone, feeling fun, flirty & tipsy & made a silly girl joke about I can't even remember what... & He completely over reacted!!! He was being so rude & obnoxious and sarcastic that I decided to ask for another waiter.. he sees me talking to his manager (lovely Burnett girl) & in front of her proceeds to yell at me, asked me to leave "his bar", told me I was "taking money out of the owners wallet"...& just made a huge ordeal out of nothing, literally through a bitch tantrum in front of management. Made me tear up, because it was my last night in Vegas & I was at one of my favorite places (to which I'm a regular too) & being treated like absolute dirt!! His behavior was completely uncalled for & utterly embarrassing!! I did nothing to deserve that! The manager was sweet and apologized and gave me a different waitress & EVEN STILL, he continued to hover over our table (that was located near the bar) ask my friends questions directed towards me. Again, completely rude and embarrassing and immature AF!!! He asked.. "Will you ask her if she'd like water"..!? Like... excuse me!? NOOOO I ALREADY ASKED FOR ANOTHER WAITRESS BECAUSE OF YOUR Ridiculous ANTICS & So can't you please leave us be...!!? I told him he was  insanely rude and I was surprised by his behavior & don't need or want to talk to you! He would just not let it go!!! His manager had to come back over a second time to address the situation again (his attitude) & told him to Leave Our Table Alone!  5-6  years I've been coming to this place and never, have I ever had a bad thing to say about Herbs & Rye.. I've brought hundreds of first timers to this restaurant/bar! I frequently come there on my own and sit at the bar...  The bartender was just having a bad night, on some weird power trip & I was the one he decided to take it out on.. NOT COOL!!! Joe (pretty sure That's his name) should be fired. He dose not deserve to work with some of the best bar tenders in Las Vegas. I was truly disgusted by his behavior... shame on you.

Always a favorite, and always a local hunt swiftly turning into an uber tourist destination as well.

Cocktails are king at this place and have been since its birth. styled like an old speakeasy the bartenders are true cocktail Craftsman. The menu is divided up by Era and it is really fun to try a new drink every time I come. 

The stakes are half price on happy hour but remember to make a reservation because it's always packed. Tonight was not my first time but it is my first time reviewing. I have had almost everything on the menu and have never been disappointed.

Cool spot with some killer cocktails!

I love it when bartenders take their craft seriously and drinking becomes an experience. This place doesn't fail and when we walked in around 8pm on a Friday night the bar was packed and the restaurant had a 30 min wait; deservingly so.

The bartenders are great and it has a very cool vibe with friendly locals who are happy it's finally Friday! Two couples moved around to fit my man and I immediately as we walked in and that was a really nice gesture. We had several cocktails and definitely began feeling tipsy on drink two. Pretty pathetic but these suckers were strong! 

After a short time we were called for our table and we were starving! Everything tastes better when you're tipsy! Well almost everything! 

So let's get to the food. Started with a margarita flat bread which was good (still on my search for amazing margarita pizza) and then the filet sliders. These were by far the highlight of the experience. The meat was so tender with caramelized onions, horse radish sauce on a very soft potato bun (AMAZING)! Then we wanted something decadent and decided on the penne. It was so salty we couldn't take more then a few bites. It tasted like eating spoons full of salt. As tipsy as I was I couldn't do it. We told our waitress and she was kind enough to ask if we wanted it remade but we decided to skip as we wanted to save ourselves for something sweet. That dish was straight up nasty. We ordered the hot donuts and they made up for the pasta! Overall good food but that penne really screwed us up. The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars was over that.

The service was great. Strong cocktails to get a nice buzz going and maybe we just got unlucky with the pasta. Everything else was good.

The decor is cool with a very back in the day feel when the cool kids were bootlegging in dark places. I would definitely try this place again.
I absolutely LOVE this place. I have been here many times and have never had a bad meal or been disappointed - my steak always melts in my mouth! Can't wait to go again!
The 4 star is for the steak, flat bread(pizza) and customer service not a good fan of their linguini clam pasta. The place is great for a lovely dinner date.

This is a hidden gem in Las Vegas. It's not downtown or on the strip which are the most ideal places to go for a drink. It's right off Charleston and has a great atmosphere with pretty bomb drinks as well. My favorite part is the historical typa feel it gives.
With my gorgeous wife at Herbs & Rye, she's having a classic cocktail and We're having  a couple of killer steaks.
Great place for a nice kickback dinner. The salmon and steak were awesome. Will definitely be back for happy hour when even those awesome steaks are half off!!!

It was my friend's birthday and we wanted to try someplace new. This was an excellence decision.  We arrived at 6:30pm on a Friday of Fight Weekend not knowing what we're walking into with no reservations. Probably a fluke but we were seated right away. We spent more time on the drink menu because of all the amazing selection. I got a French 1275 and birthday girl got a tiki drink. Neither one of us were disappointed. She got the Mediterranean flatbread and I got the linguine and clam's and just like our drinks neither of us were disappointed. The linguine and clam sauce is on the spicy side so just beware. I wish I could remember our waiter's name but without me even asking to do a dessert for the birthday girl , he told me he was going to bring out to a sweet. Now that's customer service!! What we also appreciated was the fact the entire staff DIDNT sing. It was kept low key and a class act! We will definitely be back for more happy hours!!

Wife and I came here for our anniversary dinner and it was great! MarK came and introduced himself with a handshake and to tell us his name was MarK with a K. He was hilarious, full of jokes and music and movie references. We started with the Carpaccio which was delicious Then our main courses we had the Spicy Mussels along with the NY Strip Steak with the Whiskey Shallot Potatoes on the side. Everything was delicious, steak was cooked exactly how I ordered it and it cut like butter. I got the Brandy Peppercorn Sauce to drizzle on top and it was a good addition. After our meal we ordered the donuts which were so warm and soft. 

The music in this place was so great and all over the spectrum. We thoroughly enjoyed our anniversary dinner and MarK with a K was such a great waiter. Everything came out expediently which surprised us for how busy they were. We can't wait to go back here again and maybe it will be for happy hour because I've read that steaks are 50% off. Done! Go here and leave fat, full and happy because I know we did.

This place was recommended to me by a local. The rib eye was great but the best part of it is this place has a happy hour from 5 - 8 and most everything on the menu is 1/2 price including all of their steaks!
The parking lot was packed with a bunch of local license plates. A good thing. Mine was one of only two cars in the entire parking lot from California.
The entire wait staff and especially Christian were very attentive.
I highly recommend the spot especially during happy hour.

I have a tendency to always come for happy hour - everyday 5-8pm and 12pm-close. It's awesome because you can get a steak and one side for half off! Even though its happy hour, the quality of the food doesn't go down. The atmosphere inside is very reminiscent of an old Western movie. Make sure to get a mint julep! It's really strong and one usually does the trick for me. Just make sure to make a reservation before you go to avoid waiting if you're going for happy hour. There was this one time I went around 650-7 but wasn't seated til 8ish and got charged full price, because we ordered after 8.

Not their best showing. Waitress left a LOT to be desired. Had to ask for a 2nd beer two times and never got it. Asked for bread 3 times. No go! Medium steaks are apparently red and mushy in the middle. Don't ask for a deviation from the menu, won't happen. All told, very disappointed. I'll give it or more shot, MAYBE, but would never recommend it based on this trip. Sorry.

This is an awesome little gem hidden behind the strip. Even better if you go during their happy hour between 5 & 8. Half off steaks and well drinks. The atmosphere of the restaurant is just great. They have an awesome prohibition theme menu for their cocktails which you have to try!!! I also recommend the ribeye it was delicious and cooked to perfection!!! If you are looking for a low key off the strip joint l, this is the spot!!
Had dinner here on 2/15 at 6:30 with a group of 6. The cocktails were fabulous and so were the steaks - plus they were half off! If I lived in the area I would go back often.

Great steaks prepared perfectly, a great selection of craft beers & unique cocktails. The only thing that prevents this from being 5 stars was the wait & service. Our group of 4 had an 8:30pm reservation. We arrived at 8:00pm & checked in with the hostess. She promptly informed us that "Your table will not be ready until 8:30."  That was fine we had planned on a predinner cocktail in the lounge prior to our meal. When 9:00pm arrived and one of our group checked with the hostess her response was "We are waiting for a table to clear, we will come get you when it's ready." Other than the wait & her attitude it was a great experience.

I found out about this place from a Vegas local. We went at 2am to take advantage of their happy hour (50% off steaks). The restaurant is off strip and very dark inside. I ordered the clams (very good), whilst my husband ordered the steak (good). The service was prompt and friendly. With the 50% off the food was great value.

I have no word to describe how great the food, drinks and service was!!!! Besides that they opened 15 mins late everything was awesome! We had the calamari for an appetizer was to die for! We got a NY strip with garlic mashed and a flat bread both were so good!!

This is my husband and I's go to steakhouse. We always know we will have great service and amazing food and drinks. 

Let's start with the vibe. When you pull up you will definitely think this is a gaming sports bar or a strip club and from the outside that is what it looks like. But as soon as you step inside you will see what a hidden gem this is. It has a speakeasy old-school feel. Wall paper, chandeliers, wooden bar... what else could you want. I love to eat at the bar or in the bar area, just because I feel like the vibe is better and cozier, but the dining room is nice as well. 

Onto cocktails. The wonderful thing about Herbs & Rye is that not only are they a fantastic steakhouse, but they put just as much effort into their craft cocktails and menu as they do their food. The menu is set up by era, so if you know what you like, it's easy to find, and if you don't the menu is fun to read. The bartenders will also give you suggestions depending on what you like. Personally I go for the Tiki Boom era every time and they make an awesome Painkiller here. Just a little note for the tiki freaks out there...

While the steaks here are great, the real star of the show are the sides. Personal Favorites:
Jalapeno Creamed Corn
Truffle Mac & Cheese
Truffle Parmesan Steak Fries
Sweet Potato Tots w/ Marshmallow Crust (OMG)

Now not just steak is on the menu of course. One of my favorite entrees here is actually not a steak. I am obsessed with the Yard Bird & Risotto. Seriously so amazing.

This place has something for everyone.

Came here on a date. Food was awesome drinks rocked, server was awesome but the bartender was an asshole. 
The girls drink came, stank like someone puked in it and there was bits floating around, the server smelled it and gave an odd look stating he will get another. For 10 minutes the server and bartender began conversing about the drink and the bartender sipped it till it was all gone. The server stated to the bartender he's starring at me just make another drink. He didn't. So I got up, threw the receipt book with $20 tip inside and walked out. He shouted Oh ill make you another, I replied, STICK IT.
In my opinion, the bartenders an asshole, failed to make another drink and when I was walking out the door offered. It doesn't take over 10 minutes to make a drink, especially when you finished the whole thing.

Went for happy hour on 7/14. The half off wine was nice, I thought there would be more appetizer type food for happy hour, which is what I typically go for. But the things on happy hour special were steaks and honestly full meals.  The food was good but just not what I was expecting. The steak was well seasoned and cooked well. I had the Brussels sprouts side and it was amazing, flavorful and the little crispy parts were the best!!!!!!

Friendly welcoming service. Dark romantic setting. The service was top notch. Friendliest staff I've ever met. Had the yard bird and that was spectacular. Pork chop with fig was my favorite. Loved this place !!!

The first problem with this place as well as many restaurants in Las Vegas is the horrendous smell of raw sewage that emanates from the bathroom, which is located in the front of the place.  The food is pretty decent and the service does leave alot to be desired.  The main problem is the stench and I can't believe no one has said anything about it.

This place was tokd to us by many... unfortunately our 1st visit wasn't what we were expecting. We went for the happy hour and or steak was rubber literally rubber. I'm okay with paying 30 to 60 for a steak better be good. The environment was fabulous and the bread and butter is amazing but that's where it stops.  Customer service was good. The staff comped our non eaten food and offered to replace however,  at that point we were done. I give 3 stars because they were trying to correct our problem.  I definitely want to give credit where credit is due. Would not be my 1st recommendation but, for drinks would be a fun place to be.

Happy was amazing! I highly recommend a reservation. The NY Strip with horseradish sauce was to DIE FOR!!! So  grateful to Ronnie for suggesting the best drinks and explaining the portion sizes! I will definitely be back!
Best classic cocktails in town. Be patient they take time. Food is good. Ambiance is perfect

Great reverse happy hour! An amazing local spot!!! It's a speak easy, vintage ambiance. Craft cocktails with a very descriptive menu so that you can try new things and know the era in which it is from. My go to drink is the brandy cresta (if I'm spelling that correctly, lol). It's forward on the citrus side with sugar on the rim! I also had A brandy Alexander which is more in the creamy, after dinner side. Both were great and out of my normal bubble. 

Now let's get to steak!!!! They are known for their steaks!!!!! They are half off on happy hour. I hadn't been here Ina few months, I noticed they raised their prices, but still reasonable for happy hour. I ordered the NY strip with truffle Mac and cheese and added a onion and mushroom topper to my steak! I am a fan but of the topper option! With every slice I'm getting my toppings! 

If you're looking for an experience, try and grab a seat at the bar! The mixologist are fun, captivating and very interacting! They might even take a drink with you!

Update to the old review of the drinks:

Food is good as well! Nice steaks and a good selection of appetizers as well!

Started with the beef tartare, a little light in portion size but was still good, very tasty umami beefy goodness. Wife got the Caesar salad, pretty standard. Cousin got the wedge salad, this looked amazing, and came with super thick cut, awesomely awesome bacon pieces. Definitely have to get this if you go.

I had the ribeye, ordered medium rare, and I was very pleased to see it was cooked perfectly. The beef was well marbled and no gristle. It had the taste of an aged steak but I can't say it was a Vegas top ten, then again there are some serious steak places here. Wife had the filet, also cooked expertly, these people know how to cook some meat.

Drinks were once again awesome, and the whiskey selection is very respectable.

Only complaint was the service, the guys were super nice and chill but it took quite a while to get orders and drinks, and although water refills came quickly I can't say anything else did. Course I was borderline hangry so my perception could have been altered just a bit.

Overall I recommend going and trying it out. Check out the old review for the cocktail review.

BIG PARTY BEWARE! BIG PARTY BEWARE! BIG PARTY BEWARE!
So I would like to share my personal experience of this establishment. I came here with a party of 8 on a Thursday night at 6:30 for their HH. Since I am not a local, I made sure to make a reservation just in case it gets busy. Shortly after, I received a call for confirmation. The host was very nice, told us about HH and that there would be a 20% gratuity for large parties, which is pretty basic big party procedure. Everything was great, we arrive on time, got seated fairly fast. 

Right when we got seated, a server and busser introduced themselves and told us about HH and 20% gratuity for big parties, which was fine. BUT OF COURSE, HE WOULD FAIL TO MENTION SOMETHING VERY VERY VERY IMPORTANT and I betcha A LOT of YOU won't really noticed this... But after looking at 50% off steaks, you think you got yourself a nice deal right? WRONG! At least for big parties who get auto gratuity during HH.

I shall explain, here they told us that 20% grat would be added to our bill correct? So for example, you ate $200 worth of food but HH makes it $100, then adding 20% grat TOTAL should EQUAL $120. WHAT THEY FAILED TO MENTION WAS THAT GRAT WAS BASED ON FULL PRICED MENU PRICE. So what does that mean? WELL...INSTEAD of 20 off $100, its 20 off $200, which EQUAL to $40. INSTEAD of $120, you would be charged $100 + $40 (the actual grat) = $140. So you're basically paying 40% tip. INSANE!!! 

It screams SCAM SCAM SCAM! You think we are suckers!!! This is such BAD ETHIC for your restaurant. Not only did they fail to mention to us at the beginning of seating. They also failed to mention it to me when I asked for about their policy during the confirmation called. Quite frankly I feel CHEATED like they think we're idiots. Plus, the restaurant was dim so it was very hard to read anything...I did not find out about this until we were going over the finance of our visit. 


If I knew of this policy, I would have split up the party into 4 and 4 and avoided this excessive charged, but how was I to know when all your staffs just told me it would be 20% gratuity, which normally the amount I tip anyways.  SO PLEASE, check your bills guys seriously because they will not readjust the bill for you unless you are there. Unfortunately, we found out about this when we got back home ( in Cali). And yes, already talked to their management, not much they can do. But for all you yelpers out there hopefully, my post will help you reconsider.

Made reservations online for 7pm dinner and immediately received a confirmation from Michelle Meyer.  Shortly we moved up our reservation to 7:30pm and Michelle responded with "sure".

We arrived at 7:05pm but circled the parking lot twice and thought maybe we should eat elsewhere.  However, after 15 minutes of circling Chinatown, we decided to try Herbs and Rye once more.  Found a parking spot - at this point it was 7:25pm.

Walked in with a sleuth of people waiting looking very anxious.  Approached Brittney at the podium and was immediately attacked in a loud tone that we were late and can't hold tables more than 30 minutes.  I explained to her that our reservation changed to 7:30pm.  Showed her the email and Brittney's response was "well no one told me!"  My husband and I were shocked to have been spoken to in that matter in front of a line of customers.  The waiting area is very small and narrow that the waiting customers can't help but hear the conversation. Brittney says we'll need to wait 30 minutes since she was never informed.  Not even a apology.

We walked out as  I refuse to be ridiculed and belittled by a 21 year old who has no clue when it comes to service.  Treating customers as if we should be honored that she's holding the golden key into dining with Herbs & Rye.

We drove from the Southwest side because of the raving reviews and recommendations of this restaurant.  No thank you.   Not wasting our hard money for tactless experience.  We opted for dinner on the Strip.  Pricier - but a better and classier dining experience. 

It's unfortunate that Britney is Herb & Rye's front face and first point of contact.  Suggestion: send her to customer service and etiquette training.

Decent steak prices... pushy service.

This place in the in the hood.  It looks ghetto from the outside but actually very nice inside.  We had reservations at 5:30 and their Happy Hour is 5-8, however, nobody was being let in and nobody from the restaurant was telling the growing crowd what was going on, which was beyond frustrating.  There were delivery people trying to get in but they wouldn't let them either.  

They finally opened the doors at 6pm and checked in.

#NOTE;   If you want a booth... you have to reserve it while you're making the reservation.  Who knew?  You'd think with the 1,000 questions the staff asks you while ordering, this would have been something they would have mentioned... but I guess it's not an 'add on', they don't care.

We got seated and IMMEDIATELY, "What kind of cocktails can I get you?"  I mean, as we were sitting down and not even looking at the menu yet.  We asked for a minute and literally got a minute, "Decided on some cocktails yet?"  Geez-us.  We asked for water for now and she was clearly upset.
