Pork Chop was perfectly cooked. Nice big chunk of pork on my plate. The truffle Mac & Cheese was oh so delicious melt in your mouth. 

The atmosphere is dark and intimate, from the outside it looks like a small space. Walking in there they had 2 sides of dining rooms. and a big bar area. I would definitely recommend this place. And next time I will order dessert.

For our first time to vegas, we discovered this local gem. My wife and i were looking for something different  than what we had on tbe strip.  The food was excellent,  service was great, and the drinks were out of this world.  I have been telling my friends about  our dining experience. We are looking forward to our next trip to vegas so we can stop by again!

Tasty cocktails, unique and historical recipes.  Not so great appetizer menu.  Prices seemed a little high and the only food on the "happy hour" menu seemed to be steak.....strange.  Exterior definitely does not match the interior, which is cooler than it first appears when you drive up.

I think this place is awesome. The atmosphere is great, food is delicious, and the prices are ridiculously low during happy hour. The hostess, bar tender, and our waiter were really nice. I never post yelp reviews but i couldn't get over how much i liked this place. Okay thats not really why, i just wanted to point this out because ive never seen business reaponses so savage before to 1 stars. So, i was bored as hell at work, i work night shift, and im going over the reviews. And my co worker has gone here too so we were just talking about the place. I start reading these 1 stars and i come across nectaly M. responses from herbs and rye. They're savage af but pretty entertaining to say the least. My night flew by trying to find 1 stars, then crossing my fingers hoping...no...praying that there's a response from nectaly. I dunno, maybe ill even get a savage response. Well...now, we wait.

Overall, a great spot for a late night cocktail & steak. The value here is to come during happy hour, when the steaks are 50% off & include 1 side dish. My buddy & I dropped in at 1am after doing a long gig on the strip one night. Our server was awesome. His name was Joe, I think. He was attentive, & professional, while joking around with us. The drinks were well made, although my chilled house vodka was a bit watered down. My buddy ordered the Pabst Blue Ribbon NA beer. We were laughing about it until we tasted it. It was probably one of the best non alcoholic beers I've ever tasted! The filet mignon was nice. My buddy had the NY. Both steaks were cooked properly, & had a ton of flavor. We also had corn, & mushrooms. Both were good. I would never pay full price for a meal here, but the 50% discount makes it worth a trip

I was in H&R on 12/21 and thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience. Fast forward three days to 12/24 for my second visit in the same week. I called and also checked online for any special hours that may be in effect for the holiday. No special voice mail message alerting guests of anything different. I show up at 530P to find numerous cars in front all wondering what's going on with the place being closed. 

Nectaly - in the future please update your website and voice mail greeting if you choose to change your hours for special holidays.

Very loud place and the entrance is on a gas station but I must say the moment u going inside u kind of in shock. Place has its magic , food is great stuff is awesome and omg the ribeye steak is amazing  I'll see u guys soon.

I give it 4 stars because its a great place to eat, bit pricey but if you go during happy hour its worth it. There is a very wide selection of drinks. The place is pretty awesome, like from the prohibition days. Drinks are priced around $10-15 for their specialty drinks. We had steaks, steaks were delicious and the bread and butter were amazing. For dessert we had the donuts... those was delicious!  I gave it 1 less star because we had reservations for 7:30 and we showed up 15 mins till. They werent ready to seat us so we decided to wait at the bar. When going to the bar we noticed multiple spaces open and asked if we could sit there. They said no you must will till 7:30pm. So we waited at the bar. Next to the bar we noticed some seats that had signs saying they were reserved. 7:30pm comes around and waitress goes to seat us.. sure enough its at the spots that said reserved! Why couldnt they seat us prior? So inconvenient. But at least the food made up for the poor first impression.
Great service. Excellent whiskey selection. Very intimate and personal local service with well cooked grass fed beef. This place is awesome and open late.

Made reservations here for nothing basically since we had to wait an hour anyway when we got there. The male hostess was non responsive and doesn't give you updates on your table. BUT they did a good job in making up for it in comping a good amount of our meal. Plus the food was great.

Amazing.
Just everything. 
Ambiance, service, food, cocktails. 
Great steaks and sides. 
Cocktails are handcrafted using fresh ingredients. 
Gets packed so I recommend making a reservation.
the staff is great!  you have to be very specific when ordering your food-otherwise it may not come out like you expected.  Great variety of specialty drinks!

If you're going to become a regular at any bar in Vegas, this is the one.

Yes half-price steaks after midnight are the selling point. But at any hour, unless you're a meathead or a meathead's female equivalent, this is your bar. Walk in, be greeted warmly, get drunk, have a great time. A treasure.

The best steakhouse in Vegas! We go every year for our anniversary and they always make us feel so welcomed! Mark is the best and really makes sure to recognize your special occasion. Will be back for sure sooner rather than later! The food is amazing and the drinks are delicious.

I just can't say enough good things about this place,  but for starters 50:% off the good menu for Happy hour which includes   their steak,  how can you go  wrong???  And by the way,  the steak is the amazing part!! I've had the ribeye twice with blue cheese crust and it's perfect,  actually probably best steak I've had in Vegas.  We had the spinach,  jalapeño corn,  button mushrooms,  truffle Mac and cheese,  broccoli and cheddar and they were all great,  mushrooms being the best :)  the ambiance is great totally unexpected for the area and the waiter was fabulous,  we ordered 2 desserts the chocolate chip cookies with ice cream,  which was magical omg and the bread pudding which  was ok....  The only thing they keep it like an ice room in there so bring a sweater!!  You will not be disappointed,  oh and happy hour ends at 8pm!!!
In love with this place! Just love the cocktails and the vibe it has. Moscow mule is sooo yummy! Service is always great. Make sure you make a reservation if you want a booth, they get pretty busy.

Bad surprise at the end. 

The restaurant is located a bit far from the strip with strip prices.  Located among pawn shops and alike we got a bit scared but the good thing there is a parking in front of the restaurant. 

The prohibition like ambiance is kind of cool and you feel part of a boardwalk empire episode. You expect James Gandolphini or Joe Pesci showing up at any time. 

If you are budget conscious you'd better ask for the price of he cocktails before you order. We only took appetizers and no entrees but the cocktails were half of the bill and it wasted our entire experience. 

The food was ok and the bread was really dry and old. 

Disappointed.
This is a hidden gem. Great atmosphere and fun clientele. Emily is the best bar tender with flair!

Classic cocktails done RIGHT. Old recipes with a mix of flavors not available elsewhere. The bartenders know their stuff. Its worth going for the drinks alone, but you can get a good steak as well for not a lot of $. I went during "Happy Hour" 5-8pm which saw some menu items half off. The Filet Mignon was GREAT, and at half price was a good deal as well. A good drink, steak, garlic mashed potatoes and truffle mac and cheese (amazing) brought the bill to $36. Not a bad deal at all. Highly recommend.

Herbs and Rye has yet to disappoint me! The drinks are always amazing and hit the spot. The food is also great, I love the calamari. Shoutout to Mark! We've gotten him as a server twice and he's always given us amazing recommendations for drinks. We don't even look at the menu anymore, just tell him what we like and he'll give you something you love.

Herbs and Rye is an interesting bar spot amongst its area. The interior serves a 1920's style theme. They're known for their steaks here but I personally didn't find it all that amazing. We ordered the truffle mac n cheese, the carpaccio, the ny ribeye, and to drink I got the pisco sour. The pisco sour was pretty good, with a good mixture amount of alcohol in it to keep me satisfied haha. The steak wasn't all too amazing in my opinion though, we ordered it medium rare, but it was still very plain tasting, tough, and chewy. It was more of a well done cooked steak. The truffle mac n cheese was okay as well but again I didn't feel it was anything special, the carpaccio was also decent but still no fireworks. Over all the prices are a little expensive considering I really didn't feel anything amazing from this place in terms of its food. Our waiter was extremely nice though which made up for it, he was knowledgeable about the drinks and menu and even offered us some nice suggestions we might like base on our taste. I wouldn't mind coming back here as a nice lounge around spot to bar hop for drinks if I am in the mood for a Chicago style prohibition atmosphere bar, but if someone asks me where I want to eat at in the future, unfortunately Herbs and Rye doesn't seem to be the first name that will come to mind.

This was our second time visiting Herb and Rye and our experience was just awesome. The waitress was super attentive and the food was amazing. A good friend of mine had originally recommended the establishment, and it didn't disappoint.

I can't really speak for the alcohol as I don't drink, but the steak and the sides I ordered were delicious! We also shared the clam appetizer. That's was one of our favorites. Delicious!

Definitely would recommend this establishment! As this is a nicer establishment and higher quality meals, definitely expect to pay in that price point. Definitely coming back again!

I liked the sweet Thai sauce it was so yummy it should come served over a bed of rice I was temped to start licking the plate!  I ordered a filet with Mac and cheese and my bf got the ny with mashed potatoes..  I preferred my filet over the ny but they were both very good and cooked perfectly!   My mac n cheese was actually kind of gross!  I did not care for it at all Kraft out of the box has satisfied me better!!  The mashed potatoes were very tasty!! I can't wait to come back!!

I wanted to love this from the get go.I have read so much about it.Long story short I don't think I will be back or could recommend this place for food.Maybe a cocktail yes as the menu for such was outstanding.Service was weak sorry Thor when I have to ask you more then once for another beverage you slip.What is wrong for a server to be locked on, is it to much to ask? Paying steak house prices for a steak on a plate and getting nothing more the sweet potato processed tater tots not impressed. Loved the decor and think you have something but asking for change from the bartender and getting attitude ( green lantern) not good. Man I wanted to love you!
I love this place! Great food and drinks! And homemade donuts! Awesome vibe sorta like an old school speak easy with a good old fashion.

First off, the food here definitely deserves a 5/5. The one star deduction comes from the service. 

I kept hearing about this place, and finally decided to try it out. I was told to definitely go for the happy hour - and everybody was right (half-off all well drinks, almost all steaks and some seafood). With that said, try one of their craft cocktails; there are easily 50 to choose from. For the quality and flavor, $11 is a steal. 

My dinner partner liked the spicy mussels we ordered as an appetizer, but I found them to be a bit heavy handed on the oregano. 

We ordered the NY strip and a filet mignon, asparagus, Mac and cheese, garlic mashed potatoes and the brussel sprouts with honey swine - and not a bite disappointed. Absolutely stellar food. The chef even came around and asked several tables if everything was to their liking. Very personable, and a nice touch. 

My only complaint was the service. Our server was sometimes hard to find, and incredibly slow bringing drinks. They were busy, but given the relatively small size of the venue, there's no way it took the bartender 15 minutes to pour two glasses of wine. We ordered as soon as we were served dinner (would have ordered before, but the waiter was nowhere to be seen) and had to stop eating halfway through so we could have some food left to enjoy with the wine. 

I will definitely be back (can't beat $128 for phenomenal steaks, sides, 4 drinks and an appetizer), with fingers crossed for a better server.

Great speakeasy kind of place. The bartenders/ mixologist are awesome and super friendly!!! Emily helped us and gave us choices and even when I didn't take her first suggestion, she was happy to give me more options and the cocktail she made was amazing!! Will be back here again!!

The drinks are absolutely delicious. Matt the bartender is so very talented. We started with sidecars, which were superior. Then we asked him to make us something around the same but a little spicy. He came up with this drink that I have never tasted and it blew us away. The man knows how to make anything and everything. We also had some food which was also very delicious. Thank you Matt for such great service and fine beverages.

Ugh, these were the coolest bartenders ever. It's a rarity to find fantastic hospitality and every single bartender remember every single one of our groups names. I had the best time here. Amazing vibe which reminded me of Chicago cocktail bars with TLC.  Kinson, Joe, and Adam were the best. Oh also, Big Lou for president. 
Love,
Chicago friends!

Lived in Vegas for 12 years and just found out about this restaurant about 8 months ago.  Hands down one of my favorite restaurants.  The quality of the food is amazing.  Linguine and Calms are my favorite.  Don't forget to get the donuts for dessert!  Yum!!

The perfect restaurant to enjoy a delightful meal.  Excellent food, service, location, and price especially during happy hour!  Who could ask for more?!  

The location is off the strip but not too far which works well for both tourists and locals.  It is fairly easy to find, too.  I never have problems with parking, which is a plus.  

You're immediately greeted by the host and seated with little to no wait at all.  They have a private seating area, bar area seating, and a dining area as well.  

The interior and decor has a great Italian old school vibe to it.  The bathroom (yes, I have to review that, too) is well maintained and beautiful.  

Outstanding menu with non alcoholic and alcoholic beverages to choose from.  Their appetizer, entree, and dessert selections are great and vegetarian friendly also.  The calamari and rib eye are my all time favorite.  Great presentation!  Food quality is phenomenal!  Portions are great!  The waiters are knowledgeable.  Wait time for food is acceptable.  

Our server was very attentive to refilling our drinks and asking how things were.  The bill is brought out when you're ready to pay.  You don't feel rushed at all.  Very pleasant staff!

If you're looking for great Italian food, this is definitely the place to eat!

Had dinner last night with some friends.  Flatbread and truffle fries are life changers.  Do yourself a favor and order the warm chocolate cookie for dessert.  If you're watching your waistline, skip out.  Enjoy!

Herbs and Rye is a swanky prohibition style cocktail lounge west of the Las Vegas Strip. They have an impressive menu of hand crafted cocktails to choose from and a fantastic dining menu as well. The mixologists serve up old school cocktail classics as well as new creations based on older traditions. This venue is not for vodka lovers as the majority of cocktails are made with whisky and gin. The stiff drinks are served up in the correct antique glassware in a venue that looks reminiscent of a bar scene in a film noir. Wear a fedora to complete the experience.
Amazing steak and drinks! The happy hour is best in town, hands down! Who can beat half price steaks?

Herbs & Rye tonight for late night happy hour! Having a treat myself night now that I'm feeling better :) this meal was Fantastic!!! & I eat well all the time. Ordered the 9oz Filet Mignon with a side of truffle mac & cheese. Wow, just wow! Been awhile since since I had a steak so good I didn't need steak sauce (I got a side anyways). These steaks for half off are a steal. The truffle Mac & cheese was delicious. A light truffle taste, but the Mac is very cheesy with a good consistency. Didn't take any flash pictures to capture the low light ambiance in the joint. Definitely one of the best happy hours in town.

I drink wine, beer and whiskey neat...there aren't too many places where I WANT to order a drink.  Herbs & Rye is one of them!

Fell in love with the aviation here and have lost track of the gin drinks I have sense enjoyed here.

Current favorite drink here is the Brown Derby (Bourbon/Honey/Grapefruit/Yum) 

H&R has a nice vintage/hipster feel to it.
Our two entrees were very good. Service was exceptional and the dessert was excellent. Portions generous. Drink menu extensive. Nice relaxing atmosphere.

This place is a hidden jewel.  Parking is hard due to the limited space but you forget about it once you taste the food.  From appetizers (calamari & meatballs) to the main dish (risotto & flatbread) it was all great!  Our waiter handled a party of 11 by himself with ease.  We will definitely be back!

You don't know how much I love you,
You don't know how much I care.

This review is way old but since I'm sick and have nothing better to do than stare at my feet and feel like crap I thought I'd catch up on old reviews before they are erased from memory.

Happy Hour is where its at son!
1/2 off Steaks (and a gnocchi I just couldn't pass up)

The vibe is straight up sexy, (I never use that word because I feel awkward saying it out loud) but its just dark, sultry and sleek and straight out of an old-school movie.  

The specialty cocktails are divine, the bartenders take their time and they know wassup.  Quality drinks cost money, but oh what a way to burn.

Best steakhouse in Las Vegas, hands down. Come here for happy hour for 50% off steaks (some pastas and clans/mussels also included for 50% off). Prohibition style decor, it's very dark inside so I had a hard time reading the menu but it's all part of the experience. Big plus - you can make a reservation for happy hour.

Half off happy hour steaks, that's where it's at.  The items on the menu with 2 star icons denote the items that are half off during happy hour =)  The sides, are a bit, pricey for how small they were.  The steak is just a good hunk of meat, it's probably choice but whatever they cook that baby in departs a great flavor =d  I'd skip the mac and cheese and stick with the smashed potatoes.

ps...skip the restroom, I hear it's haunted @_@

Tonight was date night for me and my boyfriend and our first time at Herbs & Rye. Our experience was amazing! Great food with great service is rare and we got both, along with fantastic happy hour deals and a wonderful atmosphere. We will definitely be back.

Quite possibly one of my new favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. I came here with two friends on a weekday evening for dinner. 

My only complaint was that the lights kept changing for some reason from normal dining atmosphere dimness to really really dark and it was kind of distracting. At one point we even joked and were wondering if we were about to witness a performance. Also parking was kind of annoying and I had to park in a sketchy ally quite a ways down from the building, but it wasn't the end of the world. 

I had a moscow mule to drink and it was AMAZING. It is one of my staple drinks and they served it with a ball of very finely crushed ice inside of a copper mug which made it more of a slushee moscow mule, but either way it was amazing.

For dinner I had the pork and figs and it was also amazing. Perfectly cooked and a VERY thick cut of meat. It was served over potatoes.

The service was also really good, and best of all was the happy hour pricing which made what could have easily of been a very expensive dinner, a pretty reasonable one. I cannot wait to go back soon!

Aly was such an amazing server. She was incredibly knowledgable. She had great cocktail suggestions and just really knew the menu. She was incredibly attentive and just had a pleasant demeanor. As for the food, fantastic as always. My brother and I both got a ribeye, I got mine blue cheese and bacon crusted at a medium rare temp. IT WAS fantastic. We also started off with the calamari like usual and of course it was as good as always. Every time I come to H&R it's a great experience. I tell all my friends. It's also one of the best happy hour deals I've seen. Half off steaks???? What???? It's so satisfying paying $23 for a filet mignon that I would GLADLY spend $46 on. So to wrap up this review, Aly is amazing and I'll probably start requesting her when I come in.

went there on a memorial weekend vegas trip on advice from Yelp .. sooo glad I did. ive never had a steak sooo good.. ribeye with blue cheese crust and filet mignon with herbs and rye rub.. truffle mac and asparagus.. went during 5 -8 happy hr.. half price steaks were $22.  and $24.. the others on the menu just sound insanely expensive. but these were worth $50 each..soooo goood!!! yummmm!!! waiter was a cool young man..no complaints... they played old black and white mobster movies in the bar which has booths too!! its tiny.. pitch black with a dim light to barely see your waiters face.. LOVE IT!!  bartender was a total cutie old school kinda guy..made some amazing cocktails too!! must try the Pims Cup Cucumber Mint drink! GULP!!!  sides were extra. total for two with one drink each.. including tip $85...  worth that and more due to flavor explosion!! also medium rare was cooked perfect!!  we got there right at 5pm. it was not very busy but full and food wasnt fast but perfectly timed!!!  the outside looks like a crappy night club.. lol.. dont let that fool you.. we will return on our next vegas trip for sure!!!!  one thing im confused on is our waiter said they didnt have any happy hour drink specials..?? WTF?  we ate in the bar in a nice comfy booth!  the music is quite loud which i would have loved if they werent playing the pop Beyonce hip hop .. didnt fit the scene or the customers..

Excellent place to get steaks late at night! Food does take a bit to come out, but it is worth the wait once it comes out. I recommend coming here during happy hours where half the menu is at 50% off. The food is pretty pricy.

Love this place! The atmosphere is swanky and the staff is friendly. My boyfriend and I always come here when we are in town. Come to happy hour between 5-8pm or 12-3am for half off the littleneck clams and steak. All of the steaks I have tried are amazing. Try with one of their marinades. The signature cocktails are not part of happy hour but they are also a must try. Really cool history to go along with each cocktail and great presentation and taste. One of my favorites is the clover club.

After two consecutive incidents with the same server, Debra, I'm forced to write this review. First happened February 14th, 2014. My girlfriend and I came in for dinner. She took our order wrong, food came out wrong, runner went back into kitchen, couple minutes later food came out right so no big deal. Debra however pretended it didn't happen and didn't even apologize. Again, no big deal. Left her a 18% tip and totaled it to 90$ on my card. On my credit card statement I was charged 100$. 

I Talked to the manager, Alennry, on the phone and said he was busy at the moment so he gave me his email to explain the situation. Emailed him twice over the course of two weeks and no reply. I ended up letting it go, convincing myself it could have been an honest mistake. 

April 12th, 2014 rolls around and I decide their happy hour sounds good, which it is. Don't get me wrong it's a great happy hour. Again were sat in Debra's section. Funny right? This time I total my card to 33$ and I was charged 38$, same thing with my girlfriends card. Now I'm at the point where I'm very upset because it's clear Debra is forging credit card tips. Being a server in the Vegas industry myself I know this is the biggest no no. 

Now I go in and talk to Nectaly himself about the situation. He seemed very sorry and genuine about the situation and said he would get the money refunded. At the end of the day, the extra 5$ charged on not only one but both our cards is not a big deal, it's the principle that counts. Nectaly emails me saying he's getting statements from his merchant. Takes about a week but he finally gets them. Then he doesn't email back for a couple days and then I finally get an email saying he's in New York and will refund them as soon as he's back. I say that's awesome and couple days go by and no email or refund. I email again and now there's absolutely no response for a week.

And now I'm writing this review. It's upsetting because like I said, their happy hour and food quality is awesome. But this is not the way you do business. The first time could have been an honest mistake but twice from the same server is no coincidence. You don't steal from customers, that's not the way you do business. Please take warning. The managers and owners seem to be more than okay with doing shady business.

Reminds me of New York inside.  I love the dark atmosphere.  I have to say is the historic cocktail menu where you can get drinks from certain time periods, starting from the early 1900s.  There's not much vodka in the early years for some reason, not sure why.  I'm terrible with history.

I wish I had come during happy hour, because it can get a little pricy.  The food is great though.  They have their own take on calamari which I recommend for everyone to get.  

Got the spicy mussels also, which I don't recommend as highly as the calamari, but still good.

I would def come here to hang out and have drinks, but more of a second choice for dining.

Sooo, Herbs & Rye is one of my favorite date restaurants. 

It's not in the nicest part of town and the parking really sucks, but, you kind of forget all that when you walk inside. 

Like I said before, it's a perfect place for date night. Dimly lit and the decor is pretty cool. Every time I've gone the service has always been excellent, bartenders to servers, everyone is really gracious and polite. 

Ok so, the drinks, yeeeah, they're pretty expensive, but! They're made well and they offer a lot of unique choices so, you really do get what you pay for, in my humble opinion. If you have savvy sophisticated drinkers in your life, this is definitely a spot to take them to. Oh, and let's talk about their food menu.

Holy hell, they have really amazing food here. I haven't been disappointed yet. Try the flat bread pizzas. They are scrumptious. 

So yeah, it's an intimate type of place so definitely come here with your significant other and get bonus points for picking such an awesome place to eat.

Went here twice and each time it was 10/10. Friend had a birthday set up in the small private room with a limited menu and service was perfect and food was delicious. The second time went there for a company dinner and again service was great and food was even better. Ambiance inside is very nice and upscale, yet staff is down to earth. Thank you for the great service you provide!
Spicy muscles were wonderful.  I was introduced to Moscow Mule for the first time. ..loved it.   I'll come back again and again for the sprouts and suing.  Ronnie was the best.

Random story, this building used to be called the Venetian restaurant owned by the Perry family back in the day. They're old school vegas. So lots of history in these walls. 

Now about Herbs & Rye...this.is.a.cool.bar. Awesome spirits collection. Knowledgeable mixologist. They make a tasty old fashioned..my absolute fave. I like the dark rustic decor. I feel like I'm in an old speakeasy, portrayed in those Hollywood films. 

They have one of the best happy hours in town. Half off most of their steaks, several pasta dishes and their spicy mussels. Love the spicy mussels. I could bathe in that red sauce. Well that's a little intense but you know what I mean. It's good! 

I think they have happy hour twice a day. Hooray for late night happy hour!

WHO: If you love italian, you'll love this place for sures! The bartender & server were super sweethearts & also chatted it up with me!

WHEN: The first time I hit this restaurant up, I missed Happy Hour by a minute! Literally! So, from my experience, you definitely need to check it out from 5-8pm, and 12-3am! Happy Hour consists of half off the entire menu! =D Also, if you are a yelper and you let them know, you are rewarded with a free cocktail with the order of an entree. Yayy for yelpp!!

(I went there recently and there are cones directly in front of the restaurant due to construction! I automatically thought it was closed because there were no cars in the parking lot, but my friend and I took a chance. MISSION COMPLETE!)

WHERE: Located on the corner of Sahara & Arville, look out for the red sign!

WHAT: There were no cocktails for me this time, but I will look into it on my next visit! After a couple of hours of shopping, my friend and I decided we wanted to try this place out. (I really just wanted to see what the Truffle Mac&Cheese was all about, haha). 

My friend and I tried:

-Italian Sausage Flatbread: I was seriously expecting something small, but the server came out with an 8-piece flatbread pizza! It was marvelous! The sausage gave it the taste it needed, and I LOVE FLATBREAD!

-Truffle Mac&Cheese: Ahhh!! Thank heaven for mac&cheese!! I am a lover of macaroni & cheese and this has got to be one of the best I've ever had!! I am craving for some more just thinking about it! There is such a perfect amount of truffle in every single bite, and the perfect amount of cheese. It is just pure perfection!

-Pork & Figs: One word that describes this dish... BOMB!! I've never tried figs (besides fig newtons, haha) but they were just dandy! I wish I would have taken a picture of the dish (as I usually do!) It was perfectly created, the pork on top of the gravy'd mashed potatoes, and the flavorful figs all around it. I highly recommend!! =D

WHY: The food is a must & an A-plusplusplus, the service was incredible (newfound friends), and the atmosphere was just CHILL!

*NOTE: REMEMBER TO GO DURING HAPPY HOUR!

Wish we had a chance to try your restaurant, but after 4 calls with no one answering the phone, we ended up leaving a message for a reservation for dinner 36 hours in advance.  The message promised that someone would call back within 24 hours.  Well . . .never received a call back or even a text.  Seems like you don't want people to try your restaurant . . . so you win . . .we WON'T.
A Vegas must do. Excellent bartenders and service. When company is in Town, I always bring them here. Love the bees knees and spicy mussels. Highly recommend.
Simply the best if you love good food, especially steaks, great cocktails and funny, eloquent bartenders and amazing mixologists.

Love this place! Have been here many times for cocktails, which the bartenders are willing to make something unique for you. Tonight was our first time with food. AMAZING! Definitely our cocktail spot, and now our new food spot! Cheers Joe and Kinson.
Best Cocktail lounge in Vegas! Taking the prohibition era speakeasy and bringing it to the modern global vegas!!! Well done!
The appetizer came out really quick, but the pasta we ordered took forever! Not sure how long it takes to cool angel hair!
Fabulous! The food here is amazing, and the happy hour is the best in the city, hands down.

What a fantastic find. From the outside it just looks like any other seedy bar but once you step inside - wow. You are transported to another time era and place. The cocktails are all old school inspired, think prohibition plus style, and the food is awesome. Absolutely loved the drinks and food and our server was fabulous with his guidance. A definite go to when visiting and an absolutely if you live around here.

There is a reason why they won best high volume bar because this place is busy. The true test of an establishment is serving the masses without compromising quality and service and Herbs and Rye executes this to perfection.  
Joe the bartender was our server for the evening and that was a good thing because the bar did not have any open seats so I felt like it was a fair trade off.  The ambiance is dark but has a really quaint feel to it, with red on the walls and big comfy booths.  The 3 of us started off with some classic libations prepared by the amazing bar staff they have employed there.  Wine with dinner and finished with another cocktail, unfortunately we did not leave any room for desert because the doughnuts are to die for.  Everyone on the table had the strip and we ordered sides to share.  Of course the Brussel sprouts with honey pig, bourbon mashed, truffle mac, garlic spinach and jalapeño creamed corn.  
You know those meals that you wished you were home alone in the dark so you can lick the plate? Herbs delivers just that.
Don't forget to order appetizers, we didn't this time around but the wings, carpaccio, muscles and the farmer flatbread is probably one of my favorite things to eat.

3 stars only because service was kinda slow. But our server was really nice!

The bf took me to this hidden gem... this place serves awesome cocktails. It looks a little sketchy outside because of the area it's in BUT it's really nice inside. Awesome decor & feel.

A great place for happy hour! Definitely a must try for drinks.

The drinks are AMAZING! the carpaccio melts in your mouth, pizza is pretty good too. 
Did I mention the drinks are AMAZING?!

The food is sooooo amazing. HOWEVER... The service is unbelievably slow which is why I only gave it 3 stars. Took me 30mins to get a glass of wine, and over an hour for my food. I'm a pretty understanding person, but if you don't have enough staff to serve your customers then maybe it's time to expand a little. Never the less the caprese salad is OUT OF THIS WORLD. Better than mastros or any other restaurant in Vegas. Mac n cheese is also phenomenal. Would definitely come back but maybe at a different time .

Had a terrific late dinner and drinks...at the bar.  The pork chop with figs was over the top awesome.  It was fully trimmed, no fat or gristle. The sauce was perfect...I wanted to lick the plate.  The bartender made me several  Old Fashioned cocktails, done very well.  I'll be back the next time I'm in town.

One of my personal favorite spots! very chill dark & relaxing environment! I always have sat at the bar! the bar tenders are very talented and friendly! I haven't disliked a drink i've ordered there yet. they make very good cocktails! I enjoy their shrimp cocktail, the shrimp are big! and awesome salmon dish as well!

My first and definitely not last visit to this awesome spot for dinner. The appetizers,steaks,sides, and their signature dessert of handcut doughnuts rolled in sugar and topped w white chocolate and caramel sauce were all excellent. Isaiah the mixologist and our waiter were awesome. I recommend this to anyone looking for a relaxing evening out for eating or just sharing a couple beverages w friends.

Incredible place! What a total best kept secret and hole in the wall finds. I had driven by this place countless times never knowing the hidden gem within. Thanks to friends taking me to this place, I would've never realized how awesome the environment is...kinda retro prohibition meets steampunk. Then of course the specialty libations and awesome menu. I had the New York Steak cooked to perfection and partnered it up with the truffle mac n' cheese...OMG!  The handsome and charming bartender Isaiah make me a creation of the most amazing gin drink that even he just made up in the moment and didn't name it yet. Loved his ingenuity & passion!  Great great place!

This place is the place to be! They always cook my steak to perfection. I have tried other steak houses but this one is the best. Even more with their happy hour. No skimping of meats or sides. I'll always comeback.

I LALALA LOVE THIS STEAKHOUSE!! From the interior decor to the food... everything is perfect! Don't let the outside scare you, it looks kind of dive-y but the inside is decorated very classic old school steakhouse-like! 

The happy hour is THE BEST, down right BEST in town. The serve the highest grade premium quality steak cuts at 50% off during happy hour; 5-8pm and 12-close. Appetizers are also discounted.

The bar is big and spacious where you can actually have a meal. Bar seats are first come first serve. 

For appetizers, my personal favorite is the spicy mussels. The sauce is so good I can drink it! 

There are "rubs" for steaks, I've only tried the Herbs and Rye House rub. It makes the meat so good. While I think the steak plain w/o the rub isn't as good compared to the many other steak houses in the city, but the rub makes it stand out. Steaks also come with a side; I've had the spinach, asparagus, mushrooms, mac n cheese, and garlic mash. All of which are good, but not to die for. 

I've never had enough room in my tummy for desserts! The happy hour full size portions at half price really fills you up! 

They also have an extensive cocktail menu, all of which are classic and unique to their own. I'm not a cocktail person, everything is sour to me so I stick with my wine. They have the Miller high life beer- "The Champagne of Beer" which you don't see often.

I suggest you to make a reservation if you come during HH hours. It gets really packed and the wait time is not short!

It's not too far off the strip, it's worth the drive/uber.

How disappointing!  I was so excited to try this place out, but the food was marginal at best.  The silverware was dirty and I had to return my wine because the glass still had lipstick on it from a previous guest. I will definitely not be back!

The Lion's Tail and the clams in garlic are all I needed to make me a fan. Add to that it was Reverse Happy Hour = bigger fan. Went with bros Tien & Anthony for part 2 of the Potluck 3 part after party. 

It retains the clubby darkness of the Venetian Restaurant which used to be here for years. It should be noted that wells ($3?) & some beers are on Happy Hour prices, but the Specialty Cocktails they are so well known for are not. Still: the Lion's Tail is epic, spicy, and deep with many right notes hit. (10$)

Speaking of high notes: those garlic clams were delicious. A generous serving Tien was glad to share as he devoured the famous Happy Hour steak Special. It was great to have Amanda pop in and hang out, gift me a picture of beautiful Petra and enjoy (?!?!) the old skool Hip Hop videos and mating rituals as the bar. The wee hours bring out interesting people, for sure. 

Our waitress was adorable but not quite familiar with the menu (or maybe didn't know a LT is spicy) Suffice it to say the Eye Candy is there; MENSA members? Not so much. Location is last place you'd expect a Hipster bar, and that is good. Wasn't overly Hipster for me = no hives ;))

Think it would make a sexy date night spot and will try either of the HH again. It can get pricy: but pricy + quality is just fine with me. Much rather pay more for real food & drink by mixology masters than cheap processed food/greasy HH specials/cheap booze. 

This again is a highly rated Yelp place which lived up to the hype for me. Always a good thing. 


Yelp 100 Challenge

I question giving this place 5 stars because I don't want to make it impossible for us to get a reservation. . One of the most important things for me is consistency and they have showed us that time and time again.  Amazing steaks, cocktails and apps.  Happy hour is a must and luckily we live 2 miles away.  Calamari is crunchy but not chewy. Meatballs are flavorful and always order extra bread to clean the plate.  Steaks are the best in town. And a must are the donuts!!! Just try them and you will understand. Great classic place.

If you order a well drink like bourbon on the rocks. They charge you $2 for the rocks and $5 for the well drink. When the we'll drink is $5. But if you order buffalo trace on the rocks they charge you $15 for the drink but no $2 charge for the rocks? Could someone explain this to me? (Manager from herbs and rye) I'm confused that you would charge for rocks on one drink and not the other. This place will nickel and dime you for the drinks you order there.

Great cow and service.  The dirty martini I ordered was pretty bad tasting. I should have sent it back but didn't. My mistake, but that's why I gave them 4 stars instead of 5. In spite of the bad drink, I plan to return as the cow was wonderful.....and after all , that's why we went there in the first place.

Be sure to check out their Happy Hour pricing.  It's not just bar snacks...it's 1/2 price on many....if not most....of their menu items.  They have HH something like 4-8 PM and again after midnight.  I know the details are on their site, so check it out....and enjoy your meal.  It'll be a taster.  The place also has a low key Vegas retro vibe about it too.  Makes it a fun atmosphere  to go along with the excellent food.

I was sadly disappointed with Herbs & Rye.  My team came here and for the price we paid, we expected better food.  The drinks and bartenders were awesome 4.5 stars. 

The food, just didn't cut it.  We all ordered some sort of steak and no one loved theirs.  The doneness was off on mine (alot), the flavor was weird on others, we just were't impressed.

I would love to say that we'd come back for the drinks, but it's far enough away that it's not worth the drive.

We were in for dinner, during happy hour, and had an enjoyable time. The menu is extensive with lots of steak choices, and the cocktails were good, the bartender even made a unique drink for me. Our server, Joe, was on it all night, so we appreciated his efforts!

You can't beat the steak happy hour at midnight! 50% off selected items, and really amazing quality steaks, which include your choice of delicious side. They also have a happy hour on their own beer, which is delicious and you can't beat it for $3. I always treat myself to a few of their craft cocktails as well, of course I wish they were also happy hour, but I don't mind paying for a yummy Moscow Mule, and they are strong too! Not to mention, the great atmosphere, I always feel like I've gone back in time as soon as I walk in the door, from the decor to the gatsby-esque music, to the lighting, to the cocktails, to the black and white movies, and even the bartender's uniforms. I've yet to have a negative experience.

Came during happy hour which made the price worth it. Otherwise I think it's a bit pricey. The food was good and service was a bit slow but I think it has to do with happy hour crowd. Would come back again.

Five stars. Why? 

1. The waiter, Mark, knew his stuff. Suggested drinks based on what we said we liked. Promptly brought our drinks and made sure we were never parched. 

2. Ambience. It's just a cool joint. Makes you feel classy and...stuffs. 

3. Food. This doesn't necessarily deserve the stars though. I ordered my filet black and blue, so it was just supposed to be seared. Though the color was right, it was not as described. I wanted a cold center because I'm weird. The center was warm. :( My lobster tail was also over cooked and tough. The man's was slightly over charred. 

Calamari was DELICIOUS. 

The waiter was very attentive and knowledgeable. Though it's a little pricy, I'll be returning. 

Sadly the server did not pack the butter or steak sauce for my left overs :(

I was having a drink with a business colleague and we were looking for great cocktails off the Strip...and Yelp led us to Herbs & Rye.  Wow -
 this place is super popular and I can see why - lively atmosphere of locals and well made cocktails.  We both enjoyed a diablo cocktail and they went down way too easy...could be dangerous.  Super friendly bartenders too!

This place is great. I will not lie when we first pulled up to the parking lot I was second guessing myself. I knew very little about Herbs & Rye other than the good reviews on Yelp. 

The menu was great and the drink selection was even better. I had the Rib Eye and my wife had the flank steak. Both were great. What really made this place great other than the food and service was the drinks. This is only the second place in the last 2-3 years that actually new what a Moscow Mule drink was. They also served it the correct way in a copper mug. 

I will make this a must stop every time I visit Vegas. Thanks Herbs & Rye and best of luck.

This is my favorite restaurant in all of Vegas. The food is very good and the drink list/menu are untouchable for anywhere in town. This is a little off the beaten path, so if you are a tourist visiting, not only is it difficult to find, but a little tough to allow for the time away from the strip and everything else Vegas has to offer. Came here during NADA this year and was pleasantly surprised that my group of 8 was able to walk in, without reservations and enjoy a fantastic meal. We all ended up sharing things from steak to pasta to chicken. I also introduced a coworker to absinthe. They make it traditionally, so you get a show with the cocktail as well. Everything is so well done here, from the food to the drinks to the meticulously decorated interior. I absolutely love Herbs & Rye!

I'm a local, this is one of my fav places in town. Must try during happy hour, half price steaks etc. you can smell the chicken wings coming to your table from the kitchen... also when you are splurging on your diet get your steak with blue cheese crusting. Bomb.
Food and cocktails good.  Service bad.  Avoid dinner rush and your can appreciate the place.

Believe the hype.   Great cocktails.  Really good steaks and fantastic service.  Ronny, our waiter absolutely killed it with his suggestions on whiskey cocktails.   Their mixologists are on point.    The wives loved the Pimms Cups and the appetizers and sides were wonderful.  Mussels, carpaccio are recommended.  

Do not miss the add ons to your steak.  

Vibe is old school.  Dark, classic music and very fun.  

WE CANNOT WAIT TO COME BACK AND BRING FRIENDS.

Our friends rave about this place and now I know why.  We went here with the in-laws because they are steak and potatoes people.  My father-in-law is a former beef farmer.  He knows his stuff about beef. He was very happy with his steak. We each got a steak and side. I got two sides. We were impressed at how simple everything was prepared, but was so flavorful. Service was good and the cocktails were delish! We will definitely be back!

This place doesn't look like much from the outside but the bar is beautiful. I went on a Wednesday night around 11pm. I was surprised that the bar was pretty full. I pulled up a seat near one of the wells a very friendly bartender named Emily took care of me. She was very nice. I tried two cocktails on their list a Frisco which I'd never had before and a Widows Kiss ( my very favorite cocktail that many bartenders dont know or don't have the ingredients in their bar to make). I love the Widows Kiss. I'd never had a Frisco before and didn't love the flavor profile but it wasn't a bad drink ( just not for me). I also had a flat bread with steak and arugula that was very good. 
Not only were the drinks good and the staff friendly they drinks are almost half of what you'd pay for a drink on the strip and they are solid. I'll be back here for sure.

HAPPY HOUR FROM 5-8PM AND MIDNIGHT-CLOSE!

I haven't been to this "hole in the wall" restaurant since about the same time last year and I'm sad that they have shorten their menu :( 

I've been to Herbs and Rye total of 4 times, I absolutely love the atmosphere and setting of the restaurant. It has a very dark, sexy, low-lit lighting that kind of resembles an old-jazz-club or speakeasy! I love that they're never overbooked or that you don't have to wait to get seated. 

Their menu has shorten to about two pages. We were looking forward to their lamb chops Jane K. wrote about, but they no longer serve them :( we asked our server about the menu changes/ shortening and his answer was due to change of chiefs. 

Anyways on to our meal, we came just in time for happy hour, and because of their menu changes, it was even more limited to choose from for happy hour... for appetizer, we shared calamari (which is not consider a happy hour item). I ordered an 8oz. flat iron steak, and a side of truffle mac & cheese. and he ordered 12oz. steak with a side of jalapeño creamed corn. 
-my medium flat iron steak was juicy with just the right amount of red and seasoning. i don't like my steak tooo bloody red that when you slice a piece of steak with your knife it oozes out with blood. Herbs and Rye didn't give me that problem, thank you! 
-truffle mac & cheese. tasted exactly as how it sounds, and it was delicious!
- jalapeño creamed corn, was too hot at first, so be sure to let it cool down before taking your first bite! I was expecting to taste what I've tried at the Studio B Buffet in M Casino, but it tasted nothing like that. the jalapeño added its distinct flavor. If you're not into "spicy" food I would definitely suggest you get a different side because after a couple of bites, I had to stop being it was getting too spicy and I love spicy food! especially if I'm the type of person to have sriracha on everything! hahaha 
-calamari in my bf's words "best in the whole wide world" the breading was just right and not thick, it was drizzled with a sauce that had its own zesty taste that you wouldn't have to squeeze a lemon like other places that serve calamari. what makes Herbs and Rye calamari "best in the world" is the thinly slice cooked proscitto that adds the "crunch" to every bite. mmm DELICIOUS! it was soo good we ordered calamari to go so that our family would try how delicious it was! 

Herbs and Rye is definitely a place I would recommend to bring friends  & family from out of town and even a perfect place to bring a date! :)

My girlfriend and I were excited for the opening of this restaurant/lounge after reading an article online. We went during the soft opening with our friends and didn't have a great service experience. However, they appeared to be feeling out the space and staff. Recently we returned with friends from out of town. We ordered off the cocktail menu. Which is mostly filled with classic prohibition cocktails. Then after a few drinks we started to order the herbs and rye (bartenders choice). This led to three rounds of perfectly crafted cocktails each costing 8 dollars each. Better than any speakeasy ive ever been to. NY, SF, LA, NOIR bar. The mixology program here is wonderful and i cant wait to go back.  Also, the two appetizers (calamari and flatbread) were fantastic.  Beware so called mixology bars with central locations. This place has great drinks, good food, and stays open late.
The happy hour can't be beat. I got a top notch steak, fantastic hand crafted cocktails and spectacular service at the bar for a ridiculously low price.
Great spot! The bartender was a wealth of information on mixing drinks and the food was great! Each drink I ordered was made correctly and tasted great!

Very old school feel and a beautiful bar. 

Usually always write decently long and descriptive reviews.... No need for this place just trust me and go have dinner or even just cocktails you will not be disappointed! 

Call ahead to make sure you can walk in... I suggest a reso.

Awesome place! Classic cocktails, the best Gibson I have ever had! The bartenders are friendly, and all the mixers are homemade. The food is excellent and the happy hour is half off. I take all my friends from out of town here. Truly classic vegas.

Customer service based. Great bar food. I would not come here for my anniversary dinner but I would definitely eat here multiple times a week for anything from a business dinner to god times with friends. Incredible cocktails and a fun old school Vegas ambiance. I can not believe they offer coupons on Restaurant.com but you might as well take advantage of them. Times must be tough. This is a consitant place and well worth your hard earned money.

There is no disappointments here!
I was surprised it's just as awesome as everyone describes this place.
Not only do they have delicious and amazing cocktails but they actually have a great wine and Champagne selection. 
We really enjoyed everything about this place from our server, drinks and the food.
Thanks for a wonderful experience!

Food was incredible.  My only complaint was the service was nearly non-existent, and I also didn't care for the waiter asking me to pay my bill so he could go home even though we still hadn't been served drinks.  Had it not been for the service, I would have definitely given a five star rating.

Cute little place; dark and quiet. My sister and I split a ribeye, mac & cheese, and dessert. Food was AMAZING!!! I'm from Missouri and it's hard to find a good steak on the west coast. Make sure to go during happy hour. Great time except the service was super slow. I ordered a glass a wine and waited about 15 minutes for it. The bar was not that busy either. I will be coming back :)
Hidden gem in God forsaken Las Vegas.  Happy Hour is 50% off steaks.  One of the most extensive and we'll done cocktail menus I've ever seen
Late after watching my girl JLo, both of us east coast people, we celebrated at here. Steaks after midnight priceless! Try the jalapeño creme corn!!

Been wanting to check this place out for so long now finally had the opportunity to check it out last night :) 

Got there around 1:30am the wait was about 30/40 min for a table but I have herd they do get packed 

We decided to go to the bar and wait and just ended up ordering from the bar no problem for me 

I didn't get to check out to much because I thought my date was going to pass out at the bar he was extremely exhausted lol 

I honestly don't even know what the name of the drink I got was called but I kept seeing it being ordered so I figured it was popular and delicious it was very yummy indeed 

I ordered the carpaccio and he ordered the wings (sadly I wanted to try more but like I said earlier my date was exhausted ) 

The carpaccio was yummy no complaints I love carpaccio it's very nice a high end place with great food stays open late!!!  

The atmosphere was great everyone seemed happy and lively I know a lot of industry people come here! 

I will totally be coming back to check out some more of this menu and great drinks :) maybe I'll make a reservation next time lol

I can't say enough about this place... Mark and Joseph made for an amazing end to a great night in Vegas. Good food... Good drinks... What more can you ask for. 

Husband loved his steak. Truffle Mac and cheese so good... Even if no truffle. Lol still so good. Garlicky spinach lives up to its name. Sausage flatbread great. 

Cocktails just as good. Tell them what you like and they'll master it. Mark's berry Moscow mule was to die for. They are definitely masters of their craft. 

We'll be back on our next visit for sure!!!

Wow.... amazing food and service. It is so good that we came back twice!  Back-to-back days. We sat at the bar and I ur bartender, Kinson, was one of the best we have EVER had!  Attentive, amazing at mixing drinks, and we gave him full autonomy to order for us the entire night. Killer drinks. Amazing steak and appetizers. You HAVE to come to this place!!!!  No joke. And sit at the bar and get Kinson. You're welcome!

Fabulous cocktails, and a wonderful happy hour -- food wise. Their drink specials were on wells and to be completely honest, I'm not going somewhere known for craft cocktails only to drink wells. I only wish we had been hungry enough for a steak! We split a side of the truffle mac with bacon. Life changing!

Probably one of the most creative menus I've ever seen. I read it like a book! Their selection of hand crafted drinks and spirits are insane and their mixology is on point. Delicious champagne cocktail, too. 

Tons of locals there. So glad we went with the several recommendations we had and checked this one out.

From 4/16/15
I've passed by this place a few times and really wanted to give them a try, so we came to Herbs & Rye on my birthday- yay! Once you walk in, you are greeted by a host, who leads you through the dimly lit bar.  As we were seated, I got an opportunity to look around more take in all of the chic 1920's atmosphere, it was like being in a speakeasy. We looked through the menu for food and apps, but I could not take my eyes off of the drink area. That part of the menu was set up to show you era each cocktail was from- very cool!

Finally, we were ready to order. We got the calamari as our appetizer, which has a cherry popper aioli, prosciutto, and banana peppers. I've never had calamari with the aioli, but it was delicious- my mouth was pleasantly surprised. As our main courses, I ordered the "Flat Iron steak, medium rare, with garlic spinach." The boyfriend got a "NY Strip steak, medium rare, with Broccoli and Sharp cheese." Our food was wonderful, cooked perfectly, and seasoned well, we were satisfied.

As for our server, he did a fantastic job, he was friendly and attentive. I will be back for sure, next time I have to try the craft cocktails.
Great food and cocktails great casual chic atmosphere will be back

I can honestly say, I don't have a reason to ever go to another steakhouse. Everything about this classic steakhouse was on point. The service, ambience, price, drinks and food were all exceptional. 

I highly recommend the double chop. This cut of pork was the best I've ever had. The steak was good but nothing in comparison to the chop. The sides were tasty and the table bread was perfect. 

Looking forward to trying the pasta and desserts next visit. This place hands down has the best happy hour in the entire state. Half off prime cuts, am I dreaming? lol

After seeing this place in magazine after magazine and having friends tell me to give the cocktails a try, we finally went on a double dinner date last night on Valentine's Day! 
The vibe is speak easy swanky 20'sans 30's theme with dim lights, cool hip music and a bar to die for. The drinks definitely have bigger placement on the menu however the food is simple and amazing. 

We started off with a Mary Pinkerton (drink) which was fruity and frothy. It opened up my taste buds for an amazing flat bread covered with sausage. The flat bread was great with the perfect amount of seasoning. I had the Kansas City bone in for dinner with the truffle Mac and cheese. My steak was accompanied by the house rub which was almost like an ancho chili paste spice rub. It was delightful and my steak was cooked to perfection. The Mac and cheese was good but lacked some seasoning. My dinner party ordered the strip steak and asparagus, jalapeño creamed corn and sweet potato Tots, all of which were enjoyable. 

Dessert was THE BEST PART! 
The donuts were absurdly perfect! Covered in sugar with a soft chewy dough! I of course covered mine in chocolate ganache! Yum!!


Creme brûlée was creamy and rich! 
The warm cookie was great for sharing with three scoops of rich vanilla ice cream! You couldn't beat it! 



We will definitely go back.
It's a great off the strip joint to being visitors who want a old school taste of Vegas!

I love Herbs & Rye.  I'm saying that because I don't want you to think I'm biased.  This place is that good!  I love speak easy's, great bars, mixology masters and Damn fine food.  Oh and ambiance is nice.  This place has it.  Bartenders are incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, and care about what you want. So you love what your drinking.   Great cocktail menu that highlights cocktails through the decades.  Little bit of history with each.  I judge a bar on details.  Like, they refrigerate their sweet vermouth, candied cherries, bartenders that enjoy talking to their patrons and they make perfect cocktails, textbook!  I love drinking a VESPER, let me tell you, few bars do it well, they do it perfect!  I hope I don't come across as being a pretentious cocktail douche, I'm not.   I've been accused of being a hipster, maybe a little, but nope.  Just a guy that loves a great cocktail.   Don't forget about thhe food.  Best steak, amazing steak tartare.  Just wish they had a bone marrow dish on the menu.  OMG that sounds so hipster douche.   I hope I'm not having an epiphany.  Anyway, if you love #EmploeesOnly in NYC (check out the new one in M8 am I Beach), #minibar DC,  #theviolethour Chicago, then you will love Herbs & Rye.  Great Uber access, both to and fro.  I just realized I want to move to to Asheville, I'm a hipster.  Crap.

Love coming to this place. Great atmosphere, the staff is ridiculously friendly and its got a fantastic menu that is late night and great happy hour. I want to come out here more often. The steaks are amazing. If you're coming here you better have a drink and steak!
I have been to this place a couple of times. Go for the happy hour and order the steak. The mixed drinks are great, and the menu explains the history behind each drink.  Neat place

First time here, after reading yelp reviews I expected so much more. Service was slow and we were their at five when they opened so it wasn't busy yet. 

Ordered the filet with lobster, the lobster was good but my filet was dry. So disappointed. Only two plus things are one our dessert the bread pudding with apples was amazing and their meat happy hour which I've never heard of.

Absolutely the best bar in the country.... Great food. Great cocktails. Great service. It's like walking into cheers, if cheers were in heaven. Last time I went in I had the best Negroni i had ever tasted, I chased it with 2 more... Needless to say, every time I walk into Herbs and Rye I am overwhelmed. Even though they have no idea who I am, they treat me like I'm family. Every time I leave I feel so sad, like the last episode of the Fresh Prince of Bel Air, I never want it to end. Cheers to the lovely staff at Herbs and Rye keep making dreams come true!

Made a reservation for a Saturday night at 5pm to ensure happy hour.  Recommend others to do the same to take advantage of great pricing from 5pm -8pm.  When we first pulled up we were the first in the parking lot, but wow how quickly it filled up while us and others trotted in for our tables.  Bar was full in about 30 minutes of opening at 5pm.  Other tables were available, however I still recommend reservations.  Our server Christian was AMAZING!  Professional, great sense of humor, but most importantly knowledgable about the history of the restuarant and the menu.  He truly added to our positive experience.  Atmosphere was dark, old school, but cool.  Loved how different it was from the flashy bright neon lights of Vegas.  FYI limited parking we were lucky since our reservation was right when they opened, but leaving two hours later many cars were waiting for our spot. Now on to the food...

Spicy Mussels -- 5 stars and best part is that they are on happy hour.  Sauce with delicious, loved dipping my bread in the sauce to soak up the juice!  yummy

Filet Mignon -- perfectly cooked rare as requested, great flavor, no seasoning needed, large portion size 9 oz.  On happy hour list as well.

New York Strip -- again cooked as requested, large portion size 14 oz, great flavor.  On happy hour list.

Sides included with steaks:
Broccoli and Sharp cheddar -- very cheesy, which I love, broccoli perfected cooked not to soft or too hard.  Definitely wanted more!

Truffle Mac and Cheese -- white truffle, rich in flavor.  Definitely would get again.

Dessert:
Donuts -- LOVE LOVE LOVE, fresh, light fluffy with light coating of sugar.  Love the ability to drown them in the dipping sauces of white chocolate and carmel.  OMG heaven!

Drinks:
French 75 -- as a champagne lover, I enjoyed this.  I would get again, however may try something new first.

Clover Club -- my husband got this, but I wanted to steal it!  Wow!  I will be getting this next time!  Smooth...easy on the palette with great flavor.

Happy Hour Wine:
Pinot grigio -- good wine, big pour.
Cab -- surprisingly smooth and lighter than expected, big pour.
Both would get again.


The happy hour prices are surprising.  50% off our food items!  It was good enough to get at full price, but I would rather go during happy hour times and get more!  LOL It was a great saturday night dinner experience, we will definitely be back, recommend to others and will bring others.  I strongly suggesting give this place a try.

Very unfortunate to have to write this review but I think people should know what to expect. The one star I have is for the food. Delicious. Overall experience left my rating at one star. We had a party of 9 which we made a reservation for 7:30 so they can accommodate us. We all arrive on time to wait an hour and half to find they seated another party of the same size that arrived after us first. When approached, they pulled all the excuses out of the book and apologized profusely but once I'm "hangry", apologies mean nothing. We're sat, we order, and like I mentioned, the food was good but expect to wait for it. We were sent a few free appetizers which made us temporarily happy until we received our bills. For me and my boyfriend, our bill was almost $200. This included a recommended drink that I did not like, a coke that was $7 because he said I've "got to have the one from the bar" and a 30% tip on each bill. Generous much?! So we pretty much paid for the "free appetizers" that we didn't ask for. Waiting for every single thing felt like eternity. Good luck to those who still will try this place. O hope your experience is better than ours.

It's not a pretty place on the outside, not a ton of parking, might have to park in the shopping center next door and the bar area is small.  For a Wednesday night the place was packed.  Line of people to be seated in the dinning rooms and booths in the bar were full but found a couple seats at the bar.  The mixologist, made very tasty drinks. I had I believe it's called a lions tail which was really great, not too sweet, not to bitter and almost no alcohol after taste.  I told the bartender to surprise me with the drink, telling him a little of what I like and it was perfect.  My friend had pineapple juice and tequila which she said was great too.  Once you walk in it's as if you stepped into a prohibition era speakeasy, it's super dark and it's on the loud side with all the peoples conversations.   Everyone that was there was having a great time. Great little spot to have a great cocktail and the food is really great too, even though it's been a few years since I ate there.  Nice little spot to cozy up to a bar and have a crafted cocktail.

Came here because the lady and i had heard they have one of the best happy hours in Las Vegas. The bar it's self is pretty well-known as well. I believe they've had some of the top awards for a bar in America over the last five years or so.

If you're coming for the happy hour which is basically half off all of their steaks make sure you have reservations or show up minutes before they open up. It gets extremely packed especially in the bar. But you can score a fillet for about 25 bucks. Not one of those that you'll find one of the chain restaurants but an actual pretty decent cut and pretty decent quality.

Make sure to have a drink is well. I'd go for one of their unique craft cocktails. Not the kind of place you want to come to have a beer. We decided to have a lions tail and a last word. The bartender was super friendly and extremely knowledgeable. Everything you would expect from a place that prides themselves in being a craft cocktail bar.

We had the ribeye and the delay. Like I said both around $25-$30 each. I decided to go ahead and add the bacon and blue cheese crust to the ribeye. Both meets were cooked perfectly to order and we're both pretty decent sizes. They each come with a side as well. We got the wedge salad, simple chunk of iceberg lettuce, covered with ranch and blue cheese crumbles with bacon and tomatoes. Pretty decent size for being a side. Then we got the loaded mashed potatoes or something along that lines. Really thick and creamy with a very flavorful taste.

And dinner with a martini. Like I said not the kind of place you'd come for a regular drink. Definitely try something off of their 1920s and 1930s section. Overall an amazing place with a very knowledgeable and courteous staff and very tasty food selection.

Wonderful cuts of meat that are well prepared. Sides were tasty, but undersized. The truffle Mac and cheese and Brussels sprouts were all very good. The portion size for the sides were quite small though. The expansive cocktail list is impressive. 

Make sure to go at happy hour, when steaks are half price! Otherwise, be prepared to spend enough money for a week's worth of groceries on dinner.

Absolutely loved herbs & rye! The service was great, ambiance and just the whole feel for the place was very nice!  I went on valentine's day with my Gf so their menu was limited but she ordered the prefix dinner with salad, filet mignon with mashed potatoes and garlic shrimp, champagne and fried donuts for dessert. I was way hungrier than she was so I ordered the bigger NY steak and had the garlicky spinach and truffle Mac and cheese on the side. Everything was so amazingly delicious and I can not wait to come back! Oh and I can not forget about the tomato bisque with bread and melted cheese! That is a must! I can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu!

I seriously love H&R, and I'm a little conflicted about writing what I really think because part of me is hesitant about my favorite neighborhood spot becoming too busy! but the other part of me wants this place to succeed and stay around for a long time to come.... sooo....

This place is so cool. Very not-Vegas. no gambling. no smoking. and an awesome happy hour that goes until 8. 

half. priced. steaks. and not crummy steaks like you might expect for half price. tender, flavorful, nicely cooked cuts of meat.  they've got a couple HH beer specials, but sadly no specials on their amazing assortment of drinks.  it's a very prohibition era, speakeasy kind of feel to the place, and they serve old-school cocktails that have ingredients like absinthe and bitters and rye.... orange peels set on fire.... really fun stuff.

and their sweet potato tots and truffled mac & cheese..... i get them every time. and usually a second order of mac and cheese to go to eat at home in my pjs later that night... 

we also ate here with a large group once and they were so accommodating! perfectly separate checks, patience, attentiveness. we even had vegetarians and vegans in our group and they worked with everyone to make sure dietary needs were met - it was a great place for a group. 

closed sundays - which, like chick-fil-a, ends up being the day i have a massive craving, so just try to plan ahead so you don't get your hopes dashed!
This place is incredible and will become a favorite. Go during happy hour for 1/2 off Filet Mignon!

Hand's down, our favorite place to eat/drink in Las Vegas.  Their happy hour has 1/2 priced steaks. The quality of their steaks is top notch. Right up there with the high end steakhouses:  the palm, mortons, Ruth chris. 

We always take friends here when we are in town. Truffle mac n cheese is heavenly. Garlic mashed is right up there as well.  You must finish off your visit with some fresh donuts.   

They use shaved ice in some of their drinks. LOVE this.  Writing this review is making me super hungry!!!

The hubs and I are on our nth trip to Vegas and want to venture out of our usual spots. We saw that this place has amazing value during Happy Hour, so we decided to make a trip to give it a try.
We made reservations for 7pm on a Thursday in June. We arrived at 7:05pm and the front desk ushered us in at 7:10pm. Server quickly served us water and kept our glass filled all night. Our waitress, Debra, was quick to follow up and provide us information on the menu. Bread was bought to us by the server promotly. Debra was excellent at providing us recommendations on the type of cut we should get. 

We ordered at 7:32pm - a half priced Ribeye and filet mignon with sides of button mushrooms and grilled asparagus.
Our food arrived at 8:00pm.

Filet mignon - ordered medium well and it is exactly what we got. Juicy and tender all around.

Ribeye - the 14oz is huge! Great flavours and a great sear on both sides. Cooked medium well to perfection.

Sides - the asparagus and mushrooms were simple, and cooked as expected in garlic butter sauce.

With the HH from 5-8pm, we will try to come back again when we return to Vegas.

Yikes, this joint is expensive.   Appetizer, dinner and a hand-crafted cocktail for 2 = $120.  

That being said.....YUM!!!  Arugula salad LOADED with crispy prosciutto (aka bacon) and huge chunks of fennel...10 points.  Crab cakes were light and fluffy with little tomato strips woven in (interesting).   Date commented that the asparagus was the best he'd ever had...and my prosciutto-wrapped salmon was pretty decent.  One culinary ding:  elbow noodles + yellow sauce doesn't = mac 'n' cheese.  Fix that or take it off the menu.

Enough about the food, you'd come here for the drinks.  They have a clever menu that gives a history of each drink.  My friend enjoyed a Moscow Mule...I tried (and loved) the Blood in the Sand...Rudy Valentino's drink.  The best part? Our waiter/mixologist lit my damn drink on fire...and wow - that made for a tasty libation...that seemed to get even more yummy as I neared the bottom of the glass.  Bravo!

Upon arriving here we were taken back by the rough exterior. But as I read with previous Yelpers reviews, I knew what to expect. But once you walk inside... Wow the decor and ambiance was pretty cool. I loved the feel of the place. Walking in was like a completely different place than the outside.

Me & the beau seated at the bar to wait for our friends. I ordered a Moscow Mule & he got a Pisco Sour. My Moscow Mule was so good, I just didn't like how it was filled with ice so I basically paid for a cup full of ice, I woulda liked more drink for my buck. Pisco sour had egg white in it so it basically just tasted like foam, honestly. I then ordered a Pimms Cup. Oh how I loved that drink! & had cucumber chunks in it! So delicious! My recommendation for a drink if you go here. 

Our friends started to come so we got a table. We were waiting for the clock to strike 12am so we can take advantage of their infamous happy hour! I ordered a Kansas Bone In w/ that extra spicy rub with Truffle Mac n Cheese as my side! OMG to die for! That rub on the steak had little flavor fairies dancing in my mouth! My friend ordered the Penne Pasta. That was also extremely good, not part of their happy hour though. The beau ordered chicken wings and everyone thought they were so good, but I think they tasted like chicken wings! Lol. ¯\_(?)_/¯ 

What really stood out to me was our waiter, Christian. He was extremely delightful, making suggestions for which cocktails we would like. One of my friends got what he has suggested & didn't like it and Christian brought him another drink for free! Also towards the end he brought us out some bomb sugar donuts with 2 mouth watering dipping sauces, also on the house! How sweet of him. 

Overall I loved this place.. I'll probably be returning very soon!
My favorite steakhouse!!!! The service is fantastic, the food is delicious and the atmosphere is really chill. Their mac and cheese is to die for. Also after midnight they have the best happy hour!

I discovered this place and decided to take my boyfriend. We love it and are hooked on their happy hour. My boyfriend isn't even a drinker....only once in a blue moon, but he can't say no to an Herbs & Rye cocktail. The service is very professional and the waiters and waitresses are attentive to your needs. Great place! Reminds me of Brooklyn. It's an escape away from Las vegas.

My husband and I went here for our anniversary. We both got steaks. I had mine with the herbs & rye spice mixture. I usually have to get my steaks medium well or well... (yeah, I know...), but I got mine medium, and it was great. 

I also tried the Pimm's cup. It was delicious. I would love to have one with Indian food. It seems like it would complement it well.

The atmosphere is nice. It kind of feels like you're in a classic movie. haha.

Very disappointing , came out her with the family for the second time . They were very busy tonight .The host stated to everyone checking in ,they were running a little behind schedule . That's not a big deal happens all the time . 

1) customer service was terrible waited like 1 hour for our food and I had a piece of hair on my bread . Which I told the waiter who served us to get me new utensils , he acted like it was no big deal and did not apologize . 

2) my appetite was ruined after that , I had order the pizza flatbread , which I ended up taking home and throwing away . 

3) check took us over 15 min to get . The best thing about the night was actually paying the bill and just leaving the joint . 

4) I notified the host at the front desk about my terrible experience on my way out. 

5) Our server was terrible but there was an employee there that came by to refill our waters and did help with my questions and concerns . He could tell we were still waiting on our check and tried to do his best with us even though the place was busy . I will give that gentlemen credit . 

Needless to say I will not be back and would not recommend anyone based on my experience .

Yummmm!! 
Thanks Eddie !! 
Beef tartar !! Yummm!! 
Orin swift wine !! Yumm 
Can't wait to go back !! 
Shout out to Mike the sous chef !!
Great service, food, and atmosphere. Shout out to Mark. Thanks for making our special night great.

I've been here quite a few times now for happy hour and, yes, I am a bonafide FAN! I looooove their dirty martinis here.  I dare say I have yet to find a place in Vegas that has tickled my vodka martini fancy in comparison.  And then half off happy hour steaks?!? You just can't beat that.  Might I suggest the truffle mac and cheese and the garlic mashed potatoes? They just might save your life.   You're welcome :) Also, the staff ain't half bad.  Pretty nice service each and every time :)

Misti Y had told me a lot of good things about Herbs and Rye before my trip to Vegas so I was pretty excited when she picked me up from the airport and we headed here immediately for happy hour.
