They have some pretty awesome classic cocktails here including Moscow mules served in the copper cups and French 75s. The bartenders have a lot of fun crafting these drinks and as a patron I had a lot of fun drinking them.

Misti and I also shared a couple of snacks to offset the liquor including a big mixed green salad that had bacon croutons. Um, yum! The other food we had was a Mediterranean flatbread that came with a blended spinach spread instead of tomato sauce, feta cheese, black olives and artichoke hearts. I really like the unique flavors of food and drink at Herbs and Rye so I can see why Misti is such a fan. I'd definitely come back on my next visit to Vegas and try more of what they're offering here.

Herbs & Rye is a dark and dimly lit restaurant & lounge located about 7 minutes off the strip (uber/lyft). The menu consists of Classic American & Italian fare like juicy steaks and pasta. Additionally Herbs & Rye's massive menu of handcrafted cocktails is arranged by the period of which the cocktail was made famous. 

We sipped on cocktails from the "Prohibition Era," spanning from 1920-1933. This is a late night spot. A perfect place for a late dinner and night cap cocktail. They close at 3 am.

Cocktails: The Rat Pack and The Hemingway are great options!
Food: Calamari, Steak and potatoes are delish!

This place was a bit of a surprise. The parking is limited. Inside theres a Speak Easy vibe. Dark romantic and nice atmosphere. They do a happy hour special on their steaks every day which is amazing. And I was extremely surprised by the quality of their product. I would definitely recommend this place and  plan on returning. I suggest making a reservation just to confirm you have a table in the dining room or the bar area. If you come here you definitely have to try the prime rib it was fabulous. Super juicy and tender cooked perfectly.

We came here on a recommendation from a bartender at another venue when I asked her where some of the best mixology in town could be found. We came here for the drinks but were wowed by the filet mignon! It was the best steak I have ever had in my life. We will definitely be back during happy hour when everything is half off. Kudos to our waitress for letting us know. Great vibe and drinks were excellent as well.

Great place for a late night drink but otherwise it completely blows!!  The service sucks and when we asked the waitress what do you have that's Italian she said well not much.....won't be coming back here again!!!!  Linguine and clams came in the shells?!!  Really?!  Bring on the Artisan!!

Ambience is nice. I will give them that. A little louder than I expected perhaps.
Had some apps, which were ok.

The score comes because of their "cocktails", which they are supposedly famous for. Or so I thought. Ordered a painkiller. Really lame. I am not exaggerating when I say the whole cup was ice. I maybe got 4-5 sips out of it, with luck. I told the waiter, who essentially made up a BS story of why they do it like that, when we all know the reality of why they do. I did not like that. Which is a pity, because I was really looking forward to this place, that was supposedly one of the best in Vegas. Not coming back.

Want a nice fruity drink go to Rhythm Kitchen, I love their Mai Tai.
Strip prices in a junky block.
Overall, a place that pretends, but does not deliver.

The food was soo good! Truffle Mac and cheese, yum! The truffle fries!, yum! Steak was well seasoned and cooked perfectly! The Brussels sprouts weren't bad, but wasn't my favorite. The donuts were good! I totally could come back to this place! Fun atmosphere and good service!

Herbs & Rye is my vibe in a nutshell and reminded me of my time spent at the Downtown Cocktail Lounge and Vic & Anthony's steakhouse.  It has a very 1920's feel with the bartenders' and servers dressed old school and the decor and lighting speakeasy-ish.

I personally love this vibe and often wonder how a city like Las Vegas has such few places that carry this in comparison to the old school steakhouses and restaurants that built this town with that flair.  

Overall, the service was outstanding, with the exception of them being severely understaffed.  The bar shook, squeezed, and stirred cocktail after cocktail until everyone seated and standing were satisfied.  The flatbread they brought out was tasty and all I can say is I cannot wait for my return visit.

Food was amazing!  My husband and I ordered the carpaccio and clams as appetizers and they were delicious!  The truffle Mac n cheese went well with the Brussels sprouts. We lucked out by going during happy hour; some items are half off!  I believe happy hour is 5pm-8pm.  We spent 124$ including 3 alcoholic drinks.  Cocktails were made with fresh ingredients!  All around this place is well worth the 100$ we spent and we will definitely be back!

We came here for dinner after a ballet performance at the Smith Center. When I walked in, I was surprised by the dim lighting in the restaurant. I felt like I was meeting to make sinister plans over cocktails. Hmm...I do like that thought though. Food wise I have to start off by talking about the lobster bisque with grilled cheese sandwich. Yes, I said a grilled cheese sandwich, and let me tell you that yes I'm raving about a sandwich your parents would give you to hold you over until dinner. This sandwich was the epitome of what grilled cheese should be, and it was served along with a fabulous bowl of the best tomato bisque. Okay, I'll move on now to the great calamari appetizer. The calamari was topped with banana peppers, prosciutto, and cherry pepper aioli. Another decadent dish. We also had the filet sliders which were also good enough to keep this as a top restaurant for me. The cocktails were great also. I had the Mary Pickford and Weekend at the Waldorf. I like how the cocktail menu is broken down by different ages and eras. I was wowed by my experience here. Great food and great service.

Their foods suck and overpriced. I tried their calamari, dry and flavorless. Their filet mignon flat bread i couldnt even eat more than one bite. Imagine a dried up pizza with 6 oz of green grass on top. Don't go here for the food, but a good place to mingle after conference. However, their crab cake was ok, and their "tomatoes flatbread" was pretty tasty. Still, 2 star for having $22 uneatable filet mignon.

Best value in town ! 
Steak is amazing! Medium rare is how I had it.
Asparagus and mashed potato .. With Cabernet.
All for under $30 during happy hour. 

Bartenders are knowledgeable and friendly, not so much with the waiters and host.

I came here while visiting LV because my friend is a local and I was not disappointed. The menu is not overly complicated with a zillion options. I had the pork chops and my friends had the steak and salmon, the food literally looked like it came of the Food network, beautifully prepared and tasted great. Staff was very funny too!

Okay WOW this place is amazing!!!! A little drive from the strip but definitely worth it. The cocktails were absolutely delicious and unique, I appreciate when bartenders really take their time developing their own signature cocktails. The food here was unreal, so good and flavorful. I got the pork chop dish and it was out of this world! Our party all enjoyed the food and drinks, will definitely come back here on our next trip to Vegas.

This place is a gem in Las Vegas. It's a steakhouse but the ambiance is really what makes this place special. Let's not forget about the drinks!!!!! The drinks are worth the money and are all labeled by time Eras.

My favorite sides are the Brussel sprouts, whiskey potatoes and the Jalapeño corn. I could eat that whole side of corn!!! 

This place is never a disappointment. I would say the dress code is business casual. Mark is a superb server and remembers you if you are someone that visits often.

I'd dare say this is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Service, ambiance, and amazing food are all on point. I've NEVER had a bad experience here. The steak is always cooked to perfection. My favorite side dishes are the truffle mac-n-cheese, and the jalapeno cream corn. If you can save room for dessert, the fresh made donuts are almost too good to turn down. 
The bar staff is extremely knowledgeable, and can whip up anything to your taste.  Server Mark is always super helpful. I recommend that if you get a chance, make it in during happy hour  when all the steaks are half price. It gets crowded, so make a reservation!

Herbs and Rye has become my new favorite go-to spot for cocktails.  The wait staff are phenomenal, and I love the dark speakeasy vibe (red velvet wallpaper, black booths, and swanky chandeliers).  I've rarely seen it crowded, which actually kind of worries me because I wonder how it stays in business!

They have some steakhouse style food, but what I go for are the fantastic creative (old school style) drinks and service.  The "classic cocktails" are amazing, and the service is personal and helpful.  There are a few drinks that dabble with absinthe, so if you're a fan of the licoricey liquor, here's a place to try it.  My favorite drink is the Aviator - which from my memory is a combo of gin, lime, and a violet infused liquor - oh my!  They also serve classics like "Moscow Mule" and will likely make anything you request.

The happy hour deal is fantastic, with some of the steaks (half price).  My friend labelled it as one of the best steaks he's ever had.  I have tried a few of the flatbread pizzas, which are a fair deal at $10 a piece.  We tried the linguine and clams, which was good but not the best I've ever had.

For a cool off-strip vibe with great cocktails and an atmosphere where you can chat with your friends (i.e. not blasting boom-boom music), or sit at the bar on your own, check this place out!
First time going and everything was awesome!! Great cocktails great food and awesome service!! We'll definitely be going back and I recommend it to everyone!

Sooo! Me and my friends decide to go to dinner here one night and it was pretty good. We ordered off their specialty cocktails which were interesting. They have a lot to chose from. I think I'll try something different each time I go. We all got a different side to share and our own steak. My friend decided she wanted extra spices on her steak but didn't ask if it was spicy so when out steak came out she wasn't very happy, I decided to switch with her and thought it was great... If it was something you wanted. 

The side were really great we have the Mac and cheese, asparagus, fries, and I forget what else. We all agreed the best thing was the fries. Although the mac and cheese was a close second. 

My recommendation is to grab a group of friends, go during happy hour and all order something different. You can share and get to try everything.

My first time here was last night for a Valentine's Day dinner with my dude, and it was amazing :) The staff was great, very attentive. Our server was very knowledgable in the realm of cocktails and had excellent suggestions! The meal was mouth watering, rich, and damn delicious! The NY Strip was so juicy and just the right amount of rare paired with some asparagus and the truffle mac and cheese, done and done! We will absolutely be back, thank you for making our even that much more enjoyable :)

Take advantage of the happy hour steak specials and you'll walk out thinking you came out on top every time.... Although, if you add a few menu'd cocktails then you're  about even.  Pricey drinks.
Atmosphere was extremely dark but cozy.  Do not sit at a booth around the bar!  With happy hour getting a bit busy, you're sure to have your table getting bumped into several times and spend your night reading the back of several shirts.  But I got really lucky and got to see some chica's ass as she climbed up a bar stool like she was Stallone in Cliffhanger allowing her short skirt to ride up lol. 
The steaks were great, ordered the ribeye with a blue cheese crown, and the filet.  Each come with a side to which we got the mashed potatoes, and jalapeño corn, also added the truffle mac (you know).  All the sides were a lil.... Eh.  Mashed:  we're they suppose to be garlic mashed cuz they almost had no garlic in em... Corn wasn't creamy enough and truffle Mac was bland n dry. Sides need work.  Oh but the calamari was on point! Great flavors on that dish.  Finished off with the donuts and hey, how can you go wrong with donuts.  I'd go back for sure but only during the happy hours.  The Moscow mule is already calling my name again.

First time visiting this place and I can't believe I drive by here nearly every day and hadn't checked it out yet.  Props to the Yelp friends for cluing me in on this place.  The decor inside is pretty amazing...I don't even know how to describe it.  Dark, gothic, speakeasy?  I don't know but whatever it is works great.  My friend and I came in here one evening at about 9:30 for a late dinner after work.  The lot is always full when I drive by; partly due to being somewhat small and partly because it seems everyone besides me knows how great this place is.  For this first visit I had one of their micro brew drafts (can't even remember the name); it was dark similar to Newcastle but better.  I also had one of their flatbreads and a house salad.  I try to keep it simple when going to new place so that I'm not disappointed (read: pissed) if I order something crazy and expensive and it turns out to be disappointing.  The food lived up to its reputation...everything tasted great, was fresh and presented nicely.  Service wasn't too shabby either however I did notice the bartender spending more time chatting with the hostess's than the guests...can't say I blame him, they were easy on the eyes but just saying people do notice this and can be off-putting to some.  Will return for another meal sometime soon.

A rally great happy hour with most of the steaks being 50% off.  I enjoyed a solid flat iron for $14.99, not the best steak I've ever had, but definitely memorable enough to give a repeat visit.

I also ordered the donuts (based on so many comments) and they were so soft, warm and delicious and having the white chocolate and caramel dipping sauce was the perfect finish to the meal!

This is a funky, super sexy, yummy place!
We ended up here by complete accident! And what a great accident it was.
Walking into the place you are immediately hit with a dark and sexy room.
It has this awesome "secret locals only place" vibe. 
Large bright cocktails, dim lights and candles and a soft buzz of conversation throughout. It felt good!

We were a larger groups and decided to split a "slab o' meat" for the table.
With a ton of delicious sides like brussels sprouts, garlic mashed, etc.

We went classic. But everything was really tasty! The service was perfect!
With an array of fun and funky cocktails.

We loved it!

Cozy, warm, delicious, friendly and inviting are all adjectives that can describe Herbs & Rye.  

From the warm greeting at the door, to the great appetizers and flat-bread and the old time cocktails, this place is a wonderful place to spend a few hours. 

We are not the typical guests here, since we are mid to late 50's and aren't employed in the industry here in town, but we still felt welcomed and enjoyed the cozy, comfy atmosphere that is Herbs & Rye.  There is no doubt it's more of a hipster joint, than a vintage Vegas place, but other than a DJ playing the current hits, you'd have thought you'd have entered a time warp with the old school cocktails. 

It's cool to see a fully stocked bar with a copper black splash and an Absinthe fountain.  The drinks were from another era.  Old recipes going back to the early late 1800's to the early 20th Century.  

We had the meatballs and though they were commercially prepared they were quite tasty as was the flat-bread pizza that we shared.

Overall a real hit and a nice way to share some good food, pleasant atmosphere and some old time specialties.
i have been trying to set a reservation over 10 times called and no picks up the phone.....so how the heck are we suppose to make a reservation!!!!

One of my favorite spots in Vegas. 

Sometimes it's nice to get away from the strip.

Herbs and Rye is an amazing restaurant and you never would know just by driving by. There's no windows at all. It almost looks like a video poker hall from the outside. But the inside is always a breath of fresh air.

Great steaks, homemade pastas, amazing sides

And one of the best happy hours around. Half off all the steaks after midnight and they have an early one too i believe.

A hidden gem!

Herbs has a good shot at being my favorite off strip bar in Las Vegas. They have some of the finest handcrafted drinks in town and knowledgeable bartenders. I also love that they kept the old interior of the Venetian Restaurant (the original). I would give them 5 stars if the food was better but then I only go there to drink.

I feel like I came in on an off night. 

This was my night cap selection after an evening out with the lady. I love a good cocktail to end the night and relax, but this place was packed, loud and not an available seat in the house. I figured it be might more chill on Thursday night at 12:30am, but nope. 

We finally were able to sit down and were greeted by a server who had excellent knowledge of the drink menu. I chose from the "Years of Reform" menu, specifically the "Lion's Tail". This is a Rye Whiskey based drink with bitters, lime, bar syrup, and Allspice Dram. It was a very good cocktail with great flavors and nothing too overpowering. I could have had another, but the first drink took so long I didn't want to wait for another.

We also ordered some fried calamari to snack-on while we hung out. This was a pretty basic plate of fried calamari, but you get almost an entire ocean's worth of fried salty morsels. This is a great option for sharing with friends, but the no mind blowing flavors here. 

I do love the prohibition look of this place and the dimly lit secret agent vibe, but I was wanting more. The bartender's seemed to be behind with a large party taking up most of the restaurant's service. 

I believe in second chances. Herbs and Rye I'll see you again soon!
The food is great! I'm writing this review mainly for the truffle mac and cheese, though. It's so delicious. I think I might be in love with it.  I talk about it at least once a day.

I've heard a lot about their cocktails and have been meaning to make a visit for the longest time but for some reason only remembered on Sundays which is when they're closed. I finally was able to visit last night around midnight ! It looks like just a bar on the outside, so driving by if you've never heard about this place, you wouldn't think it was anything special. But people, enough about it's "in the ghetto". North-town, Twain/Maryland Parkway, Boulder Highway, MLK/Charleston, THAT'S ghetto. Sahara/Valley View? Not the best but come on, not ghetto. Let's not get crazy.
Soo anyways, the inside, kind of vampirey and a little dark, it takes your eyes some time to adjust but they have mini flashlights you can request. Oh and bring your glasses, goodness I felt like an old lady trying to read the super small lettering on the menu lol. There was lots of seating and at the time we came, not busy even though happy hour was going on (12-3). Happy hour was half off some steaks included with a side. Sounds like a great deal but my boyfriend and I didn't want something too heavy so we'll try it next time especially since everyone around us was taking advantage of that great deal and it looked delicious!
Onto the drinks! Oh my goodness, soo good, AMAZING. After my first drink, Weekend at the Walfdorf, which is a fruity rum based drink, I made part of my life's goal to try all the drinks on their menu Lol. Next I had the infamous Moscow Mule that I've heard soo much about. The best I've had. Perfect amount of fizzyness and Ginger. Yummy!! I'll take a liter for home please Lol. My boyfriend had the Ramos Gin Fizz and it was another amazing drink especially if you love Gin. It had a lemon tang to it and frothed egg whites. If you're from San Fran, my boyfriend said the quality of drinks were very similar to Burritt Room & Tavern in Union Square.
Next, the food. Carpaccio was flavorful and I always like when restaurants serve an argula salad on top, so really good. I wish there was a little more capers though. Very comparable to carpaccios I've had on the strip. The Pork & Figs we shared was large and really delicious as well. I loved the sauce and figs, and the mashed potatoes. The pork was not as tender as I liked it to be but the Gorgonzola on top made up for that. I could definitely see myself craving this dish. Now let's talk about their amazing donuts. Wow. First of all, I think there's like a dozen mini donuts & holes sugar coated and was served super soft and warm. Definitely enough for four people! But since they're soo addicting, two people could easily demolish these even with a full belly. It came with two sauces, I forgot the names but it seemed like a white chocolate and caramel. Lick your fingers good Lol. 
I just really wish that this place had a higher quality feel to match the great quality and pricing of the food and drinks they serve! You can still look prohibitiony and sleek at the same time! Lol The service was good and friendly, drinks took a little long but they are hand crafted cocktails! The poor bartenders even had to froth up egg whites for one of our drinks! Lmao I will definitely be back for their happy hour steak special and their drinks!! :)

We would like to thank our server Charles for our first time experience he was very nice..we had a late night valentine date after we got off work so we was both exhausted and starving lol.we was introduced to the valentine special and happy hour.We ended up choosing happy hour cuz it was getting late so we got the 16oz steak Mac and cheese and the spicy mussels omg my bf thought i ordered too little but after he realized it was a lot of food and we didn't even finish our mussels and already tapped out.We did not drink alcohol which like Charles said there famous for but maybe next time.Because there will be a next time for sure..happy our is cheap but full of flavor thanks a lot Charles!!!! Did get a Shirley temple but I'll get it dirty next time lol

Fantastic Steaks and sides!! One if theee best steaks and pepper corn sauce in all of Las Vegas!! Dont ever miss the Muscle appetizer and dipping  your table bread  on the red sauce!! Service and friendly very cool staff!! Dont miss the Happy hour and always get desert here!! Have a great dining experience like we always do and definitely make reservations!! Leave your Vegan Gluten free cravings at the house!

I loved the atmosphere from the moment I walked in. The menu is unique and also a great conversation starter with its timeline styled cocktail menu. I had the years of reform cocktail to start along with the mussels. They both were amazing. I was sold on those two things alone . For my entrée I had the prime rib garlicky spinach and  truffle Mac.  Last but not least for dessert I got the crème brûlée which was delicious brûlée but someone was a little heavy handed with the blow torch.  I will definitely be returning and cannot wait to try what else they have to offer.

Don't let the outside of the building/location fool you: super awesome atmosphere - very prohibition-esque. Creative, original drink menu and one of the best filet mignons I've ever eaten. Keep in mind they have a happy hour - 1/2 off steaks and certain other dishes. It can be pricey so I highly recommend you make a reservation during their happy hour times. Great service, delicious sides (although the garlic spinach was just okay) and I would definitely go back. It was nice to get off the strip during our trip to Sin City.

UPDATE! I am just not ok with knowing I have a 3 star review for this place. The first time I went I had a great experience and my bf had a horrible one (read previous review) However, I talked him into going back and since we've returned 3 more times! We always go for happy hour between midnight and 3am. After trying 3 different steaks my favorite is the Bone in Kansas City cooked medium well add herbs and rye rub. I've had the blue cheese crust and the mushrooms and onions toppers. Both are yummy but they don't top the rub. Another highlight is the chicken wings. They are so different from any wings I have ever tried. I also had a chopped salad that was a meal in itself. I don't know what it is but every time I go here, I eat every single bite of everything. Appetizer, salads, sides, desserts (get the donuts) EVERYTHING! 
The mixology is one of a kind. Whether you choose one of the old school vivations, or a simple cran & vodka- its made special every time. They truly aim to please. So ignore the fact that this place looks like a hole in the wall bar, because once you walk thru those doors you are in a whole new time. A classy, enjoyable one.

Great cocktails, as everyone says.  Super good service, welcome respite from the nonsense of the Strip.  Happy hour prices on cocktails were very good, but on food for happy hour- the entire menu is not 1/2 off.  There were only certain entrees and appetizers (NOT the flatbreads), eg. there was one steak special that was a particularly good deal, and it was cooked very nicely, sweet potato tots were good too.  Wish I could have stayed around longer for more than just two cocktails.

It's really dark inside, no kidding. Really not enough light to even read the menus. Service was great and quick. Food (steak) was awesome!!! 4 pages just for drinks and 2 pages for the food. It was so tempting to try a cocktail but probably next time. Love this place.

We came into town hankering for a delicious cut of steak. When in Vegas you must live it up baller style. We called up to meet a couple friends who are locals and they suggested this place saying they had good food and interesting cocktails. After perusing the yelp reviews which are solid I decided we should listen to the locals and head off the strip. I really love checking out the local joints in Vegas, because there are so many places to choose from and a lot of times the strip places are amazing but quite pricey. We arrived a few minutes before our friends. I had used the handy dandy open table reservation through the yelp app! Upon arrival the words I said were 'don't judge a book...' The place seems like any other place you'd pass way out on the west side beyond the Rio. My boyfriend looked at me skeptically and then we walked in. Inside the intimate speakeasy type bar and dimly lit but very nicely furnished dining area we were seated in a big booth and handed massive menus. The server explained the cocktail menu was set up by time period each drink handmade by an awesome bartender with a fully stocked bar.  Each drink had a story of how it came to be and where it was popular as well as the ingredients. I was almost overwhelmed by the amount of choices until my friend ordered a drink called the bees knees and I copied! The server also informed us that happy hour was going until 8pm and that many items were 1/2 off including many of the steaks! Our 7pm arrival seemed to have been a miracle! My boy and I each ordered a 9oz filet with a side of dipping sauce, an extra but I love to dip, I had the au poivre sauce which was incredible peppery and perfect. We also split a wedge salad AND each steak came with a side! I chose the truffle Mac &cheese and boyfriend chose brussel sprouts with bacon lardon. We shared our sides of course, I shudder to say that I may really be becoming an adult because I preferred the brussels! Everything was perfectly cooked and to the exact temperature of our choosing. We had an after dinner shot of fernet to polish us off and when the bill arrived my jaw dropped! So much food & drink for such a low low price. We certainly were off the strip but you'd never know it by the food, presentation or service, only by the price. One more super cool thing is that you can order a 'surprise' drink from the bartender. They won't tell you the recipe but you can have them make you a special. My boyfriend asked for a special gin drink that came out quite tasty. All in all this is possibly my new favorite go to steak place off the strip. We will certainly be back for more tender juicy filet goodness in the near future.

Dined in the other night & it was overall a great night. Advice: make reservations, overheard that it was a 2 hour wait on a Friday night. Anyways, Made reservations the night before who happened to be our server. He mentioned our party should arrive before happy hour ends, which none of us knew about! So that saved us 1/2 off. Service was amazing as well, had some minor bumps that he immediately took care of w/o being hesitant. I wouldn't recommend the mash potatoes but the truffle Mac & chz are to die for. All the steaks were great! Overall, service 5 star & food 4 star. I'll definitely be back though.

It's become a hit or miss.... When they're busy, the food quality lacks.  Happy Hour of 1/2 off many entrées is a great value when the food is good, but a waste of money when it's not. If you have a few drinks, which I usually do, they make up their money so the quality of food should always be consistent.

Summary: Very solid off strip restaurant. 

Neighborhood and this part of Sahara Blvd have seen it's better day and I am sure that they have their up-hill battles w/ marketing this place. The lady and myself ate there on a Wednesday and every seat at the bar was filled for their happy hour (7pm). The two main parts of the restaurant were empty and they sat us at a banquette circular table in the bar area.  Little tight in the bar area as the actual bar itself is only a few feet away from the tables. So when you sit at a table in this area you are sort of forced to stare at the backs (and cracks) of the people sitting at the bar. Decor was retro and speakeasy like - place was clean and well kept. Red patterned wallpaper, TV's playing black and white movies and the music playing the old crooners (Frank, Dean, Sammy etc.). 

We ordered two appetizers - the little-neck steamer clams and the fried Calamari. Both were amazing, very tasty and well presented.  The juice or broth that they present the clams in was to die for. They give you a piece of bread that you can dip into the sauce when you are finished eating. We took advantage and LOVED them both! 

Good timing in the part of the waiter had our steaks presented to us with enough of a break between finishing the appetizers and starting the main course. Every night they have "happy hour" till 8pm and feature all steaks 1/2 price. We took advantage. My date had the fillet ordered rare + (with a fried egg on top) and I went with the rib-eye medium rare with an au pove sauce. We each chose the garlic mashed potatoes as a side. 

Steaks were right on and cooked perfectly. Been having issue with this and the chef at Herbs delivered perfectly! The cuts and the sides were stellar and would compete with the best steakhouses on the strip. My rib-eye was as good, if not better than the steak I had at the Wynn, Bellagio, Cosmo and Venetian. 

We each ordered two of the "custom signature throw back cocktails" from the lengthy drink menu. The menu spans the eras and the drinks from each time period. There are no prices on this section of the menu so be aware of what you are ordering. Most of these drinks fell in the high price or strip casino range ($12 - $15). Little too high priced for an off strip restaurant. They should also feature a couple drinks from this menu during their daily happy hour. Think people would take advantage. 

We were way too full and passed on desert (but it looked and smelled delicious). 

Bill came and the two of us racked up almost $150 in costs. Was a slightly taken back by this as those prices are what we do at a fancy strip restaurant. Seemed a little excessive for the local driven location. Might hinder price conscious locals? Might hinder us from going back more often, but we will most certainly go back. Food was delicious, service was on point. 

Food here is the big winner, food and service earned the 4 stars. 

Good job Herbs & Rye - enjoyed the visit.

Got a recommendation for this spot off the strip that local go to. Oh man, worth the trip and worth every cent. Sat at the bar with my wife and we had great food, great cocktails and great conversations with the bartenders and clientele around us. The staff was super attentive and you didn't have to wait long once you put your order in. Get a steak, it's worth it.

First time in this restaurant. We got a table right away. The waiter was good in taking our drink order and the drinks were amazing. the steak was cooked just the way we ordered and the side dishes were amazing. the best part is that all the food was on happy hour. A very classy place for food and drinks.

The first time I came here, I was overwhelmed by the drink list and tried two drinks.. both great.... this was 3 months ago and I've been back about 2x a week.  Kensen  (spelling?) Is a great bartender and mixologist. I don't even order drinks anymore, I just tell him the spirit and he performs his voodoo magic and boom, I'm very satisfied.

Great place and even better employees.

The midnight to 3am happy hour (half off steaks and some apps) is an incredible deal.  That ribeye.... best place I've been to in Vegas and I'm a local.

Today was bad. Just bad. Not sure if short staff was to blame or just our server, but never had a worse experience here. Waited 25 min (at our booth) for our first drinks. Food was good but steak was doused in oil from mushroom & onions, otherwise as good as always. Service just sucked! We had more interaction and service from bus boy (awesome should get server status) and hostess! Sorry for bad review but when things are bad ya gotta say something. Best part.... Server never even acknowledged the slow service or anything, someone give that bus boy a raise! Full price on the check too! Boo herbs & rye tonight!

This is an amazing steakhouse and I highly recommend. The steaks are tender and flavorful and you cannot beat the half price happy hour specials on steaks. The ambiance reminds me of an old Vegas restaurant, and the drink menu is extensive. Everything we tried was delicious

So disappointed when one of your favorite dining establishments lets you down. Our waitress Alejandra was the worst. A few of us in our group never got their second drink. My friend's steak was served cold. Another friend got a rare steak when he ordered medium. At least the manager came to personally apologize, but it was still a disappointing night. I want to give them another chance because I've had better from them, but tonight was just ugh. If the next time I go back and see the same waitress I'm out of there.

last night we attended a Birthday Party for my son at Herb and Rye Restaurant on Sarah in Las Vegas. we had 15 people attend.  the food was not great the service was even worse.   the steak was very tough and the sides were almost non-existant. we attended dinner at the happy hour which you were supposed to be able to purchase a steak at half the menu price. I had a 14 ounce NY strip. $21.00, the side was a small portion of Garlic mash. I  had 2 Pepsi 's $3.50 each. no refill.  the price was reasonable but the Steak was tough and the mash cold. my son ordered the 120 Oz special which came with 2 sides. Happy hour price for this meal was $180.00   regularly  $390.00 this special was supposed to feed approx. 8 people. the meat was better but again the sides were enough to only feed approx 5 people.  Total price for 15 people came to 843.00. including mandatory tip of 187.00. This is supposed to be the happy hour price of half off. I felt the prices were inflated especially because of the quality and portions of the sides. the steaks were served without any kind of mushrooms or onions. If you wanted a sauce of any kind you had to ask for it. It was not offered. I'm not against paying a fair price for a good steak however the quality of steak was like chuck steak. Myself and 9 other of the guest felt the same way. I do not recommend anyone should go to this restaurant.

As a vegan, loving a place known for their steaks and Mac and cheese sounds kinda hypocritical. However, this place offers an eclectic cocktail menu, amazing veggie sides, and delicious flat breads for those of us who aren't so crazy about meats and cheeses. 

The ambiance... Think brick floors... Red velvet walls... Low lighting and antique chandeliers... Old music from 20s, 30s, and 40s playing with black and white movies on the TVs. I almost felt like I was stepping back in time into a hip and super secret speak easy... 

The service was great. We were seated promptly and our waters were never empty. She checked on the table just enough for us to never need anything... But also not feel overwhelmed. 

My last experience here was a tad bit underwhelming due to their portion sizes of their sides going down. *thumbs down* However, everything tastes pretty amazing and they were super accommodating to my vegan needs. I ordered the button mushrooms and garlic spinach... Yum! Seasoned to utter perfection and cooked just right... It's definitely a vegan crowd pleaser. My boyfriend and dad ordered huge steaks that came with  sides. My mom ordered a flat bread and a side of mushrooms... Everyone loved their food. They offer half off steaks and certain cocktails for happy hour. I got a great glass of Cabernet for only 8 bucks! :) 

    They are open late and offer two happy hours... 5-8pm and 12am-close. The parking can be a little tricky but there are plenty of open lots near by:) I'll definitely be returning.

Absolutely love this place! The cocktails here are the star of the show. They hand-craft each cocktail with real passion, resulting in a great tasting drink that is unique. I'm sure most of you have never tried drinks like these!

The restaurant is dimly lit, the staff is friendly, the food fantastic and I love trying cocktails from each era and reading all about them. Perfect for a date night!

Best bar and steakhouse hands down......I love their happy hour from 5 to 8.  Bartenders are inventive and will make you a drink based on what you like if you don't see something on the menu to go for. Try the old fashioned with rye..... you'll thank me later!

One of the worst experiences dining in Las Vegas. Waited almost 2 hours for dinner to be served after seated. Steak and potatoes served cold. Steak flatbread had maybe 3 bites of steak. Wine pours are 3.5 oz.- below the 4 - 5 oz most pour. I don't mind paying premium prices for excellent dining but this place misses the mark on many levels.  Too noisy with annoying thumping music with everyone trying to talk over. Not a place for a relaxing evening.

The food is always great. I suggest going between 5pm and 8pm. It's happy hour and the steaks are half priced. (and believe me the steaks are not cheap). The one thing I didn't like was being seated near the bar and the music was so loud that I could barely hear my friend talking right next to me.
Great atmosphere! Definitely have to do reservations to get in but well worth it. Wait staff very enjoyable and the drinks were amazing!

Excellent food, Drinks and service. Been there before for drinks, but sat down for dinner for the first time and the experience was great. Happy hour specials were awesome. Our server Mark and his assistant Andres were great. We look forward to coming back for dinner and drinks soon .

To be honest for the price the food is okay. I love he drinks. Great Dibalo but still pricey. I had a salmon which was great though. Ambiance is quiet for a Wednesday. I guess their happy hour is okay. But not a buzzing vibe. Would rather spend my money on a fancier restaurant on the strip then be here.

Ate here for half-priced steaks and good drinks. The food/drinks were good. The service was THE WORST I have had in Las Vegas. Waiter started out by allowing us to have 15 min to look at the drink menu, not because we needed time, but because he ignored us. We ordered drinks and it took 10 min to get 4/5 of them...and 20 more min (even after saying twice to get her drink) to get the 5th. Then he "memorized" our steak orders and when the steaks came out...every single order was wrong. What should have been a nice 90 min meal ended up being 3 hours because the service was dreadful. This place should fire their waitstaff.

A pretty cool place with great service and an interesting cocktail menu from several generations. I wish the food was better as I think it could become a Las Vegas favorite for me if it was better. 

I was there with a small party of friends, one of which is a local and made the referral so we were pretty excited. The food overall was decent quality, but just seemed bland and under-seasoned. I had the pork chop and truffeled garlic parmesan fries (a favorite of mine from other places) and they were a let down. They didn't have much flavor and seemed pretty ordinary. I tasted the steak of one of my friends and it was the same. 

Because the ambiance, service and place are pretty cool, I will probably try it again and update my review if necessary.

Loved this place! The food is a little pricey, but delicious. (I'm not really a steak person so I ordered the penne pasta, which was amazing.) The cocktails are superb yet shockingly affordable given typical Vegas prices, and our server (who was super friendly) made great drink recommendations. I love that Herbs & Rye's cocktail menu spans over a century of different libations; where else can you get a mini history lesson while deciding on what to drink? The vibe of this place is very cool and upbeat; we visited on a Monday night and it was pretty busy. If you're a tourist, do yourself a favor and make the off-strip trip. Herbs & Rye is definitely worth your time!

Boyfriend made a date night reservation for two for Saturday at 5 PM. Seated right away, and it wasn't very busy when we arrived. When we left around 6:15, the bar was completely filled and the tables were starting to get full too.

We didn't order drinks, something I regretted later because the menu looked great, but the food was amazing! Service was great, and our waiter checked on us probably 10 times during the meal. The busboy who was waiting our table was also super quick, polite & attentive.

Mussels & clams: two separate appetizers each with a fresh soft baked roll. The clams were served in a white wine sauce that was not too sharp and not too sweet. The mussels were in a spicy red tomato-based sauce. Both were AMAZING and cooked to perfection. Definitely recommend for you seafood fans! Somehow we ended up finishing both between the two of us... it was that good.

Ribeye steak: medium rare - great without sauce, even better with steak sauce. We didn't end up ordering an extra sauce, but I would try the chimichurri next time.

Truffle mac n cheese: ohhhh my gosh if I could just eat one mac n cheese for the rest of my life, it would be this one. Subtle truffle flavor that leaves a wonderful aftertaste in your mouth, and the cheese is soft and mellow. The breadcrumbs on top add that extra layer of texture. So good!!

Garlic spinach: average spinach dish, nothing crazy exciting 

Sweet potato tots: the sweet potato bits are chopped up inside, not mashed. Nonetheless, tasty! Fried perfectly, not too crunchy nor soft.

The only thing I would note as a slight negative is that I needed my eyes to adjust for almost a full 10-15 minutes before I could properly read the menu. It's veryyyyy dark inside. The ambience is nice though if you're there for the right type of occasion. 

I'll be back!!

Vegas is full of amazing gems hidden off the Strip, this is one of them!  It's a steakhouse, featuring incredible quality steaks.  I had the NY Strip during their happy hour, so half off, added the special spice rub, which was delightfully spicy and flavorful.  Also had one of their Pina Colada's which is way more sophisticated than the usual variety.  Loved, loved, loved this place.  So sad that I wasn't able to come back again like I hoped.  Special shout out to Valerie for taking some time to chat about my experience and other favorite bar/restaurant locations around the country.  I will be back again and again!

Solid classic cocktails. The way the cocktail menu is setup is very interesting, according to the time period (Prohibition, Reform, etc). My Vieux Carre was very smooth. I tried a bit of the Boulevardier and Remember the Maine and there were also very well made.

I read that bartenders who work on The Strip like to come here for classic well-executed cocktails. I can see why. During our visit, there were also people who were first time visitors there like us.

I'd said that Herbs & Rye is a place where you definitely go for the cocktails, and you can stay for food if you want though not a must. They do have a good happy hour (5-8pm, 12am-2am) with 50% off some items and ALL the steaks. However, the food was not mind blowing. It was good but not outstanding.

Another off-strip place worth visiting for well done cocktails.

Visited Herbs and rye for a few cocktails after dinner. Our bartender, Joe, did not disappoint! He made me an excellent scotch mule. I'm still thinking about it.. 
Ambiance, drinks, and staff were awesome.

Been wanting to try this place for some time.....got there abot 5:30 bar was full asked the hostess if we can sit at one of booths or tables..keep in mind all tables and booths were empty..but got the wait we will see if we can accommodate you waited about 10 minutes and left..the hostess is a pompous ass.

Super cool spot away from the Las Vegas strip!! The cocktail list features very unique drinks from every era, think Prohibition! The handcrafted cocktails were enjoyed by my friends and I 2 nights ago!!

The food options were legit too! We ordered sliders, meatballs, and a few other appetizers. YUMMY!!

This is the perfect hidden gem if you want a different Vegas experience!!!
The steak here is ridiculously good, if you're going to come here I recommend during happy hour from 5-8pm. Half price steaks, c'mon!

The service was beyond amazing literally 5 star service and hospitality. I came during Happy Hour 5-8pm which is half price steaks and a few apps. We ordered the Spicy Mussels, New York Strip, Filet Mignon, Mac and Cheese and Spinach. It was beyond amazing. The steaks were cooked perfectly we ordered them Med and Med Rare which was perfect everything went as planned.

Awesome atmosphere, classic gourmet drinks, great staff! Nectaly's shareable steak was amazing! I can proudly say it is best steak we ever had. Great happy hour specials. Coming from NYC the atmosphere made me feel like home. Came here twice, once on a date with the hubby & celebrated his birthday with family and friends. The husband previously came here for a birthday party with his LeRêve performer friends and could not wait to take me here. We enjoyed our time and will definitely recommend this place to everyone looking for a chill spot with delicious food. Despite what others in our party had said in their tacky Yelp review (party of 2 which the step father was spiteful & using his wives account to place a negative review due to his personal issues), EVERYONE enjoyed themselves including the birthday boy, our pescatarian family, out of state family and friends. Nectaly is amazing and we will definitely return with friends. Keep up the good work guys!

I've got good news and bad news. Let's start with the bad news first. My fiancé and friends were out for a nice evening and decided to go to herbs & rye for dinner. I ordered a steak and my fiancé ordered the linguine clams pasta that is on the happy hour menu. A few hours after we got home my fiancé started to feel nauseous and shooting pains in her stomach. Yup you guessed it she got food poisoning. Yes, this happens from time to time as I've worked in the food and beverage industry before. I called Herbs and Rye to let them know the situation and was greeted by Christian who sounded scared to call himself the "manager." I told him what had happened and he had the audacity to tell me that food poisoning usually happens 24 to 48 hours after consumption. Basically, he called me a liar. First of all I am a local and have been to the restaurant quite a bit. Second of all, I've gotten food poisoning before and and it only took a few hours to kick in. I told Christian to check his facts. Not one time did he apologize or take any action to rectify the situation. I left my number down hoping they would call me back, but since I am writing this post I bet you can already guess they didn't. That was a shocker as "management" was fully aware of the situation at hand. With all the talk about Chipotle and all the sickness going around I'm so surprised that I didn't receive a call back. My advice is to handle your customers as if they are your family or that it is you who experienced the problem. Herbs and Rye was a great place to go to in the past, but as time goes on their happy hour continues to get worse, and the action of management has extremely disappointed me. 

The good news = waiter and hostess were very nice.

My girlfriend found this place during our last trip to Vegas, and it has officially became our MUST VISIT!

We came here after the Vegas night clubs during the late night happy hour from 12AM-3AM, and it has one of the most amazing happy hour menu. All items listed with 2 stars are 50% off - which includes their steaks. But wait, there's more! The half off steak also includes a choice sides. We ended up spending about ~$50 for a 16oz Ribeye, and a 14oz New York Strip with two sides (Mushroom and Creamed Corn). I was speechless! The steaks were delicious! I would say they were on par with Flemings steakhouse, and for the price that can't be beat.

I'm savoring about the steaks as i'm writing this review. Looking forward to my next Vegas trip to come!

Great atmosphere!
Tasty drinks!
Delicious food!

Located off the strip and easy to find. This place is perfect for anyone wanting drinks and/or food. Drinks here are strong yet tasty *insert emoji with side tongue* Don't slurp them down or you may be sliding off that stool/chair of yours real quick. Don't say I didn't warn you ;p

Absolutely fantastic find.  Was recommended to me by an Uber driver, and I'm glad he did.  Filet mignon was excellent, cooked perfectly and seasoned well.  Grilled mushrooms and onions on top with the peppercorn sauce put it over the top.  Mac and cheese side with bacon topped it all off, it was amazing.  Highly recommend, and I'll definitely come back.

This is a great spot we found off the strip. We were told it's a local's secret and I can see why. They have an amazing food happy hour where steaks are half price. We are from the east coast, but will make an appoint to have dinner here every time we get to Vegas. It's DE-lish!!! Steaks are melt in your mouth perfect. Sides are just as good. It's everything you would expect in a nice steak restaurant. The ambiance is also nice, dimmed lights and very relaxing. Cool place!

Favorite place to get a cocktail!
If you're thinking of coming here and getting a rum and coke, this isn't the place for you. These are quality cocktails. The menu is informative. It is broken down by the history of alcohol and spirits, from prohibition and beyond.

I'm obsessed with Brandy Crustas and Clover club. The mixologists are great! 

Happy hour is a great deal on food as well. I think its 11 or midnight until closing 2-3am. The gnocchi with the chianti meat sauce and the alsatian flat bread are my two staples. Those are addicting! Steaks are great too and the sweet potato tots and macaroni are good.

Great bar to hang and talk and catch up. But don't expect that on a Friday/Saturday night, club crowd and dj is in the house so it gets very loud. If you're in the mood for that, go on those nights. If you want a chill evening go on the other nights. They are, however closed on Sundays. 

Great hangout for groups too.

I absolutely love this place. We love around the corner and we try to go as often as possible. Birthdays, anniversaries, Monday night, it's always a great time. The prices are great and the sides are phenomenal!!! I rave about this place. Keep up the great work!!

This was my third time at Herbs & Rye and it is the only place I will go for steak. My favorite has been the New York Strip cooked medium. My favorite side has been the garlic mashed potatoes, but all of the sides I have tried are great. 

Don't forget dessert and grab some doughnuts! 

Make sure to join them at happy hour from 5-8 and then 12-2:30 am for some half priced steaks

Came here last night and I have heard a lot about this place! I am a huge fan of open table and last night I was looking to make a reservation and did just that once I saw that at the specific timeframe I was looking for was awarding 1,000 pts! Once arrived were were greeted by at first the bartender and then the host finally arrived and seated us! The service was great! The ambiance of the place is definitely a bit dark/romantic I guess? But I literally had to use the light on my phone to read the menu! Ordered the hot wings for an appetizer and the Salmon dish for the main dish! The food was nothing short of amazing! I can alway appreciate a Well prepared Salmon dish! I will return one of these days so I can see how good the steaks are! Oh and the last word cocktail was very refreshing ;-)

One of my favorite places in town!!  The atmosphere is great.  The service is on point.  I've never had a problem with any waiter, and I've been here many times!  The food is AMAZING.  The happy hour is incredible as are the drinks.  A true Vegas gem!!!

How did I know about this place?! What a great selection of drinks from every century. It's a cute little nook, but the insides is like a 20's themed bar. Very dark and mysterious with a hint of The Great Gatsby. It's not a big restaurant so the service was impeccable. The second the appetizer was finished entrees were delivered. The drinks were beyond imagination of mixology. 

Food:
We had ordered the calamari appetizer with prosciutto, banana peppers and a creamy spicy aioli. Probably one of the best calamari I have had in a long time. 
My boyfriend ordered the steak with their garlic mashed potatoes and I ordered the spicy clam and linguini. I think that the pasta was just tossed with the clam juice and white wine with pepper flakes which was just delicious. We ordered a side of truffle fries too that was just adorable. 
I couldn't leave without desert and ordered their cookie and ice cream which was an cookie cooked on a skillet with 3 scoop of ice cream. Think pazookie. 

Everything was great and definitely was blown away at the service and the food quality! 5 dang starssss!!!

We'd been here before for drinks on recommendation from the guys at a Downtown Cocktail Room, and had no intentions for dinner what with piles of Thanksgiving leftovers waiting at home, but when our excellent server Charlie informed us we had four minutes if we still wanted to get a Happy Hour order in, we had to ask what Happy Hour was? And when we learned Happy Hour was half off steaks -- what's a reasonable person to do??

Our table ordered filets and a ribeye. The came out promptly (and this was on a very busy Friday night) and all perfectly cooked and seasoned -- juicy with a nice char and very simple seasoning of salt and pepper that enhanced the meat without competing with it. The steaks came with one side each and we got the garlic mash, truffle fries, and sweet potato tots, which were all fine, though I wish we'd seen the option for marshmallow on the tots.

The cocktail menu is extensive and well curated. We got:
Hemingway Daiquiri
Martinez
Lion's Tale
Clover Club
Brandy Crusta
French 75
Hawthorne
Pisco Sour

All on point. As was the service from Charlie and the rest of the serving staff: helpful recommendations when we asked, unobtrusive place setting clearing and setup and refills. Vibe was lively in the bar area but we didn't feel crowded. It does get loud, ad we needed additional light from our phones and the table candle to read our menus. Dug the playlist. Parking is tight, and I'd recommend reservations.

We'll be back to drink our way through the rest of the cocktail menu and for the amazing, ridiculously discounted happy hour steak!

So bummed on this spot. My husband and have frequented here for a couple years. The food is killer and drinks, music is always subdued and chill.
Tonight was the third time -in a row- I've shown up and my reservation was given away, ON MY BIRTHDAY.
They hostess informs us that there is no longer a spot saved and lets us know we can wait an hour, that was it she moved on looking right through us. So shitty and rude.
There are plenty of options in Vegas, I'm over this one. Their best bartender moved on anyway.

Speakeasy in Vegas? HA! Yeah right. I was proven correct and would not recommend coming here for any speciality drinks. Reserve that for bartenders on the Strip.

I suppose the service was nice... but I'm not sure if this place has any much else going for it. They serve absinthe. So what? Who doesn't nowadays.

I might come back here for a prefunk but wouldn't mind going to Little Macau for that either haha.

Went here for dinner on my fiance's birthday. She was very excited as she'd been wanting to come here for a long time. I made reservations for 8 and we were seated promptly. And that was where the service ceased to be good. Our waitress wasn't very attentive. Drinks that were ordered took 10 to 15 minutes to appear (but when they arrived they were VERY good). After we placed our food orders half of it came out after 45 minutes, and the other half came out 15 minutes later. The food was WAY overpriced for the quality (even accounting for the happy hour pricing). I'm told that the bar experience is MUCH different from the dining experience, so I might be back to check it out. As it stands I won't be returning for the food.

The ambiance, the food, the staff! Everything about this place is amazing, from the entry into a 1920's speakeasy the moment you walk in the door to the food and drink pairings. I recommend highly for anyone who wants a unique "off the strip" Vegas experience.

It was an awesome laid back atmosphere and the food and drinks were beyond great.   Had the happy hour steak dinner.    How is that even possible??   Do try to make it for happy hour and order one of their signature drinks and stay awhile.  Such a great vibe.   Will be going back again and again.   Staff very friendly and the food.    Awesome

This place has an amazing concept!!! The decor is a dark brick/vintage velvet wallpaper with chandeliers hanging in all rooms. The food is amazing..(I.e. beef carpaccio- cherry pepper aioli, balsamic glaze, topped with an arugula salad...to die for. not to mention all of the classic cocktails ranging from the year 1865 to present. if you want a phenomenal bar to come to with great food and wonderful staff..come to herbs and rye. Nectaly Mendoza as well as "G" are ready to make you whatever you want...literally. both phenomenal mixologists that can answer any questions to anyone's palate. I love this place!

Man oh man, herbs and rye, you truly are a hidden gem. MORE PEOPLE SHOULD FREQUENT THIS PLACE because everything about this place is awesome. Why you must ask?

-The bartenders are truly very nice and are easy to start a conversation. Especially Mike.

-The food is spectacular. And it's a steal when you go there doing happy hour. I love their Truffle Mac n Cheese and their sweet potato tots. Yes, I said it. Sweet Potato Tots! I couldn't believe my eyes and my mouth either! And don't get me started on those HOLE-Y donuts! Sweet and delicious. I preferred the caramel sauce with it. 

-The ambiance was dark and sexy.  Low lights, candlelights, modern-victorian decor, I love the ceiling. Please look up for me! Cause it's so damn preettty!

-Their theme of the Prohibition is unique. Drinks all themed! Boo-yah! How creative can you get?

Came for happy hour. Heard it was good, but really it is amazing. The place was crowded so we had to wait at the bar for a while. What a joy watching the coolest bartenders serving up fantastic cocktails. What a joy drinking them! The food? So good. Half price steak at happy hour. Are you kidding? Mac and cheese, mussels, every dish cooked and served to perfection. Great service even though the place was jammed. Good music too. I'm a fan.

Unsure why I thought I wasn't reviewing my meal, so sorry for the bad photos! Great service, excellent food. Come during happy hour for 1/2 priced steaks. I sat at the bar and was waited on by every single person behind the bar. Shout out to Matt, my main bartender and waiter for the great service, good conversation and listening ears. I'll be back!
Never disappoints. Excellent steaks, great sides and awesome cocktails. Can't beat the price with Happy Hour from 5-8 every night. I will visit H&R every time I am back in Vegas.

After much research, we decided on Herbs and Rye for dinner after our wedding. Planning from out of town can be scary because you can not actually see the places or taste the food but this restaurant hit it out of the park for us! We had a reservation and requested to sit in the bar area, which they accommodated. 

The Restaurant: Do not let the plain exterior and sign trick you. The interior is darkly light with lots of burgundy and black. It has a very lounge type feel. Cozy yet lively - just what a steak house should be.

The Food: Excellent! We ordered the clam appetizer which we all loved (My husband joked that he could drink the broth it was so tasty.) We each ordered a different cut of steak and they were all quite simply - perfect. Tender, flavorful, juicy, and delicious. The side dishes were also top notch - the jalapeno corn and Brussel sprouts were favorites at our table. We were to full to order dessert but they surprised us with a free order of mini donuts to help us celebrate our wedding. Wow- we somehow managed to eat them and were so glad we did - YUM!

The Drinks: So much fun! They have a huge menu of drinks from all different eras. Everything we tried was very good.

The Service: 4 Star. We had two people assigned to our table and we wanted for nothing. They were very accommodating without being intrusive.  Let's just say they earned a very good, much deserved tip from us!

We can not wait to go back next time we are in Vegas. This was the best meal we had all week and with the happy hour prices it was very reasonable for a steak house!

This is insane that's your response we don't need free meals we all make enough money to eat where we want and let's post the receipt to show you 30% gratuity added. Don't worry word of mouth is the best marketing and trust us we will not be back to go through that experience again there are many other professional business that are worth it.

May I preface by saying I ended up here by default. We had initially decided for a traditional steak dinner at the Golden Steer, but they were closing, and suggested we try Herbs & Rye because they were open late. I immediately called and made a reservation for 11. 

We arrived a little early, and they were able to seat us. They didn't appear to be busy at all. We assumed we had just missed the dinner rush. The atmosphere was loud and dark, but gave you that feel that you were in an old speakeasy from the mob heydays. 

I ordered the surf & turf, filet and lobster tail, and my husband ordered the NY steak with truffle mac n cheese. I also ordered a dirty martini while I waited, which was served with blue cheese olives, which were amazing. When it was delivered to our table everything looked great. Both of our steaks were cooked to perfection. My lobster tail, on the other hand, was way over cooked, and judging by the burnt shell, I should have known. The truffle mac n cheese was okay. It could have used some seasoning, but there wasn't any on the table. My husband seemed to enjoy it though. 

We finished our meal with a few more from their vast and interesting cocktails menu. We are still dreaming about one of them we had that night. It was about that time, sometime after midnight, that we were informed that if we had come an hour later our meal could have nearly been half off for their happy hour. It seemed as though the air had been let out of the room. It would have been nice to know before we had ordered that if we waited we could have had our steaks half off. It wasn't a cheap meal, and after this was mentioned, it kind of seemed like a let down. That completely explained why people started filling up the place at midnight. 

In the end, would I come back here? Perhaps only  for happy hour, and only for the amazing cocktails.

Just heard great things about the place, half price steaks during happy hour, etc.
We were seated right away next to the bar, it's very dark and I wondered if they had little flashlights on the menu like at Capo's up the road, but they did not.  The music was really loud, therefore everyone is yelling to each other, it was a tad deafening.
Our server Joe P was not very good.  As soon as we sat down he was instantly there wanting to take our order, we asked for a few mins to decide, however he was too busy chatting to and hugging friends to come back in a reasonable time, took almost 15 mins.
After ordering we got a basket of bread that was warming and crusty.
Apps arrived, My French onion soup was bland and quite sweet with a huge inedible hunk of bread on it.  Johan had the clams, first time ever and he enjoyed them.
Timing between courses was terrible, good 20 mins after apps were finished did we get the entrees.  
We both ordered rib eyes, one med and one med well, both with the whiskey shallot potatoes and a side of truffle Mac and cheese.  However they had only 1 potatoes and one sweet potato tots, I said to the meal runner that it was wrong, then Joe P appeared and looked at his pad and said, that's correct, I wrote down sweet potato tots.  Had he repeated the order back he would have picked up the error.
Truffle Mac and cheese was ok, creamy and moist.  Whiskey potatoes were too greasy, just like chunky mashed with whiskey and shallots and cheese. It's so dark in there you can hardly see if your steak is over / under cooked.  We took a few bites till we realized they were backwards.  However both steaks were tasteless and bland, no salt or pepper on table cause they should be seasoned to perfection.  $60 for this steak? Not worth it.
Joe P never checked in on how any of our meals were, had no personality, might have been an off night but we won't be back.

I got into Vegas around 10pm from California. One of my regulars had raved about how great the food and cocktails were here, so we decided to give it a try. I'm so very glad we did! Our cocktails were perfectly crafted(I enjoyed every drop). We had the Jack Rose and the Lion's Tail. Our server, Mark Vega was delightful. He was gregarious and funny while still professional. He really tied our culinary journey together. I had the Ribeye with whiskey shallot potatoes, while my dining partner had the blue cheese crusted pork chops with fig. I would definitely recommend this to folks looking to start off their time in Vegas with a bang! They have a great happy hour after midnight as well.
Best happy hour in town.  Great steaks amazing service and a cool scene.  Perfect locals spot .

Herbs and Rye is your old school steakhouse - dark, hardwood and leather interior, a variety of steak - with an extensive menu of craft cocktails sorted by the time period in which they were popular in the U.S. If you're a fan of craft cocktails, steak, or both, add Herbs and Rye to your list of places to visit.

My steak was cooked to perfection with a nice crispy crust and juicy interior. My appetizer, sides, and drinks were all prepared perfectly as well, but what really sets Herbs & Rye apart is the service. Our server was attentive, polite, and clearly loved his job. I would definitely visit again.

Pro tip: go during happy hour (5-8 PM M-S). Drinks and even steaks are 50% off.

Great atmosphere!  Definitely a place to bring and impress a date.  

Let's start with the food.  The beef and chorizo meatball appetizer was amazing.  I would have made love to.them if my date didn't wolf them down so fast!  Savory and delicious, the goat cheese was perfect with them.  Ordered steaks of course.  The add on options are great but my Bone In KC was not a great cut.  Much to fatty.  On the other hand, my date got the filet and it would melt in your mouth.  Don't ever get the whipped garlic mash.  Awful.  Just tasted like cheap instant, disappointing.  

Drinks?  Oh mama!  Great cocktail menu.  Be brave and branch out or just order a Moscow mule (my favorite).  Bartenders here are obviously pros so be patient, these aren't gin and tonics.

Finally, service was great.  Sever was knowledgeable, helpful and attentive.  We came at a busy time but he still made us feel welcome.  Love this joint.

My favorite steak house. Every time I'm in Vegas I come in. The ambience, music, food, old time cocktails, and warm customer service makes it easy to fall in love with. So excited for my food to come out.
Very Romantic place but way too dark and too loud for for me! Food was pretty good, service is very above excellent! The drinks are pretty good too!
Great atmosphere - speak easy like. Food was great. Got the filet - cooked to perfection. Drinks were good. Great wait staff but drinks and food did come out slower than expected (only downside).
Amazing everything!  One of my favorite little spots in vegas! I love recommending this place to my customers for an off the strip experience

Garlic mash and rib eye. It was delicious. I like the house rub the use. It's got a little kick and a lot of bite. Thinking about the food is making my mouth water. The mash had a very good roasted garlic flavor. Yummy!!! Need to try more me u items before I can give it a 5.

I've only been here once, so I'm going straight to the 5 stars, but I have nothing negative to say about this place. It's awesome!! Granted I had the happy hour menu items, so pricing wasn't an issue as those are some good deals, but I could see a dinner getting a little pricey here. Still the service, cocktails, and ambiance make it worth it. 
I had the wings and beef carpaccio, the wings were fine good flavors and crispy, but the beef carpaccio was AMAZING, loved every bite. Perfectly thin slices covered in a truffle mayo drizzle on a bed of arugula, sign me up!! 
Then I drank a Moscow Mule, the most perfect summer cocktail ever, and the glass it comes in is kind of cool too. I also had the Hemingway daiquiri, also very good but I must say the Mule was my favorite.  
The tv's behind the bar were playing TCM's (and 16 candles was on) and the History channel, very entertaining to watch while sipping on some drinks.  Our bartender was the owner, and he couldn't of been nicer, very attentive and still took time to chat up his patrons.
 I will definitely be coming back here to enjoy some more cocktails during their amazing happy hour.

A diamond in the rough.  Not the greatest location in town, but OMG the food and choice of cocktails are out of this world. It's like stepping back into the 20s or 30s when you get there.  The cocktail choices are eye watering.  Then there is the food. We had several item from the menu but I feel the  Caccuccio was the star of the show.  I reminded me of the some of the better restaurants  I have eaten in when in Europe.  I will be back.

Most interesting off strip local hangout for excellent cuts of beef and well crafted drinks. Crowds of locals flock here usually and weekday happy hour pricing is very attractive.

Reservations are recommended since this is such a popular hangout.

Fantastic place! Met some friends who live in LV while we were in town for a trip and they recommended this place, just off the main strip. Drinks are handmade craft cocktails hat are phenomenal. The drink menu is organized by era (Prohibition, Rat Pack, etc.) with short descriptions and the origin/history of each drink. I had the "Remember the Maine", "Vieux Carre", and one more that escapes me. All were fantastic. Then, the food! We ordered during happy hour which means all the steaks are half off. Had a great Flat Iron steak with the Steak Frites. Great dinner and drinks spot!

This place has top-notch steaks! We had a reservation at 12 am so we could take advantage of the half-off steaks. They were cooked perfectly and as tender as they come. I had the New York strip. It was only $21 with the discount! Everyone else had the ribeye. Both were amazing. If I had to choose one, I would go with the ribeye. It's only $29 with the half-off discount and it's around 18 ounces (no bone) if I remember correctly. 

A steak order comes with your choice of one side order. They have several to choose from including mashed potatoes, steak fries, truffle mac-n-cheese, button mushrooms to name a few. They also serve a ton of unique drinks. Some date back to the prohibition days. 

Service is great and our server was very knowledgeable about all the food and the drinks. The ambiance of the restaurant is also pretty cool. They have a lot of cool fixtures on the walls and old news articles dating back many years. I highly recommend for steak lovers!

I came here in the later part of the evening with some girls after work.  We had a group of about 5 girls and it was a challenge to get a table that comfortably all sat us.  They have a fantastic reverse happy hour where their steaks are half off.  A great perk!  Parking can be a challenge as it is a small place with a small parking lot.  The sweet potato tater tots are delicious and come well presented.  The server originally brought the wrong item and the service recovery was fantastic!  I highly recommend! :)

I had several friends recommend this place. I made reservations for a Saturday night at 5pm. I found out they have happy hour until 8pm and included a few appetizers and proteins. We were blown away by the food. Truly amazing place to have steak and a few drinks. We ordered the bistecca flatbread, ribeye steak with red pepper sauce, New York strip with mushrooms and onions, whiskey scallop potatoes and sprouts and swine. It was delicious. Plus you order your steak according to their scale and they will cook to perfection. Great place for locals or if your traveling to Las Vegas and want to try something off the strip. Very easy to find. Make sure to get there early or make a reservation. By the time we left there was a line out the door!

Wow...what a great restaurant!  Happy hour includes Filet Mignon?  That is a great deal that will keep me coming back again and again (including next week when we will have more guests to bring).  I can taste it already.
Parking is really crowded, but that is a function of so many people loving this place, so be prepared to deal with it.
The drink menu is interesting as it takes you across various times of history.  #TooCool  The bartenders are very personable and add a lot to your experience, without being invasive.  We love this place!

I love this place.  It has been a stop we've made the last 4 times in Vegas.  We brought one of our largest clients here for dinner and the food and service were amazing.  Everyone was thrilled with their dinner.

Highlights included: The calimari was awesome as were the meatballs.  Steaks were cooked perfect and the sides were all on point, specifically the jalapeño cream corn.  

Server was great, she did an excellent job and had a great personality.  Love the ambiance, as our clients didn't know what to expect when they walked up but couldn't stop gushing about it the next day.

Well done, and we'll be back

An off the strip (but not too far) local gem! ...You're welcome. 
I am torn about writing a review for Herbs and Rye...I kind of want to keep it off of the radar and keep this little gem all to myself. However, the experience was beyond awesome not to give a huge cheers to the: ambiance, mixologists (bartenders), and food.
Herbs and Rye is everything you want in a dark and sexy bar in a location that you don't want it in..which totally adds to its appeal and allure. (Thank the parking-lot gods, parking was easy breezy).
The ambiance is on point from the dimly lit bar and smartly dressed staff. I'm a sucker for period, artsy, glam, & gothic noir and this fits the bill. 
I sat at the bar and ordered my traditional rye-whiskey and ginger beer. However, I took plenty of time to let the drink menu school me in the ways & ages of alcohol:  Gothic, Golden, Old School, Prohibition, Rat Pack, & Revival!!! The bartenders at Herbs and Rye are mixologists and know the ways of spirits. 
Soooo, I've been around for some 30'ish years and I will go on record saying the tomato bisque soup is the best I've ever had...It's paired with an over the top delicious gourmet grilled cheese sandwich...So DON'T order the amazing yummy flat bread as a side like I did because I didn't read the menu far enough to see the grilled cheese. Ha! Beyond satiated!!!
If I didn't live in Portland Oregon this would be 'my spot'. 
I will absolutely be back the next time I visit Vegas. 
Do come hungry 
Do come thirsty
Do make a reservation for the restaurant 
Do ask the bartenders to make you a 'surprise' drink if you don't know what you want
Don't drink and drive. If you do drive parking lot is available, do have a designated driver. 
Do take a cab/uber...and believe me leaving sober isn't really on the menu 
Don't be alarmed by the co-ed bathrooms but do lock the doors, all of them.
Definitely a little gem!  Fantastic food, wonderful happy hour and certainly affordable.  This might be my new favorite!

This place came highly recommended by a really good bartender at the Alibi room and it didn't disappoint. Anyone who's into really well-crafted cocktails/mixology should check this place out. I can't imagine there is a better bar in Vegas. It's off-strip but nothing you can't easily travel to/from by Uber.

I decided to take my girlfriend here for a nice dinner Upon arrival, I was skeptical based on the restaurant's outward appearance. However, we all know to never judge a book by it's cover. 

We had 5:30 reservations and we arrived fashionably late at 5:45. It was 5:46 when we checked in with the host and she said that they can only hold reservations for 15 minutes, so we had to go back on the wait list. Initially I thought "we are 16 minutes late.. can you cut us some slack?" I wasn't upset though because she was right. No harm, no foul. Next time we will have to leave earlier. Regardless, we only waited about 2 minutes before being seated, which was great. 

Service: our server was Jeremey. He was fantastic. He was well aware of us the entire time and most importantly, he kept our drinks full. Jeremey was polite and professional and he exemplifies the closest thing to a perfect server. 

Atmosphere: bring your night vision goggles because this place is dark! In all seriousness, it's dim, calming, and pretty quiet. Ideal for a nice dinner or special occasion.
