Food and Drinks: we took advantage of the happy hour specials, so we had wells mixed drinks, half off appetizer, and steaks. Everything was delicious.

Drinks
- Me: Gin and Tonic
- Girlfriend: Whiskey Coke 

Appetizer: Spicy Mussels
- These were heavenly. The joy you experience while eating these is comparable to the joy you felt as a kid on Christmas morning. We demolished the mussels and we couldn't stop eating the spicy red sauce that was left over. I highly recommend this. 

Entree
Me: 14oz New York Strip and Garlic Mashed Potatoes
- The steak was amazing! I love New York strips because of how lean and tender they are. This steak was the leanest steak I've ever had (hardly any fat) and it was cooked to perfection. I also added the Herbs and Rye rub, which was solid. 
- The garlic mashed potatoes were excellent. I enjoyed that they weren't overly complicated and rich. 

Girlfriend: 14oz New York Strip and Truffle Mac and Cheese
- she loved her steak! She also says that she enjoyed how lean, tender, and flavorful it was. 
- Megan (girlfriend) fell in love with the Mac and cheese. I'm pretty sure she would have no issues leaving me for a bowl of this Mac and cheese. She said it was the best she had ever had, which means a lot considering she is a Mac and cheese fanatic that has tried them all. 

Overall, we love Herbs and Rye and will certainly be back soon. If you have not tried this place yet, put it at the top of your list of places to try!

We were a large group in town for work. This is our one 'night out' each year as we are here for quite a stretch of time.  We decided to try something different and after a bit of research picked Herbs and Rye.  We had 5:30 reservations and were advised to not be late - take head, they got very busy!!!! 
This is the coolest place.  The atmosphere and vibe were so much fun.  The music was awesome. Leaves you feeling like Al Pacino or Robert Di Niro are going to come strolling in.   the food - best we've had in Vegas.  If you get there between 5-8 p.m. it is happy hour, which means all of their steaks are half off.  Our table had a variety of appetizers, steaks, sides, and the spicy mussels.   Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their food.  One person had their filet prepared Pittsburgh rare - he said that was the best he's ever had at a restaurant.  
Our wait staff was amazing.  Even with how busy they were we never felt rushed. They were spot on the entire evening.   Their cocktail menu can be a little overwhelming- but the waiter was very versed and could easily point us in the right direction.  It's probably the coolest cocktail menu I've ever come across, broken up by era instead of type of liquor- so like "Rat Pack" selections or "Prohibition" where the cocktails in each category were those you would have found in those times.  We've already decided we'll be back here next year.  And might even find time to sneak back this year!!!! 
Hats off to a great local team.

Favorite cocktail bar in the Vegas area, hands down. I've had some great experiences with some of the bartenders, with really personal service. If you let them, they're really good about getting a feel for your flavor palette, and then being innovative with your drinks. They've got a huge assortment of beers and spirits.

Friday and Saturday nights can get a little busy if you're coming for the bar, especially during their happy hour every night from 5-8pm. I suggest coming early, or right around 7 when the first crowd is finishing up at the bar. It's half off several drinks and some appetizers, but I really go for the muscles and steak. $30 ribeye steak and I'm there. It's not the greatest, but it's decent, and you can get it rare (real rare, which some places skimp on). I've also tried it with their house rub, which is pretty good.

Definitely the place I go when I want a good happy hour for some steak, muscles, and excellent craft cocktails. Don't know that I'd come for the food at full price though, to be honest, haha!

They do this half off steaks during happy hour that is the best deal in town! I got a flank steak with sweat potato tots and mac n cheese. The steak was great, but maybe a little too rare to be a medium rare. The mac and cheese was out of this world. As we're the donut dessert. Will definitely come back.

The food and service here is amazing. We are locals and always bring visitors in. You can't go wrong with the steaks and OMG the sides. The Mac & Cheese and Jalapeno Corn are musts. Honestly we've never had a bad meal here. 
However you need to know that if you order during their amazing happy hour (50% off steaks, a few apps, & some wine) your auto gratuity will be based off what the original price of the food and drinks would have been. We were there over the weekend and tipped over $100 for a $300 check. It needs to be stated on the receipt that the tip is based on the "original" price. We always tip on the original price anyway. But it's a good thing to state.
But all in all, this place is great!

This is one of my favorite places in Vegas! Often passed by, this place is a hidden gem. A dark interior gives it a mysterious, almost prohibition-era speak easy ambiance. Even the menu is artistically designed, categorized by era and a description of the drink and its origins on every cocktail. I came on A Saturday night and sat at the bar, and the service was exemplary. I had a glass of water on the side with my cocktail and it was not only refilled, but when the ice melted it was replenished. I listed five stars for food, drinks, service, and atmosphere. Pricing is high, but well worth it!

Awesome find, totally worth the effort to leave the strip. Cocktails were great, food was delicious, staff was attentive, happy hour pricing was absurd. We would happily pay full price for this experience, couldn't believe how little we spent. Seems to be busy ALL of the time - make a reservation, even on a Wednesday night.

Took my first trip to Las Vegas, and this is definitely one of the highlights. On our last night we asked a bartender at our hotel bar for food recommendations and he mentioned this place. Three of us grabbed a cab and headed this direction. With the cab dropping us off in a gas station parking lot, we were very skeptical.

Even walking up to the front door- we thought about turning around only to discover as soon as we entered this was a Vegas gem. Amazing cocktail list, beautiful food options and impeccable service.  A very relaxing (& swanky) atmosphere made for a great last dinner in the city. I am looking forward to my next trip here!

Not much more to say than what has already been said. Great ambience, limited parking. They were booked up with reservations until 8:30pm the Thursday evening we wanted to go, so we showed up as walk-ins at 6pm, and were seated within 10 minutes.

This happy hour is killer - half priced filet mignon meant four of us could eat rich for $100. Our server was wonderful, and great at recommending drinks. I got the Brown Derby, which was the right amount of strong and sweet.

The sides were all excellent - we got four different ones so we could share: truffle mac and cheese, truffle and parmesan steak fries, garlic mashed potatoes, and some kind of whiskey potatoes.

Will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas.

I was so excited to come and have dinner and drinks with my friend here....then we got there...there is only ONE CO ED BATHROOM  for the whole reatraunt and bar long wait just to use the restroom and on top of that there was NO SOAP in the bathroom! The food was NOT all that great don't get the pasta there our friend got it and she said it had no taste to it at all...I got sweet potato totts with marsh mellow and I swear I had like 7 marshmallows  covering my totts. THEN we asked our server to split our check and he had an attitude and didn't want to split the check for us so WE did the math for him and split our own check basically!!! Then just to let everyone know you pay automatic gratuity based on full priced dinner and drinks! Now happy hour special....out server was NOT good at all he did not deserve an $80 tip!!! This place was horrible and I'll never come here again.

Helllo everybody !!! So I've came to realize that i need to yelp at all times because i always look at yelp #1 & #2 i like to read what kind of experience everybody had. Well anyways HERBS & RYE let me start by saying what an amazing experience. The food was phenomenal, the service was extremely well educated & knowledgeable Charlie knew everything on the menu, I've never attended there and he went down the whole menu with me. Charlie told me about an amazing drink called "black Thorne" & let me say that was sooo yummy it's creepy to say that's my favorite drink now (I'm a tequila drinker not gin) & it's only $13 (oh yeah my server was so dope he wrote down this recipe for me)!!!!!!  I had surf and turf  and it was just soooo perfect !!! The lobster was just to die for, the Mac and cheese made me melt!!! One thing that i would like is for the light to be a little brighter ... other then that what an amazing experience and thank you sooooo much Charlie for educating me. I will be back for happy hour. You all are amazing !! Thank youuuuu!!! I unfortunately i took videos not pictures ........ next time i know to take pictures !!! My videos are to die for ... oh well next time.

Yes!!! it was super easy to make reservations for 7 online. We were promptly seated when we arrived and our server was awesome.  

The happy hour is great!  Yes, the steaks are 50% off and the steaks are yummy.  My filet had more of a char than I'd prefer, but it was still yummy.  Bonus... each steak comes with a side!  I got the truffle mac and cheese!  It was really rich. 

Love the variety of drinks that they have. We will definitely be back when we visit Vegas.

This review is for 4.5 stars.

I have to preface this review and rate the bar/drinks separately than the food.  The bartenders were exceptional and the food was very good for the half off, Happy Hour price, but not wroth the actual price.  The bar was a 5 star no doubt, while the food was 4 stars.

I ordered 3 separate drinks while dining at Herbs & Rye.  Each time I asked for a certain type of alcohol and they surprised me with a delicious concoction.  The menu is extensive by itself, but I always love getting unique, unknown drinks from great bartenders when possible.  Trust me, the drinks are top notch, but on par with strip prices ($12).

The food was very solid as well.  I had the rib eye and a side of brussel sprouts.  Since it was Happy Hour the steak was half off, but I don't think it was worth the full asking price of $40+.  If it wasn't for the great half off prices for my steak, I think I would have rated the meal portion of my visit lower.

Overall I enjoyed my dinner very much.  For a cocktail, this is the place to go.  The bqrtenders are friendly, knowledgable, and on top of their mix drink game.  The food was solid at Happy Hour prices (5-8pm), but a bit high for a regular night out on the town compared to similar Vegas strip steak restaurants.  Herbs & Rye is close enough to the strip to warrant a trip.  I definitely recommend a visit.

Awesome drinks and food.

Ordered a couple drinks from the prohibition selection all were super yummy.

Food

Being a vegetarian it's a little limiting. But just order a bunch of sides

Button mushrooms -yummy
Garlic spinach-  awesome 
Crispy truffle fries- awesome 
Sweet potato tater tots- ok
Truffle Mac and cheese- weak, watered down. Def pass on it. 

Friend of mine order the the filet sliders- said it was really good. 

Service was very good and attentive. Good vibes and decor about the place.

Def recommend. Def coming back.

I can't believe that I have never reviewed this place. It's our go to steak house in Las Vegas. On top of that it's also one of our favorite all around restaurants in town. The steak happy hour is an awesome reason to visit. They also have a great full bar with a lot of vintage drinks. The sazerac is always great. Nectaly operates a great place. I hope that this place never closes!

Been to Vegas plenty of times and thanks to the suggestion of some local friends, found my favorite place to eat ever! The HH is unbeatable and the steaks at 50% off are amazing! Service was great and the ambiance is as well. HIGHLY recommend a trip here!!!

I am really so hopeful for Herbs & Rye but I can't seem to get the consistency to keep the stars going.  One day it's a meh drink, the next awesome, the next good, the next meh.  I don't know what it's gonna take to get the consistency but please oh please find a way!  I love the concept and effort and passion.

Amazing cocktail menu, and equally amazing bartenders!
Ask for Matt or Joe, they will see you are well taken care of. 
If you can make Happy Hour, you will not be disappointed.

Came Saturday night with my girl. One thing about this place is the servers are so amazing here and the bartenders are the best in Vegas. Ordered my usual Mussels in a Spicy marina sauce with extra bread to dip, I can eat this 3 times a week. Also got the beef carpaccio which was excellent. Had the Calamari and this dish honestly has to go off the menu, forgotten forever. It was flavorless fried calamari topped with a pound of peppers and it was totally soggy, it's should be crispy every bite. Im from NY and i know good fried calamari. Change the breading on the Calamari and serve it with a spicy marinara and lemon and bam

This is an updated review. Came here last night with a party of 6 and I was soooooooo disappointed with the meal. This is the first time I've ever ordered food other than some appetizers. The spicy mussels they brought out were ice cold, still love the sauce though. My GF ordered a Filet Mignon and we always eat Med-Rare and it was clearly medium and tough. I on the other hand ordered the Rib Eye and it honestly could've been the worst steak I've ever had. It was overcooked and there was tons of cartilage in it where it took me 15 seconds to chew a single bite. The jalapeño creamed corn was good and the truffle mac was good. The moscow mule was overflowing with ice that ice was falling off as they handed us our drinks so basically 5 sips and we were done. Not exactly a good night at this place. If they plan on opening a steak house called clever they better get better quality meat than they served la




 I love this place. Me and my gf go here all the time. The spicy muscles is amazing, i dip a whole loaf of bread in the sauce. I also love their drinks, I usually order the Moscow Mule and its always perfect. I like the darkness in their and the music is great. I heard they're opening a steak house soon, can't wait to try it out

Very good place for late dinner!! Pricy but we have a great time, we order calamary for starters was awesome!! Ryb steak was good,drinks very strong OMG , service very friendly an proffecional, i will comeback for sure

I can't wait to go back!  What a cool place.  I just moved from Chicago and this totally made me feel like I was back in Chicago.  The exterior looks like this funky building that does not look fancy...but inside...exposed brick walls, dark lighting, beautiful bar...it was perfect.  The cocktails are all classics from different eras.  I had a bad day and needed some bourbon stat, Herbs and Rye had my medicine.  I had three seperate cocktails, all with bourbon, all delicious.  I would say the sazerac had a bit too much absinthe in it for me, but other than that it was all delicious.  The bartenders were good, knowledgeable and friendly.

We shared a wedge salad, better than most and a flatbread with prociutto and asparagus on it.  It was good, not phenomenal, but good.  

I need to go back during happy hour and eat and drink more!

The perfect example of don't judge a book by its cover - The outside, is meh at best but inside you're transported. This place reminds me of some of the high-end bars in NYC, and some of the cocktails are at the same price point but ultimately, you get what you pay for. THIS PLACE IS GREAT from the food to the drinks (definitely the drinks).

Average food and service for the price of expensive restaurant. Got automatically charged 20% tip for 5 people. Drinks are nothing special and food is plain. Felt like I didn't get what I paid for. Rip off!

This place was not what I expected, in a good way! When we pulled up in our Uber we had no idea how to even get in! It looked nothing like a restaurant from the outside. Then someone walked out so we went in. It was a smaller place from what I could see, but we never made it all the way in. We checked in at the hostess stand for our reservation and were seated immediately in the room to the right at the first table so that's as far in as we went. I had to take away a star because this is a true steakhouse, not a lot of opinions for a vegetarian. I went here on a recommendation from my friend that lives in Vegas and my husband is not a vegetarian so it was fine. My husband was a waiter at a very well known steakhouse where we live and he said the steak he had  at Herbs & Rye was perfectly seasoned and one of the better steaks he's ever had. He also had the truffle mac & cheese as a side and had really good things to say about that too. My margarita flat bread was excellent and I got a side of their garlic mashed potatoes and was very happy with both. The wait staff was amazing and friendly and I truly enjoyed our night out.

Love herbs & rye! Came here over a dozen times and we've always had so much fun. AMAZING happy hour and bar menu. 

BARMANIA was suuuuch a treat as well. Nothing like locals supporting a local treasure. 

The steak is prepared beyond expectations, and that late night menu is always an amazing fall back!

Holy moly! I've been here a few times, but tonight was my first time for dinner. Let's start with pre-dinner drinks. This place really knows how to craft a cocktail. So far I haven't had a bad cocktail yet, but I'm mostly a vodka or wine girl. The happy hour red is not too shabby. I wish there were more choices, but considering the awesome HH food choices, I think we can agree to let that one go. 

Our friends told us about the happy hour until 8pm and we were shocked that it includes half off steaks! What a great deal. We started with the mussels appetizer. I loved the sauce. Mussels tasted great, but that red sauce had a real nice kick to it. Quite a few of the mussels would not open, but the waiter had no issue bringing us another batch. For dinner, I ordered the Bone - in Kansas city. It was very flavorful and tender. I'm seriously laying in bed still thinking about it. 
We also ordered the garlic smashed, garlic spinach, and sweet potato tots. Best way I've ever had sweet potato.  The spinach and smashed came out with a piece of garlic clove on top. Nice touch. I liked all of our sides, but the favorite at the table was the truffle Mac n cheese. 

Ronnie was an excellent server. Very knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. If you have any questions on the menu, ask him! I'm not one for adding anything to an already amazing steak, but my friend really loved the chimichurri add on. My other friend cautioned that the ribeye was quite fatty, but the bf ordered it and was very happy. It was huge! They also ordered the homemade doughnuts and ice cream cookie. I can't comment on taste, because I was good and abstained, but it smelled delicious. Either would have easily been enough for the whole table! 

I will def be back, I just don't know if I'll be able to try any of the other steak choices, as I'm still dreaming of the Kansas. Yum!

As a local, i try to stay away from the strip and go to different places as often as i can. Wow, this place is fantastic! Love their late night happy hour! We went there a little earlier, so we didn't get to try the happy hour, but for two drinks it was about 20$. I think thats reasonable. The docor is awesome too! 50s style, exposed brick, music in the background and the bartenders are wearing black and white. This place is very similar to Commonwealth (a bar downtown) and i will definetelly be back over and over again
Service was painfully slow. Meals were good but I would not recommend paying the full prices. Go during happy hour and take advantage of the 50% off items. We probably won't be back.

Drinks are fantastic. However steak left me a little sad. I ordered a rare filet mignon. Instead I got a steak burnt on the outside and medium rare on the inside. I'll return for drinks but not for the steaks.

Awesome dining experience! My husband had been here before on a previous trip to Vegas and suggested we go for our anniversary dinner. Debra was our server and took excellent care of us. We started with the spicy mussels as an appetizer. So unbelievably good that I wanted to drink all of the delicious sauce after the mussels were gone. Then we shared a large perfectly cooked rib eye with sides of asparagus and their delicious mac and cheese with truffles. Their menu of specialty cocktails is extensive and we tried the  Vesper and Scofflaw - both were excellent. I suggest making reservations for dinner on the weekend - it's very popular and packed to the hilt and standing room only at the bar.

So I made reservations for my birthday celebration for Friday 3/30 for 16 people and they were more than accommodating. I chose Herbs & Rye due to the awesome reviews and their happy hour deals. What I didn't know is that basically you still get robbed on your bill. Technically your bill should be based on what you paid and your taxed on what you paid and you tip on what you paid. Nope not here. Now do-not get me wrong my waiter was fabulous and I am all for paying 20%. But if my bill is $369.25 with tax and tip how the hell you figure you should get $524.18. When I questioned it I was told it based on the price before the discounts. YEA I DONT THINK SO. Very very disappointed with your way of doing business. 

5/16. It's funny how I made this complaint and no one has ever responded. Soo sad.

We have probably come a dozen time, they have such an amazing menu there's not one thing i don't love on this menu. The drinks are just as good if you like a good strong drink. There your guys. The environment is very chill and romantic great for any dinner plans. And staff is incredibly nice.

Went for Happy Hour a few days ago and I was decently impressed with the quality. Didn't know what to expect, but the steakhouse was fairly good! Really enjoyed my meal, sides, and drink, and decent service as well! Always attentive!
First time here food was amazing and drinks were even better thanks to our amazing server Allie and her recommendations. This place is the best
Love this place. Best steaks for low cost when you go during happy hour! The inside is so elegant and fun. I personally love sitting at the bar and watching the bartenders work.

So many good things to say about this place! From drinks to service quality to perfect steaks this place is phenomenal. Unique ambiance with class and style is the best way to describe the atmosphere in this restaurant. I'm a sucker for their specialty crafted drinks and try a different one every time I go and have yet to be let down. My favorite is the Pimms Cup. For apps I love me some garlic and butter Clams as well as some of the best carpaccio I've had. I've never had a bad steak at Herbs and Rye but my favorite is the filet topped with blue cheese and bacon. For dessert the deep fried donuts are a must. If I have people in town i always make it a point to hit Herbs and rye

Last time I was here I did not have a pleasant experience. Thought we would give them a try again. Made reservations online, came in today to say there is no reservations for us and no seats available. The restaurant was empty and they only had 1 reservation for 6pm in their computer. Lady at the host desk wasn't very pleasant either. Definitely won't be back!

Answer to the response from whoever. 1. Aren't you supposed to be the professional? 2. I'm not stupid, I know where I was. 3. The restaurant was empty when we walked in 4. Your STAFF showed me the computer.  Don't worry, we won't be back. Thanks for being a crappy business

Came here for mine and my boyfriends 2 year anniversary.
We came during happy hour ( which was BEYOND packed!! I will give you the advice of making a reservation a day before hand if you want seats) 
The steaks are 1/2 off during Happy hour. 
I ate a New York Strip Med. Rare with the chimichurri sauce  and my boyfriend had the same but with the red wine reduction. 
We both ordered garlic mashed potatoes with it. 
The steak was DELISH! The potatoes were okay. 
Our drinks were yummy! I had the Diablo and he had.... uh oh I don't remember haha...
Ronnie ( spelling?) was our waiter and the place was so full peoples butts were pressing on our table by the bar. 
Regardless of how busy it was he gave us great service and he was awesome!
Emily was bartending and she worked really hard, I don't think she stopped moving for a second! She's the best in town so I would suggest you go get a drink made by her because she's the master.

This place is amazing I'll be back again and again.

I'm not one for writing reviews on Yelp as I think the majority of yelpers aren't qualified to be writing reviews and for the most part are full of self importance. This is my first (and hopefully only) post on this terrible app. Only doing it as I've read too many reviews from people with sh#t for brains.

1) Don't take stars off venues because they only have a small parking lot. Parking is a privilege not a right. Bars/restaurants/lounges pay rent on the entirety of the land the venue occupies, including the parking lot. They are not generating revenue from parking, so just be happy that any parking is provided. Walking 10 minutes isn't going to hurt you, tubby.

2) Don't take stars off a steak house/cocktail lounge for having no beers on tap. If you want tap beer perhaps you should be at a pub. If you feel the need to drink beer at a cocktail lounge drink bottled beer; if you can't afford bottled beer what the hell are you doing at a cocktail lounge?

3) Don't take stars off a restaurant because there's nothing you really felt like eating on the menu. Seriously...you went there Einstein. If I was craving sushi, I wouldn't go to an Italian restaurant, then complain about the lack of sushi.

4) Don't complain about waiting 10 mins to be served at a cocktail lounge. Life is not about instant gratification. If you want your order taken and a drink in front of you within 2 mins of setting foot at the bar, then go to a dive bar. If you want a cocktail that is made with pride and care, be prepared to wait. Cocktail lounges and dive bars are not the same thing. Would you go to Gordon Ramsey's gourmet burger restaurant and expect to have your food in front of you within 5 mins of being seated? No, you'd go to McDonald's.

5) Don't start your review with the  words "I'm a vegan"
No-one cares.

6) Don't spend 30 mins in a venue and give a 3 star review, then state it's because you didn't have enough time to give them an appropriate evaluation. Why the fudge are you reviewing them in the first place? Full of self importance and hurting a business' livelihood just to indulge your e-peen.

7) Don't deduct a star because you walked in at 7pm without a reservation and had to wait 30mins for a table. Whose fault is it you're disorganized and think you're special? The restaurant? News flash, you're not special. You're waxed mustache and ironic t-shirt are almost identical to the guy sitting at table 3.

8) Why on God's green earth would you deduct a star because the venue is "too busy"!?!? Punish the venue for being good at what they do and attracting business...that's the spirit.

Seriously...1st world problems for people who apparently have a 1st world education. Petty complaints for people looking for reasons to be unhappy. Enjoy life; we're here for a good time not a long time, so make the most of it.

Herbs and Rye is a great place; the food is superb and the cocktails are even better. Staff are awesome if you don't go out of your way to be a jerk. Go in with the right attitude and you'll have a great time.

I came here with some coworkers and we had a really nice dinner. The place gets busy but is fairly big. We ordered a bunch of dishes to share, including shellfish. The food was really tasty with decent portion sizes.

It was a bit dark and noisy inside, but lively too. Service was great. Prices high average. Recommend!
Way off the strip, and a total gem! The Prohibition era drinks are off the hook! Waitstaff is at 10 and the food is even better! It's a definite must go...

You step in off Sahara Avenue. It's late afternoon, 5:30 pm. The stark contrast between daylight and the darkness in Herbs & Rye temporarily hurts the eyes and causes you to see total darkness for a few seconds after the door shuts quietly behind you, escorting you into a lush experience as your eyes adjust to the light levels and you see the colorful yet subdued sprawling bar and restaurant. Dark woods, candlelight, think old Vegas, where the locals might hang out. Or those who go for a menu that is more drink than meal. Definitely more substance than fluff.

Happy hour is from 5-8 pm (and I think 12-3 am) with half off most cuts of beef and 50% off house wines and a few other things. 

The house wine (Dark Horse) was very good for a by-the-glass reasonable option and I had two glasses. My husband had a glass of champagne and thought it a bit sweet - he would have ordered more had there been a larger selection and a definitive brut.

My husband loved his steak, the 18 oz ribeye. It was so big he took half of it to go and it was done so perfectly that he was able to reheat it and it was still mildly medium rare the next day for lunch. Touche!

I am a vegetarian but I looked at the menu before we arrived and I knew what I'd order: tomato bisque soup and the brussels sprouts. The soup was spectacular and the sprouts were delicious.

We will be back the next time we are in Vegas!

We will make this a regular visit every time we come to Vegas! Great food, amazing music, friendly service. Mark was great! I will recommend this place to all my friends. Keep up the good work Herbs & Rye! Xo- Jessica, Jenny, Don & Felix

This place has the potential to be the coolest place in town, but the owner (no neck  telli) is way to proud! He has a great staff with a great product.  Emily (bartender) is as good as it gets. She mixed a top of the line Manhattan, but two dollars for a God damn ice cube is out of line. No neck is gonna charge $14 for a cocktail and slap you for an additional  $2 for a freaking ice cube on Valley view and Sahara? Are you kidding? No neck look into a price check and a exercise regime and your future will look bright!

Was completely blown away! We were told to come here from a local, and wow, it didn't disappoint! The atmosphere is wonderful, but the food is what knocked it out of the park for us. I will be dreaming of the Mac and cheese for months! Overall, this was one of the best dining experiences we have ever had. Keep continuing what you are doing, and we will come back every time we are in Vegas

Me and my friends were in town to celebrate my birthday early, because my birthday falls on Thanksgiving day this year. We had heard from our server at Serendipity that we should eat at Herbs & Rye. So, we made reservations and headed to Herbs & Rye. We got there late, but after a short wait, they were still able to seat us. We had a great server. He asked if we had been there before, and since we had not, he told us about a special ordering trick, for orders before 8pm.

Drinks were good, food was good. I had a flatbread and friends had filet mignon. There is a nice little vibe going on here!

Great sides, but be sure to order one temp up on your cut. My med rare fillet was mooing at me.
Atmosphere & cocktails A++++

I was here about a month ago with my parents and my review is based solely on the drinks but I have to say... we wished we would have just eaten there and will defiantly be back to do so. We sat at the bar and all of the bartenders were very personable and knowledgeable in drinks. My dad asked about a high end scotch which was about $135 a shot. yes, a shot. He was just curious but because it was his birthday, the bartender was nice enough to let him try about 3 different types of scotches. The ambiance is very intimate with the dim and red lighting. Can't wait to go back :)

This place never fails and always hits the spot. Price wise I've only been here for happy hour after midnight.  Steaks are 2 legit to quit - med rare rib inyo eye with Mac n cheese side. I have mention their drink menu is the best ive seen.  Other good mentions are the clams, root beer float, doughnuts yes dough deez nuts, and you can't go wrong with an old fashioned. Boom! You're welcome

Am taking a star away because the service was ridiculously slow. It was the type of slow where you need to order your next round of drinks when receiving prior round. Had to try and find someone to assist several times. Brought out of towners here and was embarrassed quite frankly, especially after talking it up about the place. We were sitting in the bar.

Have been here several times, and usually sit in the bar. The drinks are delicious. The food is good but not outstanding and is overpriced for what it is. If you want something to nosh on while drinking suggest the flatbreads. They are yum!

Have also had issues making rez. Three times reserved a table in the bar for dinner only to find out there was a private party, or they had gotten the info incorrect w out apology. Would say their hosties could use some training.

Everyone looks good in this place because they keep the lighting nice and dim. if you pick anyone up there, make sure you give them a once over w better lighting on the way out.
Food was flavorful, staff is friendly and attentive. Pretty big drink menu. Definitely would go again. Happy hour is half off on double star items

If you come to this place and order from the bar always order from mark! Everyone else doesn't come close.  Mark makes the best drinks.  My GF made the mistake of ordering from someone else .  Big mistake on her part!!!!

Gotta come for HH. Great prices on steaks! Drinks are well, but only 5 bucks.
I got the giant ribeye, and YES, I ate it all by myself. It was delicious. Had to stress repeatedly, WELL DONE, BURNT, and they got it right which made me very happy. The sides were lackluster IMO. We got the mac and cheese, sauteed garlic spinach (we had to send back and ask for no salt as when it came out it was DOUSED with salt. Inedible really), the creamed corn and brussel sprouts. The jalapeno creamed corn didn't have the kick I was looking for, I already told you about the not so garlicy spinach, the brussel sprouts were OK and the mac and cheese was OK to. The service was slow. Our waiter didn't seem to care to much about keeping our drinks full or bringing out the food quickly. Shit, he didn't even take our order for food til we were there over half an hour. But, for HH, I would absolutely come back. My steak was delicious and for half price, that deserves another visit!

Awesome place. First experience tonight & everything was great - one of a kind drinks and phenomenal food. Flatbread, filet & mac & cheese.. sooo good!

Came here for a friends birthday. Was nicely greeted & seated right away. Their cocktail menu is interesting because they have all these unique drinks so we all had a fun time choosing something new to try (highly recommend Weekend at the Waldorf & Pimms Cup). Service was great throughout our time here, we even let our waitress choose our second round of drinks. Happy hour was 1/2 off a lot of food items & well drinks. Little pricey so I would take advantage of happy hour. There was 4 of us & our bill was a little over $300. $100 of it being 2 rounds of shots, 2 rounds of cocktails, 2 filets, 2 sides, wedge salad & a flatbreads.. not bad at all. They also gave us a plate of amazing mini donuts for my friends birthday! 

Kind of a hole-in-the-wall place. I've heard of it before but never knew where it was or what it looked like so I was surprised when I saw it. Happy we came here & looking forward to coming back. Great atmosphere, nice ambiance, got pretty crowded around 1:30am-2am.
Really awesome!! You'll know what I mean if you go during the 5-8 happy hour!! Try to sit at or near the fantastic bar!!

When I walked into to Herbs and Rye, it was almost pitch black. It took a minute for my eyes to adjust to the darkness. I was greeted by the hostess and walked over to the bar. I looked around and immediately was reminded of Fangtasia from True Blood.  There's an old school vibe with the brick walls, red and black wallpaper, chandeliers. and private dark leather booths. The background music was modern and made me feel like I was a vamp tramp. (Yeah, I'm a dork.) I know the theme is prohibition but I couldn't help but think of Fangtasia. Needless to say, I really dug the vibe and decor.

My friends and I came for happy hour. I was a little disappointed that cocktails weren't on the happy hour menu as I read about how well crafted and delicious they are. I was on a budget so I settled on a draft beer which was like $4-5 (I can't recall). 

The best part about happy hour is the food. Unlike other restaurants where you get small bites off of the appetizer menu, here you get 50% off hefty entrees. I ordered a Kansas City Steak Strip with Truffle Mac and Cheese for $15! My husband got the Flat Iron Steak with Jalapeno Cream Corn. We all ordered different items off of the happy hour food menu and everything tasted like it was fine dining. 

When our waiter mentioned their homemade donuts, we were sold. The donuts came with two types of dipping sauce but I preferred to eat them plain. They were so fresh and fluffy and definitely worth saving room for.

Service was wonderful. We never had an empty glass. Our waiter was friendly and answered all of our questions. 

I would definitely come back again to try the cocktails and to have another perfectly cooked steak with the mouth watering truffle mac and cheese. Maybe next time I'll sit at the bar and try to look dark and mysterious to match the vibe of this place.

This place was amazing! Great service from beginning to end. Our waiter had a great sense of humor, and he was very knowledgeable about the menu. They have a lot to offer. Tons of different specialty drinks. We went during happy hour, so basic mixes were a great deal! All of the food was very full of flavor and great portions for the price. The bistecca flatbread was probably my least favorite bc of the small pieces of steak and over abundance of arugula! The ribeye was perfectly cooked! A nice char on the outside, seasoned simply, and perfectly tender. The truffle Mac and cheese is very rich, but if you're a true cheese lover, you will be delighted! They had well seasoned topping for the steak. The mushrooms and spinach put all those salty, savory tastebuds to work! Definitely a great place to visit in Vegas!

I don't think there is one bad thing about this place!! First off, they have happy hour from 6-8pm and 12-3am, what?! That includes half price off of all of their steaks! That's right, half off. Included with your steak is also a side of your choice. Our server was Charlie, and he was not only extremely helpful with what to order drink and food wise he was very attentive and funny! We had a table of 4, all ordered some type of steak and split all of our sides family style. The steaks were all cooked to perfection and the sides were plenty for us to share.  I also had a wedge salad that was amazing!! The drinks are also delicious. GO HERE, like tonight!!! You wont be disappointed

I've been here multiple times but I think it was the wrong day to come here when I did. If this had been my first experience here, I'd be pretty upset. But, I understand it was happy hour, pretty busy. I usually expect the server to try to start a conversation and try to connect in some way. Not this time. The server we had was barely ok. Not to mention it took more time to wait on our food than to actually eat it. Also, the pizookie was delicious but it burnt my tongue. The happy hour special for steak is still well worth it despite having to sacrifice the service. The red wine glaze is the bomb!! I will say that the busboy definitely good job of making sure my glass of water was full and picking up the slack of the waiter. Luckily, I enjoyed my company or would've been an incredibly long three hours.

This place is a hidden gem! I've lived and Las Vegas my entire life and I feel like I've been living a lie not knowing that such a fantastic place to hang out and grab a drink with friends was in such close reach! The old school decor with the jazzy music selection and dark lit environment really brings an intimate feel. The drink selection is amazingly elaborate, I felt it necessary to order at least three different drinks from different eras. The flat breads blew my mind, and our waiter brought to my attention that happy hour is from 5-8 which includes many of their steaks at half price (average steak price seemed to be around $40)!!                 So happy to discover this place, If you decide to give it a try Id recommend dressing up a little just to bring the experience over the top (casual clothes work too, but once you step inside you'll see what I mean). Order drinks from different eras, and don't forget to bring good company :)

We were in town visiting my Son and he took us here for appetizers and drinks. From the outside it looks like any other Bar/Restaurant but don't let that fool you. Once inside the ambiance grabs you with its throwback pub/saloon look. The bar is FULLY stocked and staffed by experienced bartenders. Large bar area and restaurant area is spacious. 
We had the littleneck clams and a flat bread called the Farmer. The sauce for the clams was phenomenal and clams cooked to perfection. Suggest using the bread they serve to sop up the sauce!! The flat bread had large chunks of delicious bacon, spinach, cheese and topped with 2 eggs. Drinks were delicious and well made. Service was excellent and friendly. 
Place opens at 5PM and restaurant takes reservations.

This is my boyfriend and my new favorite (weekly) spot. The drinks are spectacular; in my opinion you can't get a better-made cocktail anywhere else. Hats off to Emily- most talented mixologist we've found. Not only is their cocktail menu extensive, but if I'm undecided, I just tell Emily what I'm looking for and she's got it down. I've yet to be disappointed. My personal favorites I've had thus far are the Sloe Gin Fizz, Pina Colada (blender free and the best I've ever had), and Beachcomber. Last night we also ventured into food. The filet mignon sliders and bisteca flatbread are on point. The sliders alone might be the best thing I'v ever eaten. I cannot say enough good things about this place. Keep in mind: it gets very busy on Friday and Saturday nights between 7 and 9pm. Make sure you grab a seat at the bar or table before or after those times because unless you have a reservation you'll be waiting awhile.

Read some of the reviews prior to making my decision on this place, so my expectations were pretty high based of the reviews. For a Saturday night, past midnight, crowd was not bad. Place was clean and music was awesome! They played a lot of old school jams w/videos, which I thought was pretty neat. The bartenders were quick and kept traffic moving along. However, the food-a bit too pricey. For those prices might as well go to a nice steakhouse. The waitresses spent most of their time chit chatting with the D.j. and shooting the breeze with the bartenders instead of attending to all the tables waiting to be served. Fun place for drinks, probably not the best place to go to if you're hungry. Long wait, expensive and not worth the price.

Just to set the scene: I came here for dinner during my bachelor party.

Okay real talk this place looks HIGH KEY shady from the outside. I should've known better than to judge a book by its cover. The inside vibe was so dope. It had an old school steak house feel.

The food was so good and we got super lucky with getting a reservation during happy hour for 10 people. I had the ribeye. VERY good. I ate it too fast and forgot to take a photo.

Tips:
MAKE SURE TO GO DURING HAPPY HOUR it's everyday minus Sunday 5pm-8pm and then again 12am-3am. It's 50% off ALL steaks

I made reservations on Dec 3rd for a party of 14 and we came here last night ie Dec 20th. We waited an hour even though we had reservations. We all stood in the small aisle, servers and people bumping as they go by. My bf asked the hostess who our server going to be and if we can order drinks. She tell us to go to the bar. 

The bar was full, the dining room was obviously full. Every moment go by, people get seated before us. 4 people in my party couldn't wait anymore so they left. Finally an hour later, we got seated. 

The food was pricey. Only a few items on Happy hour. The server  was nice and the manager had some comp appetizers for us to make up for it. The Rib-eye steak came out almost done and not medium rare like my bf requested. The waiter noticed the not touched leftover steak and the somewhat dried mac and cheese, he tried to bring another one. Same thing not upto par. The calamari, pizza, meatballs etc were not anything great. We only liked the drinks and the Linguine Pasta with clams.

Just the two of us who ordered happy hour items cost us $103!

We won't be back!

I would give  this awesome  restaurant  10 stars if I could.   Happy hour 1/2 price steaks that have great  flavor.   Service  was OUTSTANDING.  It was my husband's  bday....so the owner didn't  just bring out  1 dessert. ..he brought  out 2 humongous  tasty treats.  He brought  us a "pizooki" type dessert  with chocolate  chip cookies  and 3 scoops of ice cream (certainly would  have  been plenty).  To top it off he brings a plate full of donuts topped with carmel sauce...they weren't  just good....they were decadent.  I felt terrible  not being  able to finish  them both...but we asked for a to go container....and enjoyed  them later on.   We loved this place and looking forward to bringing the kids in December.

Fantastic cocktails and really good food.  I also can't believe how fast this bar area filled up on a Thursday.   I had three great gin based cocktails an order of the sliders and some sweet potato tots.  I think I may need to make this a monthly thing.  

Oh, and Emily is best bartender.

One of my "go too" places when I visit. And I'm here a lot!! The steak is simply amazing. There rub is legendary! Spicy hot, still full of flavor, absolutely yummy!  Sophisticated, deep flavor, perfectly cooked. After Several try's I will order it a bit on the done side and I usually order rare. This steak is too good to over cook yet the  flavors blend in the way they cook it into the meat.   All others compare to this now. 
The first night it was a bit loud, evidence that I am actually in the 'old' category!  Service was great. I would not go in a hurry, this is a place to be enjoyed.

Food is great, service is terrible and the ambiance is ok a bit dark and the music is so loud.
We had the Rib Eye with truffle fries, meat eas perfectly cooked, taste was excellent and the fries were great, dinner for two on a happy hour less than $70, it is bargain, excellent value for money

So we came here for ourAnniversary and my husband and I really like it. We loved the speak easy vibe, the drinks from that time and they lit my drink on fire! (That was the blood and sand drink) our waiter had great suggestions about the food drink and what to do while in Vegas. It's very dark in there, can't really see the menu but it's part of the vibe. I may be making this a regular Vegas stop whenever I'm in town. My husband had the New York strip it was so tasty and the mashed potatoes

We had such a great meal, drinks, experience tonight. We were looking for a good local place and are so happy this is where we ended up. Great service and a fantastic night. Drinks were amazing. Food was outstanding (get the meatballs!). Thanks for making our Vegas adventure awesome. We will be back and will recommend you to all our friends.

We were pleasantly surprised that H & R was as advertised...great steaks at happy hour prices!  Yes, the outside of the place is not going to win any awards but inside makes up for it.  Christian, the host, is a good guy and Aly, our server, was a pleasure.  All in all, very enjoyable.

First impressions are always important... Love the environment they've created here. Feels super rat-pack, 1920s, old Vegas style. The guy at the host stand even had a fedora on. 

We were here for dinner with friends, but got here early for a drink. We were greeted at the bar by Emily who might be the friendliest bartender I've met yet. She was super knowledgeable and offered us drink ideas based upon our favorite selections.

The menu has an incredible selection of drinks. It's very speak-easy style. So many great choices!

After the bar we moved to the restaurant. After about 20 minutes, the hostess finally came over and asked if we needed anything and said they would find us a waiter. About 10 minutes after that, we finally had a waiter. He was welcoming and pretty knowledgeable about the menu. We placed our order and the food took over an hour to prepare.

The food was really good. I had a filet minion with the herbs & rye house rub. I also had the Mac n cheese along with the jallepeno corn. My steak temp was not as warm as I'd like it to be. 

We ended up not ordering dessert. I would've considered, but was afraid I'd have to wait a long time for it. If they improved their food service, I'd give this place 5 stars.

Very impressed! Happy hour was fantastic! Half of dinner had so many options and the drinks were delicious. Ordered a Moscow Mule, may just be my new favorite. Debra the waitress was attentive and friendly. We dined in the bar area which was a little loud but the overall ambiance was nostalgic. I would definitely go back !!

I'm so in love with this place. I think they have the best steaks in Vegas besides the Michelin starred restaurants, but I don't know... maybe even then. I get the New York Strip with a bleu cheese crust. Oh. Em. Gee! I got the bleu cheese and bacon one time and found the bacon to be a bit much. I mean, they're BIG, THICK slices of bacon. I saved them for a BLT the next day  
Mark is my favorite server. He knows when I say "lots of garlicks" on my garlic spinach, I mean LOTS *on* my garlic spinach. Other servers, bless their hearts, will either forget and bring me a side of cold garlicks or remember and put on, like 4. 
 Whichever way, the service is fantastic. I've never had a problem even when I'm in everyone's way, stalking the bar, waiting for someone to leave because I didn't make a reservation. 
  We usually go during happy hour because it's totally worth it for us because we love steak. There's no happy hour pricing for the cocktails, but the cocktail menu is practically a history lesson. It's especially great for people who like rum (I personally can't drink it), but they can substitute other liquors if you prefer. I did catch a side eye one time when I did, but the bartenders are artists, and I accept their judgment. I usually get a glass of sparkling wine because they serve it in those short, wide champagne glasses instead of the tall flutes. I don't know why this tickles me, but it does :) 

My favorite, favorite place to eat right now. See you guys soon for my birthday!

Everyone in town recommended this place, so my friend and I went for dinner. Unbelievably delicious. We ordered everything we could. Their bleu cheese pasta, 1/2 price steaks, great selection of sides (we had asparagus, mashed potatoes, and truffle mac n cheese), and their signature cocktails were to die for. They're open reasonably late and you can't beat the happy hour.

The good:  Great happy hour items to choose from like the half off steaks.  The spicy Thai wings and clams were delicious! The atmosphere is very old school Vegas, dark and intimate. 

The bad:  Automatic 20% gratuity.  Not a fan of the auto gratuity.  I feel like it makes the wait staff a little lazy since they don't have to worry about good service equaling  a good tip.  We weren't even having dinner items and half our party of six left halfway through the evening.  

The ugly.  Our waitress, Debra, doesn't believe in giving back your entire amount of change on the bill,  To me this is sort of stealing.  Not that it was a huge amount but you already got your 20% and I imagine if she did this to us it's probably her common practice and that adds up after a while and that's not cool.

I absolutely have never had a better cut of steak in my life. I had the filet mignon with the Herbs and Rye rub which is spicy and mind blowing. I'm so upset that I can't visit this place more often because I don't live in Vegas. The food was so good that the 3 people dry humping at the bar right next to us was barely memorable. Let's be real, how can you not remember something like that; it was disturbing. However, that's a funny tidbit but not a reflection of the restaurant itself. I guess Vegas brings out the skank in everyone. 
It was crazy busy. We had reservations and still had to wait for 30 min, which was not a problem at all for us. The server we had was so great Ronnie was his name and he was beyond overworked. My fiancé is a server and neither of us could figure out if he was the only one working there or what. Even with his assistant the dude was super slammed. Nevertheless the food again was incredible.
If you like trying new drinks, the bar tenders are phenomenal!! Whether your palette is for vodka, whiskey, gin, or rum the mixologists will perfect a drink for your liking!!

Came here after we had some tiki drinks at Frankie's. Kinda slim pickins for HH, but we were hella hungry. I got the bone in Kansas Steak, wifey got the Wedge Salad, and we split the Steak and Arugula Flatbread with Truffle Vinaigrette(not on HH menu, but we got it anyway). We also shared the Sweet Potato Tots and Truffle Mac and Cheese with fellow Yelpers at our table

Steak was a perfect medium rare and the truffley goodnes of the flatbread was tasty, so was the wifey's salad...I love blue cheese dressing that "sticks" to your food and doesn't flow like a bad mess.
the sides were okay, not something I'd order again, just like their desserts...ALOHA!!!

The food was amazing which should be the most important thing ....however let me list the con's of this great establishment.

-Parking ...virtually nonexistent
-service... Slow at best
-Ambiance... Wayyyy to dark and gloomy
-Bar...mad crowded
-Large groups...not comfortable at all

I really wanted to love this joint because of the great reviews I read. Maybe if I come back with the wifey only and not a large group it will be better. IDK. But for now I'm sticking with my 2 stars.

The food here is really delicious! The decor is fantastic, and the service was exceptional. Had a wonderful birthday dinner with complementary shots of fernet branca and fresh made doughnuts! We will be back, this is my new favorite place.

Nice place BUT ... Been here twice and they had a sign on the doors both times saying they were "opening late due to technical difficulties" 

Night 1 - bartenders got in a fight so they had to open late. 

Night 2 - they had a party night before she hadn't cleaned up in time. 

They open at 5 pm. That's plenty of time to clean during the day???

We arrived at 7:15 to meetup with a group of 14 people. The organizer had a reservation at 7:30. I was excited to try a new restaurant. At 8:10 we still were not seated. The entire group stood in the cold entrance area for more than 55 minutes!' We decided this was ridiculous and left as 2 other couples decided the same thing. We were highly disappointed and it wasn't the fault of the meetup group organizer since she made prior reservations for the group. Not a good first impression to all of us that were coming to this restaurant for the first time.

Love this place! We lucked out getting seats at the bar for our entire group on a Friday night. This place has good energy, classy old-school decor, a classic cocktail list to match, and a bar staff that is friendly and talented. If you're lucky, you'll get seated near Eddie. My Bijou was perfect and the Ford cocktail he recommend was delish- clean, light, just the right amount of sweet orange. I tasted a bunch of other drinks that friends ordered and all were fantastic. Definitely recommend. Wish there was a place like this in Phoenix!

Had a great time here...I am not much of a drinker but I do like my Whiskey...

The Menu needs to be fixed as I could not read it..the font was hard to read and the red letters made it impossible..I thought because I was not wearing my glasses was the reason, so i asked the guy next to me and he said the same thing.....so fix that and all is good...

I asked the bar tender what was a good drink for whiskey he made me a Brown Derby it was really good..I saw a lot of cool drinks

The Brussels spourtts are definitely  must have no they are a try them before you try anything else kinda thing and I am not a brussel sprout kinda guy.

My new place for a steak as there happy hour has steaks at half price

We are locals and came once before late night and just never made the time To come back until tonight. We came for the 5-8 happy hour on a last minute night without Kids. Steaks 1/2 off were simply decadent. Brussel sprouts were the best I've ever had. I asked the bartender to make my drink with a tequila base since drink menu was too overwhelming for me to make a decision. My cocktail was as good as my food, refreshing and decadent! Just when I thought I'd gone to heaven, we ordered the bread pudding. My husband and I both agreed it was the best dessert we have had in a while! Service excellent. Atmosphere perfect. Can't wait to back!
Great lounge atmosphere off the strip really sort of a hip forward looking retro bar restaurant with the best happy hour in Las Vegas the stakes are great mixology is perfect.
Loved it ! Everything is lovely! And delicious, came for happy hour and it was Great service

This place is plain ridiculous and I love it.  The best place for happy hour hands down. 
We got the  wonderful  signature drinks.. too die for.. 
50% of steaks at Happy hour.. 
Parking is a challenge but worth the hassle
Love this place

I like the cocktails, but the food is really overpriced for what it is- the only time I would go is for their happy hour, and even then it's not cheap. I had the mussels appetizer and a flatbread, other people in my party had the steaks. Both were totally fine, just not worth the high prices.

If you want a romantic spot for a fancy cocktail, this is a nice option- I won't be eating food there again though.

My girlfriend an I really dug the place.  The service was good.  The drinks were good.  The food though.....well, it was extremely salty.  I had the Yardbird and my girlfriend had the Spicy Mussels.  Both of them were really salty.  I wish I would've tried the steak, seeing as this was more of a steak place.  Might give it another try.  Not in a hurry though.  Maybe they won't be so generous with the salt next time.  ;)

This place has an amazing happy hour after midnight! Their steaks are half off and very good. The atmosphere is fun and great to when your on a date of with a big group of people. I didn't expect this place to be as good as it is. I was definitely impressed by the food, service and atmosphere.
Great atmosphere ! Bartender was great. Defiantly coming back. Spent many years contemplating  trying the place out. Only regret not doing it sooner.

needs a -1/2 star rating. wrong order brought out after an hour waiting with friends for birthday celebration. Manager comes over and says what can i do to make it right. Have me wait another hour so everyone else is done when my correct order arrives. No thank you....

I wish I could give this place two separate reviews.

1. The bar and the drinks are great. Additionally, the bartenders are exceptional. This isn't your typical bar where you're going to get a Redbull vodka (in fact a friend of mine tried to order it and the bar refused to serve it). Their drinks are inspire by the 1920s, 1930s, 1940s, so on and so forth. They're make you amazing custom drinks with fresh ingredients as well if you ask.

2. The food on the other hand is okay. It's overpriced and you can get better food elsewhere for the same amount or cheaper. 3 stars on the food.

So we didn't get a steak, blasphemy I know. But we did try the wedge salads loaded with bacon, red onions, blue cheese crumbles and tasty blue cheese dressing, and we also each had an order of buffalo wings. Hit the spot and satisfied my buffalo wing craving. The wings were big and juicy, a decent portion for the price. Service was great, super friendly. Definitely a cool spot to check out if you are visiting Vegas.
Doughnuts, ribeye, drinks and happy hour. Amazing, happy hour from open to 8pm and 12am to close. half off steaks!

MIKE E. is such a delightful server.  I recommend him and his recommendations as to how to order.  We started with a nice wine and a virgin mojito.  Then bread came then a wonderful Caesar salad to split.  We also had a wonderful porterhouse along with a mac and cheese side.  Just the best service.  No rushing...I recommend this highest rating

This is my personal favorite hot spot! Delicious food, prohibition based cocktails, good vibes, always great service! 
Friday's and Saturdays tend to get a little busy, so if you want to make it for the 12-3am happy hour, get there earlier!!!
Happy hour is anything on the menu with 2 stars, I recommend the Filet, (half price) with the choice of a side, and any "add on's" you'd like to add to your steak. Ex; mushrooms and onions, bleu cheese, etc.
*MELT IN YOUR MOUTH FILET!*
Everything is always, so good. I will continue to come here and can't wait to try the pasta!!!

Herbs and Rye- how do I love thee... Let me count the ways (in no particular order except for number one which is Alycia being the best):

1) Alycia is awesome! She is such a real, genuine and funny person that my husband and I make sure we always stop by when we are in town, which is often! Seriously, she is the best!!!
2) Happy hours! Early and late night deals for the awesome food here make the place a great value proposition.
3) The food!!! Where do I start!!... 
     Any of the steaks-always cooked to temperature            and super flavorful!
      The chorizo meatballs ( so good no words can describe!)
      Truffle Mac and cheese or the fries.


As a separate call out: Any of the masterfully crafted drinks! The menu is vast and full of fun facts. The best part? Tell Alicia what you like and she will pick the drink that is complementary to your preferences.

This restaurant will continue to stay in my rotation because of the food, drinks and fabulous service!

The food was amazing. The food, by itself was 5 stars, but I have to give this place a 4 for some of the cons. Came in, and waited around too long before anyone greeted me even though employees were walking around, a simple "we'll be right with you" would've been nice. When I did get greeted by the server, all he said was "one?" Service was very mediocre. I wouldn't normally care about these things, but for the price of the food, you expect better service. And, I agree with the other reviews, music is a bit too loud and the lighting is a little bit too dark.

HATE  Nothing.

DISLIKE  No cocktails on happy hour menu. They discontinued one of my favorite pastas ever.

LIKE  The spaghetti and meatballs. The music. The atmosphere. The Aviation cocktail. Our mixologist Gerardo AKA the General Manager.

LOVE  The (now-discontinued) Crabonara. The lasagna. Happy hour. The Moscow Mule.

My Fiancé and I have eaten a lot of steaks and this place still remains at the top of the list. When we were in Vegas 4 years ago we typed in best steak in Vegas and this place came up and man was it! We go every time we are in town! A+ cocktails and food!

It's nice to know there's a really good steak house open till 3 a.m. . You would think vegas  is filled  with restaurants open all night  but that's not the case  especially great one's. My husband and I came here for Valentine's Day because we had to work late and we had the best time. The food was really good we got a giant steak and had a lot to take home. I love the drink menu, drinks were excellent. The ambiance was fun yet it could be romantic too especially when you're with the right person. It's dark and the music is loud enough. We will definitely be going back

In the search for the perfect cocktail bar to drink at and have a snack - Herbs and Rye came up in every list. I had to try it for myself and I'll be damned if it wasn't every bit as good as advertised.

During the first few minutes at the bar I asked the bartender if they could make a particular drink I'm recently obsessed with as I've had a few tell me no (some bars won't as its very high cost with a large portion of it being bitters). He was a little bit condescending in his reply saying they aren't "some bar" and I'll be honest that this put a sour taste in my mouth at the beginning of the meal. I now had a chip on my shoulder. I wanted to dislike this bartender. But, to the best of my ability, I couldn't do it. He was way too damn good at his job.

We ended up having about five rounds of drinks, two of which were the bartender's choice. All of them were variations or choices from their menu (generational / historical drinks). All of them were poured well, mixed well, and delicious. The only one thing was different to what I'm used to was that the aviation I ordered was faaaar more tart than I've had before. I'm assuming this is an ingredient ratio difference, no big, it was still good. Our last two rounds of drinks were creations of his own, the last being made with a tasty black strap molasses. Lesson learned: let the bartender pick your drinks here.

Food. Oh, the food.

Did I mention their happy hour has half price steaks? As in 50% off. Whaaaaaat. So good. I got the flat iron medium rare with chimichurri on the side and a side order of bacon+brussels. Everything was delicious. The cook on the steak was maybe 5-10% under what I'm used to but I enjoy it however - this didn't detract from it at all. The chimichurri was flavorful and zesty. The Brussels sprouts were crispy and delicious.

Between my friend and I we ordered 8 drinks, had two shots, two steaks, and two side dishes. We walked out of there for less than $170 total (including tip!). I was very pleased. 

Eat here!

A very cool eclectic place.  You will love this place!  A speak easy feel... roaring 20's playing in the background,  old chandeliers,  candelabra atmosphere and did I mention the food... oh yes... giant portions to die for.  Service that trumps most 5 diamond resorts!  Priced for everyone...   don't miss out.  Make reservations and our server Deborah was awesome!

Honestly, i can no longer justify any of the fine steakhouses on the strip. This place, several miles off the strip, has them all beat!  I was served the best steak I've had in years, at half the price of the celebrity-chef steakhouses in the casino/resorts. Don't be put off by the seedy exterior. Go in and be transported back in time to a classic old Italian steakhouse with great service, really great music, and fantastic food from start to finish. Oh and the coolest and most extensive cocktail list I've ever seen. The bartenders really care about mixing you a great cocktail as much as the chef cares about a perfectly cooked steak. 

Loved every bite and every minute of being there.
Favorite place EVER! Happy hour is the best, 18oz ribeye is my absolute favorite with the blue cheese crust and red wine glaze! Their dessert doughnuts are to DIE for! Marc is the best server also!

First off, this place is gorgeous!  What other raters said about the "Old Vegas" feel are right on the spot.  We were seated at a booth with a beautiful view of the bar. I ordered the Bees Knees cocktail that was made with gin, honey and lemon.  It had just the right touch of sweet and sour.  I normally don't care for lemon drinks but this one was delicious and not overpowering. 

For food, we shared the caprese salad and the pork & figs. The salad was stacked with delicious mozzarella, thick tomatoes and the biggest basil leaves I have ever seen!  The pork chop is topped with melted blue cheese and lays on a bed of mashed potatoes paired with balsamic figs. We almost wish we didn't share this dish!  So yummy and perfectly balanced!  Our meal was finished off with their decadent homemade donuts. They are pretty sugary...but very delicious!!

We will definitely be back to sit at the bar, partake in the hand crafted cocktails and half-priced happy hour steaks!!
Everything was perfect i was running late to my reservation they gave me extra time....the service was awesome the food was delicious it was the perfect valentine

Herbs and Rye is a place that we always end up at, no matter where we started the night.  It pulls us back like a vortex.  And, honestly, I always have the most fun and best conversations with the people who frequent the place.

I love, love, love handcrafted cocktails.  Herbs and Rye has this nifty drink menu that goes back in time and tells you a little bit about the history of each "drinking era."  I have been able to try so many different cocktails and been introduced to drinks I had never heard of before.  My favorites: Bees Knees (refreshing and citrusy), Blood and Sand (careful, it involves fire!), Sazarac (puts hair on your chest), Ward 8 (can't think of a description!  Lame, I know!).

I hear all sorts of buzz about the happy hour and the food, but I've never eaten here, so I can't comment on that.  Truth be told, I always end up at the Ricos Tacos in the parking lot outside of Herbs and Rye!  But I should really try the food here if it's as quality as their drinks!

Thumbs up.

Ive always been one of those people that use yelp but was too laZy to make an account, anyways this place is BoMb.com!!! Happy hour from 5-8 half off steaks! Got the ribeye and i give it 5/5! Went a second time and got the herbs n rye house rub, pretty nasty so i wouldn't recommend that, just get the steak by itself and you"ll be happy i guarantee it.

Herbs and Rye is the place to go if you have a late night craving for some great food and don't want to eat fast food.  After midnight they have the Happy Hour which is 50% off select items on your menu.  I tried the gnocchi the first time I ate there and fell in love.  I know where to get my late night italian fix now when i'm craving it.  I also had the rib eye steak which was Delicious and cooked perfectly.  Not to mention it was one of the 50% off happy hour items.  I always get the sweet potato tator tots everytime i'm there.

The well drinks are also half off during happy hour.  If you want to try something different get the Russian Mule.  Its a citrus tasting drink with vodka and ginger beer served in a brass mug with crushed ice.  I tried one for the first time and it instantly became a favorite.    

Check this place out if you are on that side of town which is central Las Vegas, not too far from the strip.  Happy Hour specials are awesome.  Food is great.  Drinks are great.  And the history about place is kind of cool also, knowing that it used to be an old Mob/Gangster hang out back in the day.

I really enjoyed the experience but its a little pricey for the product .   The cocktails are fun to explore and I enjoyed the Mediterranean flatbread but I just wish their happy hour was a little better.  There isn't a discount on any cocktails or on the majority of food.  You can get 50% off a few wines, one beer, steaks and that is all.

I have been to this place a couple of times but few days ago it was my husband's first time here and he loved it. 
Food is delicious and atmosphere is great. One of the best things is heir happy hour - half off steak and some other items. I had filet and my husband had NY steak. Both were delicious. Last time I had flat iron, but I wasn't impressed...  They have the Best calamari!!!! And the portion is huuuge. So good!
They get pretty busy so reservations are definitely recommended...
First time here my boyfriend recommended this place and it was so good. Everything was cooked perfectly. Our server was Mark and he was great. (: will definitely be back!

Came here to eat late night with some friends and was super excited to try the place! I ordered the truffle mac and cheese as an appetizer and the truffle penne as an entree. The truffle mac and cheese was very good! A friend ordered the calamari and I was not a fan. When my truffle penne came, it was absolutely awful. A few people at the table tasted it and agreed it was disgusting. The server offered to have it remade and the second time it came out better. By the time I got it, my friends were done eat so that sucked but I was glad it tasted better. We ordered the doughnuts for dessert which were decent, nothing special. Overall, for all the hype, I thought this place was mediocre but probably wouldn't come back.

Some of the best steaks in town! I go regularly and always have a great experience. The cocktail menu is incredible!  Great drinks from different eras. My favorite is the Blood and Sand. And you can't go wrong with Mark as your waiter. 
Make sure to take advantage of their happy hour. Half off all steaks!

Loved the service , the bar was full all night , and I like the unique cocktail options from the early days. We had the Cobb salad, calamari, and flatbread for a private party. I can't wait to try the other food on the menu as well as the rest of their very strong drinks!

I am saddened that I have to write this review as I thought my calls and emails to the GM and kitchen mgr would have been returned.

We went to Herbs and Rye on a Thursday night in the hopes of having an amazing meal,
but left heavy-hearted knowing that we probably would never return again. My
husband and I have been visiting your establishment for the last 2 years during
happy hour and have always had an amazing experience. We have been served by
Rickey several times in the past, and left extremely satisfied and happy. I have always
referred people to your establishment when asked "Where can I get the best steak
in town?". We've brought family and friends on numerous occasions as well.

We began our dining experience this evening at 6:30 pm. We were made aware, upon
ordering our food that if we were ordering a steak, to expect a 30 minute cook
time. We placed our entire order at 6:40. Chorizo meatballs, Truffle Mac and
Cheese and 2 Filet Mignons-cooked medium well with blue cheese topping and garlicky spinach. We anticipated our steaks to come out within the 30 minute "window" referenced, but they were not delivered to our table until 7:35. An entire 55 minutes later. I asked Rickey
if the restaurant was short staffed that evening, to which he replied "for happy hour, we
are short-staffed in order to keep the prices low." When our steaks finally
arrived, they were overcooked and dry. And, instead of an apology, our waiter,
took out his light, and asked us to cut them in half, like we were at Chili's. He proceeded to tell me that medium-well meant light pink, to which my steak was GREY in color.
He then saw they were grey and a little "overcooked" and would be sent back. I
told him that I didn't want to wait another hour for the steaks, to which he
replied "they won't take that long, there's always steaks already on the grill."
New steaks didn't return to the table for another 30 minutes. By this time,
we've been sitting for 90 minutes. Unacceptable in my opinion. I realize it was
happy hour, but this should never be an excuse as we've never encountered this
before. We were told a manager was going to come to the table, but never did.
By the time we received our check, it was 8:30, and we had spent enough time wallowing in this disappointing situation. I have read all of the success stories and effort to turn this
restaurant around, and I have appreciated the service and food in the past. If I
knew that I was going to be sitting for 2 hours, I would have gone to the strip
for a better experience. I'm not generally one to write letters or complain
about food not being cooked properly, as most of the time, it's rectified in a
timely manner. I was even more shocked that we were about to be offered dessert as compensation, and would have had to sit another 30 minutes. We politely declined. I've given the GM and the kitchen manager 4 days to contact me via reply to my numerous emails, but so far, they have not. It's a complete shame they don't have their act together in keeping local visitors who used to visit monthly.
Definitely a must if you're in town! The steaks are delicious and the cocktails are a delight. The service is excellent! I highly recommend you make reservations as it can get quite busy.

Ate at the restaurant on June 23, 2018 with 7:00 pm reservations. We had to wait for them to put some tables together for us as we were a party of 10 and a baby.  Once seated, we were first greeted by the bus person asking about water order.  Next, our waitress Debra came to the table and gave us the run down on the menu, explained the happy hour items, took our cocktail orders and our app orders.

This was the first time for me visiting Herbs & Rye and I had heard good things.  In fact, one of the people in our party is actually related to the owners.  Needless to say, the food and drinks didn't disappoint.  

I ordered the New York Strip and the button mushrooms, had a French Onions soup to start, and enjoyed two glasses of Riesling.  Steak was perfectly cooked to med-rare as I requested and tender.  Everyone else ordered various steaks off the happy hour menu and various cocktails.  Because of the portion sizes of the sides and apps, we all shared and I was also able to try the mashed potatoes, the grilled asparagus, the creamed spinach, the shrimp cocktail, and the steamed (spicy) mussels.  Every food item was completely on point!  For dessert the waitress brought out the homemade doughnuts for one person at our table for her birthday.  They were equally delicious if not more so!  Vanilla crème brulee was also amazing. 

Everything from the seating, to the server greet, the service, food delivery, and attentiveness of the staff was impeccable.  However, I do have one complaint.  Because we were a party of 10, it states on the menu that you don't do split checks for parties for 7 or more.  Perhaps you should make an exception to this rule because it would make things so much easier for the guests, everyone would know what their portion was and what to pay, and we wouldn't have had to sit there for 25 more minutes trying to figure out what everyone owed on the bill and why some people didn't put in enough money.  By allowing us to split the check would have gave the server back her tables that much quicker, and the restaurant could have turned that table at least one more time.
