I get the reason for not splitting the checks (i.e. people walking out on the bills, system freezes up, etc) but sometimes the restaurant should make an exception to the rule.

Otherwise, everything was delicious and perfect!  We will definitely be back again to enjoy the amazing food and drinks!  Debra was also amazing as well and should be complimented for her service.

We were looking to have a drink and some appetizers off the strip before seeing a show. I found this spot on yelp and figured I'd give it a whirl. We got both the clams and mussels which were half off during happy hour (from 5-8pm every night!) as well as a variety of different cocktails. The mussels were spicy and soaked in a delicious garlic sauce, that was so delicious, that we asked for extra bread so that we could sop it all up. The clams were drastically different in a creamy butter sauce, but equally delicious!

The cocktail menu is a work of art and a history lesson all in one. Along with the ingredients of each drink, the menu also details how the drink was originally created, and when. With so many choices, we had some difficulty choosing, but the waiter was ready with the recommendations, and he chose a perfect drink for each of our tastes.

Wonderful Decor, wonderful drink menu , wonderful service , amazing filet , amazing Brussels sprouts , delicious truffle Mac and cheese... Shall I go on? Ok go here it's amazing . Hipsters everywhere unite!

An absolute treat.  The best manhattan in LV by far, incredible cuts of steak and lamb, huge portions, and awesome service.  I'll make a point to come back here every time I'm in town going forward.  Just wish they were a little closer to civilization.

Food is excellent! Prices are great during happy hour 5-8p and 12-3am. Service is so so.

Thanks to my yelp buddy Schel X for the tip, we came on a friday night for dinner and to take advantage of the half off steak deal. Actually, there are also 2 appetizers that are half off as well as all the steaks which all comes with one side. 

We got here at 6:30p and the restaurant had a few empty tables and no line of people waiting. However, the hostess told us that there's a 30min wait with no reservation. Huh? So we found a seat at the bar which was very uncomfortable for me. 5 mins after we were seated the hostess came and asked us if we wanted a table. Why didn't she offer us a table earlier before we placed our order? Lame.

Our food also took a long time to come out, which didn't make sense because the restaurant was not busy. Drinks were $11 each, and very mediocre. We ordered 2 appetizers: garlic clams were pretty good, but the bacon calamari was the bomb! After that, I got my Kansas City bone-in with a side of brussel sprouts. Loved it! The sprouts were caramelized and stir fried with chucks of fatty swine - delicious! 

Clean bathrooms and cool 1920's decor and music, dim lighting. Parking is a major pain we had to park far and walk as there's not enough spots around the restaurant.

When I die and show up to the Pearly Gates, I hope the guardians of the gate treat me as well as the mixologists here at Herbs & Rye. Isai, Kinson and Joe are the most beautiful angels on this earth. They inserted the most amazing fluids in my mouth! And they did it with a smile and elegance. They even called the next day like gentlemen...... after they left my house this morning. I thought I was left out to dry but they really followed through. Morning and afternoon delight to boot! It truly left me in a dreamy state of mind. The service & pleasure like I experienced is truly so hard to find. I'm a little overwhelmed and beside myself, but these boys and herbs & Rye showed me love like never before. The romance is real.
The food was spot on and full of flavor. The interior was lovely and the variety of their bar is what attracted us. Very nice service and friendly staff.

I'm visiting from So. Cal. Great food, great music and great happy hour. The rib-eye was 50 percent off and I would have paid full price. Leave the casino...come here...thank you for the great experience

If you're looking for a quality steak dinner, definitely come during Happy Hour 5 PM-8 PM and 12 AM - 3AM (50% all steaks and certain entrees and appetizers!). Although my wallet was sad afterwards, I do not regret eating the delicious 14 oz NY Strip steak and truffle mac and cheese, unnffff. 

The exterior of the place makes it look like some shady strip club or something because there were no windows just some doors. When we walked in I felt like I was in the Haunted Mansion at Disneyland cuz it was so dark. Nonetheless, never judge a book by it's cover! The atmosphere was great and the waiters and waitresses were extra friendly. 

As for the quality of food, I'd say it has been spot on. The first time I went here was last year when I was craving Linguine and clams at 2AM and thankfully this place was open (you have no idea how much I love linguine and clams). It was a to-go order and service was fast. The linguine and clams wasn't the best I ever had, but! Being hormonal at 2AM, it was pretty damn good. & they used real clams, not that salty canned crap.

My most recent visit on the 08-24-15 was even better because I had a chance to actually sit down and enjoy everything right there. We started off with some appetizers of Spicy Mussels. It was a good amount of mussels drenched in marinara/tomato sauce and came with 2 loafs of bread. It was a comfortable level of spice and the fact that it was 1/2 off made it more merrier. 

I ordered the 14 oz NY Strip Steak medium rare and it included my choice of one side so of course when I see something like Truffle Mac n Cheese, hell freaking yeah I'm choosing that! Again, service was pretty quick. My steak was cooked perfectly. It was literally the most beautiful thing I had seen in days haha. I was a little disappointed in the Truffle Mac n Cheese though. It was good but not great :/ I felt like it wasn't cheesey enough or something. Idk it just needed a little extra something! It's my fault, I hyped myself up for Mac n Cheese all day that day. 

Overall I've had a great experience here. Waiters were on top of their water-refill game. I'd take like a small sip and it's like their water-refill senses shit was tingling or something cuz 5 seconds later they'd be over my shoulder refilling my cup haha. Definitely would recommend this place for a nice night out :)

We are from St Louis visiting and we were referred by our Uber driver to come here. I am not going to lie, the outside looks like shit and I was VERY skeptical walking up. They have a happy hour from 5-8 where you get 1/2 off steaks and certain drinks so our group of 6 was open to trying. 

When you walk in, you can't see 2 inches in front of your face. It is dark and hard to see. The waitress greeted us and we were seated in the bar area, where the bar was packed. We order some drinks, got our bread (amazing) and our server went over the steaks. 

I ordered an 18oz Ribeye Med Rare and it was cooked perfect! By this time we had a few drinks, began to relax, and were having fun in the bar, which was hopping at this point. The food was great and the truffle steak fries and truffle Mac n cheese was amazing! 

I am very critical of my food and places I eat but please don't judge a book by its cover and come eat here!!!

Craft cocktail bars are a dime a dozen. Herbs and Rye gets it and adds incredible customer service. I checked them out for the first time last night and was impressed with the hospitality and knowledgeable staff. Amazing experience and I felt like I was treated as a regular would be.

Okay it's one of the best stocked bars in Vegas - liquor wise. Their cocktail list is serious and well crafted. Now short cuts here. A true mixologist paradise for flavor and well executed drinks with attention to detail. 

Food- I only had the meatballs with chorizo and filet sliders.... I was stuffed and wanted to order other items to see if they were as good. I will be back to see!

I usually don't give away 5 stars, but this place takes the cake.

Second time visiting Herbs & Rye over a period of 4 or so months, and it does not disappoint. Even the bartender remembered our names after visiting one time (we did not think we were very memorable or do anything out of the ordinary, they are just that good). 

The cocktails are unique, and come in an extensive variety. I like that they break down cocktails by time period too. 

Second time that I ordered the Mediterranean flatbread and probably won't stop there. The pesto and the goat cheese are to die for on this one.

Simply and consistently the best in town.  One of those places you don't like tell your friends about because it's that good.  I have eaten here several times and every single time it is excellent. The steak happy hour is amazing and the cocktails are equally as delicious. The vibe is always fun and upbeat. It is very very dark inside but don't let that scare you LOL.  One of the best ribeyes I've ever had in all of my world travels.  And the creamy corn with jalapeños... OMG

Spicy mussels for an appetizer... yes please. Get extra bread to dip into the sauce it's addictive
Amazing cocktail drinks! I like wine, but if here - try your favorite mixed cocktail.  The gimlet I had here was delish!!

Not only is the owner one of our best customers, his place is awesome! Happy Hour drinks and half price steaks are the way to go. My filet was cooked perfectly and was one of the best steaks I've had! Wait staff was friendly, attentive and fast. I will definitely be back.

Our new fav spot for a great steak! The restaurant looks iffy on the outside but trust me when you step in, it looks and feels top notch!! Our server was on point with recommending drinks and kept us full and happy throughout our entire meal. The ambiance was wonderful for our date night, great music, great drinks, and delicious steaks and food. We'll be coming back for their happy hour where the have drinks and steaks half off!!

A carnivorous night owl's paradise.

I'm always up late, and I always want steak. Plus, Happy Hour is kinda my middle name. This is why Herbs & Rye should pretty much be my second residence.

Great quality meat at a killer price. Can't say anywhere else in Vegas (that I know of) is offering such a steal. I will say that their definition of well drinks on happy hour is ultra basic: think cranberry & vodka or rum & coke. One mixer, one liquor. They told me 'no' on a whiskey sour. Kinda odd, but who cares when the steak is what we're here for anyway?

The music was loud semi-retro hip hop with lots of Common and Kanye sprinkled throughout. No complaints there. Just be ready to talk over the jams while bobbing your head.

Oh, and get the donuts.

I looked this place on yelp since I drive by it all the time and my wife heard good things about this place so we headed over to give it a try. Place is nicely decorated, hip and trendy the bar area is a little loud but they have two separate rooms for more intimacy. As for the food it was awesome had the Margherita, Truffle Mac Cheese, Flat Iron those were great oh and don't forget the donuts those were amazing! 

Will be back very soon!!!

The happy hour wasn't impressive, only a couple food items and well drinks & beer. The food we did try was pretty good, calamari was excellent, it was served different from any other place I've had it before. The meatballs were good, very spicy. We opted to try the specialty martini drinks, my favorite has to be the bee knees or the apple rose. 

Overall, I probably wouldn't return unless I was in the neighborhood. I drove pretty far to get to this place, I wouldn't go out of my way again to go there. The neighborhood is pretty sketchy. Lock you car doors and don't leave anything visible in your car!

Cool enough... especially the brass/copper (?) mugs the drinks are served in.  The drinks are pricey and small, but you are paying for "the cool", not the alcohol.  I sat at the bar and didn't eat, but from my vantage point, the food looked and smelled good.  I enjoyed myself, as did "the others."  I'd recommended it, even if you only go once.

We came in on a Friday  night with 7:15 pm reservations. We were seated pretty promptly, and our (very friendly) server greeted us and took our drink orders for the bar right away. And then.....nothing. It took them 30 minutes to get us our cocktails. "There is a large party in the bar" we were told. Okay. Not a good excuse, but fine. Whatever. Our server finally brought us our drinks and told us that he comped them due to how long we had to wait. Fine. But there is a problem when you get your appetizers and your salads, and finish eating them, before your drinks come. 
And then we waited. And waited. And waited. By 8:45 we still didn't have our food, which consisted of an order of 2 steaks, some broccoli, and truffle mac and cheese. Please remember we got there at 7:15! When we finally did get it, somewhere around 9 pm, the food was good, and of course our poor Embarrassed Server was very apologetic.  I felt so sorry for him. However, there is no excuse for it taking almost 2 hours to cook a couple of steaks. At a steakhouse. They should be much more efficient and proficient at steak-cooking! My husband and I were joking that they must be importing the beef....from Brazil. But by now we both had two ( very well made, despite the loooooooong wait) craft cocktails in us, so we were pretty sauced, considering we had been drinking on almost empty stomachs. 
There was a couple sitting across from us who came in after us, and they were (judging by the angry and annoyed looks on their faces) suffering the same wait...and fate....as we were. So obviously this wasn't an anomaly. After we finally finished, Embarrased Server jokingly asked us if we wanted dessert. We told him no thank you, we both have to work on Monday,  just the check please.
 We tipped him 20% (poor guy probably though he was going to get stiffed. But it wasn't his fault) and we FINALLY left. It was 9:30. 
So, my advice to the Powers That Be at this establishment: Stop trying to save your bottom line by grossly  understaffing your (very busy) establishment. You are extremely lucky to have a restaurant that is this popular and busy in a city that is full of great restaurants. People have many other options in this town.  There is no excuse for having only 2 bartenders in such a busy bar. There is no excuse for your kitchen being so ridiculously slow and backed up.There is no excuse for it taking 2 and a half hours to turn over a two-top. I am sure your servers pay the price for this policy in their bottom lines, as they are usually the ones who get "stiffed" when service is too slow or the food (that your customers wait 2 hours for)isn't up to par. Not every ignored  customer is as nice and understanding as my husband and I are. I am pretty sure that your 50% Happy Hour policy, (which don't get me wrong, is fabulous) is the lure you need in order to keep people coming back. Because the service and promptness  certainly are not. 
I am giving this restaurant 3 stars. The only reason is due to the courtesy and obvious concern from our poor Embarrassed Server, and the fact that when we FINALLY did get our food, it was good. But not good enough to go through this a second time.

I am currently sitting at the table eating my Ribeye and this is easily the best restaurant I've ever eaten at. The cocktails are amazing, the food is to die for, and the service is impeccable. Mark is our waiter and he used to be a mixologist and he recommended drinks based on our preferences. If you are in Vegas, please go here.

Came here because we've heard such good things and let me start off by saying the HH menu was shortened tremendously in regards to food. Aside from the half priced steaks, there were only 3 appetizers that were half off. Started off with the chicken wings with Thai sauce, we really liked it. Nice crisp wings and the sauce was good too. We all decided to order some type of steaks, I had the Kansas Steak and my 2 other friends ordered the rib eye. Our sides were truffle fries, truffle mac n cheese, and mashed potatoes. My Kansas Steak was really good and my friends agreed their rib eyes were delicious as well. I had the mashed potatoes, which I really enjoyed too. The food is worth coming back for hands down, however the reason for my 2 star review is because the service was horrible. Our server was Ronnie and he seemed kind of un patient with us. For instance, when we asked him to explain the HH to our friend who came late because it's kind of complicated, he rudely adds "Not really" and then explains to her what is included. There was an attitude problem I felt like to the point we were going to walk out.  Whenever we asked him for something we felt like we were walking on egg shells. My friends and I all work in service industries and know what it takes to be rude to a customer and this guys certainly was. I certainly do hope he was just having a bad day because we really enjoyed the food.

Stay for the solid handcrafted cocktails and delicious pasta dishes. But while Herbs & Rye touts itself as a steakhouse, you might want to pass on their cuts. 

For the past year, I've been hearing great things about this local Vegas favorite. Styled after the Prohibition era, this dimly-lit Italian speakeasy offers some great seafood pasta, flatbreads, and drinks. They're also the only place I've ever eaten at that offers happy hour for their steaks. Unfortunately, the New York strip that I ordered was overseasoned and underwhelming. However, at half the retail price of $42, I couldn't complain too much. If you're struggling to decide on a side, get the truffle mac & cheese, which was beyond cheesy. 

For appetizers, the beef tartar was amazing. I also highly recommend the linguine & clams. The white wine and garlic sauce was superb. I usually try not to eat too much bread, but I couldn't resist dipping it in the sauce. And of course, the comprehensive list of cocktails was impressive. Organized by era, it features plenty of classics that will be sure to bring you back to the days of the Rat Pack. Service was great. Our waitress was able to squeeze in a few latecomers' orders to include the happy hour price. Happy hour runs from 5:00-8:00 pm so be sure drop in.

Finally we got to experience this place not happy hour time the regular priced time we had four martinis three tasted exactly the same the beef tartare was pretty good the bread was old and really tough the calamari had a great touch which was some peppers in it but without the peppers it would've been just soggy and greasy so we r  going to give it a 2 1/2 three-stars...next time we're going to try to happy hour hopefully the experience will be a lot better

This place is a hidden gem for locals, its dark its sexy. They have been making upgrades to the place and have amazing cocktails. Big dishes in pasta and flat breads. Escape to a hole in the wall place

Sadly, I won't be returning to Herbs and Rye.

My favorite waiter, Ronnie, informed me the last time I was there that the new manager has instituted a very high corkage policy that is nothing short of punitive.
Given that this restaurant has a very limited, not to mention mediocre, wine selection, punishing wine collectors like me is a breathtakingly stupid policy.

Here's a math lesson for this boy-wonder manager, who will no doubt be managing an Arby's in the future:
Fair corkage in a restaurant should be the cost of the lowest-priced glass of wine on the menu....which is what I had. 
That means the restaurant made a few dollars on the sale. If they had charged me the same as that glass of wine to open my bottle, let's say $12, that would have been pure profit....and they wouldn't have lost a customer. 
So stupid.

Charlie was a 10 star server, he made us feel comfortable it being our first time there. The truffle Mac and cheese is amazing, definitely try it if you have the chance. Don't be afraid to try the add ons, they're $3.75 but they'll make your steak taste totally different. Can't wait to go back!

First Impression. Outside looks pretty shady but when you walk in it's a nice local gem. Emily is an amazing bartender. Extremely helpful and friendly. Drinks are great! 

The vibe and the aesthetics remind me of Capo's! Except Capo's is cleaner (women's bathroom had a bad odor). Also Capo's has better tasting quality food!

The reason why I gave this place three stars is because the food definitely is overpriced. We ordered the spicy mussels, the sauce was tasty and so was the French bread to dip it with, but the mussels tasted freezer burnt....awful! Beef carpaccio was extra salty even without eating the capers...yikes! The penne pasta - over cooked prosciutto and over powering garlic sauce....eeeek! Jalapeño cream corn was ok - the best out of all the dishes but still lacking flavor. We did end the night with the half order of donuts....yum! It was well worth the calories! Overall I would come back for drinks and service definitely grabbing a bite somewhere else before heading there!!!

You have never experienced cocktails like this! Watching all three bartenders, Joe made cocktails with unsurpassed care and expertise. I watched a lot of Ramos fizz' go out but none looked like his. This service attention to my boyfriend and I was excellent. For example, we were at the bar rail, he put my phone on a rocks glass with a napkin so it was elevated and didn't slip. He said he had seen too many accidents with cocktails, a few minutes later a bartender spilled a drink on a phone. 

They have half price steaks from 5-8 and happy hour drink specials.  The steak tartare and chorizo meatballs were amazing. Don't leave with trying the ribeye and the donuts! 

Get here early it's busy!

Literally the best meal you will have in your life. Basically Abraham's bosom in the Old Testament is not heaven; it's a metaphor for one of their cocktails in your hand and their steak in your mouth. Anyone on yelp who is complaining about the "doneness" of their meat is a moron because they list out the exact temperature and color for doneness selection on their menu....AND double check with you when you order. So don't listen to the sissy reviews that are complaining they had no "non meat" options or "weird colored" doneness--these bozos can go to Fazolis. You should come here and have the best food of your life.

My boyfriend and I went for late happy hour (midnight-close). All of their steaks and a few of their other menu items are half off. We didn't get the drinks so I can't speak to that. We came for a good steak. We both got 8 oz. flatirons. His medium rare and mine medium. It comes with a side so we got garlic mashed potatoes. Both were really good and for about $15 a plate, you can't really be mad if it wasn't. Steak was good and if I lived here I'd probably be eating a lot of steak there. We also got buffalo wings which were average. 
The ambiance was nice, super dark and we sat in the booths that face the bar. Our server was cool. He'd periodically check in and was very nice.

Oooh myyyy!!! This place was incredible! Prohibition era...it was such am amazing experience. I absolutely loved everything a out it. The service was excellent. The options of drinks was amazing and so different. They are all very unique not something you can just get anywhere. They have  happy hour where some of the things on the menu were half off including the 18 ounce ribeye which was phenomenal!!  Sides are ala carte. We had the mushrooms, truffle Mac n cheese,garlic spinach, garlic potatoes, broccoli and cheese, 3 different deserts and several appetizers. Everything was to die for!! You will not be disappointed!!!
Amazing food!!!! Love the steak! Go during happy hour!!!!! You won't be disappointed! Amazing cocktails!!! Def will be back! :-)

My friend and I decided to check this place out on my quick 24hr trip. She had told me that her coworker had visited this place and highly recommended it. We went during happy hour and all their main meats were 1/2 off! We had reservations for 5pm and we only had to wait about 15 minutes before we were seated. The server led us to a dim lit room that probably couldve fit about 50 people in there with some leg room. I also spotted a full bar before heading into the "dining" room. I chose the bruschetta and clams for our appetizer and the sweet potato tater tots covered in marshmallows as a side to my Filet mignon. EVERY DISH WAS SO AMAZING!!! the waitress also recommended specific cocktails to try and she was head on! I just told her that I liked tropical and sweet drinks and I loved both! I will definitely come again! The total at the end of the night came round to about 150 and i'd say that THAT is a good price for the great service, awesome food and even greater ambiance including the fun music they played!

Amazing food and great selection of cocktails. A wonderful place for meat lovers, veg options are limited..They have a vegan pasta, not on the menu and definitely worth trying. The last surprise is the amazing dessert - mini doughnuts. The place is busy and it is recommended to make a reservation...

Best food and atmosphere! A very trendy place that reminds me of an old speakeasy. The best truffle oiled Mac n cheese. Flat breads, garlic mashed potatoes, and calamari are so delicious. Perfectly seasoned and cooked to order steaks. Top notch, A++ restaurant! Moscow mule is a flavorful drink that is a must try. Perfect for a go to date night place. It is sure to impress! Staff and service is top notch! Only bad thing I could see was the bathroom. Door opens to the backside of the bar to show someone standing there peeing. That situation needs some work.
Heard the food is good but the dark 20s theme creeped me out. Had a beer and left ASAP.

Simply. Amazing. I suggest making reservations. Happy hour is a must, half off select apps and steaks. Tasty food, tasty drinks, attentive staff. Don't waste time and $$$ dining at overpriced underwhelming restaurants on the strip, take 10 minutes to venture out and don't let the outside fool you.

Wanted a low key but amazing birthday dinner and was not disappointed. Our server Mark (hope I spelled it right) was attentive and full of great recommendations. The place was packed but the staff busted their butts and the service was outstanding. My steak was made Black & Blue as requested and I could not be happier. I highly recommend the bread pudding. Herbs & Rye will be a stop whenever I visit Las Vegas.
My absolute favorite place to eat in Las Vegas! When someone mentions herbs & rye my mouth starts watering! Truffle mac & cheese is my favorite! Happy hour is also Ridiculously amazing !

It's my second time visited this place like this place hip and trendy for chill out, good food came late night happy hrs, server was ok try to understand our server kind of lil bit busy with the crowd at night!

A colleague mentioned her Uber driver highly recommended Herbs & Rye, as all the big time chefs on The Strip venture to Herbs & Rye after hours. If it's good enough for the chefs, it's good enough for me!

Their extensive cocktail menu is phenomenal with drinks from every era dating back from 1776. The pours are stiff and the best player in the restaurant scene, bar none. 

Mary Pickford -- A powerhouse combination of rum, pineapple, Grenadine and Maraschino served in a wide bowl champagne glass. Aside from the drink being fruitastic, it is so strong it'll put hair on your chest. I wasn't able to finish the drink as I wanted to be able to remember my impending meal. Not sure which cocktail I'll order on my next visit but I'm sure it will not disappoint.

Spicy Mussels -- Mussels cooked in a rich, tomato stew with white wine. Not one did not disappoint. Each and every one were plump and juicy. Make sure you dip them in the flavorful stew as it adds that spiciness. This item is listed under their appetizers but they give you so much, I was more than satisfied eating this as my entree. 

Their Happy Hour is undeniably one of the best in the game. Who else has filet mignon and ribeye on their HH menu? The restaurant is not too far from The Strip and is one of the few places I recommend you go out of your way for.

We ask the locals where to hang out and have nice steak dinner they're replied was Herbs & Rye. We made dinner reservations for 2 at 8:30 PM just in case. We arrived there and waited 20 mins for a table a little annoyed but once seated we order drinks and main course. The food and service was good.  I order side bacon with my steak it was only a small strip but it was good. I wanted a slab of bacon like the one at old homestead steakhouse. But overall it was a great place to have dinner off the strip.

I came for happy hour pricing last night and was not disappointed.  The prices are higher than their online menu. The steaks are $4 or $5 more.  I got the Kansas City ribeye and it was $14.50, half of the regular $29.  With you dinner comes one side and I got the creamed corn with japaeño.  The steak was cooked perfectly--black and blue as I ordered.  The creamed corn was excellent with the tang of the jalapeño.  I got an iced tea for drink.  Finally, I had a slice of Red Velvet cake for dessert.

I came early and was the only person there when I arrived around 5:30.  As others have stated, the place is quite dark and it takes a time to adjust from the bright sunshine to the darkened interior.

the hostess let me pick where I wanted to sit.  Ronnie was my server, and he was attentive.  Iced tea refills came without asking and he checked back periodically.

I had a show to go to at 7 in North Las Vegas, and this was a perfect time to arrive and enjoy the Happy Hour pricing and have a good dinner before hopping on the freeway for the short drive north.

I'll be back!

Wouldn't go here unless for happy hour. Steaks are good portion cuts. Cooked perfectly medium, but mine was under seasoned. Truffle Mac and cheese and sweet potato tots with marshmallow crust is a must! Loud, energetic environment. It's considered a bar, however it's non-smoking which made it comfortable to eat. Service was poor however, not very attentive and food took forever to come out. Food is nothing special for the price, but drinks are well put together and unique.

Okay, this is not the first time I've been here nor will it be my last. herbs and Rye is the one place I recommend to anyone new to town or friends wanting a good steak.  Best steak, best sides, AMAZING DONUTS!!!!!!   You have to have the donuts for dessert.  SAVE ROOM, I PROMISE YOU'LL THANK ME!!!!

I have visited on a couple occasions and really enjoyed it each time. Our last visit was with some family and friends in town visiting and everyone left more than satisfied. 

If you're looking for unique, well-made cocktails then this is a must visit. They have broken down the various drinks by historical time period and the menu provides a little description of how the drink got its name. 

Almost everyone took advantage of the happy hour, half price steaks. One of the filets was a bit under-cooked, but for the most part they were spot on. All the sides we ordered were great, but the truffle mac and cheese was a table favorite. I can't say enough about the "Farmer" flat bread pizza - bacon, spinach, and a cracked egg. This is something you just have to try in order to understand how delicious it really is. 

Dessert was almost certainly out of the question until the server started to describe them. We ordered their version of the pizooki as well as the homemade doughnuts. The entire table thought they had died and gone to heaven after finishing these desserts. Save room!

Another satisfying and enjoyable experience. Great food, solid drinks and a unique atmosphere away from the hustle and bustle of the touristy Strip.

This place is AMAZING! It was by far one of the best meals I have ever had. We went during happy hour, when all of their steaks are 50%. I had the filet with their brussel sprouts. It was SO good. They have a wide variety of hand-crafted cocktails, some of them have strange ingredients but they taste so good! Can't wait to go back!

We came in late to get a cocktail, didn't realize it was a restaurant until we showed up which turned out to be a good thing. The drinks were great - I was in a tiki mood and had the painkiller (really delicious and not too sweet). We ordered calamari, flatbread (the farmer - bacon, spinach, and a soft egg on top), and Yard Bird Risotto. The drinks were on point but the food was....delicious... holy crap the yard bird risotto was finger licking good. The chicken was crispy outside while tender and flavorful inside - complemented the risotto with it. We inhaled it within a few minutes. The flatbread was also really good (not a flatbread fan in general), the saltiness of the bacon went well with the soft egg on top. Top notch food - would like to try their half off happy hour food (steaks are half off!).

Pros: Great food and drinks, excellent happy hour for food (starts at midnight)
Cons: Somewhat pricey but worth it

Amazing food AND Service!
Its so hard to find places that offer both. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday. The atmosphere is dark and mysterious and cozy at the same time. They play really good soul music as well. 
The menu is simple & straightforward. We had an awesome waitress who said she worked there since opening. She knew the food and drink menus inside and out and gave fantastic suggestions. 
Even the starter bread & butter was delish. I think sourdough fresh & hot with real butter. 
Little neck clams are a MUST! Super delicate with garlic sauce that just melt in your mouth.
I ordered the pork chop with figs. Off the charts. The cut was thick but super tender and melty. The sweetness from the figs & saltiness from pork was perfect match.
My boyfriend had the filet which was also melty & buttery. Mashed potatoes and spinach very flavorful.
Our cocktails also super delish. I had the painkiller which was sort of like a pina coladas but had a nice kick. My boyfriend also had cocktails that had his fave bourbon & Absinthe!! 
Happy Hour everyday too!!
Will be our new steak go to!

Outstanding! Fantastic! Amazing! Delectable!

We couldn't be happier with our dinner experience tonight.  The decor is dark and rich like an old speakeasy.  We sat in a cozy booth by the bar.  Chandeliers, velvet embellished wallpaper, and candles.

We went for happy hour.  It runs 5 - 8 and again from 12 - 3.  $5 well drinks and $3 house draught irish red.  50% off select menu items.

We started with the fries to snack on.  They aren't part of happy hour; they were $5.  They were perfect.  Hot, perfectly crispy and seasoned to perfection with salt and pepper.  Each fry had a perfect coating.  

Next we had linguini and clams and 12 oz. strip steak with truffled mac and cheese.  It was all magical.  The linguini and clams was surprisingly spicy and flavorful. ($12.50) The steak was cooked a perfect medium rare and everything was seasoned perfectly.  The truffled mac and cheese was creamy and dreamy ($14.50).  The dinners were served with bread topped with balsamic butter.

Although they aren't part of happy hour, we partook in some of their signature cocktails.  I had the diablo, a tequila, cassis, ginger ale concoction, and hubs had the martinez, a gin maraschino, lemon mix.  Both we excellent and strong ($9 each).  We then each had the house irish red ($3).

Service was super friendly, and attentive.

Total bill - $60 ?!?!?  For an app, 4 drinks, and 2 entrees! amazing!
We would have paid full price but why when there is happy hour!

Can't wait to tell everyone and go back!
The restaurant is very nice. Its the old Venetian restaurant. I had one of the pasta dishes. It was okay, too al dente for me and too salty. The service was great though!

Okay from the outside you would not think this place would be anything crazy.. but it was sooo good!! I heard about this place so much from my friends, and I had to try it, especially after I heard about that happy hour. Half off steaks?! Stop. I'm sold! The ambience is relaxing. The inside is dark and small, making it for a nice and intimate atmosphere. This place also has an impressive cocktail menu, drinks under different themes. I went with the filet minion with the macaroni and cheese.. honestly one of the juiciest tastiest lil steaks I ever had. Parking lot is small in front, so be prepared to possibly park in the alley behind

this is my new favorite place to excitedly totter at 2am, my cab driver staring like a concerned father at the party that ain't stoppin, woot woot! 

the bartenders and crowd were all very chill, and few obnoxiously lost tourists were to be seen. reverse happy hour here is great, if you realize you haven't eaten all day or that you've had 10ish drinks and only wish to pay for one more. 

I had the long island iced tea, and my drunk-ass visiting friends had some food(finally!). of course they loved the food, but i can't comment. we spent essentially no $, thus i have to give the place 5 stars.

Herbs and Rye has been one of those Vegas staples that I've felt too bashful to step into. I thought the cocktails that they're known for would cost an arm and a leg. Their happy hour deal on steaks finally reeled me in.

I had a wonderful time with a group of five friends. The decor was cool. A lot of wood panels and low lighting. We had an awesome server. Her name was Ally I believe. She gave us recommendations on cocktails and food. She was spot on with the recommendations after we let her know which liquors we like.

My drink was delicious. I wish I could remember what it was but I don't. I know it had egg whites though. After one drink I was feeling a nice buzz. I didn't even taste the alcohol & the drink was delicious.

So during happy hour they have half off steaks that include one side. I got the New York strip with a side of truffle mac and cheese. My steak was cooked perfectly and seasoned just right. It was tender, moist, and succulent. I believe it was 16oz and came out to $18 during happy hour. 

During happy hour they also have $5 well drinks. I did opt for a rum and coke. It was a non-spiced rum and I thought the drink was delicious.

I was so scared to come in here for no reason! I found out their cocktails are all $11-$12 dollars. These are craft cocktails that's are expertly mixed. 

I just had a great time and that really tied the visit up for me. I had a great drink to start the night, an inexpensive well drink to keep it going, and finished it off with some delicious food. It was a great experience with a light price tag.

I can't wait to go back and try all of their cocktails.

Come for the fantastic Happy Hour (5PM-8PM) Stay for the extensive list of specialty hand crafted cocktails!

I was put off at first because we had set up reservations on their website for a Friday night around 6PM for my birthday and when we arrived they said we did not have a reservation and that the wait would be about an hour and a half. I really had my heart set on this place so we decided to wait it out.

The Host was very accommodating and was able to get us seated fairly quickly! 

All their steaks and meats are 50% off during happy hour so my $52.00 Filet Mignon was only $26.00 and some change and if i'm being honest even though the meat was beautifully prepared and absolutely mouth watering I would not be able to justify paying $52.00 for a tiny piece of meat like that. Just no. But I can kind of justify $26 considering it was a special occasion.

Now the drinks were really something special. I would say about 60% of their menu is dedicated to their specialty era cocktails. None of which were on happy hour unfortunately but they do have well liqueur on Happy Hour, but come on who is going to opt for a well mixed drink when they are presented with all these specialty options!!

I ended up asking our server for a recommendation and she recommended the Weekend at the Waldorf and it was beautiful, sweet and full of flavor, and strong. 

Did I mention the drinks were strong?

I will definitely be back for Happy Hour!

Went there at after midnight. Got a booth. Music was loud and cool.  Steaks were 1/2 off. Ambiance was good. Steak and sides were ok. The clam linguine was terrible. Probably should of went to Chinatown for Korean BBQ

Wow....I'm a Vegas local so I know this place blows Strip Steakhouses out of the water. $300 for steakhouses do not compare. The quality is so much better for a cheaper price. 
Kenzie* was my bartender super friendly guy really makes you feel welcomed, he was very attentive and polite. I was there during happy hour 12am to 2am (half off) and never a better time to have a nice juicy steak while you're sipping on old fashions or (which ever cocktail of your choice) and it's amazing I had their spicy mussels. The best mussels I've ever had, I could literally drink that sauce they come it. The Steak is amazing my only regret is that I didn't it almost rare. The garlic potatoes...better than any steakhouse on the strip, my new favorite restaurant. Love the retro dapper vibe makes me feel like I'm in mad men. Haha.

I am the daughter of Kay J. who posted a review on 1/9/2018 and received an evil, cruel and heartless response from the owner Nectaly Mendoza. While yelp is a platform that we all can learn from, Nectaly uses it to speak in the poorest of manners to the people who have given Herbs & Rye one star on yelp. 

No human should ever speak to anyone in the way that Nectaly has to my mom! It is a mind blowing that there is an article about how he was recognized as Bartender of the Year?!?!  

My mom took me here on my birthday, she wanted to treat me to a nice steak dinner. Being a person who has dined at some of the top steak house, this place is in the middle. The reason my mom initially complained was out server questioned us sending our over cooked steaks back!!! Seriously, I'm pretty confident I know the difference between medium rare and medium well. It was an insulting moment with our sever.

It's not the service of why I'm giving this place one star (I would have gone back), if I could give it zero I would - I'm giving it a one star review to the owner and how he chooses to respond to his clientele.

While living in LA, I found out that I love classic cocktails and, even more so, I love the atmosphere of classic cocktail bars. Before moving back to Vegas, I did my research, read the reviews, and decided that Herbs & Rye was my new favorite bar before I even visited! Unfortunately, it's not very close to my hood, so it took a couple months for me to make it over, but here is the lowdown:

Pros
*Cool cocktail menu with lots of classic drinks.
*Fair prices during regular hours.
*Awesome prices during happy hour.
*Free drink for yelpers every time you visit.
*Cool ambiance inside.
*Friendly bartenders who genuinely wanted to make us drinks we loved.

Cons
*Location. It's really not near anything else, so it's definitely inconvenient to go out there if you aren't either a resident of the West Sahara area or staying at the Palace Station.
*Crowd. As in, there was none. Why was it completely dead on a Friday night???

Overall
I'll be back to H&R to enjoy their cocktails and happy hour (maybe even to try the food?), but it's just too far to become a regular.

Honestly were to start.. The only reason for the 1 star, is because the food is amazing. 
I have given this pace SO many chances and it fails every time. The service here is HORRENDOUS! It takes about 30 minutes to receive a cocktail and you should probably look at the menu before you go and order as soon as the waiter takes your drink order because you won't see them for about another 25 minutes. The one instance that really irritated me was my boyfriend and I arrived around 5pm for happy hour, and the place was empty. We were the first guests to sit in the bar area. The server came right over, took our drink order and we didnt see him again until 30 minutes later! More tables started to arrive and he went to take care of each of them instead of returning to us to deliver our drinks or take our order. We sat and watched the server take 3 orders from other tables before even coming back to us. At this point we had already been at the restaurant for about 45 minutes with no drink and no order placed. Now being in the service industry myself, I understand it gets busy and you get behind but to at least acknowledge a table that has been waiting for a long time is all I ask for. The server finally came over to take our order and we politely reminded him we still had not received the tea and coke we ordered. Was not even apologetic or anything, just took our order and returned with the drinks. The food came out in a timely manner and was delicious as always. He checked on us maybe one time and it took us another 25 minutes after we were done eating to get the check and pay. It was an ordeal just to enjoy a dinner with my boyfriend.
     I seriously have given this place three other chances since then to change my mind and it has failed each time. The service gets worse every single time I went and its like the servers don't even care. The happy hour is great and the food is to die for, but I hate being neglected as a paying and tipping customer. Ive come at all different times, not just during happy hour and its still awful. It saddens me to even write this because this is the only place in Vegas that knows how to cook a steak properly.

"If you love it so much why don't you marry it?"

"Where do I sign???"

Within hours of departing to so cal in the AM my sister and I stop by to check if this place was open as we were driving around town aimlessly looking to get our *fat mode* on.  Landing at 1am it just so happened to be Happy Hour :D

This place bring back a lot of good o' memories as we use to come here when it was Venetian, an old Italian joint way before Sauteed Clams was established.  It was our alternative to steak and eggs graveyard special for cheap eats back in HS.  I still remember the inconsistent creamy fettuccine alfredo they served with house salad, a soda of your choice, and unlimited bread and butter for $3.99.  It was what I think was our best kept secret as everyone else was still into that S&E phase.

Fast forward 10 years later, I'm not being stingy this time.  Oh no, I'm telling everyone and their mama about this place!  This has to be one of the best HH place I've been to in a long, long time.  Way better than Brio's HH, but sadly that's a whole another review that's not even worth mentioning.  

The difference between Herb and Rye is that they stay true to their menu and offer most items at discount, 50% off to be exact, than creating a bogus menu.  Unless you dig that sort of thing then that's cool, but if you're like me then you'd want a real entree as meal.  Let me get a *dab*. Anyone?

We went with our bartender's few suggestions, Flat Iron steak with red pepper mash potatoes and gnocchi bolognese.  He let it be known that the chef recommend that we do not go above medium temp on the steak.  They didn't know it, but right then and there we "click."

Our meal was came out perfect.  Wasn't too much food, but just right.  Sooo darn good that i came back the next night after a long day trip to Cali with my sister to try something else that our bartender suggested since i really enjoyed the two dishes we shared the night before.  Unfortunately they were closed at 2am since they had a mixology tasting party earlier, but luckily I met, and excuse my spelling, Nickolay, the owner.  We chatted for a bit in the parking lot.  Found out we both once worked for the same guy before.

For 2 entree just barely under $25 this place is defiantly an option for a late night snack.  Bravo Herb and Rye, way to carry on Venetian's saga.

Best meal I've had in Vegas- such a great time. Very crowded, but for good reason. The atmosphere is great- it's loud, but not too much, and with good music. 

Food- stellar. 
The grilled cheese with tomato soup- amazing. 
The filet sliders were incredible- best sliders I've had, hands down. 
Sides- Parmesan truffle steak fries, mashed potatoes, and truffle mac and cheese were the best
Desserts- chocolate chip cookie and the doughnuts were awesome. Great way to finish off the meal.

I'm very familiar with their Happy hour so we went for dinner again the other night.  Server was absolutely on it. Ensured our food was spaced enough between courses.  Cocktails and wine were being check on so we were never empty.  Bussers are also refilling water and cleaning as we eat.  Overall a pleasant experience,  as usual.  We had been here back in April for my birthday and I forgot to make a review, it was just as great and they had to deal with a party of 13.   This is a must for everyone to come enjoy. Will see you guys soon!

Herbs & Rye was one of those late dinners with Terri R that was on a whim.  Herbs & Rye looks like a pub on the outside, even has that feel when you walk in. All I know is that it was a very long day, I was starving, and anything that was food would have hit the spot.  In other words, I didn't expect much coming in. Maybe a good thing that I didn't expect much because I was actually surprised by the menu.  I expected nothing but fried dishes or meals with zero sustenance. What I found was a menu ranging from apps to steaks.  Prices are not pub prices though.  Price here is what you are to expect at a steakhouse.  A ton of really tempting items on this menu like Filet Mignon and Lobster, Burgers, and other steak options.  

With all the recent talk about White Castle here in Vegas for the last couple of days (compliments of the Foodie Fest), I decided on their sliders.  The presentation of these sliders is probably the best I've seen in awhile.  It at least kicks White Castle's butt.  I thought that the sliders were pretty good, but just a little rich.  We also got their fully loaded calamari.  To me, I thought it was one big workout killing mess.  It had a ton of what appears to be mayo, bacon, and some other add ons.  Both Terri and I, scraped off this mess and ate some calamari the way it should be eaten.  

As for the ambiance, you can say that you get two types.  When you walk in, you have the bar to the right where all the action is.  It's louder, brighter, and this is where everyone else is eating.  Then you got the quiet side where it's dimmer, quiet, and barely where anyone is dining.  Normally, I'm good with either side. But on this night, the dining was a little too tight on the bar side. So, we ate where it was quieter and darker.  Since it was also late, keeping ourselves from falling asleep was a challenge in itself.  My other concern is that we would be forgotten and our orders never taken.  This wasn't an issue at Herbs & Rye.  Regardless which side you choose to eat, service seems to be right on. 

Overall, Herbs & Rye is a decent place to meet with friends, grab a drink, and some dinner.  I'm not a huge fan of pubs in general, but I still have my favorites.  Herbs and Rye can easily be one of them.  

PS:  I don't drink, but there's a some great Happy Hour specials here.  For all you HH dudes and gals, give this place a try. 


Sliders:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=hsoYlp9buT_qd3CKSPNLcg&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

Calamari (Fully Loaded):  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=oTvwbAcO-gfxqfjK8Vot7g&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

Bread:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=wZ9FjsP6w30y6bUVLvBrtA&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

You Know It!:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=ll-CTLfvRCBFiNe7aWxfrA&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

Mad props to Taylor S for being the hostess with the mostest and taking me to Herbs & Rye on my last trip to Vegas! This dark and vibey little cocktail bar has a "locals only" feel with nods to the prohibition era. Think penny tin, chandeliers, and a big, beautiful (and well stocked, might I add) bar. The gentleman tending bar the evening we were there remembered Ms Taylor from a few months prior--if that's not amazing customer service, I'm not sure what is. 

We bellied up to the bar and took at look at their awesome cocktail menu. They divide the cocktail list between different ages--the Gothic Age, Tiki Boom, Prohibition, etc. Lots of gin and whiskey on this menu if that's your thing! I was looking for something light and not too boozy for the end of the night, so the bartender whipped me up a very refreshing Pimm's Cup. It was the perfect night cap! 

Didn't try the food this time around, but I've heard great things. I'd be here ALL the time if I were livin' it up in Vegas and will definitely be back next time I'm in Sin City.

I finally made it to Herbs and Rye!  From the outside, I was not sure this was going to be my kind of place.  Don't let the location and sketchy exterior scare you away.  Once you open the doors, it's like stepping in to another city.  My favorite thing about Herbs and Rye is that it is very different than any other bar I've been to in Las Vegas.  Very cool and dark and love the way it's decorated.  

The drinks were strong and moderately-priced, but to be honest, I was not as impressed with the happy hour food menu.  I expected the majority of the menu to be 50% off and that wasn't the case.  The things I wanted, Bruschetta and Calamari, were not 50% off but I got them anyway.  And I'm glad I did.  Both great and far better than I expected from bar food.  The service was really great too.  We met the owner while we were here, and he seemed like a cool dude.  Gave us some of the history of the place.  I don't love Herbs and Rye yet, but I will definitely come back here to give it another shot.  Very cool, unique place.

Happy Hour gets crowded. Legit waited 1hr30minute, however we were still honored happy hour prices.

Rib Eye + Brussels the way to go
Hidden gem. Great food. Great drinks. Great service. Go but keep the secret to yourself. Happy hour - most menu items are discounted.

Why does the filet mignon taste like carne asada? 

So upset that my meal wasn't as delicious as usual, actually so upset I probably won't be coming back for a long while. My boyfriend and I would always come to Herbs n Rye for our steak and potato fix. Usually, it would always hit the spot, but not this time. It seems like its under new management (not a good thing). I have a few things to complain about, I suppose, and I hardly ever complain about my experiences with food. This is actually my first yelp review. 

I'm pretty damn sure they raised their prices on a few food items. The filet mignon happened to be one of them. That's my usual with a few sides. The sides were up to par with my past experiences, but the filet mignon is the reason for this review. It used to be $34 for it (not happy hour) and now it's $10 more! The worst part about this is the fact that my filet tasted nothing like a filet mignon! If anything, it tasted like carne asada. The meat wasn't cooked medium well (what I ordered), it was completely well-done. I don't know what the hell is up with this "butterfly cook method" but no. Never again. The meat was not tender at all, usually it "melts" in my mouth, and it wasn't thick or rounded like how a filet mignon is supposed to look. Maybe it wasn't even a filet mignon, even though the bill said it was. Also, not impressed with the service or that techno/electronic music shit like every other restaurant in Vegas. I'm going to miss that classy vibe from Herbs n Rye:(

Regardless how you people at the HERB&RYE feel I will never ever step 
inside your establishment again ------and I have asked everyone that I know not to patronize your place of business..A very unhappy customer that would be me.....
I love it here !! Great food & amazing drinks. I love Emily. She provides great customer service & I love how she takes her time making each drink, literally to perfection !!!!

As a bar I give them 5 stars for their unique, fun blast from the past twist on American history of alcohol and night life. But the restaurant side of the house is mediocre.  The food lacks flavor but are all ok and great for safe eaters. The server we had was spending more time talking to me like I was his dog then trying to provide good service. Leave the swearing for home, not work.

I heard great things about this place from numerous people. I met a friend here for dinner one night. We started off with the meatballs for an appetizer and had a few of their cocktails. I ordered the filet and the Truffle Mac and cheese and he had some pasta dish with seafood in it. I think it was a special. The food lived up to the hype. My steak was prepared perfectly and seasoned extremely well. We didn't have any room for dessert so I can't comment on that portion.

I would definitely recommend this place.

Their sides are absolutely delicious (minus the truffle fries)! 

Great happy hour deal, 50% off steaks, where can you get a better deal! Drinks were very interesting, loved the ambiance! Server was great .. especially right after I was at Capo's .. made the service here seem even better, they actually knew of my existence. 

Next time I must try the dessert, I was too full to try it this trip. :(

Ok it's been a while since I've posted but I think I'm ready... (cracking knuckles) here we go. 

AM and I needed find a place for diner before going to the Sting concert. Both of us heard good things about Herbs and Rye so I called an hour before and they had room, excellent.

Arrived and exterior looks like a classy bar. Walked in and was seated promptly. Looking at the menu, they didn't have the Mushroom Panzerotti that that was on the website menu. No problem, ordered the Linguine & Clams. The clams were really good as they were still in the shell so really fresh. I really liked the flavor of the clam juice with the wine, garlic and chili. Only thing that was disappointing was the pasta was overcooked. I like my pasta soft but it was like baby food. Didn't order dessert as we were on our way to a show. 

I would come back for drinks but not for dinner.

I love me some herbs and rye! 
The food is pretty amazing. The quality of their entrees is just as delicious as the restaurants on the strip. You can't go wrong with their happy hour which is from 5-8pm. There are two lil stars marked next to the item on the menu. It's 50%off! Pretty cool! The ambience is dark and romanticish. Kinda reminds me of those vintage Russian rooms lol I don't know but it's pretty nice inside. My girls and I ordered the steak of course. Pretty bummed they ran out of truffle oil for my Mac and cheese but it was still rich and yummy!

Love this every time we are in town m. Super nice servers.  Happy hour steaks are the best deal in town.  The broccoli side is my favorite.  Spinich is just ok to me.  I can't get enough of this place!

This place is for you if you appreciate a fine cocktail, like places that are off the beaten path and want something besides 'bar' food. 

This place is NOT for you if you don't know what a mixologist is, want to order a shot of Jager or anything mixed with Red Bull00, if you are are loud, obnoxious or wear too much Ed Hardy. So kindly please don't come. :)

Try the meatballs. They are amazing! I can't pick a favorite cocktail yet because I'm working my way down the menu.

Good luck finding a parking space at this place! It is packed and the parking lot is small, but it is packed for a reason. I enjoyed a fabulously prepared rib eye. The steak speaks for itself. Above average. Ordered several side like garlic mash, asparagus, sweet potato and mac and cheese, all of which were tasty. But, this surprisingly was not the star of the night. Cocktails, cocktails all around! What a fun and tasty cocktail menu! The cocktails are the star of this place and they are so nicely complimented by beautiful steaks. A touch dark, but nice and relaxing. A Vegas must.

My first visit and it wasn't as good as I had expected based on reviews. The ambiance is very dim making it difficult to read the menu and see my date. I didn't realize that this is mostly a place to have steak and drinks at. I don't drink and I don't eat meat very often so the menu didn't have many options for me. My date had the pork chop which was beautifully presented and she enjoyed it. I had penne pasta with cream sauce and peas. We shared the donuts for dessert which were delicious! I was very disappointed that the bathroom had no soap or towels. The soap dispenser was totally broken and the inter part was on the counter but with no way to actually get it out. This is a sanitation issue and makes me worry about how clean the staff's hands are and makes me wonder how clean the kitchen is. Sanitation should be more of a priority. Not sure if I'll be back. Also, parking is horrible and not the safest of areas. I parked in the ally that had I lighting and had some questionable people loitering around. I was quite nervous to leave my car and probably wouldn't have come here had I not been meeting a date.

I went here last night and felt I needed let Vegas know what they are missing by passing the place. I have so many times. But it was such a great experience there, I will certainly go again.  Everything I ordered left mr speechless. My choices for the night and suggestions are: truffled msc and cheese , long neck clams, garlicy sauted spinach, and the Kansas cut steak (med rare). My tummy was very happy!!!

Thursday 7pm date night at this place was awesome! We tried to come on a Friday evening around 8pm and couldn't get in so make a reservation! 

The place has a fun atmosphere. Our server was attentive and recommended just about everything on the menu as his favorite (thanks for the "help" deciding right!) We spent $130 including tip, our usual spot is at least $200 before tip so my husband was really happy. Most of what we ordered was half off since it was happy hour, score! 

I ordered the punisher for a cocktail which was amazing, not too much alcohol taste just the way I prefer. My husband the zombie which he enjoyed but was too strong for me. For our appetizer we got the clams which came with a baguette. I really loved this dish! I did manage to get clam juice all over my dress and was brought club soda which was really nice! My husband ordered the prime rib with a side of button mushrooms and I the New York strip with the house rub and my side of garlic mashed potatoes (I really wish they had a creamed spinach or vegetable medley). My husbands steak was perfection, mushrooms delicious! My steak came with a light chili drizzle! Now, I'm not one for anything too spicy so my first though was oh shit... what did I just order?! It was amazing! Not too spicy at all! I'd highly recommend the house rub! I didn't find the mashed potatoes too garlic flavored which usually is a deal breaker for me but I was too excited about the amazing steak to care. 

We really loved this place and certainly will be back!

The bar staff is amazing. They know their shit. Not just some shit but allll the shit. The food is eloquent! I frequent this place as much as I can. Have yet to have bad service or food for that matter. Plus it's a local spot who was name best high volume bar in the country a couple years back. That reputation has stuck and for good reason.

I came here for Friendsgiving for the first time and was very impressed. We were seated pretty quickly with plenty of room for our group of 5. The dining room was very dim but late at night it totally worked. They have a kickass happy hour that will definitely bring me back. Because I don't eat red meat(I know why would I come I a place that has mainly steak) I ordered the salmon dish and it was honestly fantastic. The real gem of herbs and rye is their sides though! We ordered the truffle Mac n cheese, the fries and mashed potatoes. If you want to just order sides, I know they wouldn't blame you! 
The service was great as well! The bill with drinks and happy hour entrees and some extras was around 240. Great deal to me!

Am I going to come back? Absolutely!
Would I recommend for people to go? Heck yes!

The decor in Herbs & Rye is very dim & 1920s style. The restaurant can get packed in the evenings, wait times can be long so be sure to make a reservation. The bar can get full. The food is wonderful. Their cocktail menu is unique and the cocktails are delicious; plus the bartenders area a blast. The service otherwise has been very bad, hence the 3 stars. The hostess was incredibly rude to me the one time I didn't sit at the bar and requested a table. She couldn't be bothered to do her job and had a very poor attitude. Then she completely forgot about us and we waited 45 minutes prior to finding out she forgot about putting us at a table. Another time our server at our table was rude; several of us waited 25 minutes to even get asked if we wanted a drink and never got to order food or a second cocktail despite being there for an hour and a half! The server didn't attend to us at all and was very rudea, he slammed down our stuff at the table and we impatient and huffy. I was shocked, we had a large party for our company, we decided to hold happy hours there, but after that first experience we hold them somewhere else! For cocktails and sitting at the bar though Herbs & Rye is great!

Late Review. Coming to Vegas you definitely want to try a good steak house. After days of eating nothing but pho,Korean bbq,banh mi and viet food I definitely needed a good steak. So my brother who has been a resident of Vegas for a decade recommended this place. They have happy hours with crazy hours which is very common catering to a city that never sleeps. So we definitely wanted to give it a shot. Anything with the red dot is half price on their menu including all steaks so I was pretty excited. We started off with the carpaccio which is my all time fave. Presentation was nice and was pretty good certainly not the best carpaccio I've had but definitely not the worst. Also did the spicy mussels which was kind of disappointing some of the mussels were still cold and had chips of ice in them so that dish was a failure and the tomato sauce in the dish was kind of too pasty it says cooked in white wine don't think we had any in ours becuz the sauce was too thick. For dinner I had the 18oz ribeye I asked for black and blue since I love my steaks rare as possible.. the steak was seared definitely not black and blue more like iron panned flat and that was it. So I didn't get the charred crust from the seasoning that ur suppose to get and taste. The sides we got were the jalepeno cream corn which was probably the best thing we ate at their and the truffle Mac n cheese was good as well... oh if you do venture here if you have more than 2 people in a party they won't allow you to have separate bills they put  it all together and you and your party have separate and decides who pays for what yourselves... we had a party of 8 that day and it took our waiter 45 mins just to get the bill taken care of.. hella inconvenient !! All in all not something we are dying to go back to!

Stumbled upon this place while I was driving around for a place to eat dinner. I noticed the parking lot was full so decided to pull in and find a parking spot which took a while BC the lot was full. I made it in just before HH ended so I took advantage of the discounted beverages. 

I sat in the dinning room which dark but I noticed this place is definitely a locals joint. I Started off with a wedge salad that didn't disappoint followed by the 12 oz bone in Kansas City steak and side of truffle mac & cheese. The steak was tender, juicy and the mac & cheese was solid. 

Overall a good dinner with cordial service from my waitress at a reasonable price.

This place was ridiculously awesome; a definite highlight of my vacation in Las Vegas...right after boobies. It's an amazing place for a true classic cocktail experience, and it's all done with great execution. 

The cocktails themselves are reasons to veer off the strip, but the bartender Emily is a reason to make it a priority. She was knowledgeable and hilarious. She had such a super lovable personality that we decided to make a reservation in that same night to try their steaks for the late night happy hour (12am-2am). Unfortunately we didn't make it back, only because we physically weren't able too...apparently it's illegal or something to drive drunk.

Their happy hour is amazing!  Half off most steaks!  Unheard of!
And their cocktails were delicious!
I did have some problems with their steaks.  First, they tasted burnt.  Even if it was rare, it still had that burnt flavor.  Perhaps too much flames touching the steaks?  Who knows.  Second, the steak needed more flavor... salt.  I had to salt each piece I cut, which made it a lot better.  Third, wife ordered a medium done pork chop, it came out rare to medium rare, had it sent back to be recooked, and it came back well done.  Oh wells, at least the service was good, and we had a decent experience.

This place is literally little a diamond in the rough. From the outside it doesn't look as inviting but don't let that fool you. It's really nice in the inside. Rustic dark vintage feel. Great for a date night or a group event. I love it so much I'd even sit at the bar solo! The bartenders are super friendly. Amazing cocktails; my fav is the classic Moscow mule. Delicious appetizers and steaks. Filet mignon sliders, Mac and cheese, Meatballs, corn casserole are some of my favorites to share with friends. They have a great Happy Hour and they're open late. Not on the strip but close to it. When in Vegas Herbs & Rye is a MUST!

When in Vegas, take a trip on the beaten path and live a little...like a local. 

This place is always packed and for good reason. 

First, the libations. They have 50 or so mixed drinks from prohibition on separated by era in American history. The bartenders are extremely helpful and a very generous drink goes for around 12 bucks.

The food is crazy good with excellent variety and big portions. All meat, and they are known for their meat, is cornfed but not hormones and antibiotics. 

They have a good variety of other food such as mussels claims pasta and fish. The sides are delicious and large. 

But here is the good news... all meat have price until 8 PM! That's right. A 14 ounce NY strip with a side is 17 dollars!

So with regard to the herb and rye...don't let this gem stay in Vegas... tell everyone you know...GO!

I LOVE Herbs and Rye. 
It is a unique dining spot in Las Vegas. 
Tonight I brought my new boss and 2 coworkers here for dinner. The place has a great vibe. Tonight seemed to be Motown night and they played everything from Earth Wind and Fire to the Jackson five. 
The cocktails were excellent, their house Cab I loved and the Mac and cheese with truffles was amazing. 
The only disappointment of the evening was 2 filets coming out over cooked.
Our waitress Deborah immediately was there to make sure we were happy with how they were cooked and immediately recognized that they were over cooked.
She immediately took them back to be remade. 
While we were waiting the general manager appeared an apologized and comped us a round of drinks. 
To say I was impressed is a understatement.
The steaks appeared shortly cooked perfectly with new hot sides also.
The steaks were amazing.
I highly recommend Herbs and Rye and am happy to hear they are opening a new location called "Cleaver" right off the strip.
We will be back soon!

Had heard much about this place from friends and was super hyped to eat here. The night started off well with some good conversation with the host and the physical look was quaint and rustic albeit a bit dark. The tomato bisque soup was off point, to tangy and not enough cream. The cocktail menu was extensive but the drink pours were very small. If I pay $15 for a decent whiskey I expect a decent pour. The meat and pork chops were the highlight of everyone's menu. Seasoned well and cooked to perfection. The sides that were hyped on yelp.com such as truffle mac and cheese and sweet potato tots were disappointing. I would have given another 1/2 star except for the small drink pours. I also would have given another 1/2 star if the drink prices were better. Overall, a good place for steak and chops but they need specials and an improved happy hour to make it with the trip.

HERBS & RYE. One of my go-to places for steak. It is always so, so good. Whenever my boyfriend and I have out-of-town guests, we take them here for the half-off happy hour specials. The midnight to 3AM happy hour is usually pretty busy. We've eaten here on countless occasions and it is always almost fully packed. So, the music and atmosphere are pretty loud. But, it's fine because we're too busy devouring our steaks to talk all that much. 

We typically order the Filet Mignon. It is always perfect. If I am feeling it, I will order their sauces - either the chimichurri or brandy peppercorn sauce. Both are very good. The sides are for sharing. One side could probably be shared among 2-3 people. We usually order the mac-n-cheese, spinach, and asparagus. 

If we are really hungry, we order the Tomato Bisque and/or Farmer Flatbread along with our steaks. The flatbread is pretty good. The egg on it really makes all the difference. The tomato soup comes with grilled cheese and is actually enough for an entire meal. So, if you're not that hungry but still want to eat along with your friends, order the tomato soup. 

The drinks. My second favorite part. This place definitely does their drinks right. They have drinks featured from different time eras. The drinks are strong and presented very nicely. The beer selection is also pretty good. 

Service is always on-par. They are attentive and have never had a problem in the countless times we've been here. 

Overall, this place is awesome. I highly recommend. Will be back here again and again.

Came here with a friend for the first time and didn't know what to expect... but I sure wasn't expecting a vampire dungeon castle with class... 

This joint definitely looked hip and I was curious from the moment I took a step through the door. My party and I were immediately greeted by a hostess and then we made our way to the bar. The bartenders were ready to serve us as soon as we parked our batooki's on the bar stools. 

I personally ended up ordering the stake salad flatbread, which was divine and 
a glass of chardonnay that was not such a great recommendation from the B-tend, but it was still good enough for me to drink it up. My buds had 4 french beers between them and calamari.  

Overall the bill for 1 glass of wine, 4 beers, calamari + 1 flat bread was $70 tip not included in calculation which is a little steep, but I thought it was worth it because the aesthetics made it feel like it was worth spending the extra green. The food did take a bit long to arrive, but it was no biggie. I definitely dig this joint and will be coming back real soon.
Good cocktails! Great happy hour prices! Soft velvety wall paper - don't be afraid to touch it... it makes the experience more fun ;)

This place has a really cool vibe.  First of all, it's pretty small if you're hanging out in the bar area, which I love.  Nothing exemplifies the Vegas bar experience more than a huge 10,000 square foot room with a rectangle bar in the middle of it with Cruddy bartenders pouring overpriced drinks.  This place is more out of Chicago or San Francisco than Las Vegas.  It's got a pretty dark old school vibe that I really like.  The bartender was happy to make suggestions for drinks, since we generally aren't gin/rye drinkers in my party.  Every drink we had was off the menu, no well drinks on this night.  They were all outstanding.  Didn't get a chance to try the food, but if it's as good as the vibe and the drinks it's got to be great.  

Looking forward to my next trip to try the food and more of the drinks.  

Short story, if you're into cool bars and despise the Designer/Summerlin Bar scene, this place is awesome.

I wanted to come here last night after all the good things I heard but I have to say from the outside it looked like it was a strip club.  It had no windows?  I drove around the entire building looking for parking but there was NO parking so I had to cancel my reservation online and drive away.  There was also a random old white guy sitting outside on the perimeter of the lot.  He was smoking and he may or may not have been homeless (hey no judgement) and he also helped scare me away from any parking that may have opened up.  My girlfriend and I were completely sketched out by the outside of this venue and lack of parking but I have heard great things...

The food was just awesome.  The 5 of tried 3 different steaks and 5 different sides and we loved everything.  The steaks were perfectly cooked.  My favorite sides were the jalepeno cream corn and the brussel sprouts....so flavorful.  Also loved the sweet potato tots and asparagus. The waitress was sweet and her service very good.  My hubby and i had 2 huge steaks and 2 sides for under 60 bucks.  The only disappointment was that we had 5:00 reservations,  (as well as several other patrons),  and we all stood in the 105 degree heat for 15 minutes because they didn't open the doors until 5:15 (even though a sign on the front clearly says happy hour is 5:00-8:00.) When they finally opened the door there was no apology from the hostess, and she didn't even hold the door open.  She just opened it then closed it on everyone.  Despite the bad initial impression,  we will go back for the food.  We will just be sure to go after 5:15.

I have been wanting to try this place for quite some time since I have heard amazing things about their food and drinks. I finally talked the boyfriend into it for their happy hour. 

First of all, there is hardly anything on the happy hour. 2 wines and a few well cocktails. Of course we wanted to try their famous cocktails which were not on the happy hour. They were $11-$13 each. We ordered Moscow mules and they were tasty. There also isn't very much food on the happy hour unless you're there for steaks which are 50% off but even at that discount are still pretty pricy. I am a vegetarian and when we mentioned there weren't many vegetarian options the bartender said "nope there sure isn't". Now I am a server and am always trying to accommodate vegetarians, vegans, gluten free etc and always have a few great suggestions to throw out. This guy wasn't even trying. Without his help we found some options. We ordered a caprese salad which was amazing, a Mediterranean flatbread, also tasty, and the truffle Mac n cheese which was bland and not very truffley. But overall the food and drinks were very good. 

My biggest complaint was the service. Now granted we sat at the bar and ordered apps and drinks but the 2 bartenders really seemed to not care about us at all. They never checked on us and we were constantly trying to get their attention so we could order. When we finally did they acted like we were an inconvenience. At one point we had been waiting forever for the check and we needed to get going and so my boyfriend after finally flagging down the bartender handed him his credit card and asked politely if he could please run it for the tab. The bartender grabbed his card and threw it on the back bar and then walked away. We then waited another 10 mins for him to process it. It was very rude.
