Our total for 2 people was $90 and we had 2 drinks each and those few food items I mentioned. Incredibly overpriced and poor service? Needless to say we won't be returning.

I just returned from this restaurant & thought I'd write a review while the experience is still fresh. Upon entering I liked the look of the place, it was very small and quaint and had that dark vintage feel about it. They had a dinning area that seemed really dead and dark and kinda secluded. We sat in the booths by the bar. I had a pisco sour and it was okay.

As for the food we started w/ beef carpaccio and it was good. For my main I got the filet mignon and garlicy spinach as a side. My guy got the Surf & Turf (Filet mignon & lobster) which came w/ garlic mashed potatoes & asparagus (he changed it for one of their other sides and they upcharge $4 for the change). My steak was good but my spinach was uneatable..no exaggeration, they were THE SALTIEST thing I've eaten my entire life..I think they might have accidently dumped salt in them. I told our waitress and got brussel sprouts instead, they were too charred and dripping w grease. His food was fine, steak was good and lobster was so so, potatoes were good. I must admit the broccoli he substituted was DELICIOUS!! I would recommend the broccoli here but that's really about it.

All in all:
Service - our waitress was polite and nice, she was great!

Food - pretty terrible, they messed up very simple stuff

Price - in comparison to the atmosphere and the food, definitely not worth it! You can get a better meal at another steak house that has a much better ambience and much livelier. Honestly though, im a foodie and if the food is great I'll go anywhere and this just wasn't. 

Atmosphere - small, not very lively. Nothing interesting.

Sweet baby Jesus?! We have arrived. 

Now this is how I can imagine old Vegas was when wheelin' & dealin' were going on behind close doors drinking prohibition type cocktails served under a clouds of smoke....

The last time we hit up the Herb we strolled in on a Friday night/early Saturday morning around 130AM to make it to happy hour. Yes, I said it - Happy Hour! Only this super cool joint would have a happy hour between 12AM-3AM. What a great way to get into Vegas and begin your epic adventures in Sin City. 

Everything on the menu is on point. I will always opt to add the chimimcurri sauce to any steak order. Tried the pepper corn sauce during this recent visit and although the sauce is good, my mind was on the chimumcurri the entire time. 

Take some time to check out all the drink options that they have. You never know, you might find a new concoction to try out. I always tend to immediately have a mule but with the options at the Herb, you have to try something new....

I love the atmosphere. Everyone who is there is there to have a good time and that's it. Non-pretentious place to hang out with friends or spark up a convo with one of the bartenders. 

Don't let the dark building exterior or lack of a parking lot deter you from this place. Its seriously the place to be. Woot!

We made reservations the morning of on their website and received an email confirmation no later than 2-3 hours later. We originally had reservations for 7:00PM on a Monday night to try and make it for their happy hour deal. Unfortunately we were running a little behind schedule so I called around 6:00PM that Monday to see if we could push our reservations back. I got the machine but left a message to see if we can change our reservations to 7:30PM. Michelle kindly called back within 30 minutes and let me know that it'll be no problem to come in at 7:30PM.

We arrived and were told it'd take a moment to set up our table but we could hang out in the bar area. They have an extensive cocktail menu that was a bit overwhelming to read. My boyfriend and I ordered drinks, he got the zombie and I got the blinker. The moscow mule and pisco sour caught my eye, but the blinker was actually pretty strong so I felt like I couldn't(shouldn't) order a second drink. I was constantly looking at my cellphone for the time and at the host to see if he knew where we were (or remembered what we looked like) to be able to tell us when our table was ready. After about 20 minutes we were invited to our table. We settled our drink bill at the bar and got seated.

After we put in our order, our server was nice enough to tell us that we were able to make it in time for happy hour (with only 4 minutes to spare before it was 8pm), so we got a few dishes at happy hour price - which is a really good deal for the quality of the food.

We ordered the beef carpaccio to start, then shared the linguine and clams and the 18 ounce ribeye cooked medium. The linguine and clams and the ribeye were at happy hour prices (which is 50% off). The linguine and clams was delicious, the white wine sauce was perfectly balanced. It was thin in consistency and not over garlic-y. The dish came with a piece of bread which we both used to soak up extra sauce. The ribeye was good, I usually prefer ribeye over because the rich flavor it has to the cut. Our piece was cooked perfectly and was more than enough to share - we found ourselves pushing our limits on the last few bites because it was so good we couldn't stop. The cut was a bit fatty (as ribeyes usually are) but I personally like the charred fatty bites. 

We had planned to go to dinner as a celebratory event and stated that in the reservation but didn't think much of it. Our server seemed dodgy when we were trying to get his attention, but turned out he eventually told us he was stalling for time because they were cooking up some complimentary donuts for us! What a sweet gesture. My boyfriend isn't really a sweets person (he NEVERRRRRRR eats dessert when we go out for dinner) but he could not resist the fresh donuts drizzled in caramel sauce. It was so good. We had a good experience. If you're looking to go, I'd definitely recommend going during happy hour and making a reservation!

Always a wonderful time. Fillet is so tender you don't even need a knife. Flatbread superb. I always have a hard time deciding on all the delicious sides I have to order seveal. Always have to get the outrageously delicious creamed corn with japaleno.
The food is incredible, the drinks are fantastic, and you can't beat the 50%-off-steak happy hour from 5-8pm and 12a-3am.

Came for happy hour and I don't think I could have left any happier. The filet mignon, cocktails, and crème brûlée were amazing! My waiter was Charlie and even during the busiest hours of his shift he was awesome! He suggested the best drinks, and was probably the most genuine waiter I've ever had. Hands down the best waiter! This is a place you don't want to miss out on.

Off the usual beaten path of the vegas strip you'll find this great hidden treasure full of awesome cocktails and eats in the form of beef! Our bartender was great in entertainment and knowledge of drinks ;sorry I forgot his name. Nonetheless, our time there was well spent.

After hearing great reviews about Herbs and Rye, I finally made it here for a Happy Hour and a double date on a Friday night. The place wasn't packed for a Friday, but that was fine by me. We were seated in the corner booth right away. The server came and explained to us what the happy hour items were. He left and didn't come back for another 15 minutes.....I asked him what drink would he recommend for me and he said the Clover Club. (Gin, Lemon, Egg White and Grenadine....something like that, I wasn't a big fan so he traded me for a lemondrop martini instead). 

We ordered the Carpaccio, Spicy Mussels, Linguine and Clams and the Rib Eye with the Mac and Cheese. After the server put the order in, everything came out pretty quickly. The Spicy Mussels were really spicy...to spicy for this girl. The Carpaccio was yummy!!! I could probably eat that all night, but just a FYI it's not on the HH menu. I LOVE linguine and clams and I felt that Herbs and Rye did a good job, but it was too spicy for me. The fiancé was not to happy with his steak as it was cold and tough to eat, so that was a disappointment. Overall, the food was good although I'm sure I had a stomachache from all the spiciness but it was worth it. For two drinks, two appetizers and two entrees for a total of 75 bucks, it's pretty reasonable. The Happy Hour menu is limited, but the linguine and clams was pretty delicious. We definitely will be back to try the flatbread.

I come here every few months and I always enjoy every cocktail and food. Happy hour is a great time to get any steak half off! Such an awesome deal! I've tried most of their appetizers and steaks...all delicious. Will keep going back!
Came here to grab dinner with a friend. Fantastic steaks and great drinks selection. The outside didn't look like much but the inside decorations had a cool vibe.

Our server on the strip turned us on to this place so we decided to give it a try the next night.  It didn't disappoint.  It looks like an old Italian place that's been converted into a custom cocktail bar / steakhouse.  The nondescript red door is its signature welcome.  Loved the cocktail menu!  The choices were organized by era - Prohibition, etc.  I opted for a basic Piña Colada and the Diablo.  Both very well done.  Our party order steaks and yardbird with risotto.  Added the potatoes, asparagus and jalapeño creamed corn.  Excellent all around.  The fresh donuts for dessert are a must-have.  Dang, they were addictive.

I really feel this place warrants more like 3.5 stars. Dark, clubby, with a sort of hipster take on vintage Vegas...cool menu full of mixology "craft" cocktails...solid steaks and accouterments. A cool place to go for late-night food...and located in a SOLIDLY unpretentious part of town (bonus points!!!). 

I went during regular hours and had a filet with a side of mushrooms, and caesar salad. All were good, but a pit pricey for what they were. I'll have to go back and try the happy hour menu...I have a feeling my cheap ass will like that more!

Overall, I endorse this spot.

Cool unpretentious bar with an extensive menu of classic drinks. The people serving are very helpful and will take the time to explain some of the more detailed or unfamiliar drinks without making you feel stupid. This bar is a class act!

This is without a doubt THE best cocktail bar in Las Vegas. Hands down. There is not one cocktail they serve that is not delicious. And they can make you anything that does not appear on their menu. And none of their cocktails cost more than $15 dollars.

Their cocktail menu is divided by cocktail eras, i.e. pre-prohibition, the golden age, etc. I own Tany Abou-Ganim's The Modern Mixologist so I know my stuff. So anything you order from their menu will be divine. And if by chance nothing on the meu speaks to you, you can tell the bartender what type of liquor you drink and give him an idea of what you are looking for in a drinks, say mangoes or something sour, and they will make it for you. They are so talented that the other day I went to the bar with a teetotaler and the bartender made her a drink with raspberries and stuff sans alcohol!

The service is also top-notch. We recently went on a friday with a large party and did not have reservations (I know, how dumb of us). The hostess informed us that the wait for a table was 45 minutes. 2 hours after we were barely being seated. At that point their happy hour had ended. We asked the waiter if he could offer it to us nonetheless and he checked and they did! Mind you, it was not their fault we hadn't made a reservation and thus missed their happy hour specials. So I think it was pretty cool of them to offer it to us. By this time we were super hungry and we all ordered steaks. They were delicious! I had mine with a martini, wonderful! 

Check this place out if you want affordable, hand-crafted cocktails.

Came here with hubby on an impromptu date. 
I was apprehensive when we got here, I felt that any moment a slasher lurking between the cars  will be attacking you as it was so dark at the parking lot. 
Once you get inside the restaurant, it was quite nice. Dark but beautiful interior. We were lucky to get seated at the back room area where it's quieter. We came before 8PM and some appetizers and steaks were half priced! Cool!
We ordered the spicy mussels for appetizer and it was so delicious! The serving size was  good enough for  sharing for 2 people, the red sauce was so flavorful my hubby had to ask for extra bread for dipping and ate it with gusto!
I had the filet mignon and hubby was partial to rib eye, both steaks were cooked to perfection. 
No condiments needed. I like the sides of  button mushrooms and the truffle mac & cheese.  We were so full we did not have room for desserts. 
Our server was nice and regularly checked on us. 

I'm docking 1 star as service is a bit slow: the food took a while to come out;  the
entrées were pricey (unless you come during happy hour), the background music were not conducive to a romantic date  (they were playing 70's song like Anita Ward's "Ring My Bell" when we were dining there! Ugh! )  and  the exterior is creepy - I think they should add more lights at the parking area for safety reasons.
Other than these, I think it's worth coming back to. I'll try their cocktails and desserts next time.

Love love love this place! Never disappointed always a great atmosphere and amazing food! 
Make a reservation and you'll get in right away with no problems.

You cannot beat this place during their happy hour. Old time movies playing on the tv screens and a menu that points out that their steaks are half off during their happy hour. Our waiter was super awesome because he totally realized that I am frugal. When ordering a drink, he let us know if a drink was going to be half off or not, which I totally appreciated. I have frequented places that will happily "do you dirty" and not mention when something isn't part of their special to jack up the price of the bill. Food was pretty decent. Only complaint is that it was super dark in there. We needed our phones to look at the menu.
You won't go wrong with Herbs & Rye. Great food...although I wish they would bring back their all gender restrooms. It was nice to see such a hip restaurant being so progressive.

I have been to this restaurant several times in the past. I booked a birthday dinner to celebrate, and had a reservation time of 7:00PM. I showed up promptly fifteen minutes beforehand. Due to their parking situation, which does not have enough spaces for even half of the restaurant, we had to park in another location and walk to the restaurant. We were in the restaurant before our reservation time, waiting to talk to the hostess as it was very busy. When we finally got to the front of the line, the time was 7:05PM, and the hostess told me that they already had sat the table because we were late. As they had this marked as a special event and still chose to act like this even though I was not impolite or unprofessional at any time, will keep me from ever going back. Nor will I recommend this place to anybody again. Thanks for the experience/ waste of time.

EDIT:  Mr. Mendoza: Your response is a sad attempt to cover your bases. Your in-person demeanor led me to believe you'd handle the review with grace, but it's clear you're a keyboard warrior. The review I wrote was for an experience I had over a year ago. Also, I have met you personally as you and your wife have come into MY restaurant to dine in. I'd like to thank you. I'd love to know how your "technology" keeps track of my experience. Facial recognition? It's pretty crazy that you have terabytes and terabytes to store years and years worth of video. I'd would ask how you associated my party from others using video (years ago retroactively), but it's clear you're lying. My "party" was just me and one other.

"Last but not least thank you for taking time out of your extremely busy day to create this fake yelp profile with no picture and write a 1 review. I'm pretty sure it was the highlight of your day and made you feel warm and fuzzy inside"

I'm so sorry my "fake" profile has served as an inconvenience to you. You apparently don't realize that everybody that visits your restaurants are not tourists, and guess what.. they might even know of you personally! Either way, this is a clear indicator of what kind of treatment you'll receive the next time you pay us a visit. It makes me so happy to know you won't know when and where it is. Also shocking that you guys get such poor reviews when you pay so much for SEO with Yelp. The Bill Murray quote is nice as well, since you fail to see the irony in your response. Cheers!

Did you say Happy Hour from 5 pm to 8 pm?  Wait! AND half price steaks?  Had dinner with a friend before a show at the Smith Center.  Herbs and Rye is in the old Venetian Italian restaurant.  Loved the dark speakeasy vibe and brick walls.  Caution: let your eyes adjust or you will run over the hostess!  We started with the calmari appetizer.  It was crispy and served with a delicious aioli.  The crispy pancetta was a nice touch.  BTW - it was a very large serving. I order the filet mignon and it melted in my mouth!  My side was the crispy truffle french fries.  YUM!  They have an extensive cocktail list that is sectioned by time period.  I opted for the French 75.  It is one of my favorite cocktails and Herbs and Rye did not disappoint!
Our server was awesome and kept us on schedule for our 7:30 show!  Love Herbs and Rye!

Ummm... Yum! Thanks to a recommendation by fellow Yelper (Micheal T.) we went to Herbs & Rye after our tour at the Neon Museum. I was so happy to be off the Strip. The recommendation was mostly for the cocktails, but when our server greeted us at 11:30pm and told us the food happy hour would start at midnight we couldn't resist!! All cuts of meat were half off! I got an amazing Filet Mignon with a side of truffle macaroni and cheese ($26 for the happy hour price; one side is included with your cut of meat). Grass-fed beef... yum! 

The cocktail menu was very unique as a timeline of the cocktail. I opted for the Ramos Gin Fizz from the "Golden Age." Delish! Adam on the other hand opted for Leap Year from "Prohibition." I liked mine better. I wish I could've gotten a decent picture of the cocktails or the cocktail menu, but the ambiance is romantic and dark.

I highly recommend for visitors to venture away from the Strip and grab a late night steak and historical cocktail.

Went for the first time on a Saturday night around midnight. Our server Justin? Was personable and gave us recommendations. We ordered the porterhouse, carpaccio, beef tartar, sweet potato tater tots, and steamed mussels. Seems like a little but the portions are filling. Steak wasn't that great but the tartar was outstanding and the mussel broth was the perfect amount of spicy. Their menu is extensive with four pages of cocktails but with each one we ordered they got progressively worse. We had a Moscow Mule, Incredible Hulk, Ward Eight, and a regular vodka cranberry. I've heard that their bartenders are some of the best in Las Vegas but I was disappointed. I'll definitely come back though. Loved the atmosphere and the late hours. The exterior looks run down but inside reminds me of prohibition with dim lighting and old fashioned decor.  Also they have a happy hour past 12, steaks half off!

The happy hour here is awesome!! I always get excited when places have happy hour on the weekends. A little off the strip, but a nice place to get away from the casinos. 

The steaks/sides/cocktails are all half price during happy hour and the cocktail menu is huge. The waitress made great suggestions based on our tastes. I had the NY strip and it was cooked perfectly. The truffle mac & cheese and mushroom sides were tasty as well! 

The restaurant is very unsuspecting on the outside, but the interior has a speakeasy, Prohibition era feel. Will definitely make this a regular stop on our Vegas trips!

Herbs & Rye reminds me of a speak easy. Very dimly lit, like you don't want to be seen. The first time we went, it was so dim, my bf's mom needed a flashlight to view her menu. 

I've gone twice and had the same server both times, Ronnie. He was very patient with my demanding party. One of the ladies in our group wanted to customize a drink (when they already have a long list of super special specialty cocktails) and wanted A-1 for her filet. So anyways. 

This last time we went, everything took a really long time. I'm not sure if it was our server's timing or if the kitchen was slow. Either way, I think it was a fluke because our first experience was fine. 

I think a dinner here is in the $25-40 range. 

We went during happy hour. During happy hour, it's -50% from well drinks and select items from the menu. My party of three each got a half-off entree. 

Beginning with the cocktails. Their specialty cocktails are crafted with a history of alcohol in the US in mind. The cocktail menu is listed with era in mind (the Golden Years of Drinking, Prohibition, Reform, etc), with the liquors and garnishes relevant to the drink. Very nice. I got the Aviation, an herbal recipe of gin, creme de violette, and lemon. (By the way, I don't know how much the cocktails cost because someone else grabbed the tab both times I was there). 

They have a full bar and also serve Le Grande absinthe. 

The menu is American traditional and very small. I had the Fettucine Alfredo ($12, $6 during happy hour). It was pretty basic. Really nothing special. I also had a Caesar's salad with salmon ($11). Likewise, it was a basic dish. One thing that struck me, though, was the dressing had anchovy in it and it was like, the first thing that hit my palate. It was good (I love anchovies), just the right blend. 

My mom got a nine ounce filet ($25, $12.50 happy hour) and my bf got the 17 ounce ribeye ($26, $13 happy hour). He ordered it rare and got a medium rare. All of the steaks come with a choice of two sides: Button Mushrooms, Jalapeno Cream Corn, Asparagus, Garlic Mash, Truffle Mac and Cheese, Crispy fries, Sweet Potato Tots. Might I recommend the tots? They are, how would you say, exquisite. 

For dessert, we shared a caramel flan. It was a little different from other flans I've had. It was a little less custardy and almost cakey. Like cheesecake.

For the three entrees, a salad, a dessert, and six cocktails, the tab came out to about $100. Not bad. 

The ladies bathroom is disproportionately large compared to the rest of the joint. Two stalls and kind of ill decorated. 

But the restaurant is nicely done to continue the speak easy or Roaring 20's feel. The restaurant is partitioned in to two sections: the front and the bar. Next to the bar, there are about six semicircle booths facing the bar (and the flat screen tv's ... smart). 

* off the strip, non-casino

Love this place for steak recommend it all the time, but I have had a few bad experiences with the cook in the steaks as of late. One time I can understand but not 3 might not be recommending this place in the future!

Finally got a chance to go. Happy hour is totally worth it. Our steaks were done pretty well. My wife got the ribeye and I got the NY Strip, and after having a taste of hers I wish I'd ordered the ribeye. My garlic mashed potatoes were better than my wife's truffle crispy fries (which weren't very crispy, to be honest) but those were still tasty. The littleneck clams appetizer was awesome. 

No surprise, the cocktails were dead-on, and the donuts for dessert were freshly made and perfectly cooked.

All in all, I think it was worth the wait. I would bring friends here for drinks, definitely. I'm not sure I would feel so good if I were paying non-Happy Hour prices for the steaks, but with such a long and generous happy hour that's not really a problem.

Great HH!! Half off steaks..... Yes, steaks!! Drinks are old school prohibition style drinks made properly! Food was very good and although a little pricey, worth the price!! Drinks do take a while to get out and if the bar is full service is iffy but worth the wait.

This off the strip restaurant was recommended to us. So glad we went! 
We arrived at 7pm for dinner.
Nicely greeted by the hostess Christina.
Atmosphere was a bit dark inside, but the place was packed. We had to wait a bit for our dinner table, so we had a cocktail at the bar. Joe the bartender made my wife's favorite cocktail drink and actually made it better than other places. Joe was attentive and personable. We were seated about 15minutes earlier than our reservation time.
Debra our waitress was fabulous. Cheerful and professional at the same time. She gave us great recommendations. Must have their RIBEYE along with the mac cheese truffle as your side. The char, flavor, & the way we like our ribeye, med -rare was on point! The clam appetizer was so flavorful, just a bit over cooked though. If this was cooked perfectly  then we would have rated this place a 5star. Also had button mushrooms as a side & it was perfect. All the dishes we ordered did not need any additional seasoning to our tastebuds.
Brandon, the sever's assistant was polite, friendly,
& very attentive to out table. Even the manager, Valeria stopped by to say hi and asked if dinner was going well. The fresh doughnut dessert was warm, lite, and delicious. Oh, don't forget to have a glass of red wine with your steak. 
5p-8p is Happy Hour. So the Ribeye was 1/2 off.
Dinner for 2 including tip just under $100. We shared the 18oz. steak and we were full & content.
Definitely will return and also bring family & friends when they visit us.

This is one of those restaurants that everyone has talked about and I'm glad to say that it lives up to it's expectations. GREAT happy hour. Steaks were good, given the fact that it isn't a fine dining steakhouse. Let's get to the cocktails! Probably one of the best gin cocktails selections around in Vegas. Very impressed by the gin cocktail selections they had and the mixologists were so good! We sat by one of the booths that was facing the bar and I was delighted by way they took their time in making their hand crafted cocktails!

The happy hour was great. Tasty steaks at 1/2 price. Beer was$3. The drinks were very good. We ordered a Cesar salad and we were disappointed. The gave us 4 romain leaves that we had to cut up ourselves. The dressing was very fresh and delish. Next time I will ask them to cut up the lettuce.

This restaurant is truly a hidden gem. It is located about 2 miles from the hustle and bustle of the strip.

The restaurant probably won't catch your eye from the outside, but once you step inside it is like you stepped back in time. The dimly lit restaurant is reminiscent of old Las Vegas with it's dark upholstered booths and red wall paper. The combination of 1940s swing music and Frank Sinatra classics complete the feel.

TIP: happy hour is every day from 5 to 8pm. This includes drink specials as well as 50% off every steak.

One of my favorite things about Herbs and Rye is the drink menu. It highlights between four to six drinks from different eras over the past few hundred years in America. These drinks were invented during those time periods and the menu explains who invented it and where. I've sampled quite a few of the drinks and my favorite is the Bee's Knees which is a gin drink. The tiki drinks from the 1960s era is also a favorite and they are served in tiki glasses. All cocktails from this menu are $12 and the tiki drinks are $14.

The dinner menu features a few appetizers and salads but the main draw is the steaks. Every steak comes with one side. The sides are big enough to share. My go to meal is the filet mignon with a side of the truffle Mac and cheese. The steak is phenomenal but the Mac is the best I've ever had.

Herbs and Rye is perfect for a romantic date night or night out with friends. Do make a reservation several days in advance.

The Only reason this play gets 2 stars are for interior design, bartenders, and their drinks.
Took them over 40 mins to seat party of 5 when there was 6 tables open, 27 mins for a glass of wine, 42 mins for 60 oz. medium rare steak that came out cold and close to rare, bringing out the steak on a cold skillet didn't help either. When they cut the steak they should know the temperature of the steak but no, they just serve it anyway. Truffle mac & cheese felt as if precooked and crumbling dry. Amount of fat on the steak was little more than 25%. I will come back for the great drinks but not for the dinner.

What? You haven't been here yet? what are you waiting for? I've posted a review back in September. This is my go to place. It reminds me of a quaint restaurant in NYC. Its so romantic and the music is diverse, not too loud but noticeable. The bar is always packed 'cause of the amazing bartenders and the enormous list of cocktails. The service is just amazing.
 There's Mark, the "other" Mark, Alley, and of Course the lovely Brittany just waiting to greet you at the door. And you won't believe it but the owner, can be found behind the bar on occasion. Just gotta mention the back up servers too. Always smiling and quick to get you whatever you desire
C'mon check it out!

What took me so long?!?!? Oh Man, Herbs & Rye is where it's at! 
I was privileged last Saturday to leave work early enough to have dinner with my handsomest husband. On our way to another spot, light bulb lit up and we turned around to make our way to Herbs & Rye. Best decision I could have made. I enjoyed the experience so much, we wanted to return the very next day!
On a Saturday night (around 10pm), plenty of tables were opened and my kind of music was playing. I honestly wasn't hungry but wasn't going to pass on sampling some eats, especially since I've been wanting to try Herbs & Rye for a while. I opted for the Bruschetta Flat Bread, and Caramel Apple Bread Pudding. The hubs got the NY Strip with Whiskey Shallot Potatoes.
Bruschetta Flat Bread was light and refreshing. Perfect as an appetizer or something to nibble on.
Caramel Apple Bread Pudding came with a scoop of vanilla icecream which makes all the difference for me. Honestly not the best bread pudding I've ever had, but pretty good.
The NY Strip was REALLY good! Seared on the outside and tender on the inside. Had that great char flavor.
Whiskey Shallot Potatoes were recommended by our server, BOMB! The flavors in this side were fantastic! Savory, creamy, with an orgasmic kick. 
We also sipped on some of the best cocktails in Vegas. Yes! I SAID IT! Weekend at the Waldorf and Pina Colada from the Rat Pack Era were amazing. Don't sleep on the Pina Colada, this one isn't the packet mix type that are served everywhere else. It's unique but carries some of that expected flavor. 
Another star of the show is Joaquin. Exceptional service, honestly. He was knowledgeable of the menu- drinks and food, made great suggestions - the whiskey potatoes were his suggestion, friendly, polite, attentive in the best kind of way. He never came up to talk to us while we were engaged in conversation or had our mouth's full. NOT ONCE. With the corner of my eye, I'd see him look over while passing (show's his attentiveness) but not approach the table when it wasn't a good time. I truly appreciate that. Never have I ever had a server who was so intuned.
Joaquin is who kicked our experience up to 5 Stars.

The menu is simple; I was blown away with the tomato bisque (which comes with a grilled cheddar cheese sandwich). If you go during happy hour (which I believe is everyday from 5pm-8pm), you may also get half off of your menu item(s)... This is not on everything but is not limited to just drinks and appetizers. 

Parking may be difficult. I'd suggest taking a Lyft or an Uber, unless you don't mind taking your chances for a space that may be available or parking further away. Being a popular restaurant, it would also be wise to make a reservation (wait times can be an hour). The restaurant is very bustling and lively; good for groups and dinner dates. The downside to that is service from the staff can be a little slow.

Went here on a Saturday night, we had a party of 6. Must make a reservation (we did, but many coming in didn't). Restaurant is so amazing. Services was out of this world. Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable about everything on the menu. Waters were always full, bread dish was always full and she did a great job keeping the flow of each meal course. HAPPY HOUR 1/2 off all steaks. Had the ribeye OMG is was one of the best stakes I've had in a long time. Truffle Mac n cheese with this cut bacon is also a must!! Don't be scared going off the strip to visit this place. You won't be disappointed.

First off let me say, I absolutely loved the food! I Had a NY Steak with chimichurri and Mack & cheese side. I went there on a Saturday night around 6:30. We were a party of 5 and had reservations, but we didn't get a table till around 7pm. Service was nothing special than any other restaurant. The place was packed and still had a long line waiting to sit down. Food took a very long time, close to 45+ mins.

Couple of complaints, first being the parking lot: very limited and very hard to find a place during happy hour especially (5pm-8pm). I had to park at the gas station next door. The second thing that really bugged me was the automatic gratuity that's calculated at the full price of the meals. We had to pay a $50 tip on a $150 bill so the total came out to $200. That's about a 34% gratuity. A suggested tip is fine but I'm not a fan of mandatory gratuity payment especially if and when the service is bad.

The interior looks old school with dimmed lights and have a nice atmosphere, and again the food was amazing!
This place is amazing .. Great drinks .. Awesome steaks!!! The atmosphere is perfect and Happy Hour pricing is off the charts!! This is a must visit when your in Vegas, were locals & go once a week!
Worth the wait! Such a cool hole in the wall. The steak was phenomenal!! Sit at the bar if you have th chance!

I'm not a Las Vegas local, but I am a cocktail loving New Yorker. This place is misleading from its shabby exterior which changes immediately as you walk into the stream of classic hip hop. 

The strip's commercial aspect is too much for me after a while, so this place's vibes kept me calm when popping in. 

Known for serving all classic cocktails from the US, the Vieux Carré from New Orleans is a bar favorite. Try it out! If you don't like it, the friendly bartenders are more than happy to make you whatever you'd like.  Joe was especially kind to us, along with the rest of the staff. 

Bar food is open late for the local working crowd, serving Italian foods.

Old school fun meets new school drinking. The cocktails were on point. The service was fast and friendly. The rye Manhattan was strong and well mixed. 

This place looks like a fancy speakeasy. The music isn't too loud. You can talk. 

Lots of fedoras. Everywhere.

Unfortunately I heard how great this place was, but never got to experience it. There was a buyout at the time. I probably would have waited, but the hostess was such a BI@TCH I wouldn't stay. I will also never be back.

Came here during happy hour on a Tuesday night with my girlfriend after months of hoping to try it out on many suggestions. Sat at the bar due to a full reservation list for the night. Out bartender Giseppie, a former New Yorker, was great. Suggested us cocktails and made us unique drinks based on our likes and recommendations. The food was delicious. Caprese, mussels, ribeye, NY strip, and warm cookie desert, were all good. Fantastic first experience. Was still pricey, even with half off steaks, but 100% worth it.
Great job tonight Eddie.  Cocktails were on point and service was great. People like you are the reason we will keep coming back. Thank you.
Joe "hot chocolate" is the best bartender I've ever had. He is considerate, helpful, and fun! I already loved this place before but I would love to see him next time I come in.

I've read multiple write ups on this restaurant and decided to check it out. I STRONGLY suggest reservations as the place as it is always packed. 

Called a week in advance to make a reservation and it was some how lost. The hostess did some magic and with a small wait at the bar was able to get us seated. 

I cannot rave enough about the cocktails. We tried 4 different drinks and fell madly in love with them all. 

The steak is mouth watering and came out perfectly cooked. Ronnie was an attentive waiter and offered great service. 

We will definitely be back again and again.

This is by far one of the best kept secrets in Las Vegas.  You barely notice it driving down W. Sahara Ave but do yourself a favor and go have dinner here!! The ribeye steak I had with a side of truffle Mac n cheese was out of this world. Steak was cooked just how I ordered it. Go during happy hour and get 50%off of the steaks!

Gothic/vamp inspired theme. I had the filet mignion with garlic mashed potatoes and a few cocktails. My hot date had the ribeye steak with the mushrooms which were uhmazing! And I don't even like mushrooms. Lulz. As far as the cocktails go I had the diabla which was a tequila cocktail and a jack rose which was whiskey based. Both were very strong and tasty but I preferred the Jack rose. Enjoy! it was a great steak place!

Who doesn't love happy hour?

Its no secret, Herbs & Rye is a popular spot for steak lovers. Offering nice cuts of quality meat at half the price. Their happy hour menu is not limited to steaks but also sides and by the glass wines. Being a popular spot, if you go with a big group expect a wait. Midnight hits and this place is packed. Who would of thought so many carnivores craved meats this late. I ordered my favorite cut, Ribeye medium rare closer to rare. I like it juicer than most. It was cooked a little more medium but still very tasty. I also ordered two sides: asparagus and their truffle mashed potatoes. The asparagus were perfect, steamed with still a bite to it. The truffle oil mash was a little too buttery for my taste. It was very wet and mushy. Overall, this place is great for late night eats. For a fine dining establishment. I really hope their food is better during normal hours.

You would not know how fantastic this place is by looking at the outside. The bar and drinks are phenomenal! The setup reminds me of a speakeasy! The ambience is classy yet casual.  We didn't have a reservation but it only took us 15 minutes to get a table. Cozy great date night place. Happy hour is 5pm-8pm and also midnight-3am. Steaks and most cocktails are 1/2 price.  Warm crusty Italian bread with butter served while you wait. I had the Ribeye with whiskey potatoes and the hubby had the filet with garlic mash. Both excellent dishes s cooked to perfection. This place is a hidden gem!

12/14/2011 update.
Just went in for happy hour, aiming to get the carpaccio and a flatbread. Last time I was in, these were awesome happy hour snacks, and priced as such. Both $5. (Flatbread in the interim had climbed to $10). Things are a changing at H&R. Now, they're each non-happy-hour-priced at around $13/ea, and the only happy hour appys are the mussels and the clam linguine. So much for the good ol' days. Not so happy hour. Sneakin' those prices up. Definitely not worth a $30 hit. I left when I discovered this new situation. Pffft.

Being in the industry I've heard about herbs and rye pretty often. My husband and I decided to try it out after work today and I am so bummed out we wasted money. I'm sure the bartenders are really knowledgable the menu is very impressive. But the service over at the tables was just awful. My cocktail came out with lipstick all over the rim so right away everything felt dirty. The flatbread was so salty and then the server forgot to put in the rest of our order. :( I've never written a bad yelp before I feel bad but I'd never come back even when my coworkers come.

This is one of our favorite spots in Vegas, especially considering the quality of the food and the happy hour special (steaks are half-price!). Our last visit left a bit to be desired, however. The steaks are usually a perfect medium-rare as requested, but one came out medium while the other came out rare. Still very tasty, though. Service was a bit off, also, as we had to ask for bread when the entrees were delivered, and the server's response was, "Oh, you'd like more?" when we hadn't had any to begin with! We hope it was just an off-night, so I'm knocking a couple stars off until our next visit.

Delectable ribeye and their sweet potato tater tots topped with marshmallows was worth writing back home to mom about! Get the zombie drink and be sure to have a DD on hand! And come during 6-8 or 12-2am for half off steaks and drinks!

LOVE Herbs & Rye! 

It literally looks like a hole in the wall from the outside but the inside is spacious and very warm and cozy. It's pretty dimly lit and has an old Vegas feel to it. What's special about Herbs & Rye:

- They have a wide selection of specialty cocktails to choose from
- The talented mixologists are also able to craft you a deliciously strong cocktail based on your preferences/likes 
- Half of steaks during Happy Hour!!!! (Mon - Sat, 5P - 8P and late night HH from 12A - Close) 
- Other food and drink specials during HH (definitely go for the steak though, what a deal!) 
- Excellent service - both mixologists and servers

I had a birthday dinner here last year with a few girlfriends and had a phenomenal experience. I ordered a ribeye and it was a little more charred than my liking however still enjoyable. The sides were nicely seasoned and the portions were great for sharing!  Our server even brought out a small birthday dessert at the end our meal. It's always a nice personal touch when restaurants help celebrate special occasions. 

I haven't been back in forever but I definitely will have to soon!

Place is perfect every time, at the bar or at a table. Food is great for what you're paying, especially when the steaks are happy hour. Drinks are always on point, and so is the service. I come here at least twice a month. One of my favorite spots.
Last time I went there it had all my favorite foods well done I want to come here every Holliday

If you find yourself near the corner of Sahara and Valley View be sure to give this gem a try. Old school handcrafted cocktails with proper spirits and natural ingredients will lighten your mood and the food will nourish your soul. During happy hour all steaks are half price (which makes them reasonable). The 24oz porter house will melt in your mouth ($30 during happy hour). I also highly recommend adding the bacon and blue cheese crust for another $6.50. How do you make meat better? Duh, add more meat! This isn't just bacon, it's 2 quarter inch thick slabs of amazing covered in melted blue cheese! For dessert how about a skillet of fresh baked chocolate chip cookies covered in ice cream? Yeah, I thought so. 4 cocktails, 2 entrees, a side and dessert came to $90. That's a bargain for how good everything was. Highly recommend this place!

Herbs & Rye is off the strip and worth every effort to get a reservation and go to.  

The Whisky/Bourbon list is possibly the best I'd ever/never seen.  I simply kept telling the bartender to bring me something I'd never had.  Belle Meade, Noah's Mill  & EH Taylor are three of the best I had never had.  With such a great bar - we didn't mind the wait for the table.

The food is simply amazing.  The sides are unique and add to a perfect steak.  Not just plain old mashed potatos or green beans as sides - you could make a meal out of their quality sides that go with their perfect steak.

Go here- drink - eat and you're welcome.  I may go one night just to sit at the bar next time I'm in town.

It's a unique dining experience. The craft cocktails are amazing. I really enjoyed my filet. Also, their pastas are to die for. It's a great place to bring your spouse and have a great dinner. It's not cheap but well worth it. I love this place. Take an uber cause parking can be tight.

They said this was the best happy hour in Vegas... I get it. 

We got away with an 18oz Ribeye, Truffle Mac & Cheese, Garlic Mashed Potatoes, a fancy drink AND a nice tip for less than $80. It felt like highway robbery.

They wrote on the menu descriptions of types of meat cooks, and enlisted the following, "Well done - Burnt and pointless" they won my heart with this. The medium rare we got was 'Slap My Mother Good!' Seriously. 

Our server kind of gave me this elitist response when asking for steak sauce as if it's blasphemy to ask for it on the side for the option. I understand the people under the mentality that "the steak is so good you don't need sauce" because I've heard that a thousand times. But if you are a baker that bakes the best cupcakes in the world, who are you to scoff at me for asking for frosting and a couple sprinkles, you know? It's a preference and you didn't cook the steak yourself, chief... take a breath.

His food runner on the other hand: awesome. He delivered the sauce and even playfully joked about it having cravings himself. He was very pleasant to both of us. 

** There is a $7 surcharge if you decide to share a steak with another person (which I recommend anyway if you'd like to prevent premature prostate problems). Just be advised.
Server named Deborah was awful. Ruined our meal with her poor service. Food was decent, drinks were pretty good. But will not return.

Went for my favorite steak last night at Herbs and Rye for a get together with friends and a belated birthday for my wife. I have been to Herbs many times in the past 2 years since I moved to Vegas, brought friends and relatives here for the drinks and food. Well let me tell you this was the last time. 

We had a party of 12 and upon arrival we made it clear we wanted separate checks or 3 checks of 4 and wee told by the 'manager' on duty it wouldn't be a problem. SO the drinks came, and we ordered and as usual, the food was excellent and the drinks were great. We arrived just before 7pm to be sure we would get served for Happy Hour. Service was very slow for just about everything. We did not get our food until after 8pm and at 8:08 I ordered a beer and was told Happy Hour was over and it would be full price (this was after ordering 2 bottles of 40 dollar wine, multiple 11 dollar cocktails and beers). So when they say Happy Hour ends at 8, they mean it. 

About 9ish we had finished our meal and were waiting for the waitress to come around for about 15 minutes with the 'birthday donuts' and they finally did. Then we waited for the check....and waited.....and waited...spoke to the manager about the service we were receiving. SO we waited some more. Finally about 9:45 we got our check....ALL ON ONE BILL....when we told we were granted permission to get separate checks the waitress said she couldn't do it. We insisted she did so she took the check back and went out back....and we waited...and waited...NO DRINKS, NO SERVICE, NO QUESTIONS BEING ANSWERED. Finally at 10:20 I asked to speak to the 'manager.' He came out and gave a speech about how hard it was to divide the check up. I told him to ask the waitress to come out so we could help her with the check. The manager was of no help. Now we have been there for over 3 hours, nothing comped, nothing answered, and she comes out with the split checks and they are ALL WRONG. 

Needless to say it was very frustrating. We ended up staying about 20 minutes longer to get the check straightened out and finally left. 

I'm now looking for the next best steak because I won't step foot back in that place after the way the manager acted.

A lot of buzz about this joint since they opened.... All good... So checked it out with my brother from chicago the other night... Meh! Im a 45 year old native that used to frequent the venetian that was replaced by new said place & felt the old ambience that was here many moons ago...dark and retro old sxool vibe i dig. I guess im getting old tho & couldnt read the tiny print on the specialty drink menu so couldnt imbide in their cocktails. Great happy hr deals on steaks 5-8 but was shocked by the website menu price difference to actually being there ( u guys need to update ur web menu!!!)  Anyway our server was freakin knowledgable. And superb! Like i said tho food was...meh... Started with steamers and caesar which were good. I gots the porterhouse & my bro got the fillet... Cooked perfectly but no differently than going to the butcher block by my house & throwing it on the grill for 1/4 the price. Sides were asparagus.... Good but salty... Truffle mac n cheese.... Decent but oily... Then the worst garlic mashed potatoes ever! Obviously out the box & a piece of roasted garlic on top of em to make em garlic mashed.... Whaaaatttt? Decent place but doesnt match the reviews... Careful of false yelpers... Been in the industry along time & probably wont be back.... Not horrible but like i said..... Meh!

Were you around during Prohibition and do you miss the drinks of that era? The answer is most likely no, since you'd have to be in your eighties or nineties to remember it and I don't think anyone that age reads my blog. If you never had the chance to experience the drinks popular during prohibition and would like to, however, I suggest you go to Herbs and Rye. Not for the food (definitely not for the food), but for the drinks, which are terrific. In fact, you're not limited to drinks that were popular during Prohibition, but can enjoy the whole American history of drinking from the "Gothic Age of American Drinking" (1775-1865) to it's "Revival" (1990-present). No matter what you choose I'm sure you'll be happy. I've tried three, the Frisco from the Gothic Age (I don't even like whiskey), the Scofflaw from Prohibition (I don't like bitters), and the Diablo from the Reform years (gotta love tequila). Each has been exceptional, but I don't review cocktails, I review food.

My husband and I have now been to Herbs and Rye three times. We were disappointed the first time, somewhat less disappointed the second. In fact, we walked out after drinks and calamari the first time when we were with my parents because it took forever to not get our food. You might be asking yourself, "Why would you go back a second time, let alone a third time ?" Well, there are several reasons.

1) We had been anticipating the opening of a new restaurant ever since they closed and we saw a new sign go up (though, that's really just a reason to try it a first time, I suppose).
2) Every new restaurant deserves a chance to work out the kinks.
3) It's close to home.
4) We hadn't yet had a chance to try their 50% off happy hour, and 50% off food is great way to get you back in the door. (5-7PM and late night, M-F)

The meal always starts out fine. The drinks, as I mentioned, are spot on, and the bread is good, made all the better by sweet honey butter. The servers are pleasant, but then you order, and you wait...and wait. I understand the time it takes to make the cocktails (browns stirred, whites shaken) but there is no excuse for the food taking so long when there are a maximum of two other tables. The calamari ($7.50 with happy hour, pictured above) this time was much better than the first, so I was glad to see the improvement. The idea was good (peperoncini, crispy pancetta, and aoli drizzle) but somehow it ended up as a fairly uninteresting salty mass. Perhaps I am being too harsh. It wasn't so bad, and the portion was large, if you like that kind of thing. I suppose the most disappointing aspect was that it was a vast improvement. A long while after it left our table we got our Vitello a la Fiorentina, a veal T-bone ($18 with happy hour), which wasn't a T-bone at all. Our waiter admitted he had forgotten to tell us that the chef had changed it to a chop, which would have been fine if it was good, but it wasn't. Although it was cooked well, I don't think we were able to get more than six decent bites out of it that weren't ultra-fatty between the two of us. The mashed potatoes underneath weren't hot and didn't have enough butter, and the asparagus was completely void of seasoning. Forget about the "caramelized lemon" and white bean ragout, if you can even call it that. If we'd been paying the full price of $36 I definitely would have complained. What am I saying? I complained anyway. The chef took it off the bill, almost making me feel bad for being so negative in this review. Alas, a critic's job isn't always an easy one.

The chef truly isn't the only one to blame for the imminent demise of this restaurant, however, the decorator is. The dining room is supposed to make you feel like you are in old Vegas, but falls short in every way. The red felt wallpaper, fake leather booths, tiny chandeliers, cheap silverware and fake bookcases all add to the depressing ambiance. The worst, above all, is the music. It is more outdated than the drinks and is truly nauseating. I mean, I'm sure "Suwannee River" had it's day but it's 2010 now. Ian put it well. "I think I'm going to slit my throat with this butter knife if I have to listen to this anymore." "Wait!," I said, "Let me finish that honey butter first."

Overall, I'm not sure the 50% off menu even makes it worth coming here. I would truly like to see this restaurant continue to make improvements because they have a really great thing going with the bar. It would have been smarter of them to open up a much smaller place that focused on great drinks and served a few exceptional tapas, rather than investing $1.6 million in this huge, boring place (the young new owner unfortunately invested everything he had). My suggestion is to stay in the bar and order the drinks. Order lots of drinks, that way the music probably won't bother you as much. Who knows, you may even start singing along.

Brilliant!!  From the ambiance, to the cocktails, to the food but especially the service!! Charlie was phenomenal and super knowledgeable.  He was able to explain the menu to us inside and out in vivid detail.  He suggested to do the linguine and clams in a marinara sauce which had us suspicious at first, but given his previous spot on recommendations we decided to take the chance.  It was superb!  Must go while in Vegas!!

Come for Happy Hour (5-8pm)!  You have to sit at the bar or one of the tables in the bar, but you get their steaks for half-price. I got a NY strip with asparagus for $21 (normal $42).  The tomato bisque was excellent as was the glass of house wine. Considering the Outback on the Strip charges $39 for a steak - this is a deal. It is about 3 mi from the Cosmopolitan (where I stayed) but it was worth the Uber ride.

Off the beaten path but well worth the trip. When you walk into this place you immediately feel like you're taken back in time.  The wait staff is top notch. I can't stress point enough. From the moment the manager greets you to when you pay the bill and walk out they are there when you need them and out of sight when you don't.    

Dinner consisted of the following: 

Drinks - 2 Moscow Mules, 1 glass of red to accompaniment my Ribeye.

Starters - Clams and tuna tartare 

Dinner - Ribeye with truffle mac and cheese.

This is probably one of my greatest finds on Yelp. Half off steak during happy hour??! How can it not be?

Here's the run down :
+ Happy hour from 5-8PM and then midnight to close (3AM). 
+ During happy hour, you get half off steaks and a few other options. Each steak order (unless otherwise noted) comes with one side. I usually go for the mushrooms and creamed corn.
+ If you split/share.. there's an additional charge. Note : Don't bring people who aren't eating their own meal. 
+ free bread is good
+ Don't be scared by the grungy exterior look. This place is worth it.

They really do close right at 3AM, so better to come earlier rather than later!

A damn near perfect dining experience. Mark was as on point as possible if you are reading this review request him as your server. Order the pork and figs. Amazing. We enjoyed the Mediterranean flatbread. DANK! We loved the French 75 aka a hooker cocktail. The pimms cup and the corpse reviver #2. Skip all the bs on the strip and dine where frank would.

Moving away from the strip on a Saturday night is a feat only locals can do... so luckily for me, a very good friend of mine,  a local, did take me away to this very special place. 

And, as with all the foodie places he takes me to whenever I'm in town, this place did not disappoint. I'm so happy to be friends with a foodie. Yay!

Their drinks are solid. Well... except for this aviator thing. I think it's more of a preference and I prefer not to drink perfume... but let's forget about that and get to the good parts because that's what I'm all about.

Good friends will switch drinks with you and that's exactly what my friend did! haha, thanks friend! I wish I remembered what the damn drink was called because I really want that thing again. It was some ginger beer concoction... it took me back to my days working in SF where I would order a dark and stormy. Damn... I miss living in the Bay.

First time here and really loved it. Happy hour lasts until 8:00 and thoroughly enjoyed a perfectly cooked new York steak for half price! It even includes one side. The decor is very stylish with brick walls and a beautiful bar area. Staff very friendly too.

Last week, found out this is one of the kids' favorite restaurants... mainly for the bargains during Happy Hour...

On the menu...

House Beer (***) The waiter initially described their Beer... "Red, like Killian's". Reponded... "Killian's Irish Red???". "Oops! Excuse me! It's only Red... doesn't taste like Killian's."

Yes, the House Beer is Red... He was right... no way did it taste like Killian's.

Littleneck Clams Appetizer (*** 1/2 $11.00 Happy Hour Reg-$22) Parmigiano, Lemon, Broth. 

Smallish Clams in a... watery Broth. Frankly, could have used more Butter... a lot more. Had better last year... somewhere else in Vegas...

Bread & Butter (**) I'm a Dipper, an expert Dipper from way back... Love to Dip Bread & Butter in Broth from the Clams Appetizer and from my daughter's Linguine & Clams entree. At first EVERYONE received their own individual six-inch mini-loaf of hard, over-baked Bread. Asked for refills... only two were brought out. Asked for refills again for just me, which the waiter didn't know... only received one loaf. I'll bet if I asked again... we would have been ignored...

Kansas City Strip Steak (** 1/2 $14.50 Happy Hour Reg-$29) Chose this Steak over the Filet... mainly because of the price and size, which was 12oz... the Filet was $34, but was only 8oz. Chose the Jalapeno Cream Corn as a side. Wanted to take it easy on the kids' wallet...

When the entree came out... The Strip Steak was on a separate plate, which surprised me... and the Side of Jalapeno Cream Corn (which was Not Creamed!) was in it's own deep-oval dish almost as long as the plate itself.

Steak, itself, was the thin, smallish Steaks you'd buy for yourself at the local Super-Market... the one's that are gristly, and that you'd always over-cook... never can get right because it's so thin. Hate to say this... the best part of the meal... the watery Jalapeno (Creamed) Corn.

Also received donations of....

   Filet Mignon (**** 1/2) Word to Yelpers.... the ONLY Steak worth it's 
      price regardless whether it's Happy Hour or not is the Filet Mignon at 
      $34. $17, during Happy Hour, is an absolute bargain!

   Linguine & Clams (*** 1/2) Used the same Broth as the Clam Appetizer.
      Same conclusion... more BUTTER, PLEASE!

   side of Truffle Mac & Cheese (***) Tasted OK... if you ignore the 
      over-cooked Macaroni!

   Looks like I ordered the wrong things... all the way around!

Bee's Knees (* 1/2) Hand-Crafted Cocktails? They might be Hand-Crafted... but not by a qualified Barttender! NOT!

When the drink, which consisted of Gin, Honey & Lemon came out, there was the thin film of dark Honey on top over the light-colored Gin & Lemon Juice which indicated inadequate mixing of the beverage - minimum 30 seconds of continuous shaking, stirring, mixing... whatever. Very amateurish attempt. Sorry, fellow Yelpers, whomever mixed this drink will have to go back to Bar-tending school...


If you want to "do" Vegas on the Cheap, I guess this place is as good as any versus the super-duper-expensive Strip. But, you'd compromise first of all with the character of the establishment.... first impression... Old-School, Dank Red-Velvet Wallpaper, and Dark, mood lighting. And then when you're seated, you're handed a hefty, black, faux-leather bound Menu... that should have been re-bound years ago. 

About twice as many people at the Bar than people having a sit-down meal.

Maybe it was just a bad night, or maybe because it was a party of 10, but this was not a good night for us at Herbs & Rye.
We came during their happy hour and thank goodness, because the bill would have been almost double, and I am sorry, but the prices they are charging for the quality of food just doesn't match up!
I don't mind paying good money for good food, but this was not good. I guess their specialty here is their drinks. So maybe we missed out on the whole "experience", we drank wine with dinner, which no complaints about the wine. The problem really was the food. It just wasn't good.
The ribeye was cooked properly as far as the medium rare order was placed but there was no flavor, and the texture was bad.  One of the worst steaks I have tasted. As bad as the steak was it was better than the pasta. The penne pasta had a truffle cream sauce and it was really inedible. The cream sauce tasted so bad, it was really not cooked properly at all. The cream was too heavy and was separated. My son had the linguine and clams, he ate all of his dinner without any complaints or issues, my daughter had the angel hair pasta with chicken, and she also did not complain about her dish.
I had seen so many good reviews for this place, and I was really looking forward to going. I knew I wanted the ribeye because of all the good reviews. I don't know what happened on the night we went and I doubt I will go back. At least for the food that is, maybe just go for drinks?

Good cocktails, good food, good service. My husband got a very, very respectable Old Fashioned. We drink these every night... no, seriously, EVERY night, which means that we've had Old Fashioned at cocktail bars all over the country. We're a tough crowd and we'd probably rank this a 7.5. Good, good stuff. I had an excellent cocktail but, of course, forgot the name. We got the bisteca flatbread and some fries to share. Fries: Good. Flatbread: Very good. 
Service was friendly, prompt, and helpful. We are at the bar and the bartenders took good care of us, even throwing a couple of drinks our way when the entire bar was toasting a birthday girl, and we were the odd men out. How cool! 
We did have some trouble with the bill, which took a couple iterations to get right, but they were very sweet, apologetic, and accommodating. Nobody's perfect and, quite frankly, I dealt with something similar at another establishment earlier that day, which was not dealt with with nearly the same humility and helpfulness--so I was happy and charmed. 
In all, we really had a great night. The best part, really, was the warmth of the whole staff. My husband's family lives on the same side of town, and we are frequently looking for a late-night joint to escape to after his folks go to bed. This place definitely tops the list. We can't wait to come back.  The cocktail list looks like a blast and I'm looking forward to many joyful samplings.

I like this place.  I have been here one time previously for drinks...actual hand-crafted cocktails, and they were great.  Came back tonight for dinner. 

Of course we still ordered cocktails. I had the Ward Eight which was a great balance between tart and sweet with a tad more tart. 
We started with the calamari appetizer. It included peppers, and had a very light breeding with a house aioli and crispy prosciutto on top. 

For my main course, I ordered the rib-eye.  Of course the cut was way too big (18oz), but I can't help myself...rib-eyes are my favorite! I ordered it medium, and it was slightly overcooked.  Still good though. 
Then I got the jalapeño creamed corn and it was delicious. Although, I would have loved more if they used fresh corn instead of frozen. 

Lastly, when I was about to bust, and 75% of the appetizer, 50% of the steak, and 50% of the side were all in togos, they brought out the complimentary doughnuts. I am not a big sweets eater, but I couldn't resist and popped two of the tiny holes in my mouth.  They were very good, but if I even ate one more hole, I would pop.  My friend loved them, and the two dips and even took them home. 

It's a little pricey here, but I will be back...the next time during happy hour for half priced steaks!

I went here during their late happy hour, which is from midnight until 3AM (50% steaks and select items. Anything with 2 stars next to it). I had high hopes for this place based on 2 friends who have gone during happy hour for the steak and I was not let down at all from the moment the 'Littleneck Clams' hit my tongue. My date and I also ordered the 'Spicy Mussels' which were also delicious, since both of these seafood appetizers were on happy hour. I did not choose a drink from the amazing time period cocktail list. I was looking for a certain taste for my cocktail choice and the waiter suggested a fine cocktail not on the list and I absolutely loved it! We ordered two '14oz New York Steak Strips', one with 'Peruvian Chimichurri' and one with 'grilled onions'. If you ordered one steak to split, they will charge you $7. For our sides, we got 'Garlicky Spinach' and 'Truffle Mac & Cheese'. EVERYTHING was cooked perfect and every bite had me weak in the knees and melting on the table. We were so distracted by our food that we barely touched our drinks until we were done eating. We were so full that we didn't try their dessert. You don't have to sit at the bar to enjoy their happy hour menu. I like the dim lighting and the way the restaurant/bar is set-up. The service was great and quick. There were maybe 25-30 other guests there around midnight. We will definitely be back!

My coworkers and I made plans to visit Herbs and Rye after work to partake in their reverse happy hour. I was extremely excited and pleased upon entering. The decor is downright cool. The bar looks like a lab conducting experiments! My coworkers were at the bar waiting for them to get our table ready. Once it was ready we took our seats. We weren't given any menus so we just sat there a while. As soon as our server finally came over to fill waters we asked for menus. A majority of the 10 people at our table ordered off of their hand crafted cocktail list. It seemed to take FOREVER for our drinks and our server didn't use the time to take appetizer or dinner orders to help....now our entire table was full of servers from a steakhouse so we remained calm and understood what was up. I was 5th to order and I went with a medium rare ribeye and my side was the Mac n cheese. We ordered the calamari and little neck clams for our apps. And we all ordered different sides to have variety to share. So the clams came out and they were AMAZING! I could dip bread in that sauce for the rest of my life!! After a while our food starts coming out....calamari showed with dinner. So they brought out the first 4 people's food first then the next tray had the other 5 people's food.....where's my food? Everyone was eating and our server never came back to check on us so I couldn't tell her anything!!! I didn't want to make a scene but finally 15 minutes later she comes with my food. No I know this is a small restaurant so maybe they didn't have enough room to cook my steak. But I had ordered in the middle and she never came to let us know it's on its way or anything. And worse off 5/8 steaks ordered were over done. Our sides were AMAZING and the calamari was different and GREAT. But our steaks were sad :( and my Mac was gritty and didn't taste very good, no one at it....so we had asked about dessert before we had ordered food and because of the pics on here I knew I wanted those doughnuts!!!!!! So we ordered 2 doughnuts and 2 cookie things. She came back and said no doughnuts whaatataaaaaat you just told us there were doughnuts!!!! So we get our cookies and they are obviously burned. To the point if I had been serving it I wouldn't have let it touch the table. 

Will I return? Probably! For doughnuts and for clams and brussel sprouts. Not for steaks or to sit at a table. We'll stick to the bar.

Made reservations for my boyfriend's birthday last night for 10pm. We arrived early and they were able to seat us sooner, which was great. 

The atmosphere was really cool inside. It's dark and they play really loud music. We were seated and it took at least 10-15 minutes before someone came to greet us and get our drink order. But by then, we were already ready to order our food (which took extremely long to come out) 

I ordered the linguine and clams, it was very good. They're very generous with the amount of clams they give. My boyfriend had the surf n turf, which was AMAZING. We shared a calamari appetizer, that was soso. Not what I was expecting. 

Reason I give 3 stars is because our service wasn't that great. I couldn't even make myself leave 20% because it was that terrible. I can't remember our waiter's name, but he hardly came around to check on us and I felt that we were in the restaurant longer than we needed to be. Don't get me wrong, he was nice, but we were in there at 9:30pm and didn't leave til almost 11:30pm.

I would come back for the food, but for the amount of money that we're spending on food; I'd expect the service to be a lot better.

Drinks I had:

Brown Derby
Gin & Soda
Last word
missionary's downfall


Drinks were amazing! Customer service out of this world! They really know what they're doing at this place. Super knowledgeable about drinks, liquor history...if that's a thing lol and the food is AMAZING!! You have to check this place out. On the outside you wouldn't think this place has a whole lot to offer but honestly, I was very impressed with this place by far. Definitely at the top of my lists of places to visit in Las Vegas. Plus, its not touristy at all. It has a real local feel.

My review is late.  Better late then never, right?.   I had a group of 4.   We all sat at the bar and everything was AMAZING.  It was actually so good, that I can't even find it in me to bitch about the 4 dollar horse radish.   The bartender Emily, made the night.  She really has taken her job to a whole new level, she doesn't just make drinks, she's an entertainer.   If you find the time, this placed is a must.

Wow, I loved this place. Locals bar. I used to be a Vegas local, but now I guess I am a carpet-bagger and visit occasionally. The bartenders serve up good times. They know their drinks inside and out. They told me it used to be a Italian restaurant in the past.

Pretty hip joint I must say.  I thought that this place was just a bar that served bar food.  I was delightfully surprised.  

We took full advantage of their late night Happy Hour.  Drinks and food (that of which is listed with a star)!  Carpaccio, yum, shrimp cocktail, yum, calamari, yum.  Haha, get the pattern?  Drinks, wow, very colorful and detailed cocktails that I'm coming back to try more.  

Oh, the mac and cheese bacon was not what I was expecting.  It was good, but not as good as everyone made it to be.  Its seriously mac and cheese with cut up pieces of bacon and then they slap on a bacon slice as a topping.  I've changed my mac and cheese expectations for all the various mac and cheese I've tried around town :P

Great place to get away from the Las Vegas strip life.  They have a video DJ that plays some 80-90's goodies that had me bobbin' my head.  BTW, DJ in a restaurant means seriously loud music.  So not a place to have intimate conversations, you'll be yelling the whole time! 

Love it, We shall be back

A way overdue review for this dark but unique lively bar n grill. Want to enjoy a fabulous steak dinner at half price during happy hour?? Herbs n Rye is the place.  Known for it's unique mixed drinks, the food can't be beat. May I suggest the creamy truffle mac n cheese and to polish off your steak dinner, have the warm melt in your mouth, freshly made sugar donuts with the yummy caramel and the delectable vanilla dipping sauce!! Oh my, my!!! :D 

On a side note: Parking can be a challenge during peak hours, due to small lot. Minus one star...

I really enjoyed this place.  The decor was amazing!  Reminded me of an old school vegas type of spot where you might find some gangsters having dinner and drinks in the back corner. Even though the place was packed I was able to snag two seats at the bar pretty quickly. The drinks were great.  I had a Moscow Mule and some other specialty drink that I don't quite remember the name of.  For dinner we had salads which were both delicious. The bread was really good too. Happy hour specials were good but the food is a little on the high end so prepare to spend about $30 on a steak even if it's half off during happy hour.  The portion sizes are large but I'd like to see some smaller portions at more reasonable prices. The staff was entertaining and accomodating. The only reason i gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the entree costs. If you're looking for a dark,  loud,  trendy spot with lots of action this is it.  If you want something quaint and quiet go elsewhere.
Great service. Amazing food. Cocktails on point. We had the Filet. Great food. We will definitely return.

We came here on a date night and am pretty glad we did! The inside is VERY dim and the candles in the middle of the table add a romantic vibe to the place. I know some people come here for their drinks, but my bf and I aren't big drinkers and we appreciate the preparation and the creativity behind food more so than drinks. It's been a while and I can't really remember what anything was called so bare with me. (I will provide pictures!)

My boyfriend got a HUGE steak with a chimichurri sauce drizzled on the top and it was one of the best steaks I've ever had. It was the perfect medium rare and the chimichurri was tangy, garlic-y, and yummmmyyy. 

I had the pork chops that had some sort of fig reduction and a blue cheese crust with a sprig of rosemary and mashed potatoes. This dish was a huge explosion of flavor! Although I was hesitant to get the pork chops (almost every restaurant I have ever been to has overcooked them) these pork chops were moist and cooked perfectly! My mouth is literally watering just thinking of them.............

We shared an order of truffle Mac N' Cheese and although it was pretty effing good, it was a little too truffle-y?

Then for dessert, we opted for their freshly baked donuts that come with a white chocolate and caramel sauce. These are SO good that on a different night after, we ordered them to go. JUST THE DONUTS. I called in and was a little embarrassed just calling in for donuts to go but the lady on the other line just giggled and said they get that all the time, so I felt better :D They're THAT good, people!

The whole experience was pretty awesome. The service was great. Our waiter was very knowledgable of both the drink and food menus. He came by a few times to check in on us and even recommended the steak that my bf eventually got. I like the romantic ambience, the only thing I don't like about it is where it's located. The *little* parking is in the front of the restaurant but on a busy night, i can see people having to park in the adjacent parking lots. Not a big deal. Wouldn't keep us away.

I'm on a low carb high fat diet and the bartenders knew what to give me from every level!!! Wow! The apps to the dinner to the craft cocktail!!! Seeing staff interpret a diet and completely meet it is impressive!! Thank you to Eddie, Johny and Isiah (spelling?) on that late night Tuesday shift! We will be back!
Oh my goodness best steaks in Las Vegas! So delicious! I also loved the lobster. Great side dishes plus save room for the donuts! They're absolutely divine!

My wife and I were in Vegas to celebrate our anniversary.  Since eating at restaurants on The Strip can be so pricey we decided to see if we could find a place off the Strip.  We asked a waiter at another restaurant if he could recommend a location and he suggested Herbs & Rye as a possibility.  He suggested another restaurant as well but that location was closed on Wednesday and Thursday nights so we booked a reservation for 6:30 PM at Herbs & Rye.

Parking - Parking is a real challenge at Herbs & Rye since they have a small parking lot.  We did find parking behind the restaurant in an ally where we saw several other cars parked.  We parked our car there and went into the restaurant.  We asked the hostess if the ally was a safe and good location to park and she said they have grown so much that people do park in the ally.  We had no issues with parking in the ally but it was a bit odd.

Drinks - We were seated almost immediately since we had reservations and we had arrived at the restaurant a few minutes before our time.  We were warmly greeted and water was brought to our table immediately.  I ordered one of their suggested drinks and the waitress made a suggestion for my wife's drink since she tends to be a bit selective.  She ordered the Walking by the Waldorf and I had The Diablo.  Both drinks were outstanding and my wife was pleased with the suggested beverage.

Dinner - We were shown the menu and most items are half priced during their Happy Hour which lasts until 8:00 PM.  My wife ordered 9 ounce Filet Mignon and I ordered the 12 ounce New York Strip Steak.  We both ordered the Garlic Mashed potatoes as our 1 selected option.  Both steaks were prepared perfectly and the Garlic Mashed potatoes were silky smooth.  Everything was seasoned to perfection and served hot.

Dessert - We ordered the Chocolate Chip cookie dessert that is served with ice cream.  The cookie or cookies are prepared when you order to make certain they are warm and served on a platter with ice cream.  This dessert was the perfect ending to our dinner.

Service - We had an outstanding waitress who made us feel so welcomed.  The entire staff at Herbs & Rye were warm and gracious to us the entire time we were at the restaurant.  I like to talk and was able to have delightful conversations with everyone who served us.

All in all, an outstanding experience that I highly recommend for anyone who is visiting Vegas.  Get off the Strip and eat at this wonderful location!

Yes yes yes. Happy hour from 5to8. Sexy vibe. Half off steaks and the atmosphere is old skool mobster sexy dangerous. You cant go wrong. The contrast from parking lot through door is enough to spin yah right round baby and get you in the mood for an amazing vintage cocktail and some flirty conversation. Always a sassy time. Dress like you may be making a new friend... cuz you just might

Ahh yes. Herbs and Rye. What a fabulous establishment. I've only been a couple of times, but I've quickly become a fan. They not only have excellent classic cocktails, they also have excellent food. This is far from your typical local bar.
