Let me start with their cocktails. Their classic cocktail menu is unrivaled. I love poring through the pages in search of my next beverage. It's just so detailed and well thought out. If knowledge is power, then the Herbs and Rye menu will make you a Cocktail superhero. Every drink has a little tidbit about its origin. It's also organized in chronological order. Want something from the Prohibition era? Herbs and Rye has got you covered. Perhaps something from the Gothic Age of American Drinking? Wait. What the heck does that even mean? Regardless, they have your back on that too!

On the other side of the coin, Herbs and Rye has some fantastic food offerings. Did someone say happy hour? A selection of their steaks are half off during HH. On my first visit, I went with the Kansas City Strip Steak with a side of Truffle Mac and Cheese (during HH, you only get one side instead of two). While the steak was flavorful, I admit that I was envious of my neighbor's Flat Iron. I'll definitely get that one instead next time. Outside of their steaks, I've also had the Clams from the appetizer section (also half off during HH). OMG those were incredible. It's basically a bowl of clams in a buttery sauce of awesomeness. On the side come two pieces of toasted baguette. Trust me when I say those are not enough. I ended up asking for more bread just so I could soak them in that buttery goodness. Yes, I know. Healthy as can be.

Will I return? Is it hot in Vegas in July? Does it flash flood when it rains? Is it dark in here?

The outside of this place does not give it any justice. From the outside the establishment looks like a cheap bar. However, the inside is totally different. The atmosphere is like a bar on the 60's like Sinatra times. The lighting is very dark, as a matter of fact too dark to even read the menu. Their drink menu is pretty cool, they have a large variety of unique drinks which illustrate a specific period of time. Some of the time representations were the Prohibition, Gothic , Golden age, etc.  Their speciality is their steaks. During happy hour (every day from 5-8) the steaks and the appetizers are 50% off. We ordered the Kansas City bone-in  which is a good choice if you like the grilled taste. I got the Filet Mignon which was juicy and very tender. The sides were very mediocre. They were something that I could probably do at home with no problem (and I'm not a good cook). We ordered the mac n cheese and the jalapeño corn, and they were equally disappointing. I saw a lot of small plates that look really good, perhaps I would come back and try them instead of the steak. Oh as an FYI, we read on the menu that you cannot share your steak if you buy it during happy hour! Even though we never planned on sharing, it annoys me when an establishment tells you what to do after you are paying for your food!

It was good service from the second we arrived and it was almost a full house. The portions were a little smaller but form happy hour specials they were bigger than most places. We both had the fillet and it was prepared excellently. The chocolate chip cookie desert is made fresh per order and worth the 10 min wait!
WOW!  The best porterhouse steak I have ever had in my life!!!  Be sure to go during happy hour as all steaks are half price!  Great atmosphere and the drinks are all hand poured and very good!

I have to give Herbs and Rye the full five stars. The atmosphere was great and lively, from the time we walked in. Everyone, from the hostess, the servers, especially Alycia, were awesome and wanted to make sure our evening was great. The food was delicious and since it was happy hour, many of the meals were discounted. We were celebrating my wife's 65th birthday and the staff made sure it was memorable. The evening topped off by some great specialty drinks and one of their signature desserts. Thank you again to the manager Michelle and our server Alycia for ensuring we had a great evening.

This place has a sketchy outside, is in a less than perfect neighborhood, and lacks parking.

But....

Dang it's probably one of the best steaks I've had in a long time. The cocktail menu was a lot of fun as well. Great for a date night!
Excellent happy hour special... Half off excellent quality steaks .. Very dark romantic type place. Mark was excellent as my bartender server...

GREAT CON!!!.....price your sub par over fatty steaks at gourmet room prices then sell them for 1/2 price every nite. $58 for a bad 16 Rib Eye. Make it half price, $29 and fill the place up. I guess we are all suckers for a deal, even if it's a bad deal.
How about $18 for calamari,not half off, it was like chewing bubble gum.
$12 for a glass of Bad Merlot, maybe a 6oz. pour. I'm not a send my food back type of person, but that's what This place deserves. I should of know when I saw the table next to me sending their steaks back.           
I don't mind paying for a quality cut of meat or a quality meal. We have plenty of great steak houses in Las Vegas. Trust me, this isn't one of them. The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because the waitress was excellent. Mad at myself for falling for the sucker deal!!

Came here for drinks for the first time.  My boyfriend ordered the calamari and it was delish! The banana peppers and sauce gave it a twist from the usual breaded calamari.  The drinks were stiff and different.  We will be back to try out the steak!

I had a lovely time at Herbs and Rye ! Our server Joe, from Massachusetts, was super helpful and hospitable from beginning to end. He even gave us a list of recommendations for strip clubs, where to get the best chicken fingers and of course other top notch restaurants.

A group of 9 celebrating a friend's bachelorette party in Vegas enjoyed every bit of our experience here. My cocktail of choice to start was the French 75 which was absolutely delightful! I have a thing for drinks with champagne. The clear favorite and most popular were the Ramos Gin Fizz that looked like a Pina colada from a far.

The apps included two sets of their spicy meatballs - these bad boys were very well seasoned and oversized, bruschetta caprese with mozzarella and an eggs and bacon flatbread pizza.

Family style seemed to be most appropriate to share and get a great sampling of what the menu had to offer.

We had the 60oz King Kong Rib-eye which comes with 3 sides along with a NY strip and the Filet Mignon. At first, I was like we are not going to finish this but we definitely handled it.

The 3 sides we choose to accompany the Rib eye were the truffle mac and cheese, spinach, and truffle fries. The sides were much smaller than I think most of us expected but there was enough to go around.

For dessert, we, of course, enjoyed their complimentary beignets as a celebratory treat for the bachelorette! And to top it off we each took a shot of Fernet!

Great experience and we definitely paid for it as it was not cheap! Well,  I guess when in a Vegas, you gotta live it up!!

A+ ammmmmazing steaks and drinks!! The service was incredible and the atmosphere was really cool. My only advice to the restaurant is to use 'reserved' plackards on the tables. We had a reservation for 5pm, the time they open. We got there and stood in line for the doors to open with alot of people. When we got to the front, there was a lady in front of us, who told the hostess she was just 'going to the bar'. The next hostess was walking us to our table and that lady tried sitting at our table. Seriously running in front of me and sat in the chair. Luckily the host explained to her that the tables were reserved and she left, but I nearly had to call her out on her trying to sneak past and save a table for friends. Anyways, karma will get her...but moving on, it was happy hours and many dishes/drinks were half off. Great deals. Everyone at our table ordered steaks or pork chops and everybody was raving about their dish! Loved that I did Not feel like I was in a casino and in a real swanky restaurant with delicious food and drinks with some cool jazzy/swing music. A++++ love it! If you go..make reservations early!

My boyfriend and I invent reasons to come here. The main reason is usually their cheesy broccoli, among other dishes they make. Also, Moscow Mules. Theirs are delightful. As a cutesy couple who likes to snuggle up in a booth, share all our food and drinks, and get just a little tipsy. This place is just perfect. The food is surprisingly good, several of the items on their menu have become things I CRAVE. It's great for dates, for girls night, when you've got a friend from out of town, whatever reason you can think of... Get here, you'll enjoy it and you can thank me later.

I have been meaning to try Herbs and Rye for the LONGES time.  I can't believe it's taken me over 2 years living in Vegas to get out to this amazing restaurant.  Before I even talk about how incredible the food and drinks were, let's talk about the ridiculously amazing happy hour!! 50% off steaks from 5-8pm??? WHAT?!  AMAZING. (PS If you get there at 7:50, like we did, they'll give you til a few min after 8pm to get the order in. So nice!)

Here's what we drank....basically everything.  I wish I remembered the specific drinks - every single thing we ordered was not only inventive, but very well balanced (which is the #1 thing I look for in a cocktail).  Their cocktail menu takes you on a delicious tour through the many eras of booze.

We ordered the beef tartare: it was excellent!  I'm super picky about beef tartare, and this one was delicious and had a great presentation as well.  We also ordered the filet and some asparagus.  Of which, we ate every last bite.  I will definitely be back - happy hour or otherwise.

In wanting to get off the Vegas Strip, I sent out a call for recommendations and received a great one for Herbs and Rye, located in a somewhat seedy part of Vegas on W.Sahara. Don't let the outside location deter you. The inside of Herbs and Rye had a great, dark vibe and was definitely not a Vegas Strip kinda place. I am quite certain its a local hang out. In fact, if I lived in Vegas- I would be a regular for sure. They specialize in craft cocktails, a favorite of mine and the reason why my buddy and I went. I had a Buck's Fizz (on the menu) which was a great refresher followed up by a Pimm's Cup (not on the menu) which was done well, although with Ginger Ale instead of Ginger Beer. My buddy had a Moscow Mule which was great and quite large drink which kept him occupied during our whole stay. The menu is divided into cocktail "eras" such as "pre-prohibition", etc. I thought that was a cool touch. A pleasant surprise was the food. Being a cocktail place they don't do drink happy hours, which I admire- however they do food happy hours...with several dishes offered at a discount. To take advantage I had the mussels in a spicy tomato sauce and my buddy had the fillet and mashed potatoes. Both were excellent and a great deal. So, in addition to recommending this place for a great pre-strip hopping cocktail, I would definitely get there for some grub prior to going back to the stock tourists hang outs.

I went there when it just opened for a month or two. I was there maybe around 6 pm. It's been a while ago. But I still clearly remembered how disappointed I was. It took around 20 minutes for the server to take my order. And it took ONE AND HALF HOUR to get my steak. At least if my steak is juicy and tender then I can tolerate. But... the steak is like a cheap steak from your local grocery store. So chewy, I can't even swallow it, no juice at all. My friend also order a steak, same thing chewy like a rubber... especially $35 for two steak, so so so disappointed... 

Maybe it was only me, on the bad day at the wrong chef. But that experience will never ever bring me back to Herbs and Rye.

I was here with my sister and her pharmacy school friends a couple nights ago and was overall quite pleased with my experience. We originally made a reservation for 10 but we must have miscounted because we actually had 12 people in our party. What should've been an easy fix (adding a couple chairs and place settings) took about fifteen minutes and my sister overheard the waiters whispering to each other about making us wait longer since we inconvenienced them. Very uncool. 

The first thing I noticed when I walked in was that it was very VERY dim. It took a while for my eyes to adjust, but I guess it added to the ambiance. The service was a little slow but the food was quite good. Since we had a party of more than 8, we were told to order appetizers and share them family style which would cost each of us $8. We agreed to it and were not disappointed. We got margherita flatbread, meatballs, calamari, and caprese salad. For my entree I ordered a flat iron and it was cooked perfectly and tasted great. I ordered truffle fries for my side and the portion was huge. So even though the steak was a little pricey, I feel like I pretty much paid for two. We made happy hour thanks to our waiter who disclosed to us that we should order our entrees quickly before it ended. This meant that all of the steak entrees were half off which is a pretty great deal. At the very end, our waiter brought out free desserts for us which brings them up to four stars despite the questionable service at the beginning.

My experiences in the past were riddled with substandard food and bad service, so I stayed away. A work assignment brought me back here and I'm glad it did because now I see why people love it.

I've decided that the only place to sit is the bar. That's where are the excitement is and the bartenders are amazing. Not just at what they do with the libations, but because they know what customer service means. They're knocking it out of the park. During my time there, they passed out shots a couple times to all the patrons just because it was Friday. It was an amazing energy.

Spicy Mussels ($26; H/H $13): This was recommended by our bartender and I was actually hesitant! You know what happened next - I am so incredibly glad we ordered it because it is truly fantastic! Seriously, WOW. The mussels are served in a tomato stew made with white wine and it is absolutely perfect. We literally wiped the bowl clean with bread. There was no way we were leaving a drop because it's that good. And that happy hour price is KILLER!

Mediterranean Flatbread ($16): Pesto, goat cheese, artichoke, roasted tomato, and olives. Whoa. This is another home run. I remembered enjoying the flatbreads in the past, but not as much as now. The crust was so, so good - crusty perfection and ridiculous flavor. The toppings definitely sealed the deal.

USDA Certified Angus Ribeye, 18 oz ($59; H/H $29.50): I'm certain this is a big part of their popularity - 50% off steaks during happy hour. Yeah, it's a great deal. This is my third time with their steaks and I don't know what's up, but I don't enjoy them. This time, the temperature was perfect (I ordered rare plus), but there was a thick charcoal crust on the steak. We wrote it off as the way their steaks are prepared, so we took off what we could and enjoyed it as much as possible. Then, I saw photos of their steaks and realized that there is usually no crust. I should've said something, but I also wonder why they would serve it like that? Either way, I'm avoiding their steaks or I'm going to figure out a way to get that perfectly-cooked steak from them!

I love their choice of sides! They're all delicious.
Brussels Sprouts and Honey Swine ($8.50)
Truffle Crispy Fries ($8.50)
Sweet Potato Tots ($8.50)

Doughnuts with Caramel and White Chocolate ($8.50): Fresh delicious, fluffy doughnuts. Really great. The white chocolate sauce is amazing. I could eat like 50 more.

Their cocktails are insane. I got Blood and Sand (Scotch, Cherry Herring, Sweet Vermouth, and orange juice) because that's my jam. I'm not a straight up scotch drinker, but I love a good scotch cocktail. Their interpretation of Blood and Sand is AMAZING and obviously, you get a show with it.

Went on a friend's recommendation, but wouldn't go there again!
Service was extremely slow - 20 minutes to get drinks, 50 minutes to order food.
Prices were 50% higher than advertised on their website.
Food quality was mediocre to average, and not worth the wait or the price.
Server was very inattentive.
If you want a hipster environment, go there.  If you want a decent meal, or anything above a minimal level of service, go someplace else!

The old school Vegas feel ! Great steak great atmosphere craft cocktails he best steak and service hands down the best is Isaiah, spotty ,g, Eddie ,Matt, you guys always now what we want like drinks ,and the best ambiance in Las Vegas local after hours !

Awesome place. Really friendly staff, the owner is the nicest guy, also really cool decor. We go for the happy hour. Sit at the bar though because otherwise the service is kinda slow. Only reason I gave 4 stars as opposed to 5.
Order the cream jalapeño corn, and try the linguini with clams. They also have the best steak you will sink your teeth into in the greater Las Vegas area, hands down. 

Amazing happy hour.

I frequent Vegas from Portland and i have been to many restaurants, and many so called classy fancy shmancy places, one thing Portland is known for is the best places to eat in the US.

Let me tell you a floor guy from the Rio told me about this place, he said "the best steak i have ever had its a locals spot" i said that's a tall statement and i went.

First of all i called asked if i needed a reservation they said know how many people are in your party i said about 7 or 8 then we showed up maybe half our later and they had our table ready, i was a little shocked because it seemed to be a little hole in the wall place (which i like) but unlike the normal Vegas experience. The Decor and atmosphere was very welcoming and honestly reminded me of many nice places in Portland, then we were seated they played jazzy electro house , underground old school hip hop instrumentals HA i heard a MOB DEEP instrumental which i was shocked but i loved it and people seemed to love it,  this again reminded me so much of Portland because we can get away with it, I don't see other city's and places doing this especially if its a fancy dining! The Waitress was very friendly and so was all the staff, i ordered the NY steak and garlic mash , i am very picky about my steaks and it was AMAZING it was cooked to perfection, everyone else enjoyed there food and was completely satisfied!  Food, and drinks aside the biggest thing i loved was we had FUN, its was not like your normally fancy dining experience in Vegas i agree with the other reviews this IS a hidden GEM! 

this place is a MUST go every time i go to Vegas from here on out!

Where do I start?  One of my favorite spots in all of Las Vegas.  This place is a hidden gem and I think a lot of people pass by it a million times and disregard it.  Here's the Low Down...

Decor:
Swanky, chic and old school.  One of my favorite "date places" or just a cool place to hang. 

The Booze:
BTG wine list is solid.

The cocktails are amazing.  These guys know their stuff and have really mastered the art of Mixology with their craft cocktails.  

Extensive list of all liquors, specifically their Gins and Whiskeys.

Solid beer list

The food:

The food as awesome.  Especially for the reverse happy hour!  My personal favorites are the Jalapeno Cream Corn, Kansas City Strip with peppercorn sauce and Prosciutto Asparagus Flatbread.   

If you haven't been yet, YOU NEED TO GO!

How do you review a place where the food was excellent, the service pretty good, but the sit you in what looks to be the dance floor and in the corner of it to boot? A solid three stars is my guess. There's a great selection of cocktails from the older times of these being the "cool drinks" and some great food.  If I had to pay the full price (go during Happy Hour...period) I'm sure there'd be less stars given, but for the price (and company of friends in a trendy place) I'll keep it on the list of places to go.

Where to start... I love this place. The atmosphere, the cocktails, the food, the service, all top class. It is hard to find something on the menu I don't like. Some of my favorites are the meatballs, the truffle mac and cheese (w/ bacon)! and especially, the spicy mussels. All expertly prepared and absolutely delicious. With an excellent happy hour lasting from 5 to 8pm and midnight to closing, you can try selected dishes at half off. The cocktails are some of the best in town, hand crafted by one of their impressive mixologists. The Ward Eight is absolutely my favorite. The soft elegant lighting makes for a perfect romantic dinner. With their great prices,  coupled with the quality of food and service I am baffled at why this place is not packed every night. Herbs & Rye is a must for everyone.

This is such a great little neighborhood joint. It is really busy after work so be prepared for the noise level and the crowds! It is a little pricey for the cocktails, I wish they would have a little more extensive happy hour list...However, their food menu items during happy hour is outstanding, totally worth a stop in. A group of 4 of us came for an early dinner, and everything was fantastic. All of the steak choices were amazing, perfectly cooked with tasty added sauces and the brussel sprouts were to dye for! We ended with the donuts...I could eat the entire plate to myself!  Overall, a cool hip little place with great food. Now if they would just include a few cocktails on happy hour (not just a glass of house wine or beer---Booo :(  we would be there a little more often
Best Damn Steakhouse in Vegas, I could go on & on about the service, cocktails & selection of cuts, but I'll say this, Go There! And check out Happy Hour!!

Herbs and Rye offers an excellent happy hour twice a day: 5pm-8pm and 12am-3am.  Happy hour gets you 50% off certain food items, $5 wells and $3 drafts.  The other evening I enjoyed a 17 oz. bone-in ribeye and a side of jalapeno creamed corn...all for a delicious $13.00.  While it still makes for a good $26 entree (ordering this dish during non-happy hours gets you two sides instead of one), getting this for half price only sweetens the deal.  This is one of the better deals I've come across in a while.  Don't get dragged to a Station Casino looking for their late night steak and eggs;  this is the place to be!

The bartenders are the other stars here at Herbs and Rye.  They have been able to make all drinks that my friends and I have ordered without giving us a blank stare and asking, "What is that?"  This is a refreshing thing to see as compared to other establishments.  My friends have been very impressed by the drinks crafted here; I think they make good drinks, but nothing on their menu has really made my palate scream for more.  I'm perfectly happy ordering an Old Fashioned here, though, which I can't say about 90% of the other bars out there!

One nice thing that's happened recently is that all the video poker machines have been removed from the bar!  This makes for an even better place to grab a few drinks and a meal if your party is small enough to sit at the bar.  Nectaly has been a superb host, remembering customers and always asking customers how their experience has been.  Herbs and Rye is another repeat eat for me here in Las Vegas!

When traveling, I always like to try and find one of the local places off the main drag. A friend of mine who lives in Vegas met me for dinner while on a trip. We headed away from the strip to Herbs & Rye.. a place that my friend had heard of and wanted to visit.

Pulling up, I had to tell myself that outside appearances are often deceiving. We parked outside the rather plain building and walked into a beautiful restaurant. After my eyes adjusted to the super low light level, I saw exposed brick walls accented with deep shades of red splashed throughout the place.

We made a reservation on OpenTable and were seated immediately after checking in with the hostess. She gave us a choice of sitting at a table in the bar area, or a seat in the main dining room. We chose to sit in the dining room so we could chat. With only 6 or so tables, it was perfect to carry on a conversation.

I was really looking forward to a drink after reading the reviews on Yelp and seeing the photos other reviewers had added. A killer headache kept me to water only, but I definitely had drink envy when the party next to me started getting drinks. The menu was smaller than I expected. Steaks make up most of the main course options along with few pasta dishes, but they do have starters, salads and flatbreads.

Our server came over and welcomed us, and let us know since we arrived before their 8am Happy Hour ended, all of the items marked with stars were half off. This definitely changed my mind, and I went for the 8oz flatiron steak with a side of asparagus. Normally $28, I got it half off for $14. Not too bad.. and definitely cheaper than I could have found anywhere on the strip. I will say my first choice in sides was Brussel Sprouts, but they were deep fried, which turned me off of them. Most of the sides were deep fried, and when it came to healthier side items, the menu definitely was lacking.

The steak came out perfect. Seasoned only with salt and pepper, my medium steak was juicy and absolutely delicious. I felt bad not being able to eat it all.
The asparagus, on the other hand, could have been better. It was served in a small cast iron skillet and had been overcooked to the point of almost losing all of its beautiful green color. It was mushy and swimming in butter and had absolutely no bite to it at all. Perhaps I should have stuck to something in season... or perhaps it shouldn't be on the menu if it's not fresh.

Aside from the asparagus, everything else was spot on. The steak was delicious. The service was impeccable, and my water glass was always full (and I drank about a gallon of water). Definitely worth checking out if you're looking for a place off the strip for a night out.

So, we go early to stand in line last Saturday to get in at 5. It's our third time there. Bartender, Hispanic nearest the men's restroom, acted like I was invisible. Never got to to order a drink because I waited 15 minutes after all 5 people ordered before me even though I was sitting at the bar way before they got there. When the Hispanic POS bartender It was one of my worst experiences eating out. He knows he's in control since he's the one pouring drinks. What a loser. Thanks for ruining my 24th anniversary. 

Ahhh!!! Look at the response from the business  isn't the owner a local??? I'm sure he cares. I'm the kind of customer who loves eating and drinking like everyone else! You and the bartender should be fired!

I've been here many times and the drinks are excellent! They do not skimp on the alcohol either. The food is delicious and they have steaks on happy hour. The staff is always friendly and attentive. Nice 1920's ambiance. I will keep coming back!

Came in Tuesday for happy hour with friends.  Atmosphere was very busy and loud but you could still carry on conversation.  Steaks are half price during happy hour so I ordered flat iron steak and tomato bisque with grilled cheese.  The bisque was the best I had ever had!  My steak was cooked to perfection and seasoned perfectly.  Would definitely go back!!

Absolutely love this place! The ambiance is amazing and the steaks are out of this world! Love the happy hour and the cocktails! Anyone looking for a nice romantic steak dinner, this would be the place to go!

Perfect first date if you wanna impress your girl... They have a wide variety of drinks and it's super fun to pick a variety of different ones and share. Bartenders are awesome and the absinthe is quiet the show !!

We took 7 people here to celebrate our daughters Birthday on a Friday night.  Our reserved table was located in the bar area.  The music was so loud we were yelling.  Even the waiters struggled to hear us.  Absolutely nothing special.  Our daughters filet was over cooked, while another persons steak us undercooked, when she finally got served a new one, we were all done eating.  I even stepped away from our table and asked the waiter if he could have the music turned down, he stated that he really doubted that the owner would turn it down.  I told him everyone was yelling, because the music was so loud.  Nothing changed.  First and last time to ever go here, a huge waste of money!

If it's your first time here, don't get scared of the look outside, parking is not the greatest either. The whole story takes a twist when you come inside. 

Group of 20 industry people. I'm not sure if us being who we were helped the experience, but regardless, it was perfect. We came in for a double birthday celebration, all of us had drinks and steaks/pasta mostly and JOE made sure everything was flawless. He explained all the rules to us and it was smooth sailing from then on. All the drinks were amazing. I had a Manhattan. Steaks and couple of other things are all 50% off during happy hour and, wow! Some of the best steaks in Vegas.

Overall, thank you Herbs&Rye. Will be coming back for sure.
Best ribeye i have ever had. Open late too. Go happy hour so its half price. $70 full price

This place is actually better than it looks from the outside. This restaurant bar is different from any other restaurant in Las Vegas. The menu times are very creative and the staff is very nice and professional. The drinks are different and awesome. The stake is hands down the best stake I've had in town. Leave some room for dessert and have donuts with white chocolate and caramel! Highly recommend this for a group of friends or simply a date!!!

My new favorite bar in Vegas. Now, I hate most of what you think of when you think, Vegas. Gambling? I'm too good at math. Strippers? Sorry, knowing daddy didn't hug someone enough ruins it for me. What else? Club pools? Meh. But...this place. An italian steakhouse mixed with a prohibition cocktail bar. EFF YES. Red velvet walls, dark wood, two happy hours (save HALF OFF MEAT) and some really good dishes. I had the prime, my coworker had the rack of lamb, jalapeno creamed corn, etc. Bomb. The whole place is what I want from Vegas. Top notch.

If you are ever in Vegas and don't mind a bit off the strip this place is 100% worth it. DONT MISS HAPPY HOUR! Service is spot on, prompt and kind. We had the rib eye and let me say it is a steak even a vegetarian dreams of....

Great Streak. I had the NY Strip and it was perfect. Quality cocktails, and the sides were excellent as well (wife loved the mac 'n cheese, I liked the Brussels Sprouts). My wife had the chicken and risotto, which she shared and we both thought were great as well.  Truly, the steaks here are what are remarkable though.  Happy Hour pricing makes them even better.  We'll be back...and this should be a part of the rotation...which is remarkable because it's nearly halfway across town from where we live in the southwest.

We live in Los Angeles and visit Vegas about three times a year and we like to get off the strip sometimes. Found this place browsing online and yelp. From the outside the place looked a little sketch, but once we walked in the atmosphere and ambiance was great. Dim lit speeak easy style. 

We had a reservation but grabbed a drink at the bar while we waited for a table. The bartenders were friendly and engaging and made a really good Old Fashioned. 

Once we were seated we were surprised to hear that Happy Hour was offered at the table as well and Happy Hour prices included entrees! 

We ordered the Pork Chop with sides of Asparagus, Mac & Cheese and Brussel Sprouts. If you look at all my other reviews I pretty much order the same sides everywhere. The Pork Chop was really good. I don't order Pork Chops often because not everyone can prepare them right, but they did such a good job I would definitely order again. The sides were delicious and as usual I particularly enjoyed the Truffle Mac N Cheese. 

We were celebrating a birthday and at the end of the meal our server brought out dessert with a candle, which was super sweet!

On top of the food and atmosphere being great, our server was AMAZING. He was funny and chatty and made the experience. Shout out to M. Vega for the great dining experience. 

We will be back and definitely for their Happy Hour, the best one in town!
Love love love the happy hour and the extravagant drink menu. One of our favorite places to go for a date night. Half off steaks during happy hour, it really can't be beat.

Reservations are very helpful. We went on a Tuesday and still waited 20 minutes. Overall the food was very good. I did not get a chance to try the steaks but I had a steak pasta dish that was very hearty. The decor is very trendy and the drink menu is very creative. I was intimidated by the outside at first and parking can be a challenge. However, it's Vegas home of semi sketchy but amazing things! Haha

My boyfriend is a huge steak lover & was recommended to try this place out.

He can eat a lot & is never satisfied with the amount of steak he gets. However, Herbs & Rye definitely did it.

We didn't make a reservation, but we were able to be seated right away even though it seemed pretty busy for a Tuesday night.

We ordered the calamari for an appetizer, which we could have lived without.

For our entree, we decided to share the "King Kong Ribeye," which is 60 oz. & normally $190, but because it was happy hour & 50% off, it was $80! I definitely recommend taking advantage of that kind of deal! You also get to choose two sides. It was all so good. We obviously didn't finish it & had to take leftovers home, but my boyfriend was full & satisfied for once.

I forgot my ID & couldn't order any cocktails, but I'm sure I'll be back.
Drinks are amazing! We had a birthday party of 15 and took almost an hour to receive apps. Service and food are ok. The only outstanding dish was the meatballs

Interior was cool, food wasn't. Very oily and full of butter, very heavy. Couldn't breathe, and I ate only tomato soup and mushrooms, little bit of broccoli from my friend's plate. An hour later I felt very sick for two days. Drinks are very small and I didn't like the taste of it, but everyone have own taste, my friend liked it. Service wasn't the best, very slow and lady seemed like doing us a favor by serving. May be she wasn't in a mood that day or something. Won't come back.

This is an out of the way - none-tourist old world bar type of a restaurant with a great "mixologist", and good quality food.  We thoroughly enjoyed our visit, as both the food and the service were excellent.  The drinks are truly exceptional.  If you want a nice non-tourist experience for dinner, this may be your place in Vegas.
You may need to wait for a few minutes for a cab, but the restaurant will arrange it for you.

Came here with coworkers and didn't know what to expect.  While we were waiting at the bar for a table I saw a waiter make two drinks with orange and lemon peel in them.  He peeled some fruit on the counter and plopped the peels in the drinks without washing his hands.  Utterly disgusting.

This was my third time here. We went as a group of 8 friends. The previous two times I was there with a group of 6, and then on a date with my wife. Those two times were very good. This latest time, our group waited for over an hour to receive our food. Two of the steaks were not cooked as ordered. The waiter did try and right things by giving us a free dessert at the end of our meal. Their Happy Hour makes it extremely tempting to go back, this last experience does not. 
  Also, wear a jacket, they do not keep it warm in there.

Went there with my friend, it was very busy on Wed night but we got two seats at the bar. Kenson took excellent care of us! We had the mussels that were delicious, a great flatbread, and to die for bread pudding! Also loved our cocktails! Will def be back soon!

Apparently there are two Herbs and Rye - the one that people seem to love here on yelp, and the one I went to, which sucked.  Strangely enough, they are in the same building, so good luck getting the good one if you go there.

Everything from the ambiance to the service to the quality of the drinks was poor the night we went there.  Supposedly that is not the typical experience; so I may try it out again....

Problem 1: the bar booth tables have no leg space, so 4 of us were uncomfortable in a booth that appeared to be quite large.

Problem 2: the service was terrible.  The waiter took our drink order, and came back 15 minutes later to take a second drink order for our friends.  I inquired about where our drinks were and he then realized he never put in our drink order.  When we finally got drinks (25 minutes after ordering in a very empty bar), he spilled half of my friend's drink and one of the other drinks was only about 2/3 full.  (He did not offer to bring her a new one.)

Problem 3: The drinks did not taste very good.  They were OK, but not the awesome deliciousness that I was expecting.  Also, there are no prices on the drink menu, and there are wild rumors flying about town that drinks cost $20-30 each.  (They do not, they were all $9, which was the only reason I was not totally angry).

I've had similar cocktails at other mixology establishments that were much better... just more balanced.  These all seemed to have one taste (bitter, sweet) that overwhelmed the rest of the drink, which I think should be a more subtle combination of flavors that enhance one another, not clash for dominance.

Problem 4: The place has a lot of potential ambiance, but at some point they just cranked up the top 40 radio, which is not very "speakeasy."

The only food we ordered was the (vegan! yay!) sweet potato tots.  I really liked these, and that's why this place is getting two stars instead of one.  That and b/c the drinks were only $9.

Great food and great service. Happy Hour is everyday with 50% off on most menu items. Our server, was phenomenal from the beginning and recommended the perfect wine to go with our meal. They are starting to feature live music but the volume doesn't over power the ambiance of the place.

We ordered the calamari...one of the best I've had in the valley. It didn't have your typical marinara sauce, but instead was tossed with slivers of banana peppers and an aoli sauce...excellent. For the main course we had the sirloin (they recommended the rib-eye but had ran out by then) and the fettucini "crabonara". We didn't feel rushed and the food came out perfect.

Definitely coming back here again to try everything else. Their menu items weren't your typical italian fair and they served probition era type drinks and cocktails which were interesting...it also helped they were 50% off.

The food is phenomenal! You can't go wrong with anything. Happy hour has some great deals..5pm-8pm. One item in particular that I LOVE is the flat iron steak with the Herbs and Rye rub!! The seasoning is remarkable! And you can't forget about the sugar mini doughnuts..oh my!! They're hot, fresh and melt in your mouth! They have a big variety of old school cocktails as well! I highly recommend this restaurant. You won't be dissatisfied.

I booked a reservation here for my boyfriend's 30th birthday last Thursday at 6:30 for happy hour. We had to wait a few minutes for our table but we were seated pretty quickly. If you like a speakeasy kind of vibe with good music, good drinks and steaks you'll like this place! We shared an appetizer, the ribeye and the filet mignon, and two drinks each for about $130. The steaks were great and the service was good as well. I definitely would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a great steak without the Vegas Strip price tag or atmosphere. Will definitely be back.

My husband and I made a reservation at Herbs and Rye for our dinner following our wedding due to locals raving on this hidden gem. This place is the BEST steak place I have ever been in my whole life! I was not even worried about our sides due to how delicious the steak was! The drinks were also the best I have ever tasted! You can tell the workers take pride in what they serve!!!! Make sure to make a reservation for their happy hour to enjoy half off steaks. The location has very little curb appeal but it is so nice in the inside! TRY IT!
Amazing classic cocktails, friendly and funny bartenders - a gem in a town where cocktails usually suck. If I lived here I'd need a new liver.

OMG I am in love. I have been wanting to try this place for a while and I finally got to go on Friday. We went for their first happy hour of the night from 5-8pm to take advantage of the half off steak special. They also have a second happy hour from 12-3am for those who like a late night snack after drinks at the bar. We decided to split the King Kong Ribeye between four people.

Before we sat down for dinner we went to the bar. There I discovered the massive drink menu and had the hardest time deciding on a drink. I need to go back multiple times because there are so many I want to try! What is so cool is that they have drinks by time periods. You can order a drink from originated from the 1800s or 1900s. Under each drink they have a mini description of how this drink came about. I thought that was so interesting and neat. The drink I got at the bar was the French 75. It intrigued me that it had champagne. It was very tasty and I enjoyed it. We also ordered the calamari at the bar which also did not disappoint. I loved all the banana hot peppers they had in it.

When we were seated I then ordered the Bee Knees. Best decision of the night. It was gin, lemon and honey. So delicious and not too sweet. I need to learn how to make this at home. As I said before we decided to get the King Kong Ribeye cooked medium. It also comes with a complimentary side which I thought was awesome. We decided on the mac and cheese. We then ordered the Brussel sprouts and asparagus. The meal was great. The steak was good just the right amount and was very tender. We had more than enough and was able to to take it home and eat it for lunch the following day. All of the sides were a perfect size and they were all eaten by the end of the meal.

We were too full for dessert but those doughnuts sounded awesome! 

If you are looking for a steak house in Vegas you must try Herbs and Rye.

Had been wanting to try this place for a while, finally had the opportunity last night while a friend was in town visiting. Unfortunately he was sick all night and is still ill on my couch as I write this.  We have eaten the exact same items except for this establishment for 2 days, so yes I'm sure it was this meal.  Risotto for any of you who are curious.

Their food was bomb... Every single thing I've tried from their menu is really good! Italian food and even happy hour items. Bartenders are really friendly, place has a homey vibe which I always like... It is the perfect place to just sit chill and talk story with a friend or a group.. Certified locals spot!

We had visited Las Vegas on 4/23/2018,and with only reading the great reviews had to try it ourselves.Well they were right it was the best place for a steak and drinks! We had so much fun! I had a Brown derby and my date had a Vodka Gimlet and he said it was the best he ever had! From the hostess to the waiter to the best bartender Eddie, I can't say enough about this place.We will be back !!

Party of 12 reservations at 7:00pm for surprise Birthday Party.  They don't have the reservation!  Not a good start.  Excited for the Kansas City Steak but it was served cold.  One guest sent his back, I felt  why bother.  Rolls were served with appetizers but that was it, none with dinner.  I felt why bother.  Wallpaper and music is good.  Place was packed.  Oh and no absolute citron!

Love this Place! Great drinks - try the Moscow Mule! Its so delicious! 
Prices are very good and I went on Monday night and there was cool house music spinning in the background. Was Great.

Love love love this place! If you have an appreciation for craft cocktails  that range from classic to trendy, you will too! The drink menu is split into different eras (Roaring 20s, 50s, etc.) with the drinks revolving around those categories, and they have PLENTY to choose from with the price range being $10-15. The atmosphere is dark and intimate, but at the same time it isn't intimidating like a bar at the strip of the same caliber. It is definitely a place that you would go to catch up with someone or a small group of people (I'd say 5 max). They have a very nice, fancier dinner menu as well, with more expensive items ranging from $15-30...we didn't eat there, but next time I will be sure to try it. The only thing that I would comment on is their lack of reasonably priced appetizers/bar snacks that would accompany the drinks.

Always good sometimes great! This last time really great! Ribeye smothered in mushrooms, fillet w a side of brussel sprouts, NY strip, sautéed asparagus, chimichurri etc. Steaks all cooked to perfection. Mozzarella caprese not bad not great (difficult to find good mozzarella so I understand). Amazing craft cocktails. My favorite is w the mezcal but the bourbon Campari drink was amazing too. Have nothing but great things to say about this place. It's a must every time I'm in Vegas. PS.. happy hour till 8! Half price steaks! An absolute must. Enjoy!!!!

After a hard week of work our friends suggested we go here because their friend was DJing.  It was a Saturday night and I was really looking for a good time that didn't involve...long lines!  Entering the building you are immediately surrounded by brick which is really unique in Las Vegas.  The sound of 90's hip hop was very welcoming!  We greeted the DJ and walked to the old bar that stretched to the back of the building.  On the other side of the bar were these beautiful booths and the wall was covered in a red antique wallpaper.  The wait staff is super friendly!  We had a couple shots and beer on tap.  The price of the shots were a little high but, for beer on tap for $4 wasn't bad at all.  We also ordered french fries.  They were a little pricey and they didn't give you more that an large order of fries from McDonalds.  After 12a they have a happy hour.  I would definitely recommend taking advantage of that cuase it's 50% off.  I give this place 3 out of 5 stars.  We will go again.  I would even love to go here for a birthday celebration.  Great place.

If you like tender, melt in your mouth perfection of steak goodness, then come to Herbs and Rye. I had the truffle Mac and cheese as my side and it was the perfect cheese to noodle consistency you want in mac and cheese. The last course we had was mini donuts that we're still warm, doughy and tasted like a funnel cake. We will be back to try all the other sides and drinks.

The food is out of this world. Best calamarie I've ever had hands down. Everything we ordered was  prepared perfectly and tasted amazing. Service was prompt and everything came out faster then expected. Scenery was relaxing and homie. Over all a kick was experience. If you're gonna splurge, do it here.

What to order: 

New York. Medium well. Steak rub. Chimichurri. 

Thank me later.
Fabulous happy hour! I look forward to going back and trying some of the HH food specials.

I most dig this Ol' Skool SpeakEasy type joint with a brief history lesson on prohibition era crafted cocktails.  Unfortunately, I didnt experience the wheel of a deal during happy hour, but I didn't regret even one sip paying full price!  Open up the menu and you will find a brief description on the origin or a fun fact of each cocktail.  From the Sazarac to the Moscow Mule chilled and served in its original copper mug, each one is worth giving a try.  The Bartenders take their trade seriously here which makes for a very artful show on its own!

This is now one of my favorite places to come when I visit home.  The drinks are spectacular and the atmosphere is amazing.  Every drink I tried I have loved.  I recommend the corpse Reviver 2, and the bees Knees.  Drinks are around 11 ish dollars which is somewhat steep but considering they are speciality I don't feel too terrible.

Wish they would clear out the dining room put in some live jazz and swing dancing after hours.

I like coming for happy hour.
The staff is really friendly, the drinks are strong, and you have to love half-off on steaks.
They lost my reservation, but they were really good at accommodating us. I will definitely come back.

We love this place! Go between 5-8 pm any day of the week for happy hour. The main draw of their happy hour is the 1/2 price steaks. Their fancy "by the decade" cocktails aren't included, but they do have a couple of happy hour wine options, and $5 well drinks. 

The ambiance in the bar area is great, and you could go 5 times and still not try all the cocktails you want to. The calamari is to die for, the salmon is phenomenal, and any of their steaks with the chimichurri or blue cheese crust are worth getting.

We drive by here everyday so we finally decided to give it a try. Came in for happy hour and they had half off steaks. My friend got a Moscow mule and the ribeye medium with a side of garlic mashed potatoes. My husband got the ribeye medium rare with a side of truffle Mac n' cheese and I got the filet mignon with the brussels sprouts. My food was great! Loved the Brussels sprouts especially. The filet mignon was like butter. My friends ribeye was great, it was well season and cooked perfectly. Her mash potatoes were good too. My husband's truffle Mac n cheese was probably one of the better Mac n cheese we've ever had. His steak was ok. It had a giant silverskin running through it. He ate around it so it wasn't that bad lol. We also got the donuts for dessert and they were amazing! Really great deal if you come for the happy hour and the service was great as well.

On a trip to Sin City, I got a recommendation to come here for dinner. I made a reservation online a few days before driving out. The day of, Kimberly was nice enough to call me to confirm our reservation and let's us know about their great happy hour pricing! The food was delicious, the drinks great! And the staff were all awesome! I'm glad we found this place, it's off the strip but so worth it!!

We've been here a handful of times and it seems like the service overall has gone down and the prices have gone up. From being greeted at the table, to receiving our drinks, to the food coming out (took a very long time), to the server doing a check back. The quickest thing she did was drop a bill. OUR service was so bad that we finally were abled to ordered our 2nd round of drinks partially into our main meal (after asking 3xs to see our server). BUT we cancelled our drinks as they were arriving bc we were finished with dinner and about 15-18 mins had passed from when we placed the 2nd order.

Our party was of 6 which means autograt so that might explain the lack of service. But if she could bump our checks up with a 2nd (maybe 3rd) round of drinks, then her check and autograt would had been higher so still confused on the lacking service. Anyhow we paid and left and as our party was leaving, I asked a different server for the mgr and he said he's the gentleman at the hostess desk with the beard. So I waited at the desk for his return...and I waited...and I waited. I waited so long that I witnessed a party of 4 come and to be seated, never greeted and talked about where they should go instead bc of the lack of service. I waited at least 10 minutes that my group said "Let's just go" and since I couldn't speak with him, I'm leaving this long negative review that I wanted to avoid. Herbs & Rye is good and well known. We visit frequent but after our last visit, we won't rush back.
This place is a real gem. Probably one of my favorite places I have visited in Vegas. Drinks are amazing, food is high quality, their happy hour is top notch. Definitely a fun date venue

Service is slow. They seated the manager's friends before us even though we waited an hour. Not sure that warrants anything above 1 start. Probably should be a negative star . Not sure how this place is still in business given the favoritism in service.

Love the vibe here. Not what you expect from the outside. It's got the 20's prohibition theme here. Spicy mussels and meatball appetizers are a must! It's the first time I've tried Moscow mule. Pretty good!!!! It's quite pricey but I like the vibe and the food so is say it's worth it!

I highly recommend this place for a date night spot. The room is beautiful and feels like a speakeasy. Don't judge the place from the outside, wait until you walk inside. The menu is unique offering cocktails from different era. I personally love the prohibition era and ended going off the menu and ordered the Last Word which was on point. Service was great and offered me bread and butter. My buddies all enjoyed their cocktails as well.

I ended up ordering the buffalo wings and they were great. I would love to come back and try their entrees and see what else they offer.

Stopped in for late night dinner 3/18/2014. As usual food and service was outstanding. We had wings (as usual) but this time we skipped the calamari (very VERY hard to do) and went with our waiter Cristian's recommendation of the beef tartare. It was amazing. Highly recommend this place, and Cristian was great!

This was our favorite steakhouse in town until our last experience. We went to celebrate my birthday this week and unlike our previous visits, this one was sub-par. 

My husband and I both ordered steaks. I had ordered my steak with the Herbs & Rye rub. Our steaks came out lukewarm. They burned my steak and then piled a thick pasty layer of their herb rub onto my steak to cover it up. I had to scrape it off because I was piled on thick. I didn't want to send it back because I didn't want anybody to mess with my food. Our Brussels sprouts were lukewarm as well; the only item that was hot was the potatoes. 

Service was a little slower than usual. We were placed in a booth, alongside one of the walls, in the room separate from the bar. The tables were so close to each other that it was practically as if we were sitting at our neighbors' table. I was looking forward to a relaxing, nice dinner with my husband but it was difficult to create that ambiance when when you're 2 feet away from a politically charged group that's very passionate about their views. 

I was ranting and raving about this place for months to my co-workers. I've been recommending it left and right. I'm not ready to write off this place since this is the 1st by experience we've had. I hope our next visit is a better one.

I am giving Herbs & Rye a low star rating solely for the poor management of reservations. This is the 4th time I have been here in the last month and a half (on various nights of the week, weeknights & weekends), and ALL FOUR TIMES I have been sat significantly past my reservation time (and I have always arrived before my reservation time). Each time the host team has simply apologized and said that they were running a bit behind. Once is understandable. Twice is acceptable. Now I am simply questioning why I continue to return to this restaurant. (The reality is, I keep coming back because the food, cocktails & service staff are all 5 star, but this will only go so far if I am always waiting over 30 minutes past my reservation time.)

To add insult to injury for tonight's reservation, I had confirmed that we would have a child in our party when H&R called to confirm this afternoon. 21 minutes past our initial reservation time, I got the text saying that our table was ready. When we went inside to be seated, they told us that the table they had for us was in the bar, and we would have to wait for a table in the dining room because of the child. This was infuriating, as, Again, I confirmed with them this afternoon that there was a child in our party; this was not new information. We were finally sat 20 minutes later, 40 minutes past our initial reservation time, and 55 minutes after arriving at the restaurant. 

I would like to reiterate that this is not the first time that this has happened; had it been the first time, I would have written it off as an off night for the restaurant. This wait time has become all too consistent. If this issue is fixed the next time I dine here (if there is a next time at this point), I will gladly update my review/rating. This has been my favorite restaurant in town for a few years now, and I am having a difficult time wanting to go back.

Joe, our server, was outstanding. He was 5 Stars all the way.

I have been here a couple of times now and really enjoy this place. It is great for just about everything...from just wanting to go out and have some cocktails to wanting to have cocktails + a good meal. 
Don't let your first impression throw you off. From the outside yes, this place is slightly shabby, however walk in and it's a whole new place. Dark, leather booths, perfect for dates. Amazing and interesting and HUGE cocktail menu...and the drinks don't disappoint!
The food is pretty good as well. Mostly a steak place but I've gotten appetizers and flat breads here that were good as well. Three stars for the food, but add the fourth for ambiance and the cocktails.

I love this place. I am considering picking up a third job to eat/ drink here everyday.


Cocktails are handcrafted extremely well. Perfect balance of each content.  

Food is the perfect compliment to cocktails. Service is on point

Hole in wall I was really impressed with. Never would of went without a friend taking me there. Drinks were unreal and very unique with drinks from the late 1800's to early 30's. Chicken Cordon Bleu was good. The service was a little bad. Luckilly it was not busy and I was not in a hurry.
We are here last night and it was AMAZING. I shared the flatbread bruschetta and the mac and cheese and it was the best! The waiter was great. Noting to complain about!!

This is a good solid steakhouse and apparently a local favorite. Came here with a group of friends on a Tuesday night for a friend's birthday. Parking is a little tricky cause the lot is small and people just make up their own spots along the wall. Some of my friends had to park in a different lot so that kinda sucked. When you walk in the restaurant has the typical steak house atmosphere... Red walls, chandeliers and dark lighting. 

They have an extensive menu with a great bar and eclectic food choices. The double stars on the menu means that it's half off!  How awesome. This includes the steaks, pork chops and some appetizers. When is happy hour? Not really sure but we ordered around 7 to 730 which is prime time for dinner and we got happy hour prices. There were multiple waiters to fill our water cups, get drink orders and serve us basket after basket of bread.  Bread is delicious btw. It's warm and comes with whipped butter. 

We had the spicy mussels to share for appetizers. It was delicious. Reminds me of boiling crab but less oily!  We ate all the bread and used it to soak up the yummy garlicky sauce. For half off it was a great deal. 

I ordered the ribeye medium rare and my side were Brussels sprouts. The steak was pretty big! It was really charred and crispy on the outside but on the inside it was a perfect medium rare.  The steak was sooo good!!  Juicy, salty, great texture with a slightly crispy outside. My first bite was heaven. The Brussels sprouts were super good too. It was very oily because it had thick cuts of bacon in it. I love Brussels sprouts and it's actually my favorite vegetable so these were great. I also got to try the truffle Mac and cheese and creamed corn. All were really good!  Can't really go wrong. 

After our meal we got a digestif. It was like a thick minty herbal syrup. Tasted a little liked chinese. medicine. Not for me but some people like it. 

My 18oz delicious juicy steak was 30 bucks. Definitely will come back!!

My husband and I had dinner here last night! We got the fillet with Mac and cheese and creamed jalapeño corn! Also got a bottle of the house Cabernet and donuts for dessert. This place doesn't look anything special on the outside, parking sucks  and it's not in the best location which is the only reason I took away a star. Service was great and happy hour prices can't be beat! Next time we go we will just uber;)

The girlfriend and I went for dinner and drinks at Herbs & Rye on our last night in Vegas upon the recommendation of many of the local bartenders we had encountered during our stay.  It's been our experience that the word of a local bartender especially in Vegas is one to be trusted and this was no exception.  Herbs & Rye is off the Strip and definitely not a stop for most tourists.  It occupies a fairly non-descript block building on W. Sahara, well marked with signage announcing its presence.  Stepping inside is like stepping into a time machine to an Italian steakhouse 30-40 years ago.  I liked it for its laid-back charm and unpretentiousness.  Still, we weren't there to appreciate the architectural and interior design.  We came to eat and drink...not necessarily in that order.

We started off with some cocktails and apps.  Herbs & Rye's cocktail list reads like the comprehensive history of American cocktails.  Even if you're not having drinks, the cocktail list is worth a read if only for educational purposes.   I had the classic Lion's Tail ($9) made with bourbon, lime juice, pimento dram, simple syrup, and Angostura bitters.  It was a well-made, tasty drink notable for the allspice notes from the pimento dram.  We shared an order of the fried calamari ($15).  It was nicely fried leaving the calamari tender (as fried calamari can be).  It was a bit overpriced by $3-4 considering the portion size received.

For my dinner, I had the New York Strip with a side of Truffle Mac & Cheese ($34).  It wasn't a dry-aged prime cut of beef nor was it wagyu, but my steak was cooked to my requested medium rare, juicy and tender enough.  The Truffle Mac & Cheese was cheesy and imbued with plenty of truffle flavor.  In fact, it was to the point of straddling the line of too much truffle essence, as it was the dominant flavor practically overwhelming the cheese.  Service was plus.  Josh, our server, was personable and attentive throughout our meal.

From its generic exterior to its dated circa 1960s/70s interior, Herbs & Rye's anti-Strip look and feel belies its true nature.  Herbs & Rye is a first-rate cocktail joint with its outstanding craft cocktails that are well executed and reasonably priced.  The food is satisfying, if a bit unremarkable, and doesn't shine nearly as bright as the cocktails.  That said, I still left fat, dumb, and happy!  I'll gladly return for drinks the next time I'm in town!  3 stars for the food...4 stars for the drinks.  3.5 stars overall.

Great drinks...desecrated carpaccio

To whom it may concern,

We visited H&R last night about 8:30 pm. The place was fairly busy; we told the hostess we'd like to sit in the bar, she said "sure." The bar was full but three booths and another table along the wall were open so we sat down. Several minutes went by, the table was not wiped off so we continued to wait, no big deal. After a few more minutes a busser at the next table called out "hey guys, these tables are only for reservations." It wasn't exactly a hello, but at least someone let us know what was going on.

My boyfriend went to see the hostess, to find a table or make a reservation for right then - meanwhile our first server greeted me while the table was cleaned. The hostess and my boyfriend returned, I asked if we're moving or - ? She said, "it should be fine." That's a confusing response from the person in charge of knowing if the table was reserved. 

Our drinks were great. The carpaccio was a travesty. Beautiful beef cruelly slathered with balsamic and aioli from squeeze bottles and an inexplicable mountain of arugula in the center. I gave it a chance but it was ruined by so much sauce. I would have let the server know but he never circled back. So we waited.

Our second server came along, removed the carpaccio and explained our first server had left. Both servers were very pleasant, though it would have been better if the first one had checked in on the food. The second server was so professional and gracious we were tempted to stay for another cocktail but decided to call it a night instead.

The visit could've gone better in several respects, so much so that I thought it worth an email. I could not find a direct email so I'm posting my comments here. A negative yelp review is not my first choice, but here we are.

Sincerely,
Erin

Fantastic place! My girlfriend and I come here often and the service/food/drinks are the best!!

The waiter we usually have is Mark, and he is the best server I've had in any restaurant I've gone too. He remembers our preferred drinks and recent events we've done. The food is awesome. The steak are perfectly cooked. They have these rub with Cajun sauce. 

The drinks we order is the Brandy Crusta, Blood/Sand, and Lion's tail. those are our top favs.

This is definitely a hidden gem in Las Vegas! This isnt an every day restaurant, it's a once in a while event since it is a little more pricey. But it is totally worth it! Me and my friends went here for happy hour and showed up about an hour before our reservation to get some cocktails at the bar. The cocktail list has groupings of cocktails from every decade starting I think around the 20s. It is super interesting and they have a ton of really delicious cocktails including many gin options which isnt common anymore. I loved The gin fizz the most. It was a work of art! And it is so fun to watch the bartenders create these amazing drinks.

For happy hour you get half of states and I think drinks. Making mistakes around 20 something dollars which is very reasonable considering the quality of the state! You can add things onto it I added mushrooms and onions. Also you can get side separately. I ordered the truffle mac & cheese which was divine! I would go to herbs and Rye just for that mac & cheese! 

I had such a great experience here that I am planning to go for my birthday with about 15 friends! When I called to make a reservation the girl that I talk to was super accommodating and seemed very excited to have us! You definitely do need to make a reservation way in advance because they do book up. 

I might update with at least photos for my birthday party!

great prohibition-y vibe with an extensive menu of cocktails, but the actual cocktails don't live up to the rep this place puts forward. 

Service was super lackluster.  Came at about 6:30 on a weekday and waited probably an hour to get our food. When I asked the waiter if our food was coming soon, he had the gall to ask, "Do you have to be somewhere? Is there a certain time you need to leave by" 

So..... if I said 8, would you wait til a half hr before to get me my food? What kills me, was that it wasn't even busy... other reviews might talk about the waiters running around with their heads cut off, but it was not even busy. 

3 stars for the amazing deal on steaks (got a kansas flat iron for 14$... really not bad) 

but there are virtually not HH drink deals (all 13$), and the other food was very average and expensive. 

I.e., 

flatbread - bruschetta style -- very mediocre $15 
Mac and Cheese, --only plus was the truffle flavor, but otherwise nothign special 
Prosciutto penna pasta -- a whopping 22$ and it did not knock my socks off. 


We asked the bartender (i think the owner) to make 3 different cocktails and he could not get it right... for a place that touts such an expansive list, you'd think he could make 1 well balanced cocktail, but he didn't really know what he was doing.  To his credit, was a nice guy, so 3 stars for that and the food)

Made reservations for my husbands birthday, for 5pm they called and confirmed the reservation before 4pm. We show up at opening time and our reservation time at 5pm. We were left outside waiting with the doors locked called at 5:10 women who answered the phone who said they were about to open the doors took 10 more minuets we were seated at 5:20. We didn't receive our meals until 6:45 My husband and I had to quickly devour our amazing steaks because we needed to leave at 7 to catch a flight. Two other smaller parties were seated near us and served before us, our waitress checked on us a total of 4 times, she stuck by the book as far as a sever goes canned and well rehearsed didn't feel like she earned her 25% added gratuity on a check of $400+ Took her a second passing to clear our empty appetizer plates, and a third passing to ask if we wanted another drink. Really disappointing experience for a place we love to go, I would have at least appreciated an apology especially because I had to hunt someone down to request our check. Never again will we celebrate any family events here.

My fiance and I dined here on our last night in Vegas tonight, and it was such a memorable experience. The atmosphere is very romantic and actually kind reminiscent of a 1930s mob restaurant with the antique chandeliers, satin red wallpaper, and black leather pincushion style chairs. We both had a steak; myself the filet mignon and my fiance with the New York strip. Both were incredibly tender, cooked perfectly to order, and came with great sides. The cocktails are as exquisite as they are literally a piece of Americana with their list being in chronological order from different eras in history. The H&R donuts were an unexpected, but very appreciated gift from the house, but they were absolutely excellent. Imagine miniature donuts in a white chocolate and caramel glaze and sprinkled with just a dash of crack. Yeah, these little guys can't be legal. Allie (I hope I spelled that right!), our server was incredibly friendly and helpful in finding cocktails that hit our respective palates just right and left both of us feeling like we were royalty. However long it takes for us to be back in the Vegas Valley, we will be back to herbs and rye; that's a promise.
This place rocks! So enjoyed every  aspect of our dining experience. Music was a tad loud, hard to have conversation, but that's a minor thing compared to how great it was.
Outstanding! Steak tar tar was awesome. My bartender "spoty" was simply amazing. Encyclopedia level of knowledge of Scotch and all other cocktails. Don't miss this place.

Reminds me of the old speak easy' during prohibition.  Bar tenders know their gin...

Food is excellent!

This place is pretty pricey compared to most places, however, have an amazing happy hour with 50% off steaks clams and pasta. They have amazing specialty cocktails and their food is just wonderful. I recommend coming here for either a late night out for their happy hour after midnight or right after work for happy hour.

I've been going here for the past few years and yes, it's been consistently lovely. I've taken even a few visitors here for late night eats as it surely beats having graveyard specials at a janky diner. We get to sit in a cozy, dark booth and listen to a really thoughful soundtrack if you like stuff like downtempo.

The main draw is every night from 5pm-8pm and 12am-close is HAPPY HOUR. No, it doesn't include the cocktails, but I believe well drinks and some beers are. The gem of it is the food. There is a limited half off food selection of various types of steaks, a few apps (currently spicy mussels and garlic butter clams), and a entree of linguine and clams. 

Get the steak! Its good quality for the price. I normally go with the 18oz ribeye (ends up like $20 at HH) or the Kansas City Bone In 12oz ( I believe $15 during HH) and it's been tender, cooked to the right temperature, and seasoned well that I don't put any steak sauce. It comes with one side and their sides are great here. I really like their truffle mac n cheese, sweet potato tots, or super garlicky spinach. No it isn't your dirt cheap steak special, but you get what you pay for and it's a great value considering the quality. We've brought even the BFs grandma and mom recently and both approved of the steak and would like us to bring them back.  

We also get the spicy mussels often during HH. It's a rather large pot they give you for the $11 HH price and the marinara is garlicky, a bit spicy, and needs to be sopped up. Ask for more bread - theirs is delicious, hot out the oven. 

They serve some of my favorite consistent drinks. Drinks here don't rotate so much, but are all classic cocktails using a lot of small batch spirits so it speaks to my heart.  The BFs and my drink of choice is the Vieux Carr'e (Rye, Cognac, Benedictine, Sweet Vermouth, Peychauds Bitters, Angostura Bitters) since its just alcohol on top of more alcohol. I just find I like less sweet stuff over the years and just want something unfussy and you can taste the nuances of the alcohol. If I want something tart and refreshing for a change, I go for Blackthorn or Moscow Mules. I find both great for summer. I've also ordered mystery drinks here and have been pleased, whatever I was given. I think at this point they can peg my tastes pretty well. I shockingly haven't drank the entire menu yet (but close) and will report back once I do with a running list of what each drink is like.

I think this place will always have a special little spot in my heart. It was actually the place I met all my Yelp friends, for the first time so it holds special memories. And throughout the years the steaks and the drinks have never disappointed.

In the location that once housed the famous Slanted Clam, Herbs & Rye touts a 20s speakeasy spirit that, while obviously faux, has been done so lovingly you can't help but respect it. 

Haven't tried the food, but sitting at the bar perusing the history lesson-cum-cocktail list, a tear almost came to my eye. If I were to open a bar, certainly this is the way I'd do it (oh wait, I did open a bar once, and we almost did it right--H&R do it better). 

From classic to creative, H&R mixes with finesse. I'm a fan, and how. Oh, and the drinks cost easily half what they'd be on the Strip.

Was here on Sat/22 Feb about 11 pm.
- A cocktail is $11.  My buddy had an Aviator, I had bartender's choice and he made a great drink with my preferred liquor (vodka).
- The decore, ambience and the red patterned wall (wallpaper?) was really nice.
- After here we went to Moondoggies, total opposite decore and clientele (in a rough, good way).
- Will be back to have a meal here eventually.

After driving by this place countless times and saying "i'm going to go there sometime," I finally made it thanks to Mario S, Anthony M, Tien and others. Happy Hour is the way to go otherwise I can't see spending that kind of money here. Even on happy hour it adds up quick if you are not careful. Steaks, Mac & Cheese and linguini with clams were all very good.

Atmosphere and staff were top notch. I'll just leave it at the single guys weren't complaining about the girls that work there. Plan to visit this place every once in a while moving forward. Great spot to meet up with friends for drinks and food.

I always enjoy myself at Herbs & Rye, the happy hour is packed and full of vibrant energy! Drinks are unique and you can really feel the bartenders love their jobs and know their stuff. Love the ambience here and speakeasy vibe. This little gem for locals and tourists alike is just want we need off the strip and not downtown. I recently came for a Monday dinner and it was absolutely delicious. We were told there was a wait for a booth of 45mins even though the booths were pretty much empty and we had just missed happy hour so it had cleared out pretty quickly. We decided to wait at the bar and have a glass of wine, maybe about 10 minutes later, our booth was ready so do not be afraid to be put on the waitlist. Waitress was super attentive even though she had a few tables already, she brought us out the bread. The portion for their bread is much to be desired, it was a little loaf, kind of looked like it was for one person. For appetizers, we decided on the flatbread pizza and truffle Mac & cheese, I don't remember what kind of flatbread it was called but it had cherry tomatoes that melted in your mouth and capers. Omg it was soooo good! We were pretty full just after that and our wine. Our main entrees arrived promptly afterward, I had the Penne which I believe was Penne Alla Carbonara and it was to die! My boyfriend had the angel hair pasta, it was all very tasty. Every bite was rich with flavors and our server tended to us just enough to let us know she was there but not overdoing it so we had plenty of space and alone time while we ate. All in all, very pleased with the food selection at Herbs & Rye! Will be back for happy hour steaks because those prices look to be a steal for the quality you are getting here. You cannot go wrong here, if it's happy hour drinks at the bar, or sitting down for a nice dinner with your man/woman. P. S. Music that night was Motown jams, also a plus.

Not impressed at All.  The customer Service of our waitress wasblah. My friend's boyfriend and I both ordered steaks, mine was Medium; friend's was medium well. Waitress switched our orders, and she told my friend, "sorry, would you like me to put that back in the grill?" (Because its too pink) usually they would replace it with a New one. While mine was over cooked; waiting If she Will offer me something... NOTHING. Just sorry!!!  My steak was over cooked and salty! Spinach side dish was too salty. Nothing was right! Bad experience.
This is the best drink and happy hour for a great steak! And the sides are to die for!

Went here for the first time last night for a birthday celebration.  Ambiance was great, music was a good mix of oldies. Our waitress was attentive, my steak was cooked to perfection  and my dessert was amazing. I recommend " the painkiller " if you are looking for a delicious rum cocktail. I will definitely be back for their happy hour :)

Clarify to the bartender that it IS Happy Hour...get him to acknowledge it! We rolled in after 12am specifically for happy hour. Looked at my phone to check time while I was STILL in a taxi...12:10..cool. We pop in and order food and drinks and have a good time. Bartender is cool...ask for the check, while he's doing stuff he says you look familiar...bla bla bla...where ya from. Finds out we're not from Vegas then shows up with a check time stamped by the register for 11:48pm as the time when we placed our order. I'm stunned that the "owner", Nicately, would pull something like this for an extra few bucks??? $22.00 dollars to be exact. I asked him about it and he said that was the time when we ordered. I told him we were in a taxi at that time...HA!! what a loser. Keep the money friend.

Truly a local gem! This wonderful restaurant and bar is just off the strip and the perfect place to take someone for a more affordable but quintessentially Vegas experience. The happy hour is one of the best in town but I would recommend skipping the discount drinks. This place has one of the best cocktail menus in town and you would be an utter dunce not to indulge in the wide selection of exceptional drinks offered. To compliment the terrific cocktails is a well focused menu with some truly great offerings, especially for those who want to partake in the happy hour discounts.
