Rhe cocktails are already $11 to $13 each (which is a steal in Vegas for this level of quality), but some of the menu items are half off from 5 to 8pm during the week, particularly the steaks. To start, the carpaccio is as generous as it is delicious with a perfect balance of acidity. I have been to most of the great steakhouses here and the steaks here do not disappoint. They are comparable in quality to steaks I've had in strip restaurants for $10 to $20 more without happy hour discounts. They rely on excellence and quality service here, rather than location and name recognition. I almost feel bad recommending this place, hoping to keep it a bit if a secret for myself and friends who visit. Honestly, I can't wait to go back.
Love this place! Highly recommended, open late, intimate atmosphere and excellent service.

Me encanta!
The steak flat bread and the mules were delicious! 
Very relaxing and very crowded at times, good service overall, will come back soon!

This is the worst bar and lamest restaurant in Vegas. You have be a nerd or loser to come to Vegas and dive into this hole known as: Herbs and Rye. 

You're in Vegas...
And you're going to Herbs and Rye- man, your life sucks.
Everything about this bar sucks and they are dishonest. I use to be dragged out to this place with a corny biz partner from the Midwest who liked its chic and drab garage-like décor and setting. The drinks were always watered down and food served cold as well as the order totally WRONG about 60% of the time. The staff never cared and viewed no one as regulars. 

If you come here to have fun after 6:00PM you have officially peaked in your life. Its downhill from here. You could go to any bar in Wisconsin or South Dakota and have the same experience. 

The owners should tear the place down and remodel it to be a normal Vegas bar like everywhere else that is trying to attract young people with money. Hahaha, who invested in that place?

Don't ever come here!! The food is amazing, but it's not worth the terrible service. I have come here with friends about 8 times, hoping each time the service will be better, but no luck. I once waited an hour and 23 minutes for my food. It has become a game for us, how long will it take for a draft beer to come to our table? 32 minutes!! I ordered a steak one night, and was still working on it when the waitress picked it up to take it away. I told her I was not done, and she held the plate for me to eat it out of her hand! I finished my steak with her holding it for me, and she stormed off as if I was an inconvenience for her. Another time we told them we had a group of about 12 people coming, and I was told we are not allowed to have more than 6 people. I looked in the dining room and there was noone in there. I asked if we could push some tables together for our large group and they said no. It's such a shame because their food is amazing and their signature cocktails are delicious. Unfortunately, I will not be going back again.

This place was GREAT! Get yourself a reservation and Go.  We had a party of 9 and had a great time. Kids shared their food and tell the server and they split it in the kitchen. Steaks were cooked perfect. Sauces are available if you like sauce with your steak. Everyone in my party was pretty happy. Now if your down to eat order the 120 oz steak. Risotto was great also. Mixed drinks are great.

I'm a really big fan of Herbs & Rye. I've only gone a couple times so far, but the perfect storm of quality food, excellent customer service and happy hour half priced steaks has won me over immensely. 

Each time I have come here I have been treated awesomely right from stepping in the door and being greeted by the friendly hostess. And the waitresses Donna and Debbie are fantastic as well. They are friendly and they go above and beyond to take care of you. 

I have opted for the 18 oz. Rib-Eye both times and have been very pleased with it. Rib-Eye is my go to steak in most any circumstance. I did try a bite of the New York Strip and that was pretty fantastic too. The sides are incredible. My favorite is the truffle mac and cheese, but I have also been a fan of the garlic mashed potatoes and the truffle parmesan french fries. The steaks come with one side order and during happy hour, they are an absolute deal. They also have $5 well drinks and I think a $3 amber ale, if I remember correct. If you want Jack, they charge you $8. That's my one knock against this place, but I'll live. The bread also isn't bad and definitely hits the spot while you wait. Nothing really to write home about, but better than nothing while you wait. 

The ambiance of the place is pretty classy. It's dim and the walls are lined with a nice velvet looking wall paper that looks pretty elegant. It's the kind of place you would probably want to dress up a little for. 

Overall, Herbs is most likely going to be a regular spot of mine when I need my steak fix. If you haven't checked it out, do yourself a favor and head over there. Best time would be during one of their happy hours. The first one is from 5 to 8 and I think the second one starts at 11. Oh and they're currently in the process of changing out their beer and wine menu along with adding a few food items including a Porterhouse. More reasons to check back.

Great place for Steaks & Cocktails! Unique venue: Speakeasy theme. 

Recommendations:

1. Start with a cocktail. They have a LOT of options here. 
2. Entree: I go from cocktail to Steak. Get your favorite cut. I always defer to Ribeye. I recommend getting the sauce on the side so you can taste the flavor of the steak. 
3. Side: If you like sprouts, their Sprouts & Swine is FANTASTIC!
4. Dessert: They have a Cookie Dessert. This is the one to get :)

This place is absolutely fantastic. I loved absolutely everything about it. Such a cool atmosphere, amazing customer service, superb food and drinks. I was visiting a friend over the weekend and we came here twice. Both times for reverse happy hour and both experiences were phenomenal. First time was a Thursday night, we sat at the bar Gerardo took care of us and he was absolutely wonderful. He made great drinks and he's so genuine and kind, he truly made my night. I ordered the New York strip, my friend the filet mignon and we both got the truffle mac and cheese. The steak was honestly one of the best I've ever had, cooked perfectly and the mac and cheese melts in your mouth, like it was heavenly. The second time was a Saturday, it was busy which was to be expected but we were seated at a table within 10 minuets. Our servers were fantastic, so helpful and kind. We got the spicy muscles and oh my god they were bomb. The sauce that it's served with was so delicious that we took the leftovers home and our server hooked us up with some extra bread to go with it. Once again the steaks were perfect and since I loved it so much, I got the mac and cheese again. I cannot wait to go back to Vegas and visit Herbs & Rye again. I'll rave about this place to everyone who will listen.

After a dozen visits to Herbs and Rye, I can honestly say it is my favorite place in Las Vegas.  The bar is lively, the bartenders friendly and the crowd (with a few exceptions) is local.  If you want to make friends while enjoying great food and drinks, this is the place.

Steaks and selected drinks are half-price from 5-8p daily.  EAT the ribeye...it is the bomb!  Sprouts/swine, mac/cheese and sweet tots are a few of my favorite sides.  

This is a BOOZE bar.  They have a few wines and some beers, but nearly everyone drinks cocktails.  The booze selection is extensive and the bartenders can help you craft any cocktail.  They also have a great list of house cocktails - at least 20.  So if you need assistance, you just choose something from the list.

Finally, a big shout-out to Eddie, Matt, Gene, Mike and the other bartenders who make Herbs and Rye such a great experience!

Finally made it to H&E!

Since we just had an amazing dinner, I came here completely full...so no half price steaks for me!

We ordered a handful of beers and some cocktails.....they weren't cheap, but not obnoxiously overpriced either.  

Just being this kind of hole in the wall place, I would have thought the drinks be a little cheaper...at least during happy hour anyways.  I don't know if I would have ever stopped in here if it wasn't for Yelp.

The environment is clean and comfortable though, and the service was good.  It would be a good place to come for drinks, and maybe for the steaks I keep hearing about :)

Probably my favorite "place to go out" of all time. Amazing, unique handcrafted cocktails, and the best happy hour food deals I've ever seen. High quality perfectly cooked stakes and delicious sides. The fact that it's within walking distance of my house is also a bonus, haha. The Farmer flat bread sounds weird, but it's soo good. My favorite part about this place is the atmospheres... Vintage chique and a "locals" place by far, a great place to avoid the tourists! Looks creepy and dumpy from the outside but that's just to dissuade the wrong crowds. Hmm maybe I should delete this comment so it stays that way?

I'm so disappointed that I'm not able to give them 5-stars, because our server was so on-point... except they couldn't keep my drink filled. In fact, I repeated had to ask to have another after it sat empty. The first time the busses completely forgot. He came by later to grab our plates and walked off. I asked him for a refill next time I saw him, and he said he forgot. I only had 2-refills within 2-hours.

As for the food, everything was exceptional. Their brussels spouts are one of my favorite recipes; made with bacon and topped with cheese. There's nothing special about the mushrooms, so nothing to write home about. The NY steak came out rare instead of medium rare. So if that matters to you, then order the next temperature up. I don't mind it when its high quality beef. And the right cut. A cool-centered ribeye steak probably would've been chewy and gross... I've tried it before. And I love me some ribeye.
This place never disappoints!! Love me some herbs and rye!! They have the best happy hour!! A must!

I came here last night and I can't believe it was my first time! The atmosphere here is on point. I love the dark setting but not your average quiet spot. It was pretty busy and loud but it didn't seem short of anything but good vibes! I highly recommend coming here. We made a rookie mistake of not going during happy hour when a lot of entrees and drinks are HALF OFF! However, it still will be on the pricey side I suppose. Oh and we did have a snooty server. Regardless it was a great dinner. The presentation of the food was very nice and my favorite was the red wine glaze that came with the filet mignon! It was delicious. Im even considering having my birthday dinner here! It seems perfect for a big group of friends to start or perhaps end the night with! 

The first two pages of there menu are food items and the rest of it is a really extensive drink menu. I shared the surf and turf with a side of cream of corn (MY FAVORITE) and mac n cheese! Highly recommend them to you all.

Great place to kick it, eat and be served by first class people. 
BTW: This is my first yelp review.

We visited this place on our last jaunt to the City of Sin.  After reading up on it, we followed the tips of other Yelpers and showed up at exactly at our Midnight reservation spot on Thursday night/Friday morning.  We still had to wait a good 15 minutes past that (at the bar) to get our table.  So, we had a drink at the bar and enjoyed the great atmosphere, music, and people watching.  There are mostly locals in there, which is exactly what we were hoping to find.  

When we got sat in a booth right behind the bar (best possible spot), we ordered our half off mussels and half off steaks.  The mussels came out first.  I usually can't tell much of a difference in mussels from one place to the next (kind of like raw oysters) because every place does the clear/garlicky broth the same.  The sauce on these is tomato based with a TON of extra flavor.  I asked for more bread just to soak it all up.  That sauce was surprisingly the highlight for me, even though all the food was excellent.  The steaks we're prepared exactly as ordered and very good.  They were not Prime cuts, but still very flavorful, tender, and delicious.... I'd bet very selective Choice cuts. 

I had the Clover Club: gin (even though I typically don't care for it), lemon, raspberry syrup, egg white...and it was AMAZING.  I usually like to try a variety of drinks, but it was so good, I didn't want to risk being let down after, so I had another of the same.  And another.  My husband had something similar to a Manhattan but with anise in it.  He wasn't aware nise tastes like black licorice (I was in the restroom when he ordered it), so the bartender swapped it out for him to another drink that was similar but without it.  He was satisfied, but had beer the rest if the stay there.

Overall, a 4.5.  It is a great little local find with excellent atmosphere, food, drinks, decor, and HH prices.  The bartender was not that friendly of a person and the extra wait beyond our reservation time won't always be ideal for others.  They should focus on those two things if they want it to be perfect, but it was already close.  I highly recommend seeking it out (at the midnight Happy Hour time) and would be happy to go back.
This is a strong steakhouse.  1/2 price steaks and wine if you come early.  Fantastic drink menu and really cool staff and music.  Enjoyed a nice NY strip and side with my wife.

First off their drink menu is super cool you can order drinks based on the era from the late 1800s all the way up to modern times. 

Overall quality of the food is good, it took a while to get our meals though. the steaks are good, the sides are good and the drinks are killer. 

It is a bar so you do have to be 21 or over to get in  it's very dimly lit, had to use my phone flashlight just to see the menu

Servers we courteous and very helpful 

Back to the drink menu... even if you can't decide what you want you can just tell the bartender what types of things you like, the type of alcohol and the flavors you prefer and they will put together your own personalized drink. I found that to be pretty cool

This is a solid joint.  We came here for drinks only (though we ended up ordering some wings and calamari for a snack) and with one exception, all of the cocktails we ordered were very good & service very efficient.  Loved the exposed brick walls and candle lighting.  Too, the DJ spinning that night was great.  Played a bunch of old school hip hop stuff which was perfect -- upbeat but not clubby.   Would definitely go back.

Happy hour between 5PM to 8PM and midnight to 3AM. All steaks are half price and absolutely delicious. Still pricey but a lot more reasonable. The drinks are what I go there for though. A huge menu with a variety of drinks offering more than the usual cranberry vodka. Servers are knowledgable of all their drinks and provides such a great experience. Don't let the outside fool you.. The inside bar is like a hidden gem of Las Vegas!

It's Valentines day, around 8:00pm and me and my date are looking around on our phones for places that would be reasonable priced and doesn't have a 2 hour wait time. We called a few places and had no luck. I saw that this restaurant wasn't to far down the street, (Avoiding the strip at all costs), the reviews were good and the pictures made the place look classy. 

I called and a young lady answered the phone and before I could ask about wait times, she put me on hold. I was on hold for at least 7 minutes and I hung up. He said we should still try it and if it's to busy, we could keep looking. So when pulling up, I didn't like the look of it, just by the neighborhood. We found a parking spot and soon as we start to walk to the door of the restaurant, some man seen us and said "Well look at you two" We were dressed pretty nice. I think he was coming from the bar next door..

So I meet up with the hostess that had me on hold, and while standing there, she answers the phone and puts the person on hold. lol. I just giggled knowing that person will be waiting a while. Now that I am standing in the building, my whole outlook changed. It was dim lighting, not noisy and also not busy! We had no wait time!! We got seated right away, and in the back to ourselves. The service was so good, and they were always around when you needed them. 

We started with a appetizer, which was the crab cake. I had never had one before and can I say I am officially obsessed with them now. We both wanted more after licking the plate clean. It was great, from the sauce, to the fish being cooked perfect.

Our dinner was, Spinach Pappardelle, and a steak, with sides of Mac & Cheese and Mashed Potatoes. We could not stop talking about how good the food was. We would take a bite and rave about it more. I don't even like steak, and I could not keep my fork off his plate! We got so lucky with this place, on such a busy night. This place I swear found us, instead of me finding it. Perfect Valentines Day!!

WOW! WOW! WOW!
We've been to many many restaurants throughout Las Vegas and usually stay in our general area of town (southwest).  We've continually been hearing about this place from everyone and hearing how great it is.  So today we finally decided to make the trek here and check it out. 

It opens at 5pm and we arrived right at 5pm.  We were quickly seated and given menus to check out for the drinks, app's and dinners.  

Ronnie and Lou totally took care of us and were awesome.  I started with the mussels then proceeded to the ribeye w/jalapeño corn and garlic spinach.  AMAZING!  My wife got the filet and we finished with the creme brûlée 

If you haven't tried this yet...your missing out

Decided to come here late night for a late Valentina's dinner with the boyfriend. Good size restaurant and bar with a sexy and dark vibe. I absolutely love dark little spots like this. So thumbs up for that part! 

I decided to order the filet mignon (half off cuz of the 12-3am happy hour) and truffle Mac and cheese. The filet mignon was nice and juicy and I absolutely love that it was half off! The truffle mac and cheese was yummy as well. im a huge mac n cheese fan and this did not disappoint me! 'The only complaint I have is the service, took about 10 min to finally get someone at our table. She was just really boring and made me feel like I had to rush to eat lol.  Didn't really check on us to see how we were doing either.  This is probably why I had to give this place 3 stars! Sorry guys. But food was great!

Place is as good as it gets
Everything we have eaten there is awesome and even more incredible half priced during happy hr
The drink menu is so well crafted and delivered by knowledgeable and personable bartenders,
decor is great
I wanted to take my gf's sister and her boyfriend with us here on happy hr but we got caught up on the strip with them exploring,we missed happy hour still brought them,i footed the bill and still didnt mind paying for the quality(although happy hr is and even better steal) if i had any complaint, after bartending and managing bars the one thing i always preached with my bartenders is you should appreciate every tip you get  
but if someone goes head and shoulders out of the way to take great care of you take an extra second to let them know you genuinly appreciated it...i tipped about 90 dollars on a bill just over 200 as i told him he was all set he said thank u as is appropriate for any tip but when go to cash it out and see someone tipped u that well u naturally would assume u would turn around show graitude.i mean i make it a point to shake hands with someone if they tip me 5 on a round of drinks

It was a great choice for a date night with my husband. They have all these amazing cocktails from different eras & they definitely pride themselves on them as they should. I had a sprite, but my husband enjoyed the cocktail he had tremendously. He raved about it even after we left. The steaks were awesome & we had the asparagus & macaroni & cheese. Unfortunately, or asparagus was undercooked, but the rest of the meal was fantastic. The music was up too loud & didn't match the vibe or mood of the place. It has a very mob feel to it... Like a speakeasy..... The music..... Not at all.

Anther reason it lost a star is because our waiter was not a very good listener. When he first came around to take our drink orders, I was ready, but my husband wasn't. I asked if I could get a sprite & he smiled at my husband & said "I'll just give you guys some more time." Our waiter wasn't even really a waiter..... The girls from the front f the house brought us everything, even filled my water & sprite twice because our waiter didn't come check on us. He showed up at the last second with our bill & we weren't even done as we were thinking of staying for some cocktails. 

Hopefully just a hick up, but we will definitely be back, maybe not for e restaurant service, but for the bar service.

Herbs and Rye seems to be the last bastion of the creative mixology in Las Vegas.  At times, it almost seems like a school for young up-and-coming cocktail artists, marshaled by the seasoned head bartender.

The cocktail menu is refreshing in its focus on classic and prohibition era cocktails, but if you are in the mood for something more modern or unique, the bartender will mix you up something fancy and catering to your specific tastes.

The atmosphere is very calm and cozy, a great place to relax after dinner or to recover from a taxing experience in a more 'energetic' bar.  The music I can't quite remember, but I'd like to say it was Jazz.  All I do remember is that it was great background music for a conversation.

I hope the word spreads more for this spot, they deserve a place in the Las Vegas local's scene.

Went here for my birthday last month, absolutely delicious! We went during Happy Hour (Thank god) and they have amazing pricing. I got the lobster tail and my boyfriend got the steak of course. I highly recommend the Truffle Fries, they were delicious and their mac n cheese is something that I still dream about!

Definitely worth it to come for happy hour for the steaks. 

Ordered the 60 oz med rare and it was delicious. 

The linguine and clams were yummy, especially the garlic butter sauce.
First time here with my girlfriend and we absolutely loved it!!! Great food n super cool atmosphere. Our server mark was really nice and funny! We'll def be back again!
So happy we discovered Herbs & Rye!! Happy Hour is great, food was delicious, and the classic drinks are a hit. Must try!!

Came here because a friend recommended their Happy Hour steaks, and to collect those Open Table points.  H&R is located next to a gas station, and I feel like it's kind of ghetto around the restaurant.

Reservation was for 6pm on Friday.  We arrived a little late because there was no parking in their small lot.  After circling the lot 2 times, we called H&R and they said the next best place to park at is Eyeglass World, 2 lots to the west.  

Upon opening the door to the restaurant, you are blasted by a wall of darkness.  We waited for the hostess to get off the phone, then she led us to our table.  BTW, the cushion seat against the wall is SOO much more comfortable than that wooden chair!  It takes your eyes about 20 mins to adjust to the darkness, but it was still very uncomfortable and disorienting to be eating with such dim lighting.  Not to mention that you can hardly see the food you're eating.

I would say the decor is a mix between pool hall meets back alley.  

Dishes tried:
- Appetizer: calamari ($17) Some server brought this out and immediately my date and I commented on the lack of sauce.  Legit, there was a drizzle of the aioli sauce, or at least from what we could see of the dish.  We ended up asking our waitress for more sauce later on and then she brings out a boatload in a gravy boat.  We could have done with that earlier...  Overall, lacking sauce and overpriced. 
- Steaks: Porterhouse and NY Strip steak.  Filet part of the porterhouse was really tasty.  NY Strip steak was on the rare side for the medium requested.  
- Sides: waitress said the truffle mac & cheese and jalepeno corn are "the best" sides.  We got those with our dishes and boy, were they horrible!  Let me first say that I am a mac & cheese and corn connoisseur, and these sides did not meet my standards.
    - Mac & cheese tasted like frozen Stouffer's.  Had that fake not real cheese taste.
    - Corn also tasted like frozen corn and towards the end of the meal, the corn texture got thicker.  Yeah, twas gross. 

Dude, if I wanted a frozen meal, I would have gone to Trader Joe's.  

BOTTOM LINE: I wouldn't even come back here for their happy hour.  Not a pleasant dining experience.

Happy Hour is 5pm - 8pm and 12am - 3am everyday with the exception of Sundays (closed).
Half price on select menu items. $5 wells.

Returned last night and sat at the bar during happy hour. The happy hour is top-notch as virtually everything on the menu, including some hefty entrees, is 50% off from 5pm-7pm, and then they have reverse happy hour, but darn it, I didn't notice the hours. I was being selfish. Sorry! Oh, wait, there it is right up there on the Yelp business listing: Late night 50% off 11pm-3am. This adds up quickly in a good way. My bar mate and I had five cocktails and some crispy calamari for $25. I am not even sure how that is possible, but it happened. 

I had a couple of Diablos- a tequila drink with ginger ale, cassis and lime. My friend had a Clover Club followed by two French 75s. She really liked the French 75; it is made with champagne. All of their syrups are made in house, and you can tell that they take pride in their craft. 

The vibe is VERY dark and mysterious. I am still not digging their plates, but I guess that is a minor detail I will have to get over. It is balanced out by the wallpaper. Just don't look down at your plate if you can help it.

The bartender and staff are nice characters; they can be mysterious. I think they really take their prohibition theme seriously, which I can appreciate. I didn't have a dining room experience, but I enjoyed relaxing at the bar without being smothered by smoke! I am adding a star for a smokefree evening. If you sit at the end closest to the door, you get the ins on the restaurant action, as that is where all of the servers come to retrieve their drinks. I appreciate a little behind the scenes commentary. 

Oh, and they are hosting special cocktail events on Tuesdays at 10pm. We had been there since 6:30, so we didn't stick around, but it looked like it was going to be a fun shindig. I received a rather handy Sailor Jerry dog tag necklace with a built-in bottle opener. I might check the event out next week. 

So, keep up the good behavior boys! I am giving you five stars, and that is a very big responsibility.

I like that it seems more mature people go there.  I've been twice and I didn't notice any
20-30 something crowd.  But that's only 2 visits for Happy Hour only.

I like the atmosphere, dark and sultry.

I don't like the noise level.  It is LOUD in the bar area.  Too LOUD.

The appetizer menu is nothing great either, there are only a few things on special.  I guess the
big attraction is half off steaks.  So you spend $30 instead of $60.  Big deal.

The items I like are not on happy hour.  The shrimp cocktail, the mac N cheese, crab cakes(I think they took them off) the wings, etc. I got the fried calamari once and it was so hard and dry I sent it back for a salad. And the martini's are not on special either.

So, it's worth a visit to check it out, but I didn't think it was great!

I want to compliment the excellent service we received from the moment we entered the establishment. Our waiter "Charlie" gave excellent service and so very informative on the menu, the drinks and pairings. I couldn't have been more pleased with a restaurant that I brought out of town family to celebrate at. Will definitely be returning here!

We went to H & R for our anniversary...big mistake. This is a place that really doesn't know who it is or wants to be. The bar has potential as well as the food but when you mix expensive drinks with overpriced food and a wait staff that tries to get by on there looks with little or no concern for their guests you have chaos.
We were lucky enough to go during Happy Hour. If not, our 2 entrees and 3 drinks each would have been $165 instead of $140!
The steaks are priced like the Wynn as opposed to a dive on West Sahara!
The drinks are $10 each or more...my wife's glass of reisling was $12 for 3 oz!
The kicker...the server never thought to ask if they could buy us a shared dessert for our special day. I never thought about it til my wife mentioned it on the way home.
Would I go back..sure if I can get someone to give me a loan for dinner!

Good food, great atmosphere, awesome service, and excellent price. Went there for the first time last week, got a chance to savor some amazing food and drinks. Not sure what all the negative reviews all about but seriously, get a grip, grab a drink and enjoy yourself! Cheers!!!

Fantastic food. Fantastic cocktails. Fantastic bartenders. 
Looking for great steak and American food, but want to avoid the touristy Strip? Herbs and Rye is IT. And they have a robust cocktail menu and a very "craft" approach to their mixology. Bartenders are knowledgeable and friendly- not snooty hipsters. 
And half off steaks and chops on Happy Hour (til 8!) great locals spot. 

Found a new favorite spot for Vegas. Thanks, Herbs and Rye!

The happy hour here is awesome. 8 bucks for a bowl of calamari that I cannot finish. AWESOME! The Mediterranean flat-bread pizza is half priced too and is again huge and amazing.

If you can make it here for a happy hour of if you get their and it's dinner time. You'll get plenty of food for your dollar. So enjoy!

This place was amazing!  Advice? Go during happy hour.  50% off steaks from 5pm-8pm & 12am-3am.  And if you can, make reservations.  The place gets packed.  Outside of the restaurant is nothing really to look it but inside you will find a hidden gem.  It reminded me of a dark lounge-y type restaurant complete with an old bar smell.  They specialize it cocktails ranging from gothic age (1800's) - revival age (present).  I had a little cold so the server suggested a mocktail, something I've never had before.  It was excellent; tasted like a refreshing blend of citrus cucumber and mint which worked wonders for my throat.  

For appetizers we ordered the clams, calamari and bistecca flatbread.  They definitely do not skimp on the servings.  We had 5 people in our party and it was way more than enough.  For our on-trays my friends all ordered the steak but I settled on the linguine with clams.  It was DELISH.  I lost count of all the clams.  I felt like I had clams with linguine.  The steak came with a choice of sides.  I got to sample the mushrooms, mac and cheese, and jalapeno corn.  GET THE Jalapeño corn.  You will not be disappointed.  I have never tasted anything like it and now I don't want my corn any other way.  The steaks were HAPPY hour prices but full size servings.  We all had to be rolled out with our doggy bags.
Judging Yelp photos? I am a zombie and eat brains.... does that mean I will starve at your place?

There are places to eat in Vegas that are off the beaten path, places that are reasonably priced and high quality. This is probably the best of them.

My friends and I have done our share of the strip in Vegas, so we stayed at a suite in the Golden Nugget. Looking for something out of the ordinary, we came across this steak place. Oddly enough, we found out that it had a late-night happy hour from midnight-3am and steaks were half off. The prices are reasonable as is, but even better then! I knew it was a legitimate spot when the menu had two other options before "rare" for those with a bloodthirsty appetite. 

I chose a New York Strip, medium rare, with a side of truffle macaroni & cheese. The steak was cooked perfectly, lightly seasoned with salt and pepper, and the macaroni & cheese was delectable. One friend ordered the bourbon potatoes  - wow, what flavor!

Thank you for a wonderful experience. Next time we're in Vegas, we'll have to drop in again.

I attended a fabulous Yelp elite event at H&R last night, but I'll base my review on a dining experience last week. The stand out feature of Herbs and Rye is really the atmosphere. The velvet wallpaper, copper walls, the cheesey electronic piano guy. I love it ! It was relatively empty on a Saturday night and quiet enough to carry on a conversation - my kind of place ! 

I tend towards the more girly on my drinks so I can't say the drink list was particularly appealing to me. That being said, if you're a rye drinker (as the name implies!), you'll love the drinks here. My Hemmingway daquari was decent, but not a drink I'd drive across town to drink again. 

As many have mentioned - the Happy Hour is insane. I love the fact that it goes till 8 PM (note, the Yelp hours are currently wrong at the time I'm writing this review). Tons of great food options on the HH menu:

*Chicken cordon bleu ($8) - chicken itself was deilghtful but the risotto it was served with was the worst risotto I've ever had ! It had a scoop shape like it had come out of a mold and it was really dry. Honestly good risotto shouldn't hold a mold shape, it should pool in a puddle of goodness on your plate. Minor detail.
*Ribeye ($15) - served with choice of 2 sides. Ribeye itself was very tasty. No, for $15 you're not getting the type of steak served at Cut, but it blows every other "discount" steak I've had in this town out of the water. Again the sides here weren't all that special. Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. Wouldn't pick either of those again despite those being my normal favorites. 
*On a sidenote I did try the flatbreads at the Yelp elite party and those were fabulous - even cold . I'll have to try one of those next time.

Served with dinner was delightful bread with the coolest butter I've ever encountered. It was honey butter with chives and parsely . Sounds gross, but the flavor worked for me. It was so intriguing ! 

Overall a great experience was awesome service. Fun atmosphere, great for a date or a group of friends. If they could get their sides up to snuff this is a 5 star place for sure.

Tonight was the 2nd time my husband and I went to this restaurant.  It was so good the 1at time we chose it as our spot for our two year anniversary.  We made a reservation for 7 but got hungry early and they seated us right away as they did the 1st visit.  I love the interior of this place.  It is decorated very classy, dim lighting, upbeat music that I would think of for swing dancing.  Even the bathroom was decorated nice and very clean.  Our waiter, Jaquim was on point!  He was perfect. pleasant, attentive and knowledgeable.  Tonight I had the crab cake which is OMG! the best.  I would recommend this to anyone who wants to never like anyone else's after eating theirs.   I had the seared Salmon and again, PERFECT.  Whoever the chef is and whoever decided the menu for this place knows what they are doing.  Then there are the drinks...The 1st visit and this visit we have tried several different specialties that they offer.  I have only positives things to say about this place and highly recommend it!

First impression of showing up at Herbs and Rye were not the greatest. 

From trying to find a parking place to walking into a dark, dark restaurant and having to wait for the hostess to return to the stand and not be greeted right away or even looked at. Almost some what completely ignored for several minutes while she was playing with some menus, looking at the computer and whatever else. 
But after we were seated our server was awesome and helpful, he explained the specials and since we were there during happy hour the steaks were 1/2 off and they came with 1 side. So, the steaks weren't horrible just way too chard on the outside and incredibly pink on the inside. 3 of the steaks were ordered medium well, however they were more like chard medium. However, The pork chop with figs was incredible. 
As for the sides, the mac n cheese, truffle fries and broccoli and cheese were all really good. 
For dessert, the donuts were good,  however, the Crème brûlée wasn't good at all. It wasn't creamy and the topping was too thick. 
Also, the menu says that for parties over 6, gratuity is included. However, it is calculated on the regular price menu, not the happy hour menu. Kind of suspect, especially since happy hours are 5-8 and midnight to 3am. I think that is kind of wrong and our waiter didn't tell us that the gratuity was included as well. 
In conclusion, I'm not so sure that we will be back, especially with so many exceptional restaurants in town with easy parking, amazing customer service, ambience, and great food for the "happy hour pricing" which in other restaurants would be normal pricing.
Excellent food and happy hour is amazing. Only criticism would be wait times on drinks when they are busy.

I went here with my friend on our first evening here in Las Vegas as we were looking for a bar with good appetizers, good drinks and an atmosphere free of gaming -- we found it at Herbs & Rye. 

We sat at the bar and we each ordered the bleu cheese wedge salad and then ordered (to split) the Margherita pizza, chicken wings & chorizo meatballs. 

We each ordered a classic cocktail (their well ginl is Beefeaters!!) and the drinks were delicious. 

The wedge salads showed up: my gosh, they were so delicious and made right. Lots of cherry tomatoes, bleu cheese crumbles and bleu cheese dressing. 

The rest of the appetizers showed up -- they were also delicious! Of particular mention are the chicken wings which were very tangy and delicious. 

Of note: we ordered way too much food,, and as our hotel doesn't have a refrigerator, we had to abandon a lot of it there -- I HATE wasting delicious food!!

Was reccommended this place on my last visit to Las Vegas.
It is a Steak Place and the only way to enjoy this great place is to sit at the bar, get amazing drinks from Adam and take advantage of the Half Off Happy Hour Prices.   My $59 rib eye (delish) was 1/2 off.
So get there early and Cheers!!

Ate here for dinner with my girlfriend and it really exceeded my expectations. We had reservations for 6pm and we were seated immediately. It was really dark in there, but your eyes get used to it. It may still be hard to see the menu, but just pop out your cell phone (most tables were doing this ). From 6-8 it was happy hour: anything that had a double star on the dinner menu was included.  The drinks were not included in the happy hour in the dining area, but I think they may be included at the bar because it was jammed packed. 
The waiter chose our drinks for us after we explained a little about what we like. He brought me a Saturn which was citrusy, sweet, and smooth. Really loved it. He brought her a French 75 and it was bubbly and refreshing. We started off with the spicy mussels. They come in a really delicious red sauce and bread. They were pretty good and not too spicy.  We ordered a filet and a ribeye both medium with garlic mash, truffle Mac and cheese, and mushrooms. The steaks were cooked perfectly. So much flavor in each bite. Neither one of us could decide which one was our fav. The sides were great too. Potatoes were nice and creamy. The truffle Mac and cheese had the perfect amount of truffle oil. The mushrooms were sautéed to perfection with a nice wine flavor.  Would highly recommend the place. Next time, we will definitely be trying dessert.

I really want to like this place since I've heard it's a great spot for happy hour. Like most reviews say, you should make reservations before hand.  Our family and I recently went to this location. It took us a while to get an opening spot but we showed up 8:45 when we made the reservation. We had a group of 7. It was squished in the front and the hostess told us to move. We were escorted to the bar, which had ONLY 2-3 seats to accommodate our party. We finally get a table 45 minutes later, RIGHT NEXT TO THE BAR which had little to no room in between the bar stools and our table. Menu is very limited. But I've heard have great deals for happy hour. Restaurant is way too dark that we had to use our phones to see what's on the menu. Food is overly priced for the quality and the taste. I tried a little bit of everyone's food. Some were out of the world while others... not so much. Only 10 fries in truffle fry container for appetizers but a ginormous amount of calimari. The pasta noodles were tough. Gluten Free menu isn't really an option. Serving staff wasn't very friendly. One of our guest was allergic to something they put in her entree. Waiter seemed concerned and said he would ask the chef. He came back and pretty much told her she was crazy. She ended up needing an EPI pen later that night. I know it's always best when the WHOLE entire party orders drinks but not all of us wanted cocktails. The waiter seemed mad that some of us ordered water.  Based on unprofessional service and hut or miss food,  I don't think I'll ever come back.

It had been about a year and a half since I last saw her, but she came blazing back into my life on my holiday trip to Vegas. Without much debate, it was agreed that we would spend Christmas day out in the desert to celebrate our happy reunion. I felt the winter desert chill under my jacket as the sun began its daily journey below the horizon. And she, dressed in green, looked as beautiful as the last time I saw her. She had not changed one bit, still living life like it would burn out within the span of a half hour's time. Like always, she stormed back into my life and took over, burning my lips with her kiss and devastating my emotions with her words. In her presence, every fleeting thought escaped into a rabbit hole into which I felt compelled to pursue with singular obsession and undivided attention. Why was the desert so brown? Why was this road that we were on so long and windy? And what the hell did I do with my meager existence in the years 2002 and 2003? Time slowed and every possible outcome which could result from our actions became all the more manifestable.

An entire day spent with her left me drained and unable - or unwilling - to move an inch when I finally went back to the hotel. After a very restful slumber, I awoke in the morning and decided that one day was enough. I could not be with her again for my last day in Vegas. She left in me a need of recovery and triggered an unexpected feeling of homesickness. During dinner that next day, I noticed a book that the bartender had at the bar titled simply "PDT". Upon inquiry, I found that it was indeed a reference to the bar in East Village. The bartender said he loved the drinks in the book and I asked if there were any place like that in Vegas. He lamented that sadly there aren't any, but there was a particular bar-restaurant which made prohibition-era and classic cocktails. What better way to quench my homesickness? Off to Herbs and Rye I went.

Herbs and Rye was not located on the Strip, and it was definitely not within walking distance from the Strip, guaranteeing an establishment that wasn't inundated with tourists. It was the night after Christmas day, and the restaurant didn't have many customers. A lone waitress and the owner-bartender staffed the place. The mood was relaxing and and the lighting dim. I skipped the food menu and flipped to the drinks. Customers can easily tell that the owner was passionate about classic cocktails from what was offered on the drink menu. The drinks were divided into eras in which the drinks were popularised, including descriptions of the eras and history of each drink. Made with absinthe, of course I first had to order a Sazerac. Each sip of this clutched at my throat deliciously herbal and bitter. Next I ordered a Brown Derby, which I've never had before. Who knew honey and grapefruit could go so well together? With the bourbon, it made for a full-bodied drink with contrasting flavours. I must profess I liked the Brown Derby more. While I drank, I made conversations with the friendly owner about drinks and food.

Herbs and Rye is definitely a restaurant I will be visiting again the next time I'm in Vegas, and I recommend it highly. My only regret was that the drinks, while delicious, were not made strong enough for my taste.

Came here for a date night, and was extremely impressed by the atmosphere. The music was old school, and the ambiance was amazing. Our waiter was very informative and very nice. We ordered the calimari, a Caesar salad, and we shared the filet mignon. Everything was amazing and it didn't hurt that the steak was half off since we went around midnight. We will definitely be back.

Items Selected:
Clover Club - Gin, Lemon, Raspberry Syrup, Egg White
The Farmer Flatbread - Double Thick Bacon, Spinach, Cracked Egg, Crème Fraiche
Truffled Mac n' Cheese
Pork and Figs - Gorgonzola, Garlic Mash, Fig Glaze
Sweet Potato Tots with Marshmallow and Honey Crust
Old Granddad Bread Pudding with Vanilla Ice Cream
 
Heavily praised for an extensive era-specific list of craft cocktails with a menu full of sustainable organic meats and plates far more interesting than the average bar or lounge Herbs & Rye had long been a place of interest and with recent reports suggesting the kitchen to be firing on all cylinders I finally decided to stop by, a Saturday feast for one in the dimly-lit dining area my reward for eschewing alternative plans on Las Vegas Boulevard South.  Designed in a style somewhere between "Old time Vegas" and stripped-down speakeasy with a less-than-ideal location on West Sahara it was with eyes still adjusting from the 6pm sun that I entered the small tavern and greeted at a small podium by the woman later to be my waitress I was quickly led to my choice of tables, a menu soon in hand presenting tough decisions with a resultant four item order divided into two courses accompanied by one of nearly a dozen gin based cocktails I'd have liked to try were my liver's capacity on par with that of my gut.  Obviously a space prone to becoming lively as the night wears on but only perhaps half-full during the course of my meal it was after perhaps a ten minute wait that my cocktail arrived and featuring a lovely balance of fruit juxtaposing juniper notes beneath a cloudy of foam the Clover Club was a hit, the flavor profile particularly refreshing when matched to a rich opening duo of tender macaroni unfortunately overwhelmed with truffle oil and a crisp, lightly charred flatbread that fared far better with briny bacon finding its foil in the tang of crème fraiche.   At this point debating an Aviation versus the Bee's Knees it was a bit to my surprise that my second round arrived immediately on the heels of my first and forgetting the second cocktail as it was likely to arrive far too late to be enjoyed with the food I instead dug straight in, the 12oz bone-in piece of pork seared perfectly and coated with bleu over hand-smashed potatoes amidst a jus of pork and poached figs, the later laying split alongside the protein and still intensely sweet...though certainly not as much so as a bowl of tender tots bathed in a pool of honey beneath snowcaps of toasted marshmallow that ranks amongst the best "sides" I've had this year.  At this point sated but happy to go another round it was to an oral explanation of the restaurant's desserts that I was finally treated and although large sharing portions of sugared doughnuts and a skillet cookie were hard to resist it was instead in the day's special that I partook, the piping hot chunk of booze-soaked baguette crowned by a ball of vanilla ice cream proving very 'special' indeed with butter and cinnamon bubbling at its base as if the kitchen had known I was coming and prepared it just for me.

Herbs and rye is a great place with an old school vibe to it. The dim lighting and old tunes creates an ambiance similar to the prohibition era. The place is pricey, but their happy hours offer 50% off several menu items including the steaks which makes this place very affordable. I would recommend the porterhouse or rib eye steaks to quench your appetite. 

So come on down and bring your friends.

Consistency is a rare commodity, and Herbs & Rye steakhouse endures the old school steakhouse and bar. 
The minimal interior (velvet wallpaper is my favorite) and masculine atmosphere is old school Vegas.  This town needs to be back in The Rat Pack days;) 
Emily easily achieves to strike a chord with the customers at Herbs & Rye!  She has the ability to mix and serve a cocktail, all the while exuding a rare charm. 
Their menu will please any carnivore's cravings  with outstanding cuts.
This is nestled away from the Strip and by all means if one is visiting the Strip- please do make a point of coming into this gem.

I am sitting at Herbs and Rye, dumbfounded by the spectacular service. 

It is my mom's birthday today and we figured we would try this place out. I heard my friends rave about the atmosphere and the food quality so we figured, why not? 

Seating was quick although unfortunately it was in front of the bar. It would usually be okay if I were out with friends but if you're coming for an intimate night, between family or your significant other, be sure to call for a reservation and ask for a table in the backroom area. It'll surely help save your voice :P. 

Back to the amazing service, we ordered the clams appetizer as a starter. It was a decent size but probably not good to share with more than 2 people. The sauce that came with it was WOW. 

For the main course we opted to get the King Kong steak, a gargantuan steak weighing in at 60 oz (that's 3.75 lbs!!!!!) along with a delicious side of mushrooms and Truffle Mac & Cheese (MUST HAVE). 

The steak came out cold at first so we asked the waitress if we could get it warmed up for a bit. Out steak was taken away and we were promised to get our steak back nice and warm but something more impressive occurred. The manager came over to our table and told us he felt it was unacceptable that our meat was cold so he told us they were in the process of making a steak that would come fresh out the grill and straight to us. When the steak came out it was better than the first bites we first took with our other steak and we were all pleased. 

The professionalism that the manager and the waitress demonstrated was beyond our expectations. 

Will we come back? HECK YES! Any restaurant that is committed to having customers leave happy is a restaurant worth revisiting. 

Tip: Come from 5 pm to 8 pm to enjoy half priced drinks and some STEAK (amazing, right?)

This review is a little late but better late than never. I was here for my 24th birthday with a group of 11 I had another guest who last minute didn't show up but in these cases Herbs N Rye is one of those places that will seat you once most of your party is there. At that point in time we had 7 and they let us sit down as the rest of the guests arrived moments later. I was so relieved that they could seat us as many will simply say "No we cannot seat incomplete parties" so Herbs N Rye thank you for that. Next was the drinks and food, as always it was amazing! Although I do have to point out our server (don't remember his name) took a little longer to get our drinks and one of my friends ordered two at the same time which were brought out after we asked a second time about them. It was busy for a Thursday so we could understand how maybe they were short staffed or they had to serve many more tables. After the meal is done comes the check which I mentioned to everyone to bring cash in my party but as always there are some who didn't do they were kind enough to split the check. I understand it's a headache and that's why they have this policy so I didn't mind but they made it very accommodating. 

One more thing anyone who goes needs to try their donuts, OMG even when you are full order them try them warm and fresh and take the rest home!!!!

Wow.. Based on the owners feedback I cannot suggest this place at all. It is obvious that they do not care about their guests what so ever. I have never gotten feedback like this before after posting an honest review. Steer clear

This was the third time I've been to Herbs & Rye and sadly the worst experience.  We had a larger group (7 people) and all ordered steaks.  The food took awhile to come out, not a huge deal but noteworthy.  Several people in our group had problems with the temperature the steak was cooked at.  I ordered mine medium rare and it was rare, which it was better to error on the side or rare as opposed to medium but it was still not what I ordered.  3 other people in our party had similar issues with their cooked temperature being wrong.  

The food overall was good and definitely worth the half-off price of the happy hour.  I tried the garlic mashed potatoes and the mac and cheese for sides.  Both were very tasty.  

The bussers and assistant servers were much more attentive and helpful than our main server.  The service wasn't bad overall, it just let room for improvement.  

We had a reservation and the host was quick to seat us so that was a positive.

We went there twice on our last trip.

The first time we were part of a group of 6. We got there about an hour and fifteen mins before happy hour ended and we got seated about 20 mins before happy hour ended. There happy hour is good because some of the steaks and a few other things on their menu are half off! While we waited we found an area to hangout around the bar. i personally don't like cocktails, but for people who do they enjoyed the cocktails there. There's no prices for cocktails marked on the menu, but they generally range $11-13. 

Our main table was nice. The restaurant didn't seem crowded or loud and our table was spacious. The restaurant decor is nice. I think our server was inexperienced (or just a bad server). One of the people at our table ordered a bottle of wine and the bartender had said they would make sure it got to our table. We asked the server about it a number of times and he seemed to have an issue asking the right questions and being able to get the wine. Overall he was pretty awkward. Three of us ordered pastas and he failed to bring over the complimentary bread until we asked. The issues with the services were annoying, but they weren't a huge deal. The part that definitely made it worse was that since we were in a group of 6 they automatically added the tip onto our bill- and it was on the non happy hour price. I wouldn't mind tipping that amount if the service were good.  But, the service we got did not come close to warranting the size of tip the server got.

The second time we went the service was great. The server was knowledgable. The guy that was helping clear tables and refill waters was exceptional. A water glass wasn't empty for more than 30 seconds before he had it refilled. 

As for the food: My boyfriend had a steak and has said it was good, but nothing special. The mashed potatoes he had as a side were ok, but portion was small for the price. Our friends had sides or mac and cheese and that also was small. I had the linguine and clams pasta. It was good but lacked flavour. The main reason I would order it again is that it is on the happy hour menu so it ends up being reasonably prices compared to a lot of other things and since I'm not a steak eater its a good alternative. The spicy muscles were great!! I would definitely try them. I enjoy hot food, and they were spicy but not too spicy. It came with bread which was good for dipping in the spicy tomato sauce. We ordered the pappardelle. It was our mistake because we assumed there was a meat sauce with it. Was rich and had an overpowering garlic taste. Make sure you save room for the donuts. They are plain sugar donuts with two dipping sauces!

I finally got to try their steaks at happy hour!  I was going to get my favorite filet mignon but our server informed us that they have a filet wrapped in bacon. So, I got that and truffle fries. I also tried the truffle mac & cheese and the Herbs & Rye House Brew (HH price: $3). The sides aren't included in happy hour. We got beignets to end a great meal.

Bacon-wrapped Filet Mignon:
It had two thick slices of bacon on top and not wrapped around the filet. For a piece of steak that would normally be at least $50, getting this at half the price definitely changes everything. It was perfectly medium-rare, tender and juicy. 4.5/5

Truffle Fries:
Thin-cut fries with truffles and parmesan cheese. You can taste and see truffles, yay! The fries were crispy. I enjoy truffle fries but what makes this even better is that it's less than $10! 5/5

Truffle Mac & Cheese:
After eating great truffle fries, I was disappointed with this mac & cheese. I couldn't taste truffles. It was like regular, plain mac & cheese. 2/5

Beignets:
These aren't similar to the famous beignets from New Orleans. These are like mini doughnuts covered in granulated sugar. Normally comes with 2 dipping sauces: white chocolate and caramel but since I don't like white chocolate, our server threw in chocolate sauce. 4/5

The Kool Kids ordered Jack & Coke but it wasn't like Jack & Coke - our server later on said it's not really Jack & Coke, it was something else. That and my not-so-bacon-wrapped bacon-wrapped filet made me think we were getting punked by our server.

I've been several times & always forgot to write a review... It should get 5 stars because of the fantabulous mixology & 1/2 price wonderful steaks (during both happy hours, I usually end up after midnight,) but the service has ALWAYS been atrocious! If you sit at the bar, it's better, but I usually go with a group of people & we need a booth or table. It's always 15-30 minutes just for drinks & on top of that the waitstaff NEVER writes down orders, so something is ALWAYS wrong! Sometimes a drink is forgotten or the steaks are cooked wrong or the side item is wrong... It's always something & it's frustrating since you wait so long just to get these items, then forever again to get them corrected! They also never take anything off the bill to compensate you for all the trouble; it's just the way they do business. People just have to expect that & choose to go or not since it has such great drinks & food...

kenson and G are amazing!

the drinks are amazing. indescribable. the cocktails demonstrate creativity, careful research, and passion for the craft.

the flatbread is heavenly! the light and airy crunch makes me want to chew faster so I can have another bite!

fantastic staff, fantastic food, amazing happy hour, wonderful atmosphere--so good I went there two nights in a row.  Truly a place where it's a tragedy not to have a a cocktail or few--the bartenders make it look easy and the drinks are all amazing!  The food is great too:  expertly prepared steaks, soft bread with a crunchy crust and whipped butter,  linguini and clams, fun desserts.  Can't wait to come back!

This place was simply AMAZING.  Came here for my birthday dinner, and was not let down in the least.  I ordered the Flat Iron Steak with a side of Garlic Mashed Potatoes and Asparagus.  All of it was cooked to perfection.  The Flat Iron came with a side of Chimichurri sauce, but honestly it didn't need it.  The steak was seasoned extremely well.  Customer service was also top notch.  Our waitress (I forgot her name) was very nice and helpful.  Aside from their food, they're also well known for their cocktails.  She was very helpful in assisting me make a good decision based on what I was feeling like at the time.  Another thing I liked about this place was the dress code.  You can dress either casual or nice to it if you'd like.  It's not strict like some places, and if you've been out and about and haven't had time to go back and change, its a good spot.  If you don't live in Vegas, and are just visiting....then you need to try this place at least once!

One of the best cocktail bars in the States and thee best in Vegas!!! I love how the cocktail menu is set up by era. There happy hour is amazing! 50% off steaks! Wow! I got the filet. Was a perfect MR and soooo flavorful. Ended the meal with a Vittone Fernet.

This place lived up to everything I've been hearing and so happy I finally made it down here for a few drinks. I truly was impressed and far from disappointed. 

The bartenders are knowledgeable and how could they not be - there's a 100-year old drink menu here! 

From absinthe to decadent martinis, the drinks are on a whole other level of expertly made. 

The ambience is sexy, dark and full of that energy that will kick off a first date with class but also passionate with eclectic decor and just the right amount of dimness. 

I really cannot wait to try every drink off of the menu. (In moderation of course )

Sipping your way through the Golden Age, Prohibition or the Rat Pack era is an experience filled with nostalgia, loads of history and just darn good cocktails. I've been remiss, this review is a bit late but the old adage applies: better late than never. Herbs and Rye is, in a word, extraordinary. Okay, Las Vegas extraordinary if you will.  Imagine a dimly lit dining room, not large, but roomy enough to accommodate a good sized crowd. The usual bustle of a restaurant including the ambient sounds of servers taking orders, drinks being prepared and patrons boasting about the deliciousness of their meals or cocktails.

We started our evening at the bar and ordered a couple period cocktails. The Original Collins and the Martinez. Both were fantastic, but agreed we wouldn't name a favorite opting to continue trying them all. Each period cocktail has a unique taste, they really are special...each and every one mixed with expert care. It's loads of fun to sip and chat about that point in history. We opted to dine right at the bar, why not have access to master mixologist and owner Nectaly?  Ribeye for me, New York for him with his fav peppercorn sauce. Jalapeño creamed corn, mushrooms and truffle mac...all delish, I could have had a 2nd helping of the corn, it was that good.  Way too much food, but leftovers were just as tasty.

It gets quite busy here though I've never had a reservation as we tend to visit on the slower days. Take advantage the amazing happy hour prices!

Herbs and Rye is a must visit every time I'm in LV.

One of my favorite places. Always a good time at Herbs & Rye.. the staff is awesome. Great food and drinks. I love their steaks and all of the sides that you can choose from are good too. I crave it all the time. This probably wouldn't be the place to go to if you want to go somewhere quiet, especially during happy hour because they can get pretty slammed on certain days. 

Oh, and see "G" from the bar. He's the best!!

UHHH!!! My stomach feels like it is going to explode. I am so full. I cannot eat another bite... but there is still half a dish of truffle mac'n'cheese. All are common responses when visiting Herbs & Rye. 

I have been so bogged down with work, or work related situations that I was set on treating myself to a nice meal. I called up a friend and we met up for happy hour. Both of us didn't feel like drinking, so we opted for their food specials. The deals are limited to five or six items, but they offer some meals for half off. Instead of just filling up on quick fryer food, H&R includes a few steak and a pork chop entree. We began with the spicy mussels ($10 HH, $22 regular). The tomato sauce was so good that I was scooping it into empty shells to slurp down. For my entree I got the 12oz. bone in strip cooked to a medium rare with the peppercorn brandy sauce and the truffle mac ($17.50). I have to say this was near perfection. Yet, I would have been happier without the sauce. My friend had got the same steak with the chimiccuri and asparagus. I stole most of her sauce. I should have listened to our server, the chimicurri was much more flavorful and bold. Usually I am not a mac'n'cheese person. My gaze usually zooms over these words, but Robyn and Kevin L. swears by it. Luckily, I trusted them and ended up a winner. 

By the end, two steak dinners with an large order of mussels to start cost us less than $50. Even though their HH list is minimal, Herbs & Rye's offerings are more than satisfactory.

So I've been hearing about this place for a while for fellow Yelpers and been wanting to try. When I finally got the chance, we ended up having plans to go twice in the same week! If my rating was based solely on service they would've got a 1.5, based on drinks 4.5, based on food 3.
My first time there we were with a very large group ( 30+ people) on a Tuesday night at 8pm. It's not like they didn't know we were coming, but they seemed overwhelmed. They couldn't keep up with our drink orders, it took way too long to get the orders in let alone get the drink (even if it was just bourbon on the rocks). It took a long time to get our food as well, some people in our group were done and leaving when we didn't even get our food yet. They ran out of sides. Brought out sides way before our entree so the side was cold. Steaks were overdone. My lobster tail was over cooked. The food was just  "meh". We were all happy with the drink selection and drinks...when we got them.
I was turned off with that first try, but I gave them a pass since it was such a large group. And went back with some friends on Friday night around 7:30. Again, service was horrible. It took forever to get our drink orders, and it was nearly impossible to get the waiters attention if you wanted anything else. Once we ordered food, the food also took forever. I got the Calamari this time and the first time and it was good both times. I also got a Prosciutto and Asparagus Flatbread, it was good, nothing exciting, but good. My husbands steak was much better this time and his side, Broccoli and Cheese was yummy. A friend at our table never got his food when we were all done eating, so he cancelled his order. My drinks were perfect (order 2 drinks at a time because they take so long to get!) Brown Derby and Blinker, both good in their own way. It was our friends birthday so we all split some Donuts....they were awesome.
I like the decor and old fashioned vibe. I've been to this locale before it was Herbs And Rye...boy has it changed! 
The service alone would keep me from going back, not sure if I will go back. Only time will tell. Good thing they have some loyal Yelpers as patrons because they turned off a room full of people.

It's good. Great speakeasy type of vibe.

The downsides were the prices of drinks and how long it took To get them.

We had steak, meatballs and pork chop.

The meatballs are insane. Some of the best ever. The Ribeye was just meh. Nothing special. The Pork chop was great.

The Brussel Sprouts had to be sent back. Undercooked and flavorless. Swapped them for the potatos mash. Not bad!

The MAC n Chess was just average.

Is it worth the $12 Uber ride from the strip? We probably would go back to try more of the Italian food.

I was definitely surprised when I walked into this restaurant.

From the exterior, Herbs and Rye looks like the kind of place where people go for line dancing; almost shed-like... But once inside, I noticed that this place was actually very nice. Black and Red walls with all black furniture and a door concealed as a book case make you feel like you're in a 1940's Italian mafia movie. Even better, is the service which makes you feel like you're practically family.

As for the food, I enjoyed it very much. The flat bread we got as an appetizer was so good that by the time my entree came, I was full. 

The drinks selection, all from the age of prohibition, is also something I enjoyed. Most of the drinks were too strong for me but I appreciated the fact that all the juices/mixers were fresh, not to mention, it was nice to see something different. 

On a last note, this place is great because it is off the strip (so you avoid the hassles of the crowds and the valet) but you still get on the strip quality...

I should probably add that I was brought here by a local (I'm from L.A.) named Jesse. So if the people from Herbs and Rye happen to read this, you can thank him for my review :)
This place was great! We went at happy hour and sat in the bar area! Great ambiance and setting, with even better food!

The food was very pricy and if your ready to spend that much go!
The service was good, he was that typical waiter, doesn't want to come to the table to much. 

I order the Pork and fig, it was super delicious, but I, as a cook myself, have never cooked a pork as rare as I had it. I couldn't really tell because the lighting was really dark, but the next I'm completely sick!!! I have never had to actually order the TEMP of pork before! If someone does not want it well done they say so! But the only reason I'm suffering right now is because I gave them the benefit of the doubt and believed in the cooks!

IF YOU ORDER THE PORK MAKE SURE YOU TELL THEM A TEMP TO!! because apparently it's a new thing to cook them medium RARE!! 

My boyfriend got the strip steak which he order rare and was perfectly cooked!
My girl friend got the salmon. I tried as well it was delicious.
They both loved the mash potatoes!

For dessert, they had home-made doughnuts with two different sauces, a white coconut and a delicious buttery caramel. Me and my girl friend over stuffed our faces with dessert!

"I could of skipped dinner and just had that dessert!" - we all said.


The alcohol selection was fantastic! I've tried scotch for the first time. I don't prefer it, but it was so cool, the one mix drink they have with scotch, they hold an orange peel over the alcohol and light the top on fire. SUPER cool.

The atmosphere was beautiful, the lighting kept changing in the middle of our dinner, which was weird. 

My girl friend that took me loves this place for the scotch, it's not my scene, but for someone that likes really good aged alcohol will love this place.

This review is for both the food and the cocktails. 

The food is good and should not be classified as bar food. The quality of the ingredients and the preparation make this a place worth eating.

You should come for the cocktails. If you like a good cocktail this is easily one of the best places in Vegas. They carry spirits and cordials that most bartenders haven't heard of. The preparation is generally spot on.

They have some stupid rules about splitting checks with large parties. That is enough to keep me from eating there in a large group ever again.

Originally came here for the Mixology part of things, was not disappointed on that front. First 3-4 times I came here was perfectly happy... but then the patron to my right ordered food, life had changed. Steak happy hour I discover is between 4-8 and 12-4am you will be more then satisfied 50% off steaks that you would be happy to pay 200% for. Between the steaks, the calamari, the chorizo meatballs... this place is a gem! Doesn't look much from the outside but crack the door have a seat enjoy a "everybody knows my name" top knotch experience. Granted even with the happy hour steaks a 2 hour visit normally rings in about $130 with all the drinks you won't be able to resist, I pay it with a smile and shake the bartenders hand with a gracious tip of the hat. Favorite place for dinner in Vegas hands down. *Pro Tip* Rebel Republic is right across the street one of the best craft beer spots in LV pay them a visit first to wet the whistle, great beers friendly staff, tell Wendy I sent ya ;).

Fun atmosphere and drink list. It was hard to pick out our cocktails with so many good ones to choose from. Only wish they had more whiskey options. Enjoyed the food too. Steak was seasoned well and cooked just right. Pork fell off the bone, delicious.

One of the best kept secrets if there is anything still in Las Vegas. We came here around 12.30-1AM and it was during their happy hour. 

We ordered the New York Strip and Ribeye (Medium Rare for both, anything cooked beyond Medium is a waste) and got Garlic Mash and Mac & Cheese as sides. Food only came out to $50 and was split between three people. 

For drinks we ordered:

Black Thorne - Reminds me of the Aviator at Sand Dollar

Two Gin & Tonics

So worth it and worth coming back to monthly or weekly....

A previous reviewer's characterization of Herbs & Rye as "old style mixology" is wholly accurate. Seek out this local gem for the drinks, whether at the bar or in the dinning room. If you visit the latter, you will have the opportunity to peruse their historically inspired drink menu, which includes anecdotes and legends all the way back to the 1800s. This is a place you should feel entirely comfortable ordering the "Bartender's Choice," a beverage custom selected and mixed to your personality. Our waiter was discerning enough to recognize that my girlfriend did not have the fruity pallette of the usual Ladies' Night patron and brought her a proper whiskey drink.
Appropriately,  the hospitality matches the mixology, fostering an incredibly welcoming and appreciative atmosphere. Our waiter Christian, who some keen locals might recognize from Makers and Finders, not only remembered me from the coffee shop, but took extra care to present my girlfriend and I some of his favorite samples from both the drink and dinner menu.
Let us not forget that Herbs & Rye is also a steakhouse. In the classically inspired environment with speakeasy decor, you will find your traditional, hearty butcher cuts even more savery. 
Herbs & Rye is a great place for locals to become regulars. When your friends visit to experience the Boulevard, keep this in your back pocket for a surprise, after they have exhausted themselves with our city's signature extravagance and request something unassuming, delectable, and welcoming.
This place never gets old food is delicious environment it's fun love to order almost about all the desserts they have the best fried donuts but their food is really good the drinks are delicious

Holy moly....

My friends decided to bring me here for happy hour/dinner. The food was fantastic! I had the filet with blue cheese crusted bacon. Omg delicious! Cooked to perfection, and the bacon and blue cheese were just the right touch. Happy hour is amazing here, it's half off steaks! How can you beat that!? The well drinks are also only $5.00 during happy hour, and they have a bottle of red, and a bottle of white that are half off as well. 

The only complaint that I would have is that the service is a teeny bit slow. My husband ordered a beer which the server forgot to bring, and when he finally remembered my husband was half way through his meal and decided not to have it any more. I don't fully blame the server since I feel it was only him and one other person serving tables, and it was busy. Other than the few minor mishaps, all was well! I will definitely be returning!

Best place in town for a craft cocktail. The staff is very professional and know their stuff. I really enjoyed flipping through their menu and picking different cocktails from different eras. The food is really good as well! Its pricy but it's worth every penny. You get your full worth for sure!!!!
Always enjoyable to take out if towners to thus local spot. Food delicious and minimal wait time of 20 mins.

Herbs & Rye from the bar scene perspective gets 5 starz from us.  We haven't ate there yet, but have enjoyed the crafted cocktails on a few occasions.  Took a couple friends last night that hadn't been before.  They were impressed by the cocktail craftsmanship.  We were lucky enough to be served by the only female mixologist, Emily & she's the bomb!  When we were in New Orleans we found out that Herbs & Rye consistently wins the annual cocktail competitions & they are so modest about it.  Emily was wearing her mixology pin award on her vest.  They also dress to impress - very professional & passionate about their craft.  Our friend asked for Campari & Emily suggested a better brand for her to try & it beat out Campari.  Another Italian Brand pictures here...

When we moved to Vegas we made a list of all the steakhouses we wanted to try here...SO many to choose from. After reading reviews and looking at menus online our list narrowed. Herbs and Rye made the list though and we are so glad it did. We had dinner with friends here last night. When you drive up, it's just a average looking place. When you walk in from the Vegas sun, you feel like the place has no power...lol...it's so dark inside, it takes a minute for your eyes to adjust...then you finally see the hostess waiting at the end of the hallway to greet and seat you. We had made reservations because I had a feeling it would be busy on a Friday night, during Happy Hour where ALL steaks are 50% off!!!!! Yes you read it correctly!!! 5pm to 8pm ALL steaks are 50% off.  We were then seated at a great booth inside the bar...now if you are looking for a nice quiet dinner, don't let them seat you in the bar. We didn't mind sitting there. The energy was fun...it was loud like a bar that is hopping should be. We were the 1st to arrive and greeted by our waiters assistant...he got us nice cold water and we then met our waiter Ronald. He greeted us, asked us if we had ever been to Herbs and Rye and since we said it was our 1st time he went over the menu with us! We ordered cocktails while we waited for our friends to arrive. The bar menu is amazing...a ton to choose from. We however like tiki drinks so we ordered painkillers.  They came quickly to us in these beautiful large tiki cups...1 drink had me tipsy...honestly after 1/4 of the drink I was feeling it. They were yummy.  The bar atmosphere and decor were great...very classic & old school.  Ronalds assistant was very attentive with our water needs...we needed it with the vegas heat..hydration is important! ;) 
Our friends arrived and we finally were able to order! I ordered a filet mignon and had it was Bleu cheese crusted, the truffle Mac.n.cheese, and we shared a Cesar salad.  My man ordered the Ribeye and had the chimichuri seasoning, which is garlic olive oil and seasonings added and asparagus. We shared the sides. We also shared a side of garlic mashed with our friend. Our friend ordered the pork chop and our other friend ordered the filet flat bread with arugula. 
When the food arrived, steaks were on their own plates and the sides were served in individual little casserole dishes, so very easy to share. 
I have to say...it was one of the BEST filets I have had, juicy and tender and taking a bite of the man's Ribeye it was the BEST Ribeye I had ever tasted. The flavor was amazing.  The asparagus was cooked to perfection with butter and lemon. The mac.n.cheese was creamy and had a crust on the top that was crunchy. The mashed potatoes I didn't try but my man said it was really good. Our Cesar salad we had earlier was delicious as well. The dressing was garlicky and peppery! We were also served hot bread and butter that was delicious!!
