But honestly the BEST part of the entire experience was the attention from our waiter. Customer service is a HUGE part for me...and this was spot on!!! Thank you for not only an amazing meal but a wonderful experience!!!  We will 110% be going back!!

Good place for a steak and if you come during happy hour it's a great deal. Steak is always cooked perfectly and they have a wide variety of sides and toppings to add to the steak. My favorite is the thick cut bacon pefectly cooked and goes well with the steak. The donuts are also a must at any vist...sugary and warm served with two dipping sauces. I've ordered the framboise multiple times and the bill always reflects a higher price than the menu price so watch for that. And if coming with larger parties they don't like making separate checks and charge a sharing fee.

This is one of the few places in Vegas where you need a reservation to get in. But once you are in, you know why.

Their steaks are one of the best in town, and so very worth it during happy hour. Their sides are also great. Very rich and filling. Their appetizers are awesome. Honestly, I have yet to have anything I don't want to go back for. 

Love the boozy, speakeasy vibe. My only gripes are the parking and music at night can be too loud. 

Definitely worth trying if you have not already been.
Visited Friday night for the 1st time. Great atmosphere, great food, and entertaining bartenders. Well done ... I'll be back

Outstanding service, delicious/delectable food, phenomenal craft cocktails, and just a great overall experience. 

My boyfriend and I sat at the bar - luckily it wasn't too busy because we had the pleasure of Kinson's service. He's exceptionally attentive, polite with a hint of edgy, experienced, competent, and more than willing to cater to your specifications. His recommendations were completely spot on - side dishes to pairings to everything! They want you to have a great time here!!
 

I see that there are some complaints about the wait times and parking lot. The parking lot - I'm not sure what could've been done. As for the wait....1.) The food is worth it 2.) Most great restaurants have wait times 3.) Reservations are good

I have to say that I love Yelp!  At first glance I would have never stepped foot in to Herbs and Rye but based on the reviews we read hubby and I decided to give it a shot.  Much to our delight we found another locals spot that we will be sure to frequent.   However, take note that you do not come here for the service.  The waistaff was nice enough but didn't seem to have their at together.

Now on to the fun stuff...
Mussels in tomato sauce was awesome.  Enjoy the fresh hot bread and soak up every drop of the sauce.
The carpaccio was great although a little less of the mayo type sauce would have made it perfect!! 
Dinner consisted of the family style portion of the linguine and clams.  Great flavor and good sized portion.  It would be great to automatically bring up the proper bowls And utensils to we could enjoy dinner.
We were too full for dessert.

Another cool feature are the cocktails.  They have quite the throwback list and crush their ice in a bag, old fashioned style.  


Definitely a spot to try if you're looking for a new place to eat and drink!!!


***  ADDITION TO THE REVIEW  ***
We went back for another dinner.  Appetizers were the same as above but we made different dinner selections.  The notable selection was the Ribeye with Green Chimichurri sauce.  DELICIOUS.

However, the one that WINS it all are the homemade donuts to order.  A total MUST!!  They are miniature donuts with powered sugar.  Absolutely finger licking good.   Not a good take home item for later though.  Once they were cold they weren't so yummy...  so enjoy hot and eat them all!

Yeah, okay, I know there are a bunch of 5 star ratings on here and very easily they could be justified, maybe we hit the place on the wrong night.

The food with the exception of one thing was excellent, far far better than I was expecting.

For me, the Kansas city cut steak with truffle and parm fries.
For the wife, a Caesars salad and the sliders.

The salad was excellent, a good bite to the dressing, the sliders were also very good, though a little over cooked IMHO.

The steak, while listed as choice, I would not have argued if I had been told it was prime, it was a darn good steak, perfectly cooked.

The fries...Yeah, here we go again..... Okay, the rest of the food shows that the chef knows how to cook and present good food, damn good food in fact, so why does he think that buy in bulk US food fries should in any way, shape or form be found in this restaurant ?????

Seriously, this place could easily hit it out of the park, but when you are charging $7.50 for fires, hand cut them, they taste better, they look better and they are cheaper in the long run.

So now you are probably wondering why I only gave 3 stars, sure if you know the way I rate places you would be thinking a 4 star review, well yep, minus 1 star for the BS fries.

But the service, wow, yeah, this was the let down for me in a big way, the place isn't that big, there were 3 waitresses working and yet they all seemed to be running around doing nothing, as I said, maybe a bad night, those do happen, but it really could have been so much better. Slow to take the order, slow to get drinks, slow to refill drinks, slow to clear plates, slow to give the check.

The place certainly has a great ambiance,  this is a place I would bring friends, one small issue, the music could do with being a touch lower, on a couple of the jazz numbers the trumpet note just went right through me, I could see the same reaction from a few others, so I am guessing it's not me just being an old fart...Though I will say, it's nowhere near the level of say Fire Fly which can be stupidly loud at times.

Last little thing..The happy hour...If your going to offer a happy hour on food and drinks, maybe something other than the steaks and a couple of clam dishes, which btw, made them prices I would happily pay, the regular price for say clams and linguine is $28...Yeah sure.

Drink prices as well, great to offer half price drinks, but when the regular price for a Pimm's cup is $22, your not really offering much, btw, the cost is just under a dollar to make that drink and while I will say, the bartender we were watching is maybe one of the best in Vegas, it's still a stupid mark up.

Yes I know, a lot of negative, easy fixes for the most part and yes, we will be going back, fingers crossed the service issues were just a bad night.

Quite possibly the best steak I've ever had. 

The truffle mac and cheese was good. But not a great compliment to the steak. The broccoli with cheese and the whipped garlic mashed were both amazing and complimented my steak perfectly. The rib-eye is the only way to go. Perfectly seared on the outside and perfect pink on the inside. When you order medium, medium is what you get. For 3 of us, during happy hour, with 1 cocktail, came to about $150.

Ive come here several times over the years. One of the best and friendliest cocktail bars. So tonight, I just have to compliment Charlie (the one and only) as our waiter! By far one of the most helpful, professional, and great waiters Ive ever had the pleasure of being helped by. His recommendations were superb!!! Kudos to the bartenders who skillfully crafted my cocktails and the chefs who cooked our steaks. Also shout out to the additional staff who ensured we promptly had bread and water. I love this establishment and the ambience. If you are a local and haven't been here yet, you are missing out.

I personally really loved the food and my server Mark too.  My co worker who I met after work at 2am was really cranky and I don't think she realizes how heneious she was coming off but I woulda as a server would've been compelled to tell her to go screw herself.  Mark was so patient and awesome.  It was late and lowered in there and it was a bunch of young people in there... was a really cool hip bar but I didn't expect the price to be as expensive as they were so I just had the beef tartare and shared bread pudding with my other guest.  Food was yummy.  Seriously Mark if you're reading this you're awesome and I'm sorry you're last table of the night was a yucca table!!

Food = amazing. Great steak and lobster, mash and asparagus were delicious. Our service (debra) was not good. Full waters- check. Food delivered hot- check. After a delicious cocktail- our server disappeared. We were through bread and salad and a wait............ then we asked our food runner for our server to get wine with our steak.  Ridiculous. Finally got wine. She again never returned. Hubby had to flag her down to get the check (and we are not fast eaters - this was a 2 Hour meal- which we love). Server lost out and it's unlikely we will be back.

I think the broken sign and nondescript door all play into the prohibition theme of this restaurant....   A coworker told me about the happy hour here that runs from 5-8pm and 12am-3am....HALF OFF STEAKS! WHAT?!  Now that is my kind of happy hour! The 18oz boneless ribeye was $24 and comes with a side.  The ribeye was cooked perfectly and marbled well with fat.  We tried a few sides since we were with some friends.  Honestly, the sides were underwhelming (jalapeno creamed corn, sweet potato tots, brussel sprouts).  I definitely would not pay the regular price for the sides again.  A few of the appetizers were half price, so we tried the spicy mussels ($13).  The marinara sauce that these mussels come with is addicting, we kept asking for more bread to sop up all the sauce.  The bread is warm, freshly toasted baguette and perfect for soaking up all the garlicky goodness.    Honestly, the price of most of their happy hour items is what I would probably expect to pay normally.  The items on their food menu seem grossly overpriced for this location, so unless you are here for happy hour....I say there are better options.  I highly recommend if you want a good steak and don't want to pay a visit to your cheap steakhouses like Outback, then to come give Herbs and Rye a try.  Also make sure to sit in the bar area, the regular dining area seemed dead.

I enjoy coming to Herbs & Rye. I love the atmosphere that makes me feel like I went back in time to an old fashioned whiskey bar. The happy hour is amazing! The drinks are well priced and steaks were half off! I tried the ribeye and the porterhouse. Both were tender,  delicious, and cooked to perfection. The bartender made the best bourbon sour I have ever had. I can not wait to come back here again for some more steaks and whiskey cocktails.

Diamond in the rough. Always try to stop by Herbs and Rye any time we want a good steak for a decent price. With all the choices in Vegas, this place is definitely a winner.  The building that it is in looks a but inconspicuous.  You wouldn't expect it to be as nice as it is from the outside.  Once you walk inside, the decor is classy with dimly lit booths and a Prohibition era decor complete with waiters and bar staff dressed in that time period.  Every time I walk in, it makes me feel like I've stepped in to a time warp and I'm having dinner and drinks in Old Vegas fashion.  

A go to must is their happy hour.  All the food that is marked in their menu is half off.  I believe their happy hour is from 5 to 8 and from midnight to close.  I've been here at least 5 times and their steaks are always exceptional.  My bf and I usually share both of our sides. You get one side per entree.  You can pay a little extra for sauces such as their house chimichurri but with a good steak cooked well, its not necessary. Save the extra bucks and try out the various cocktails they have on the menu.

Delicious! From the fancy cocktails to the food! There is some sort of history for each cocktail and the menu really catches your eye with the graphics. Tried a chicken risotto dish that was amazing and had a bite off of a steak that was realllllly tender. My date ordered a drink that the waiter lit on fire! Little dinner and a show there. Highly recommend this place if you're looking to impress.
Don't be fooled by the questionable building! This place is a gem. Great ribeye! The owner in super nice.

Omg love this place! The ambiance was super cool like prohibition era the drinks were very crafty and tasty. We sat at the bar and Emily served us she was awesome she suggested what to eat and drink and it turned out great. We had filets, Mac and cheese, mashed potatoes and clams for appetizer. Christian the manager came over and greeted us to make sure our dinner was up to par. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for good food. My fiancé and I were so surprised and have been raving about it.
The service is amazing. I loved our server, his knowledge and enthusiasm. The food was spot on and full of flavor. This place is a must try hands down.

Best steak my fiancé and I have ever had. We shared the ribeye and it melted in our mouths. Well, best everything. The Mac and cheese, spinach, and truffle fries were insane. Let's back it up to the appetizers. Carpaccio and mussels were out of this world. Even the bread and the happy hour drinks. Our waiter Charlie even hooked us up with a free desert. He was incredible and super attentive even though very busy. We wish this place was in our hometown. Amazing.

As a Las Vegas local, it's nice to get away from the Strip and the hub bub that surrounds it. My boyfriend made reservations here ( which I recommend because it gets busy! ) for my birthday.  When you walk in the door,  the ambiance is what hits you.  It's dark, inviting and oh so swanky.   We were seated quickly and handed a menu.  I knew before we arrived that happy hour is half off steaks from 5pm-8pm & 12am-3am.  

 We ordered the spicy mussels, which was also a happy hour price.  Delicious.  The bread served along with it was super fresh, warm and toasty.   Mark, our server was very nice and knowledgable about the menu. They specialize in classic old school cocktails.  I ordered the "Blood and Sand", which paired really well with the lamb and risotto, which was also delicious.

My boyfriend ordered the steak.  It was so tender and cooked perfectly...just excellent.  

Staff is very friendly and attentive.  If you are looking for a memorable foodie and cocktail experience, this is the place for you.

Came here for my work anniversary with my team from work. We called ahead for a restaurant and ended up getting a table after the happy hour (8pm). Parking is a pain and I quickly remembered when I arrived that I should've taken a ride share. Food is really good. Ended up ordered the surf and turf which canes with a filet, lobster tail, mashed potatoes and asparagus. Staff was friendly and the service was fast considering it was a group of 8 of us.

This place is awesome!  Make sure you go during happy hour; you won't be disappointed!  My wife and I took our children there at 630 on Saturday night and were surprised when we got our check and was half off!   This is the first restaurant we've been to in a long time where I was content with the amount we spent.

Was looking forward to trying this place out. Went online and made a reservation. The website was easy to navigate. About an hour before my reservation time, the restaurant called and said my reservation was canceled. This seems very unprofessional and left me and the rest of my party stranded on a Saturday night. I don't think I will be scheduling a reservation online again.

Best bartenders and cocktail experience I have ever had. As a former bartender I was truly impressed by them. There may be fancier places, but Herbs & Rye has better drinks than them. Also its one of the only places in Vegas where drink prices haven't been insane.

I've been to Herbs & Rye twice and, my goodness, this place is gooood! Excellent customer service, well executed food and superior craft cocktails are a few things you have in store when you dine here. Do not judge this place by the outside appearance, cause as soon as you step into the restaurant you feel as if you walked onto the set of a beautifully executed speakeasy scene in a movie. The dim lighting perfectly complements the atmosphere they are going for. 

They have happy hour Monday-Friday from 5-8 (a late night happy hour too) where you can get a juicy, savory, perfectly prepared 18oz ribeye for a little more than $30. That's hard to beat for a premium steakhouse. Everything, and I mean everything, I've tried was extremely tasty. I'm not embellishing at all. Their calamari appetizer was one of the best I've ever had (it's a big portion, perfect size for a group of four) and it comes with strips of prosciutto and banana peppers. The Yardbird and risotto is one of my favorite non-steak dishes at this place. The linguini and clams are some of the best I've ever tasted. There are no wrong choices at this place. The only problem I have is getting too full before my entree arrives. 
 
This place is great for celebrating birthdays, which was why we came...The server, Mr. Logan (I can't recall his first name) took excellent care of our party, so I wanted to give him a special shout out. Again, this is easily one of the best restaurants off the strip in Las Vegas. Do yourself a favor and dine at Herbs & Rye

I have been here many times, we were a party of three. We came in the Hostesses were rude, they didn't greet us, didn't initiate contact. They were too busy talking to each other. We initially wanted to sit at the bar but it was full and didn't have seats for three. Seeing as how they had plenty tables open we went back and told one of the hostess we wanted a table instead. They told us there would be a 10 min wait we didn't understand why, they didn't even explain, so we waited the 10 mins. After 15 mins, people were leaving and we were growing tired of waiting especially with tables open. We were waiting behind the hostess booth and we saw they were searching images on google. The hostess would look at us and not even say anything, not even a "Sorry for waiting". We were tired so we decided to go back to the bar. The bartender came and asked us what we wanted to drink, we asked for a drink that had egg white in it. His response was "I don't know we have a lot of those drinks, you need to give me more info." After more inconveniences, we decided to leave and not order anything.

Abundant grilled meats, a bonanza of specialty cocktails.  Very few beers.

I like this place, overall, but the hostesses are definitely the weak point from my experience. 
Made a reservation three weeks prior for a large party to celebrate a friend's retirement.  When we arrived, we stood at the podium unacknowledged while three employees carried on a work conversation for almost a minute. While I know a business requires employee communication, it would have been appropriate to say "Hi, I'll be with you in a moment."  

Considering our reservation was 6pm, most of the dining room was empty, but the bar was packed three deep. The hostess never made arrangements for our group table to be assembled and forced ten of us to stand in the narrow hallway, until the full party arrived. In my opinion, they should have seated us at our table and taken drink orders, if for nothing more than the convenience of their staff and other guests.

Finally, at about 6:15 after I pressed the point, the hostess spoke to some staff and led us to be seated... at two tables of six. Two tables? What? No. That's not what a group reservation means. Then as we stood watching, in the way again, the staff arranged one long table. Finally, we were seated. Things went much better from there.

Our server was pleasant and worked both ends of the table to ensure everyone knew about their 5-8pm food and beverage happy hour.  It took a long time to get our food, but it came out close to together and was relatively tasty. The available time was consumed along with conversation and cocktails. We were a happy bunch. I had the NY Strip, a well-portioned steak with delicious seasoning and cooked to perfection.

Above all, I want to recognize our assistant server, Andre. He was always on top of things.  Bread, water, removing spent glassware, even taking orders for fresh drinks.  Honestly, if it wasn't for Andre, this would be a three-star review.

The kitchen puts out good food.  The servers and assistants were good.  The establishment needs to empower the hostesses to be problem-solvers instead of rule-followers.  Lastly, for  those who enjoy beer, a broader selection would be appreciated, even if it's bottled.

Nice joint.  I'll visit again, but not with more than five friends.

Our first stop after driving 4 hours on the I-15 to get into Vegas.    We timed it just perfectly and made it for HH on a Friday night.  We were really excited to try Herbs & Rye and it did not disappoint. We ordered a Ribeye with  Mushrooms & Onions to share and a Linguine & Clam.  Both tasted amazing and were totally worth the money.  Robbie, our server, did an amazing job and we tried to show our appreciation for his service.  We'll tell all of our LA friends to come here when in town and we expect to make this our go to spot at least once when we're in Vegas.

My new favorite spot! Skeptical at first from the looks of the outside and location. But was amazed with the ambiance, service and menu! Happy hour is amazing! Delicious food for half the price. Truffle Mac is a must have!

This place has very little parking, its noisy and dark, its small. The Caesar salad is nothing special and the calamari was chewy. With all that, this place is awesome hahah. The steak was incredible and if you don't get the bacon on it you are a fool. It is the most delicious bacon I've ever had. The sides are nice as well. The beat is that if you eat there before 8 you get half off your steak. This only adds to the enjoyment. This place is fun, crowded, and has phenomenal steak. Just be prepared to park in a shady alley.

This place is a gem! The happy hour steak prices are killer! My steak was delicious because of how flavorful it was. However, the food quality here is not very impressive. I'm guessing because of the prices. The asparagus were cold and slathered in oil and garlic. The donuts I felt were very cheap tasting, kinda watery flavor and bland.

If you're looking for good cocktails made right, this is the place. Dimly lit classy establishment located inside a little brick building. Great date night spot. 

They open at 5 pm, we arrived at 5:08 pm and already there was a line out the door. We placed our name on the waiting list with the hostess, who quoted us 15 minute wait. The host texts you when the table is ready so you don't have to keep checking back in, which is nice. Our wait time was a perfect amount of time to grab a drink at the bar. The bartender was nice. I didn't know what specifically to order but told him I don't like dry drinks but a little light and fruity. He said he knew exactly what to make and it was delicious. 

The drink menu here is extensive and the cocktails are separated by each era, which i found to be very unique and cool. The prohibition era and etc. 

Our server was great and took the time to thoroughly explain options on the menu we had questions about.  

 Pros: Great first date spot to leave a great impression, Classy restaurant with great service, Great happy hour specials with late night happy hour options as well. Dimly lit cool brick building with an old vegas style vibe with great cocktails. I would recommendation trying the sweet potato tater tots or the garlic mash potatoes 

Cons: Small space so wait times if you don't have a reservation 

Tips: I would highly recommend making a reservation. This place fills up!  On Happy hour, anything on the menu with double red stars is half off!

I popped in late Friday night for food and drinks with friends and had an absolute blast. I have been here before and have always had a great experience. This was no exception.

Friday night we shared a carpaccio (a fave of mine, as some of you know, and so I am ultra persnickety about this dish), a pork loin dish, salads, and... I feel like we had half the menu between us... and there were only 5 of us! The food was perfectly cooked (or not, as appropriate), seasoned, and, truly, wasn't on the plate long at all. A lot of "you *have* to taste this!" and "I'll fight you for the last bite of that..." was heard amongst our little group. (To be fair, I think I may have stabbed someone with a fork while uttering that last bit...)

Not to be outdone by the food, the bartenders were on their game. We all went for the "Herbs & Rye"... a drink that is decided upon by whosoever is keeping the bar. We were treated to their famous classic cocktails (one of the best menus in town for these oldies but goodies), never receiving the same one twice, and sometimes finding them with a twist or a dash or a splash, to make them even more creative. Much like the food, drinks were passed around and lauded and coveted. Repeatedly.

The space is small and cozy without being stifling or claustrophobic, the decor is dark and enveloping, lit perfectly, and seems to transport you out of Vegas - or maybe just to a Vegas long gone (in other words, no seizure-inducing, flashing-light video game machines or clang of slots machines). 

Intimate and social all at once, there are romantic booths, classic table seating, or, do what we did... belly up to the bar and trust the people behind it. You won't be disappointed.
Perfect spot off the strip! Has an old 40's lounge feel.  Great music, great food, great service!

Following a rather busy Saturday, a small contingent of us managed to get a late dinner in.  I only heard good hollers about this joint so took a detour from the Commonwealth (still never been to yet) to give them a try since the couple we was with lives deep in Hendo.

From the outside, the place looks like a dive bar or possibly even strip club or swinger bar appearance, with no windows or accents other than a well lit sign.  There is parking around the building and the place can be found on the south side of Sahara.

Upon entrance, I immediately dug the atmosphere.  Very dim lighting for those scared of the dark, lol.  It is deceivingly spacious inside and well designed in several sections for dining and the more bustling bar area.  

There was a pretty sick DJ in there spinning hits with the accompanying music videos to match.  Unfortunately, we were seated in a four person booth that was directly under on of the speaker monitors, making it extremely hard to communicate.  We resorted to sign language and drunken facial features before long.  

There is a vast menu of custom cocktails and saison beers.  Nothing extravagant, but offers a little more than your mainstream domestics and imports.  They brew their own beer as well but went with Chimay (red label) and recommended it to my buddy who is not accustomed to Trappist beer.  The ladies went with some cocktail that was a bit sour for my taste and probably explains why I didn't get its name.  

For dinner, there is two happy hours, one in the early evening and a reverse happy hour later at midnight.  All items with a star next to it are half off, considering some of the steaks range from average prices up to $160+.  My homie went with a New York steak, his lady the clam linguine, and I shared a medium rare rib eye with my girl.  Steaks are aged and grilled well.  Defiantly good cuts.  We got there about 11 and killed some time with the carpaccio, calamari and shrimp cocktail until happy hour hit.  Oh yeah the mac and cheese was on point as well.  Not nearly as good as DW Bistro though.

The decor is hip and trendy.  The bar was packed and this place seems to cater to a nice variety of heads.  A boat load of friends drove in from Cali on a whim and met over here before hitting up Spearmint Rhino for one of the girl's barfday.  It got a bit busier then and they were in the secluded section all on their own, and sadly, was not pleased with the waitresses neglect to them like some orphans with B.O.  (poor things).

The overall experience was great and can see ourselves coming by in the future, either to pre funk before a headliner venue, or just to get a late bite to eat.  The place is a hit and was highly recommended from my co dub and another couple.

Oh yeah, since the place is about rye's, don't forget to get the Sazerac...after a few, I dubbed it the commissioner sazerac (sic) instead of Sisolak...go figure.

Okay...knocked another one of my bookmarked places off the bucket list last Friday.  I am only rating the drinks as I did not try any food nonetheless well crafted cocktails flow here.  I had a triple play of ward eight, remember the Maine and some offshoot of a sazerac cocktail.  I enjoyed the ambiance and talking with Nectaly.  I will be back for drinks and will bring a flashlight to read the menu...heard good comments on the food.

So many moons ago, all my friends told me to try this restaurant out. It took me almost a year to make it there. 
On Friday, I called at 7:30 p.m. for a reservation, the hostess said 8:45 p.m., I was fine with that since it was short notice.  I knew I was going to be early, so I already knew I would have a wait. 
I arrived about 8:10 p.m., checked in, and the hostess, took us right back to a table for two. 

Alycia was our server, and she was very attentive to our needs. As we both were first timers she went through the basics of the menu for us. Gave us a little history lesson about the restaurant. 

I ordered the double pork on the bone with mash potatoes. (pictures below), and my friend ordered the Kitchen Sink(also pictured below).

Alycia made it a point to run through the temperature process for me on the pork chops since the closer to the bone will be different.

Two nonalcoholic drinks, and refilled water until we could float. 

The food came out hot and fresh. The pork was cooked exactly the way she said it would come out. Very minimal fat and the mash potatoes were very tasty.

The Kitchen Sink was mixed seafood in a red sauce with a kick.  My friend loves spicy food and she loved the sauce and meal.  Her biggest concern was some of the shell based food had small broken shells throughout the sauce which you just need to watch for. 

At the of our stay, Val came over to check in on us. Pleasant and personable. She also with some prompting gave us the back story of the restaurant.  

The total was 95.00  for two.

Ok....if you like great food and amazing drinks it's a must. If not, don't go. This joint is frequented with locals and including the local celebrity chefs. First you will feel like you are back in the 20-30's with the hip style. The all male staff (minus the hostess) don't just know the menu, but they're mixology experts. We started with the meatballs, and WOW!!! We followed it up with a filet with the signature herd rub and double pork chop....no words will describe the taste. I've had the best of the best and this is better! Swing in, belly up to the bar and have the meal of your life. P.S....you're welcome.

After volunteering at the Wine Walk at Town Square for 4 hours, it was already close to 10:30pm and BFF Mel C. and I still needed to eat some food, even though it was way past my bedtime.  We picked Herbs & Rye on the fly and it was a nice choice, especially since they stay open late.

I had:
tomato bisque with grilled cheese 
side of truffle mac n cheese
some of the calamari that Mel ordered

First of all, it's dark in there.  I had a hard time reading my menu.  They play really good music.  The service is great and our food came out fast.  Maybe because I couldn't see that well in the dark or because I was sleepy, I didn't realize my soup came with a grilled cheese sandwich.  I probably wouldn't have ordered the mac n cheese side, but then again, I love mac n cheese and theirs was flavorful. I enjoyed everything I had except the calamari.  There was too much going on there with some assorted toppings and I'm not even sure what they were:  green peppers, green onions, some kind of mayo dressing?  I had to dig towards the bottom of the bowl to get to some of the calamari that was untouched by all that stuff.  
Overall, it was a great meal and I enjoyed the ambiance of the place.  We'll have to go back to try one of the alcoholic concoctions on the menu that looked great and when I'm more awake.

Hand downs to this amazing, cozy, heartwarming place to hang out by the bar or to have fillfuling dinner. I see why this place is crowded and busy! I made a reservation on an open table online a few days before and I received a confirmation call on the day of. Wonderful! I dig their happy hour, on which I did not know until it was mention by Mark, our great guy who took down our orders. I wanted to surprised my fiance for his early birthday cause he likes steaks. He enjoyed his ribeye very much, perfect medium rare and it was a huge portion! Everything that has two red stars on the menu are half off for happy hours! The spicy mussels are a must to order. As well as the linguini clam dish on which I ordered. Truffles fries all the way also! Steak cut fries are the bomb! We didn't finish our dinner cause it was a lot! And we did not eat anything all day too.. We pack in to go boxes to bring the rest home. Even the hot fresh donuts that was brought out, desserts w a lit candle dish, on the house cause of my fiance birthda. it was totally awesome and surprised! Overall, great services, &. tasty favorful foods! We will be back.

This place has been on our radar for a while now but we finally got around to checking it out when some friends suggested it for dinner.

We arrived a little early so we made our way to the end of the bar where we were lucky enough to grab two seats.  I started to run through their extensive list of cocktails and it took me a few seconds to realize how neato their menu was, broken down by eras.  It was sort of educational but fun, cuz it was booze. 

Because I'm a fan of egg white drinks, I went with the Pisco Sour (also a fan of this drink anyway). And this was a doozy.  It was the fluffiest drink ever and the best Pisco Sour I've ever had the pleasure of throwing back.  I think the bartender's name was Joe.  He employed a multi-step shaking process and definitely got the volume other bartenders covet.

Our friends showed up and we made our way to the entry area to greet them.  Unfortunately, the only damper on the evening was how long it took them to seat us since we had reservations and the table (as well as other tables) had vacant and ready to go since we started waiting.  Maybe they were trying to scrounge up a server?  I dunno.

Food was impressive on the whole.  To start, we the calamari which was deep fried but then tossed with some sweet and hot peppers.  Yum!

For the main event, I ordered the filet mignon while hubby got the double cut pork chop.  Hubby thought the pork chop was decent, though a little overcooked.  My filet mignon was a perfect "rare" as requested.  Yum!  We shared a few sides including the jalapeno cream corn (delicious), garlicky spinach (really garlicky but not my cup o'tea due to a sweetness you don't usually get in this dish), and truffle mac & cheese (must order).

During dinner, I had a couple more drinks - the Hemingway Daiquiri (good and not at all like the pink slushy stuff you think of when you hear "daiquiri") then went back to the Pisco Sour.  Unfortunately, this next Pisco Sour wasn't as fantastic as the first one.  Oh well!

Service was pretty attentive.  Our friends happened to be familiar with our guy (though I don't fault him for pretending to remember them) because he used to be the bartender.  He was very friendly, helpful and attentive.

Definitely going to be a place for us to come back to, especially for the drinks!

This place used to be good. Now there is a rude big sized bartender with a scruffy long beard working there  I won't mention his name but if you go there and he still working there you'll know. Right from the start you could tell he was a jerk. Ask him questions about the drinks and he's very vague and seems bothered like he doesn't want to be working there. He definitely shouldn't be making drinks as he pours careless without using any jiggers. I ask him his name he knew we has rude and he goes do you want to talk to my manager and I said I would call him another day and he said please do. I can tell you this much until he's fired I won't recommend this place anymore or come back.  This is the owners fault for hiring a rude careless person.

Ok half off steaks is a pretty killer deal, especially for a fantastic steak, let's be honest! Also had the little neck clams which were amazing and the spinach parpadelle pasta which was prepared great and tasted delicious!cocktails were on point, unique and tasty. The trance music was a little off putting with the classic speakeasy vibe, i felt like it clashed. Being in the service industry I'm a big fan of friendly and knowledgeable servers, I think our girl was named dawn or Donna and she was super sweet.It did, however, take awhile for me to get a second cocktail and for us to get the check. When we first got there the hostess said we could sit at the bar and we would have a table shortly, but they forgot about us and my boyfriend had to go remind them. Those are the only things keeping it from being perfect though, definitely coming back and definitely into the atmosphere and good food!

This place serves great food but is moderately priced. I came to herbs and rye for my birthday with a party of 8 and had a great overall experience. Parking lot is small and I had to park 2 plazas over and walk 3-4 minutes before entering the restaurant. Outside of the restaurant looks plain and dark, I was wondering why my friends chose this restaurant. The inside of the restaurant is the complete opposite from the outside. Inside you are greeted and served by the nicest receptionist and waiters. The lights are dim with an old fashion decor to the restaurant. The place is always packed with customers too. For food we ordered a filet, meatballs, kitchen sink. Food here is delicious and portions are large enough to share. Overall, food is great but you're looking at spending around $40-60 for dinner. They do have a happy hour which ends at 7pm (forgot when it started). The service here is top notched and I recommend anyone to try this place at least once.

Great food, excellent cocktails.  the place is a little dark so give your eyes some time to get used to the lighting.  

The atmosphere is fun and energetic, but not too loud.  

The food is excellent, especially the steaks, which are always juicy and delicious.  Great service!
Delicious ribeye steaks however terrible service during happy hour, waiter was rude to us and said "can you hurry up with ordering I have more important things to do"?
Great food and drink. They make a great Old Fashioned, and the filet sliders were amazing. I took away one star because they played EDM most of the night and I hate EDM.
This place is awesome! The atmosphere, the food & the service! Happy hour is great. I loved how the drinks reflected different Eras! Definitely coming back!

I've visited herbs and Rye on my last trip to Vegas at the request of my brother-in-law. The service was mediocre the food was decent but nothing extraordinary contrary to other reviews. I started with the onion soup followed by the mac & cheese spinach and a 9 ounce filet. They offer a large list of specialty drinks categorized by different eras however very few of these drinks appealed to our party. The atmosphere has a very (too cool for school) vibe.  If this is your cup of tea then good on you. Overall there's no reason for me to return to herbs and Rye hints my two stars.

Does herbs and rye really need another 5 staff review?! 

What's not to love about this place especially at happy hour!! Select apps and steaks are half off!!!

The drinks. Some of the best cocktails I've had. Sazerac is my go to and they never fail! 

Let's talk about the food tho..... holy sh*t those mussels in that spicy red sauce and that bread to dip!! It's a must for me and you should try it too. 

The steaks seal the deal. That grilled taste and a nice medium rare temp. You don't need no sauce just a pinch of sea salt! One day I will order one of those monsters. 

Mark our server was cool af he will treat you well and make sure you always have a drink in your hand and bread to go with your mussels haha
Such a great place.  We loved every second of our meal.  Not to be missed.  We got there while happy hour was going on-5 to 8.  Half priced steaks.

I've been wanting to try this place since moving to Vegas 8 years ago. Met a girlfriend last minute on a Thursday for dinner. They were already booked full with reservations for the night! That has to be a good sign!

We decided to grab drinks and find a spot at the packed bar. The bar turns over pretty quick, and serves a full menu for dinner. 

Happy hours means half off of steaks? What!??! Yup! Large portions and amazing quality of filets. Truffle Mac n cheese is to die for! 

Don't know what you want to drink, their bartender or mixologists are wonderful at creating something for you. 

Only negative would be super small parking lot. Take an Uber or Cab so you don't have to park away and walk.
Perhaps the best cocktail spot in the greater Vegas area. The large chunks of cooked cow ain't bad either. Thank you to Matt a real honor to the craft of bartending.

Herbs & Rye has been on my to do list for almost a year now. I am thoroughly ashamed of myself for not dining her sooner! What an idiot! 

This place is my new Vegas favorite! 
I actually expected it to be kind of divey but was pleasantly surprised when I walked in the door to find such a cozy and charming place.

Maybe it was because I was incredibly starving, but I was close to ordering  every appetizer on the menu, I was shut down... 

There were six of us, we all split about 3 apps, individual entrees and a few sides. Carpaccio, mussels, tomato soup,  Chops & Figs, jalapeno creamed corn, Filets, Seafood Linguine.

I don't have a negative thing to say about Herbs & Rye.
Excellent selection of hand crafted classic cocktails.
Mouthwatering steaks, and chops
Prices seem average 
Attentive servers

Omg I absolutely loved it all! Ate and drank at the bar. Love the atmosphere, the bartenders, and the food! 
Ordered the meatballs, it had chorizo in it and goat cheese-so flavorful with a little kick of heat
I had a filet flatbread-omg soooo good
And I have an obsession with fries-the truffle Parmesan fries were good too. Love the mixed drinks and loved watching them make them like a boss. I would love to come back and taste the steak, can't go wrong here at all.

After having 3 separate people tell me that Herbs & Rye was the place to go, I had to check it out for myself. All of my friends recommended making reservations... I definitely recommend this as well!! I made my reservations for 6 and they called day of to confirm and ask if we were celebrating anything. My friends had just gotten married so I let Kimberly know. She was so sweet and excited for us to celebrate there!! 

First thing: parking is awful. Tiny parking lot and at dinner time, it was full (and then some). Checked in with the hostess and a few minutes later we were seated. I was surprised at how spacious the dining areas are...it didn't look that big from the outside. But even with all the space, the entire place was PACKED. We were seated by the bar in the back corner. 

The food... oh goodness! The food!! So tasty!! I ordered a filet (medium rare with the blue cheese topping) and truffle Mac & Cheese. That Mac & Cheese was amazing. For me, I couldn't finish it, but I really wanted to! The steak was perfectly done and the blue cheese crumble was a great added touch. Others in the group got ribeye, mussels, whiskey potatoes... everything was amazing. 

To celebrate the wedding, our server brought out some of their delicious donuts. SO TASTY! 

I will certainly be returning. I had a great experience and the food was amazing. I would warn that it is LOUD as well as pretty dark, so keep those things in mind.

Solid 4.5 stars. One half point deducted for an extremely heavy hand on the salting. I LOVE salt. But mind you, there are other flavours in the world. Salt is meant to enhance a dish's flavour; not dominate it.  The steaks are already generously rubbed with a house seasoning which renders any of the "add-ons" totally unnecessary. The apps are super salty, the sides are super salty, the steaks are salty.  So by the end of your 3 course meal your mouth is falling in on itself with pucker. We came during happy hour and unfortunately our medium rare steaks were overcooked. But they were still delicious, nonetheless. Service was attentive, the drinks were well balanced and delivered promptly. Even the hostess was really good at her job. My espresso (I am obsessed with the stuff): perfect. Creamy, rich, and had no burnt aftertaste as some espressos are wont to have. If you care at all about craft cocktails you MUST come here. I've never seen anything like it. (Bartender for 14 years)

I came here for my birthday and everything from the host to the food was amazing. The host&hostess were nice but our server "Charlie" was probably one of my favorite things about this place. I loved his personality and he was very knowledgeable of the menu. He was chill and just seemed like someone I would hang out with on a daily! 

Now let's get to the food! As a appetizer we ordered the calamari, which was huge for just two people. We agreed that there wasn't enough calamari and sauce and a little too much pepperoncini. The touch of bacon on it is really good though. For our main course we ordered one of the surf and turfs that come with two lobster tails and a 18oz steak. The lobster comes on a bed of mashed potatoes that doesn't even need gravy because it's so good! The steak on a bed of asparagus which was also very good! We ordered the herbs and rye spice rub sauce and Charlie made the excellent choice of putting it on the side because it was a little too spicy for me! Other than that the steak and lobster was good enough without the sauce itself! Oooo moving on to desert we ordered the creme brûlée ! This creme brûlée is probably the best I've ever had in life! The texture of it just melts in your mouth. The amount of sugar on top is perfect and there's just a vanilla bean after taste that's just to die for! 

Overall we had an amazing experience since we walked in and I will only be going there if Charlie is my server! We love you Charlie! 

Also the restaurant itself is pretty casual wear and it's pretty dim inside. So when I took this picture with the flash on I definitely got some attention sorry I'm not used to eating so fancy!

Very good food and drink here. Delicious steaks and vintage cocktails.  Has a speakeasy theme.  Gr8 service and Mad Men ambience.  Sides, pasta, salads and desserts are good too.  Happy hour is half price on the steaks.  Christian was a gr8 waiter.  Some prices were fictional at happy hour but overall an excellent establishment.

Don't let this Gem of a restaurant fool you from the outside view. Once you get passed the front door  and your eyes  acclimate to the very dim lights, you will experience a speakeasy atmosphere.  The food was wonderful and so was the serve. Happy hour is 5 - 8 and the steaks are half off including limited other menu items.  I had the filet mignon which cut like butter and the flavor was mouth watering. For the side dishes we tried the jalapeno cream corn, truffle mac & cheese and garlicky spinach. Everything was great! They also serve many different vintage drinks.  We tried the Gin Frizz , very original and tasty.  There menu prices are a bit high so I recommend happy hour.
Came here for happy hour after a show on the strip, the food took awhile to come out & service wasn't that great. 3 stars for food & 1 star for service.

It's Friday night and I end up here at herbs and rye with some friends and the vibe in here was very comfortable, the music brought on a nostalgic mood as 90s hip hop was playing overhead and had everyone in the restaurant vibing, the food I ordered was simple but they were able to make it into exactly what I wanted ( sweet potatoes tots with caramelized mushrooms and onions on top) which was by the way delicious!!! Our server mark along with Joaquin made ordering our drinks fun and exciting as they were throwing out ideas on what we can have, over all we had different drinks mixed for us and each one was unique as they come, thank you for a fun experience.

Went here for a group work outing arranged by one of my friends. She highly suggested it, and I absolutely love the happy hour they have daily. They have an array of appetizong steaks, sides, and refreshing beverages.The dark ambiance is splendid. Only suggestion is to offer wine and anything other than well drinks at a special price and provide a better parking situation. This is a go-to place with alot of anticipated business. I highly recommend for a fun outing with friends.
Great place for happy hour, especially if you're looking for a steak! The clams are absolutely amazing! Definitely a must have when dining here!

Very good chop house with a Chicago vibe. The food is great. I understand that it's known for its cocktails. We were there for happy hour, twice. They have half price steaks for happy hour ss well as a simple spirits menu. I wanted a dirty martini but there are no martinis on the happy hour menu. You're allowed one spirit and one mixer, so, I ordered vodka and a teaspoon of olive juice (dirty martini) but they won't shake it, lol. My only real issue with thus place is that they don't understand the definition of a reservation. We made reservations for 4 on both visits, always arrived on time, always waited a minimum of 20 minutes. Get your timing issue fixed, it's annoying.
Debra was by far the best!!! Made the perfect recommendations. Great food, awesome drinks and vibe was on point!!! Def a Vegas hidden gem!

I've been here twice only. I really had nothing to say the first time around (just my friend and I) except that it took forever and a day to get our check.

The majority of the review here will be for the second experience (tonight). It was a fairly large group -- a group of 12 for a birthday dinner.

When making the reservation for the large party, they tell you you need to order appetizers to start off. However, they didn't enforce this when we were there, FYI.

Most of us ordered steaks because of happy hour half off. I personally got the flat iron (medium rare and $14 due to HH) with a side of asparagus (comes with a side).

I enjoyed my food. No complaints at all there. However, as a party, service wasn't as expected. We asked for splits check when we were ordering -- she said okay. Well, that was easy, for such a large group.

When the food finally came out (mind you, it was really long since there were so many of us), one of us didn't get his steak. Apparently they made a mistake and made it well done instead of medium rare (though, when it did finally come out, it was medium). That issue was resolved in the end as he got his steak comped.

She forgot about splitting checks only to come back 10 minutes later to tell us we can't do split checks and we just simply have to tell her how much to charge on each credit card. Bah. That was a good pain in the butt because somehow we were short $10 and it was just such a huge headache. They did give us a small treat at the end (not sure what kind of donuts they were? beignets?) for the birthday boy.

Manager was nice and easy to work with but I guess just the system of doing things was not a pleasant experience. The food was a much better experience for me this time around. So, try their steaks! Maybe not at full price, but happy hour -- why not?

Went here for happy hour during a recent trip to Vegas. The outside is pretty unassuming, but our Lyft driver recommended the happy hour. I've never seen a better happy hour food deal ever. My steak was cooked perfectly. For sides I had the whiskey shallot potatoes and the sprouts and swine. Both were delicious. Our table ordered the donuts dessert. They were gone in seconds. 

I loved the drink menu. Cocktails are separated by era on the menu. I had the bijou and it was really well done.

My only complaint was the darkness of the restaurant. It was hard to read the menu and see the food.

We live nearby.  We always wondered why there were so many cars in the parking lot because the neighborhood is not known for foodie establishments.  Went there tonight and the mystery is solved.  Great vibe, quite with good soft music.  Good service.  Hip and classic.   Fabulous hand crafted cocktails and classic steakhouse menu with fine ingredients and imagination.

We got there right as it opened and there were already  people waiting outside. The food & service was amazing! The pork chop was cooked to perfection and the linguini & clams and the perfect kick of spice.
Decent lounge atmosphere. Opens late and has variety of food & drink options. Overall I like the place if I'm craving some food & drinks late night.. Very chill atmosphere for locals.

Came here with a group of people. Didn't have much of an appetite from being full still from having eaten at Hot N Juicy Crawfish. Ordered the Alsatian flatbread topped with red onions, potatoes, goat cheese, and arugula. It was o.k. tasting, nothing to rave about. Had a bite of my sister's Bisteca flatbread. That one tastes better than mine.

This was a great find for us. The outside of the building made us question our choice but once we got inside, we were sold. The service was good and included several visits by the owner. Be warned that the drinks are handcrafted so they take a while to get to the table. We all ordered steaks because of the 50% off prices during happy hour (5-7.) There was nothing fancy about them. They were cooked right and had an excellent seasoned taste. The truffle Mac and cheese side dish was incredible. Save room for dessert. The donuts melt in your mouth. 
By the time we left at 8pm, the place was packed, mostly with locals.
It was a $20 cab ride from the strip, but was well worth the trip.

I like this place for its happy hour. The steaks are all half off during happy hour which is during very convenient dinner times. I can't remember the exact timing but I've never had an issue going and getting the happy hour pricing! The cocktail list is superb! They have so many fancy cocktails! The steaks are good, not amazing, but good. You definitely go for the ambiance and happy hour pricing.

Visited last night after seeing all of the reviews. We came for happy hour and arrived just before 5:00 with a little line out front but we were promptly seated, there was plenty of room left after we got seated though as the bar seats got taken first (but you can still order happy hour from a table).  Joaquin was our server and was very accommodating and patient and ran through the whole menu for us. Ordered an old fashioned and another rye based drink based on his reco and both were excellent. I ordered the ribeye, which was very good, but my wife ordered the filet which literally melted in your mouth, minimal chewing required.  It's 9 oz, which was ambitious for her, but she finished all of it, which never happens. The jalapeño cream corn was very good as well as unique - not spicy but a good jalapeño flavor. Truffle Mac n cheese was also quite good. The atmosphere, as good as the food was, was what put it over the top. You feel like you're in a speak easy almost with the dim lighting and decor.  The music was on point to.  Also shout out to the bust staff, any empty glass/plate was promptly removed from the table. We were visiting from out of town
But definitely will make a point to come back!

Always delicious. Must try truffle mac and cheese, chorizo meatballs and creamed spinach. Drink are also amazing. Let them surprise you with a drink. Always good. Atmosphere also very nice. One of my favorite spots.

Don't let the exterior fool you... as the saying goes "Don't judge a book by its cover"!! 

I have been to Herbs and Rye several times and have genuinely enjoyed myself each time.  

The service is always great and Gerrardo / G (the bartender) is quite knowledgeable with the cocktails and always accommodating. He alone, deserves 5 or more stars!

This is definitely NOT the place to go to for the froufrou, sweet, flower decorated drinks one commonly finds on the strip, at the hip club of the moment.

This is THE place to go to for some seriously dang good cocktails, made traditionally... just like the days during  Prohibition.  
My husband and I love that they stay true to the era and only have spirits that was available back then. It's a history lesson on alcohol!

We have never ever been disappointed with the drinks.... they are always delicious and well made. 

The food, on our very first visit, was hit or miss.
We came with a group of 10...... the group ordered the filet, mussels, several of the various flat breads and calamari.
My girlfriend and I couldn't decide on what we wanted, so G asked us what we were in the mood for and ensured it would be made. 
We asked for shrimp with linguine. (Thank you G! Excellent customer service!)
The linguine, mussels and flat breads were very good! 
In fact, we wanted more pasta. However, the steaks were over cooked and dry... and the calamari was not crisp and very chewy. 

The next time we visited, we had a group of 17 and it was a blast!
All of our drinks were fantastic and the food was delicious. No complaints from anyone we were with.
My favorite that night was the chorizo meatballs and sweet potato tater tots. YUM!! 

I recently went with a girlfriend who had never been and she was impressed.
We sat at the bar.... and of course, G took very good care of us. 
We took a chance and ordered the calamari (after all, we are human and the chef from the first night may have had an off day)
and the clams.
Both dishes were excellent! The calamari was nice and crisp, topped off with some crunchy prosciutto and a light sauce.
And the clams.... we could not get enough of it. The broth was the highlight of the dish! Perfect for dunking bread in.

I've tried many of the drinks from their cocktail list and my favorite is the Leap Year.  Cheers!!

While we got off to a bad start, at least it ended with good food. 

We arrived at 6:55 on a Friday night with no reservations. They said it would be a 30 minute wait (no problem) and we weren't seated until 8:30... That's an HOUR longer than the estimated wait time given without even a free drink offer as compensation. Needless to say, by the time my butt hit the chair, I was a grumpy girl!!!

The tomato soup was outstanding and it comes with a tiny grilled cheese sandwich on the side. Everyone else enjoyed their salads and the main dishes were presented beautifully, had lots of flavor and our bellies were full and happy.

Finally was able to come here on a Monday night made reservations for my 6 year anniversary with my boyfriend, we had Charlie he was such a delight really explained happy hour and what to order, for appetizer we chose the calamari for entree I chose the ny strip steak with blue cheese crust and Mac and cheese my boyfriend got the filet mignon and spinach... for dessert our server brought out doughnuts that I devoured they were light and delicious... over all I would definitely come back love the atmosphere and friendly staff.

We went here for a bachelor party this past Monday. There was 8 of us total. We got the 120 OZ rib eye. We got the truffle mac and cheese, parmesan french fries, jalapeño corn and the mushrooms. It was all perfect. The steak was cooked medium rare. The mac and cheese was creamy and flavorful. 

If you have never tried this restaurant then you are missing out on a fantastic meal and a great old school Las Vegas experience.

My wife and I wanted to eat some steak just because it was our last night in vegas.  We came across this restaurant, man! it did not disappoint.  Our server was really helpful explaining the menu since it was our first time eating here.  He's name is Vega and I think you'll recognize him just by his voice since it sounded like my drill instructor voice in bootcamp.  We ordered the steak, calamari, and clam pasta.  The food was pretty good, specially the steak.  The serving is pretty huge but my wife was able to finish the steak because it was that good.  The drinks tho it was the BOMB,I suggest getting the "Jungle Bird" this drink is no longer in the menu, if I wasn't driving the next day I would've ordered more.. I suggest you all go during happy hour and make a reservation because we got lucky we were seated right away without making reservation. We definitely coming back again and trying out their other drinks and steaks.

We just finished a going away dinner at Herbs and Rye. The drinks were incredible as was our service. The waitress took the time to answer any questions and recommend drinks. I gave Herbs and Rye four stars and not five because the food was just okay. My husband and I both got the Surf and Turf and we shared the beef carpaccio. None of the food made us stop and savor our bites. If we go back, it will definitely be for the drinks.

Ramos Gin Fizz has become a staple of mine. Always start with that then move on to wine. 

Be sure to visit during their happy hour. You can find Steaks and select items half off.

A friend of mine from Chicago recommended this off the beaten path place. I had an amazing filet half-price during happy hour. I highly recommend the brussels sprouts and potatoes as a side. Sitting at the bar allows for the optimal ambience. This is one of the best meals I've had in a long time.

I had a much better experience here on my second try. I guess sticking with the meats is the way to go. The happy hour deals of 50% off all steaks really makes it a phenomenal deal of the day. 

Rib eye steak- 5 stars. Fatty and was cooked perfectly. 
Kansas City bone-in - 4 stars. Not as fatty but good flavor. We asked for medium rare, but it was completely rare inside. 

Brussel sprouts with honey and swine- 5 stars. Brussels Sprouts were as good as mon ami gabi, plus it has fat bacon or pork belly bits with a tint of lemon. I didn't taste the honey. It was good either way.

Truffle Mac and cheese- 4 stars.  Didn't taste the truffle oil at all, but it was a solid Mac and cheese.

Food was seasoned well. We went on a good day!!!!! Will be back again for happy hour when I have a hankering for steak.

Large inconspicuous box looking thing with a neon sign? - (well that's what my eyes saw at 2 am). However as we walked in, my inebriated self thought I just walked into a bar in Williamsburg.. am I back in New York? 

Hungry for some eats after partying at Encore, a friend took us for some good post-party fare that was easier on the wallet and off the Strip away from the madness. This chill bar, dimly lit by the ornate chandeliers and homey brick & paisley wallpaper, fed us well with tasty treats such as flat bread pizzas, wings, salads and for the one in our party who wanted a proper meal - Pigs & Figs! Not your typical pub fare but better!

Friendly service and definitely great post party food. The cocktails looked bangin' but by that time, we've just about had enough.

I had wanted to sample the fare at Herbs & Rye for some time, based on the recommendations of Yelp Friends.  Finally, the moment came, and Diane and I passed through the darkened entrance.  We were there for the food--not the creative drinks--and looked forward to a sumptuous dinner.  

First to be set before us by our friendly server Eddie A was delicious fresh-baked French bread and soft butter.  This was quickly followed by a lovely-looking Shrimp Cocktail featuring six medium-sized red-tailed and white-topped shrimps curled over the serving plate.  The cold crustaceans tasted very good after being dipped in the zesty traditional Cocktail Sauce that accompanied them.

Next was a novel surprise: an Iceberg Wedge that, instead of being crafted in the shape of a wedge as expected, was about two-thirds of a head of Iceberg Lettuce that had been sliced straight through the top to resemble a high mesa somewhere in the Southwest.  Festooned on the flat leafy surface were slices of tomato, red onion, bacon, Bleu Cheese crumbles, croutons, and a rich and ample supply of Bleu Cheese Dressing.  This was an excellent, crunchy salad course. 

Produced after this were my 9 oz. Filet Mignon with Brandy Cream Sauce & Peppercorns, and Diane's 12 oz. Ribeye Steak.  My entree was largely medium-rare as ordered, but a few parts of it were slightly undercooked.  Diane's Ribeye, on the other hand, was overcooked--more medium-well than medium-rare as she prefers.  When asked if her steak was cooked as she had specified, she admitted that it was more done than desired, but said that it was okay and she would eat it.  "No," said our server.  "We'll prepare you another one, and take it off the bill.  We want you to come back."  My wife politely declined the gracious offer, and slowly picked at her steak and sides until not too long afterward when suddenly a steaming plate was placed before her, with a new, obviously medium-rare and glistening 12 oz. Ribeye mounted on it.  The kitchen had quietly prepared a new steak anyway.  She accepted the promising substitution, and her old steak was immediately removed.  This fresh and juicy steak she really enjoyed, accompanied by a luscious Macaroni & Cheese side with bacon added.  I sampled the Mac & Cheese, and the hot white cheesy sauce really was delectable, just as was the Brandy Cream Sauce that covered my Filet and provided a liquid base for it.

We had other sides to indulge in as well.  Sauteed Button Mushrooms were hot and meaty, and I opted for the deluxe version of Sweet Potato Tots with Honey & Marshmallow Crust.  Large marshmallows were nicely melted over tater-tot-shaped knobs of sweet potato that had been sweetened further with honey.  

While we were eating our meals, mob movies were playing without commercial breaks on a large flat-screen TV mounted behind the bar and facing our booth.  It was actually quite enjoyable to have that as a backdrop, and we became engaged in following the action.  The final delight of the night was the gigantic, warm, and freshly baked Chocolate Chip Cookie a la mode that was presented with long trails of Chocolate Sauce drizzled across the massive cookie and streaming down the two large scoops of Vanilla Ice Cream that rested on top and stood like silent sentinels.  It was a great dessert, and a sweet way to end our leisurely stay.


P.S.  True to our server's word, when the bill arrived, besides a 50% price reduction off the cost of my Filet for dining during the extended Happy Hour, no Ribeye Steak appeared on the tab.  It was an unnecessary but generous and classy gesture.  So, I reciprocated by leaving a substantial tip.  And, I am sure that we will come back.

This place suprised me for sure. The spicy mussels are the best thing Ive ever had. I needed more bread just to soak up the amazing sauce that the mussels were in. The steak was probably the best steak I have ever gotten. Seasoned well and tender melt in your mouth! This place is a must try, youll not be disappointed.
This place was good. Visited during happy hour. Our spicy muscles  appetizer was great. Drinks were good and the steak was even better.

Very yummy dinner and definitely more affordable than most steakhouses around Vegas. (During happy hour 5-8pm) 1/2 price steaks during the happy hour. We both had the filet minion which was delicious. I had the truffle mac n cheese and my husband had the garlic mashed potatoes. I wasn't a huge fan of the mac n cheese and preferred the potatoes. They also poured a good glass of bourbon even though it was on the pricier side.  Total came to $82 for two peoples dinner and a glass of Blantons bourbon. We will be back for sure.

Prohibition era...oh my - how I love this theme!  No windows, 1920's inspired beverages and bartenders in vests and tie's equals LOVE!!  Ally was our waitress and she did a phenomenal job of taking care of us.  Her drink suggestions were spot on.  I loved the Mary Pickford!!  Our rib eyes were perfection as were all the sides we tried which was almost all of them.  The carpaccio was probably the best I've ever had.  Dessert, oh dessert!!  I usually pass it up because as some of you know I live gluten free UNTIL the bread pudding and doughnuts came out and I watched in pure envy while my fellow diners oooh'd and aaaah'd!  I had to, I just had to and once I took that first bite not only was I in love but I couldn't stop!  I will be back, probably weekly!!  I'm just sad it took me so long to try this place!  Go, Eat, Drink and be Merry!!
Awesome place to enjoy a delicious dinner. The food, drink and ambiance is excellent especially for off the strip. Everybody I've taken here loves it. Highly recommend it.

Food was great - Surf & Turf was 'spot on' and cooked to perfection (Medium rare was our request). The lobster tail was a generous size, and the Caesar salad was Fab.Drinks were good. Menu was a little hard to read in the dim lighting with the small print....Our server was 'interesting' but pleasant. I will definitely return in the future. The only issue was parking - a little tight on space, especially if other patrons park inconsiderately of the limited space.

My friends brought me here for a girls night dinner. The atmosphere was great! It had a classic feel to it and the food was tasty! Its definitely more on the upscale side so be prepared to spend at $40-$100 for your entrées. It's definitely a place to on special occasions. Our waitress was superb! 

Be prepared to adjust your eyes when you enter. It's super dark and this place gets packed so it's in your best interest to make a reservation prior to arriving or you will be waiting awhile. In addition, parking spaces are very limited and hard to find so you might end up driving behind the restaurant parking in another ally and walking like we did. I heard a lot about this place and glad I finally got to try it out.

I'm a sucker for a place with a gimmick and this place does it right.   I was most impressed with the detail and literature in the menu.  Each drink is described with a bit of history as to how it got its name and where it came from.  I had one of the flatbreads which was perfect and I got to enjoy it again the next day for lunch.  Our server was very nice and attentive and the whole staff just looked baller in their uniforms.   I'm dying to go back!

Had reservations with a big group that they lost. They set up a table for us late...food came out 45 mins later for half the table and 1.5 hours for the rest of us...I left one-hour and 45 mins later and still hadn't gotten my food...

Officially my favorite place to relax and have a few drinks. They have a unique variety of drinks to choose from, all of which, at least of those I have tried so far, are very delicious. The food exceeded my expectations as well and I fell in love with the half-dollar sized clams. To top it off they play a great selection of music to keeps you there for hours!

Current obsession: Herbs & Rye

I've sat at the bar both times and have been wildly entertained both times. The show stopping bartender is Spotty who somehow manages to mix cocktails like a boss while still taking great care of the people right in front. 


During my first visit he and Joe took great care welcoming me as a first time guest. Stopped, shook my hand, asked my name, welcomed me to Vegas. I felt like royalty! I drank the Hemingway Daiquiri which forever changed the way I think about the Daiquiri cocktail. Not overly sweet. Tart. Delicious. 

The filet sliders are juicy bites of heaven. You know it's going to be mouth wateringly delicious when they ask what temp you want the meat on your sliders. The bruschetta flatbread was refreshing and delicious. The showstopper was the shrimp cocktail. I want to go back in time and thank that shrimp for its service. 

Before I left Joe asked where I was headed. He made a "boomerang cocktail" message to take with me to the Velveteen Rabbit bartenders. 

I already feel at home at this place. So much so that I went back the following night and enjoyed their HH steak. The New York strip was a steal!! Garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus + all the cocktails makes for a delicious evening. 

See you soon because I'm going to boomerang my booty back asap.

I can't count how many times I have been here? I can't believe I'm just now writing a review?! My bad! This is the best local spot ever! From the outside it seems like a dive bar. You walk in and it has good music and a dark setting. Super chill dive bar vibe with 5 star food! The menu doesn't match the spot at all! The drinks are specially mixed and themed during the prohibition era! Super good and super clever setting. I highly recommend his spot!!!

We drove by and decided to go inside for some drinks around 12 midnight, and we were happily surprised to hear we had walked into happy hour. I enjoyed a thick, perfectly cooked, New York steak w/garlic mash, and two cocktails; a Painkiller and Missionaries downfall. Which were extremely delicious!!! My boyfriend ordered the little neck clams to start, and couldn't stop licking his fingers. Haha. He ordered the flat iron steak with blue cheese topping and asparagus. His plate was completely clean by the end of our meal. He enjoyed his dinner with a Blood & Sand cocktail and said it was strong and very tasteful. Our dinner came out to be $101.34 w/out tip.
I believe all the steak dinners come with one side. Alycia, who was our server was polite and attentive to our needs. The ambiance was warm and romantic. It also wasn't too busy on the Wednesday when we arrived. But as we finished our dinner and were leaving, I noticed the place getting busier with the majority of the tables and bar seats being filled. 
I highly recommend this place for creative drinks and tasty food.
Love it! Great spot off the strip. We are from the OC and my hair stylist told me about it. Fab HH. Amazing pork chop bone in. We had a wonderful time and the lightening is very dim.

I've been waiting to try out the Happy Hour at Herbs & Rye for as long as it's been open.  Last night we finally timed it right.  But I can't remember ever being as woefully disappointed in a HH menu as I was here.

First, the good: 

-- The ambience.  Loved it - all that dark wood, flocked wallpaper, cozy, dimly-lit, romantic.  

-- The service. Our waiter, Ronny, couldn't have been more attentive and patient.

But it went downhill quickly when we realized that there was nothing on that HH menu that would work for us.  The wine was a piss-poor selection of just a couple of whites or reds that neither of us would drink.  The beer?  What bar has NOTHING on tap???  I'm not a beer drinker, but my husband wasn't blown away either by the selections or prices.

As for the food, the only two HH appetizers available were clams or mussels.  We don't eat either of them.  Flatbreads (not on HH)?  The price for the one with steak was the same as one with just tomatoes. What a concept. We weren't about to bite, knowing we can get the same tomato and cheese flatbread at Kona Grill HH for nearly 2/3 less.  Sure, it's not the same atmosphere, but you can't always eat the atmosphere.

The only main course available was linguine with clams.  Not clam sauce, which I (but not hubby) would eat, but clams, just like in the appetizer.  I'm shell-averse.  I don't like to work for my food; if I did, I'd have stayed home and cooked.

The steaks would have been okay, if we were craving a juicy steak.  We never crave juicy steaks, and had already exceeded our beef quota for the week.  We weren't about to exceed it just because it was there, since it's never a first choice for us anyway.

In the end, we had our drinks - a low-end beer for Herb and a very good non-HH Riesling for me - and then went for pizza, and it was infinitely more satisfying.

Love love love this place. First class service and menu without any of the pretentiousness. Bartender, Adam, was awesome. Best cocktails I've had plus he truly cared about the patrons, charging cell phones, calling cabs etc. I'd definitely recommend this place.

Got the $9 crab cake appetizer, delicious but the inside was room temperature. 14 oz New York strip with garlic mashed potatoes was $18 because of 50% off happy hour. We were were served by Ronnie. Overall, great food, calm cool and collected atmosphere. Definitely coming back.

PS. THOSE DONUTS THOUGH. GET THEM NOW AND SEND ME SOME. STOP READING AND NOW. GO!!

Really enjoy the style of this place- a fun speakeasy prohibition style vibe! Their drink menu is awesome- full of flare with variety, they also have a full service bar with lots of options! Excellent food! Attentive service!

Definitely a place worth checking out!

MUST GO: This place is great. I went on a Monday night after work. I started off by telling the bartender I wanted a cognac cocktail. He asked what other cocktails I've tried before and I told him none with cognac. He gave me a sidecar which is what I expected. It was a great classic cocktail. The sugared rim was a nice touch. After that I ordered a 9 oz. filet mignon and "sprouts and swine" for the side. I ordered the filet medium and it was cooked perfectly. The brussel sprouts were a little overdone but still quite delicious. 
Ambience was nice. There was a great selection of alcohol to check out and make a mental check list. When I got there they were playing some smooth jazz and transitioned into some mellow hip hop, my personal favorite. 

Overall I had a great experience and appreciated that the bartender used my name almost every time he addressed me. Very classy joint with impeccable service. Seriously, if you want a good steak and a great cocktail then you should check this place out.

P.S. Get the donuts. They are "Dynamite!"

Everyone says the steak is the main event and it was impressive (filet mignon with red wine glaze and a side of truffle mac and cheese) but the cocktail menu is where it's at. They go through different eras and serve the drinks in the glass of the time frame. I was so impressed that sampling drinks from each area became my main focus. I wanted to watch a Baz Lerman flick after this experience. Our waiter, Mark, was very knowledgeable and personable. In fact when we return (I haven't finished the drink menu yet) we will be requesting him!

On our way to herbs and rye, my car was hit by a truck and the truck driver decided to take off without stopping leaving us with no insurance information and forcing us to follow him to take pictures of the license plate. Luckily, it was minor body damage, but my girlfriend and I were still shaken up by the ordeal. We attempted to steel our nerves and continued our way to herbs and rye after making a police report. We were shaky and in desperate need for a drink. 

Nothing could have turned this bad night into a good one the way Herbs and Rye did. The drinks were crisp and refreshing and took the edge off just enough so that we could hold our forks straight to enjoy our food. Best Meatballs I have had. Ever.
