We had the pleasure of being served by Mark Vega. Now I didn't meet too many people at Herbs and Rye, but i'd like to think that Mark is the premier waiter whose serving chops inspire all other associates around him. Everything Mark did and said was both fun and comforting, and made us feel like welcomed guests, despite this being our first time. 

We live in LA and don't make it to Vegas often. However, Herbs and Rye has earned a permanent spot on our "Must Do" list next time we visit.

Thank you Mark, and thank you Herbs and Rye!

So after many trips to Sin City I finally made it in. Cocktails were on point. I ordered the Calamari as well. Not a traditional Calamari dish as far as Italian etc. having said that, the breading and remolaude were excellent. I order a whiskey smash. It was made from the well. It was balanced and excellent. Service and atmosphere were enjoyable and exceeded the price point. Absolutely recommend.

Cool spot to take a date. Cross between a 20s era speakeasy and a hipster type joint. Food was excellent and the prices weren't too bad. Try the donuts for dessert :) The music was just right. Not too loud and easy to eat / drink by. Service was also attentive, but not overly bothersome. Definitely a locals spot worth checking out.

Located in a slightly rough area. Be observant when you are in the parking lot.

First time here, was enticed to because of their happy hour, I mean $20 steaks are worth a try. The ambiance was pretty cool and the energy was upbeat despite the gloominess of the lighting, definitely great for a romantic date! The sides were awesome, I was a bit disappointed with my steak though, it was a bit chewy and not enough flavor, I should've gotten the rib eye instead! Word of advice though save room for dessert! The doughnuts were the star of the show! The waiter said that the desserts change daily so I hope ur lucky enough to have this on the menu that day!

My medium rare steak was paying it took a long time to get here I waiter made me feel like he was in a hurry and he was rushing  my dinner gas had ordered the brussels sprouts and had to send them back twice because they were cold each time by the time they came back she was actually done with her state yes they are half price during happy hour but they're half-price is regular price for other restaurants so what seems like a deal is OK but not worth the rush and the way they make you feel. I would much rather spend the money at someplace that cared that I was there and made me feel welcome and invited either way you're going to spend the same amount of money you might as well get something that's worth it. Oh and $12 for white Russian is a bit much especially during happy hour.

Honestly, this is my favorite steakhouse in Vegas. You get the most bang for you buck. I've eaten at super fancy steakhouses before and this place out do all of them. I normally go during their happy hour for half off steaks. That's normally from 5pm-8pm. These times are normally  busy. They always have a full house so I suggest making reservations ahead of time. I recommend making a reservation for Friday and Saturdays two or three days ahead of time to get a spot during happy hour. Otherwise, you'll be waiting there for hours to get seated. 

My go to is the ribeye cooked rare. It's so tender and juicy! My favorite side include the jalapeño corn and the garlic spinach. The mashed potatoes is also delicious. 

But you know what makes the experience top notch is our favorite server Mark! This guy's level of service is top notch! He pronounced our names correctly plus remembered it the next time we came. We'll keep having to try to get a table with him. 

I recommend this place for anyone who is looking for a great steak paired with great service.

I love the vibe here, and the food, and the drinks. 

The tartar was hands down delicious. Meatballs were a hit as well. Pork and figs is my new favorite dish. Ordered some truffle mac and cheese and that was great as well. Ordered all of the desserts except for the creme brûlée  and they were all delicious. My favorites were the cookie and the donuts. I didn't want to share my dessert haha. 
I was drinking Pimm's Cup and it was perfect and super refreshing. 

Happy hour it gets a little packed in here, so it's best to make a reservation. Every time I try to come here without calling ahead I regret it. 

Be sure to try this place out, happy hour or not, you're going to be pleased!

Finally made it down to Herbs & Rye for their Happy Hour specials and I was very pleased with my experience. 

The atmosphere is pretty cozy and I would like to get a booth next time and settle in for a longer period of time. They have some pretty good Happy Hour specials. I can't wait to try their flatbread pizzas and steaks, but on this occasion I ordered the meatballs with chorizo and the sweet potato tots. We were just making a short pit stop here on our way to dinner so didn't get an opportunity to try all the menu items that I was craving. The meatballs were lovely. Delicious and spicy. The sauce was delightful and I was hoping for a roll or some bread to sop up the rest of it with, but the bartender claimed they were out. We tried to order the bruschetta as well, but were told they were out of that too, so I guess I have to believe him on the bread thing. The tots were ok. Pretty much exactly as you picture them. Sweet potato tater tots, so self-explanatory and not really worth further description. Pretty good on the whole though. 

Now for the drinks. At $5 a pop for well drinks they certainly treat you right. There was barely a hint of tonic in my vodka tonic, which I had a hard time downing at first, but was much easier with an extra lime and some food to make it go down easier. 

Great deal in general. I look forward to my next visit!
Love the cocktails . Happy hour is one of the best when it comes to the food . Bomb steak and I love the ruffle fries . The atmosphere is great.
Go for happy hour, but good luck finding a seat. If you aren't there when it opens you might as well try another day.
Nice place with good drinks and food, great late night spot with a killer happy hour menu. Nice vibe and crowd, although friendly service was lacking IMO.

Swinger-Hipster atmosphere. Drinks are slightly overpriced but good. Had the pasta and was underwhelmed. I was well attended to though. Maybe just for drinks it would be OK but I am unimpressed at the quality of the meal I had. Is it wrong to judge a steakhouse based on having the pasta?

We went here for a work related function. There was 20+ people in our party. The service was fast and efficient, the food was fantastic and the drinks were the best part.  New york strip and truffle mac and cheese!! To top off the whole deal, we made it in before happy hour and all steaks and appetizers were half price! Next time I'm in vegas i will be visiting Herb's and Rye!

The only place where happy hour = 1/2 off cuts of steak!

Came here for date night with the bf on a Thursday around 6pm. While it was 100 degrees and sunny outside, the restaurant was incredibly dark and had a very old-fashioned Las Vegas saloon vibe. 

The menu was quite expansive with the majority of it consisting of drinks. They offer authentic classic cocktails that are worth the trip to the restaurant alone. These bad boys set you back $10 each, but they are worth it. I had the Remember the Main (it was a strong drink since it had Absinthe in it) and a Lion's Tail. These drinks were absolutely delectable and I just wish they were included in the happy hour. I'd be visiting this bar much more often then!

The bf and I split the special that night, a 24 oz porterhouse steak with one side (we picked button mushrooms) for $29. At that price, it was a no brainer. This steak was arguable one of the best steaks I've ever had. It had a gorgeous charred sear on the outside but was deliciously moist and flavorful on the inside. They have options to add on blue cheese or a dry spice rub, but we wanted to enjoy the steak in all it's natural glory. It was absolutely delicious. Both sides we had, button mushrooms and the garlic mash, were great and completed the meal.

For dessert, we split their homemade donuts. I'm not much of a dessert person, but these were incredible. You get both the soft and fluffy donuts and donut holes along with a dark chocolate and white chocolate dipping sauce. These were soooo good. 

Both their food and drinks were exceptional and I will definitely be back. Date night seal of approval!

Oh. My. God. How to describe this gem? We were in Las Vegas for a fun getaway and our Uber driver was the one that actually recommended this restaurant to us. He really got us interested when he told us about the happy hour deals. We had no idea the place would be so busy so we headed to the bar and luckily found a couple that was leaving and we took their seats. We had some wine and mixed drinks. I can't remember the name of it but boy was it good! The bartender was amazing. Making friendly conversation and always checking in to make sure we were doing good. And the food? Superb. I was so pleased with my visit there. Always going to be on my checklist anytime someone goes to Vegas. --sorry that I only took a picture of the wine and bread, the food looked so amazing and I was so hungry that I completely forgot to take a picture of it.

Went for happy hour. Half off several menu items including filet mignon dinners! Drink specials weren't too good: $5 well drinks and buy one get one 1/2 off bottles of wine. I would like to see a discount on the classic cocktails to encourage people to try your specialty! I had a clover club and blood and sand classic cocktails. Both were good but the blood and sand was better! Steaks were cooked to perfection and the flat bread pizzas were huge! Great visual atmosphere but the music was off putting - you can't play house techno music in a fine cocktail lounge... service was fine once I mentioned I was a yelper.

With the suggestion from the guys at Tenaya Creek Brewery, my husband and I checked out this super local, speakeasy-like steakhouse. From the outside, you'd never guess the cool, dark ambiance inside.

The steak happy hour (half off steaks!) is pretty incredible and hard to resist at a steakhouse. If you have any appetite for a steak while you're here, just go for it. We also got the beef sliders, which were delicious and definitely worth getting, and the wings, which were good but not blow-it-out-of-the-park good. Even the bread basket was good and warm. 

Even with all the extensive Yelp reviews, I had no idea how big the cocktail menu was going to be. The menu itself is laid out in a fun way, so you can learn a lot while you pick your cocktail. The pisco sour and pimms cup we got were right on point (not on happy hour, though).

Overall, this spot was definitely cool and something different. If you're in the downtown area and jonesing for a cocktail or steak, you should check out H&R.

Ok, so being a Las Vegas local and eating out almost daily I've tried basically all of the local steakhouses. When I want to rate a restaurant I take into consideration a lot. Such as atmosphere, customer service, value, wait time, everything. It's not even something to think about to not give them a perfect rating. To be honest the first and second time I went here I thought it was beginners luck beings this place is a bit of the grid. I can assure you it's not. I go once a week and it's as good every time. The steaks are amazing, the sides are the best mac and cheese and mashed potatoes I've ever had. The fact they even have happy hour and half off steaks and certain cocktails is so awesome. And also the cocktails. Well all the bartenders there are true bartenders making amazing cocktails from all periods of time. They also just got rated best cocktail lounge in Las Vegas. Emily is an amazing bartender with skills and personality. I truly love this restaurant. Always best to call ahead and reserve a table if you have a few heads with you. They will always try to accommodate. Everyone there is smiling and enjoying having customers there right down to the bus boys. Thanks Herbs and Rye for being awesome. See you next week!!!

Great non-hotel/casino steakhouse!  Always ask the hotel/casino employees for the best places, they will know what's good, inexpensive, etc.  My wife and I are staying at Caesars, many many choices of dining to choose from, most of them probably going to ding you at least $100 per person, so we tried this hole in the wall on W Sahara, about a $15 cab ride from our hotel.  Older building and decor, sort of a Victorian style, very dark - you get a distinct '60's feel in there.  Their dinner menu features many $50+ steaks, however they run a "happy hour" from 5pm-8pm, where most of the entrees are discounted 50% - my $42  14oz. NY Strip was $21, my wife had the 9oz. filet for $26 (menu price $52), and so on.  We had Little neck clams as an appetizer - $12.  Cocktails were reasonable, my wife's Manhattan was $11, my Grey Goose vodka was $13, and the first time I've ever seen this - was charged $1.95 for a "large ice cube".  The drink was great, I didn't complain, but I haven't seen a charge for an ice cube before.  Steaks were cooked to perfection and were excellent.  We noticed there were no salt and pepper shakers on any of the tables, I think their philosophy is that you're not going to need to doctor your steak in any way - in our case that was 100% correct, they were great!  Sides come with your entree, we opted for the Smashed Whiskey Potatoes (yum) and the Garlicky Spinach (also yum).  We were full, but had to try their signature Doughnuts (see photo), home made and decadent.  We got out of there paying a $114 check, which was not bad considering 3 cocktails (including my $1.95 ice cube), an appetizer, entrees and dessert!  Very friendly service staff, this is a must-try place on your next Vegas visit!

Drinks were awesome!! I have no idea what I had though LoL it was amazing, and it had something with strawberry in it. I sat at the bar and told my server I wanted a drink that was fruity, but would get me tipsy. He did just that!! I had a pasta that was not good at all. It was a lemon-buttery pasta. Stay away from it.

If nothing else, I praise them for the drinks they offer and the bartenders who were extra special.! 

Sincerely, 

The Guy with the crown

Everything was delicious, the service was great, and the prices during happy hour are pretty good.

Plus, my wife and I sat at the bar and although we don't drink, it was still cool to see Scotty mixing drinks. Very entertaining. We'll be back for sure.

The food, the drinks, the atmosphere...
Sublime!!!!
I will come back often. I'm gonna bring my dearest friends. So unique. I felt like I stepped back in time. It was wonderous! I opted to let the bartender choose my cocktail. You say you want "Herbs & Rye.", and you will get a surprise! It was a surprise! I loved all 3 of the drinks he thrilled me with. 
Especially the "Blood & Sand" 
I had the Bistecca flat bread and Potato Gnocchii..
It was like I had stepped into the 1940's. Ohhhhhhhh
Unbelievably fantastical idea, "TMC" Turner Movie Classic channel is channel chosen for motif. TOO COOL! I will come often. This place is the BOMB. The service was divine. I felt like a movie star from the '40's, hehe that's how I was treated. I felt so comfortable. ahhhh Mmm
